1273.question: Does ketamine improve respiratory rate, oxygen saturation, or hospital admission rates in children with severe acute asthma who do not respond to standard therapy?
1273.notes: The study showed no significant difference in these outcomes between ketamine and placebo groups.

1274.question: Does doxycycline provide a significant improvement in pain relief for patients with osteoarthritis of the hip or knee compared to placebo?
1274.notes: Effect size of -0.05 (95% CI -0.22 to 0.13) indicates minimal to no difference in pain scores.

1275.question: Is rectal 5-ASA more effective than placebo for maintaining symptomatic remission in patients with distal ulcerative colitis over a 12-month period?
1275.notes: Rectal 5-ASA group had 62% remission compared to 30% in placebo group (RR 2.22, 95% CI 1.26 to 3.90).

1276.question: Does the use of clomiphene citrate with gonadotropins reduce the incidence of ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome (OHSS) compared to gonadotropins alone in IVF treatment?
1276.notes: Significant reduction in OHSS incidence (OR 0.23, 95% CI 0.10 to 0.52).

1277.question: Does cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) reduce gambling symptom severity immediately following treatment?
1277.notes: CBT showed a very large beneficial effect on gambling symptom severity immediately post-treatment (SMD -1.82; 95% CI -2.61 to -1.02, n = 402).

1278.question: Does locomotor training significantly improve walking velocity in people with traumatic spinal cord injury compared to other forms of physical rehabilitation?
1278.notes: The effect size for walking velocity was 0.03 m/sec with a 95% confidence interval of -0.05 to 0.11, indicating no significant improvement.

1279.question: Are continuous suture techniques associated with less short-term perineal pain compared to interrupted methods following childbirth?
1279.notes: Continuous sutures are associated with less pain for up to 10 days postpartum (RR 0.76; 95% CI 0.66 to 0.88).

1280.question: Is nicotine replacement therapy (NRT) more effective than placebo in aiding smoking cessation?
1280.notes: The risk ratio (RR) of abstinence for any form of NRT relative to control was 1.60 (95% CI 1.53 to 1.68).

1281.question: Does cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT) have a sustained effect on mood and catastrophising outcomes in chronic pain patients compared to treatment as usual or waiting list?
1281.notes: CBT shows small effects on mood and catastrophising with some evidence of maintenance at six months.

1282.question: Is there a difference in two-year all-cause survival between patients treated with stent-graft repair plus medical therapy and those treated with medical therapy alone for uncomplicated chronic type B aortic dissection?
1282.notes: The two-year all-cause survival was 95.6% in the medical therapy group and 88.9% in the stent-graft repair plus medical therapy group, with no statistically significant difference (P = 0.15).

1283.question: Does the application of compression bandages or stockings aid venous ulcer healing?
1283.notes: Evidence from eight RCTs suggests better healing outcomes with compression compared to no compression.

1284.question: Does using email for clinical communication between patients/caregivers and healthcare professionals improve patient outcomes compared to standard communication methods?
1284.notes: The review found it was not possible to adequately assess the effect of email on patient outcomes.

1285.question: Does milk oral immunotherapy (MOIT) increase the ability to tolerate a full serving of milk in children with IgE-mediated cow milk allergy compared to an avoidance strategy?
1285.notes: 66% of MOIT group tolerated a full serving versus 8% in the control group (RR 6.61, 95% CI 3.51 to 12.44).

1286.question: Does combining high-dose methotrexate with cytarabine improve progression-free survival in patients with primary central nervous system lymphoma?
1286.notes: PFS was improved with HR 0.54; 95% CI 0.31 to 0.92.

1287.question: Do antibiotics reduce the risk of infection in patients undergoing third molar extractions?
1287.notes: Antibiotics reduce the risk of infection by approximately 70% (RR 0.29, 95% CI 0.16 to 0.50).

1288.question: Do General Practitioners (GPs) use fewer healthcare resources than Emergency Physicians (EPs) when attending to non-urgent patients in the Emergency Department (ED)?
1288.notes: Two studies reported fewer blood tests, x-rays, hospital admissions, and referrals to specialists by GPs compared to EPs, but one study found no significant difference in resource use.

1289.question: Does push gavage feeding result in a more rapid establishment of full gavage feeds compared to gravity gavage feeding in preterm or low birth weight infants?
1289.notes: The abstract mentions insufficient evidence to recommend either method due to only one small cross-over trial being included.

1290.question: Does early selective surfactant administration reduce the risk of neonatal mortality in intubated infants with RDS?
1290.notes: Typical risk ratio (RR) 0.84; 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.74 to 0.95

1291.question: Does the use of antidepressant medication reduce the relapse-recurrence rates of depressive disorders in children and adolescents compared to placebo?
1291.notes: Three trials indicated lower relapse-recurrence rates with antidepressant medication (40.9%) compared to placebo (66.6%) with an odds ratio of 0.34 (95% CI 0.18 to 0.64).

1292.question: Does psychosocial intervention improve quality of life when measured using cancer-specific measures in newly diagnosed cancer patients?
1292.notes: A small improvement in QoL was observed with cancer-specific measures (SMD 0.16; 95% CI 0.02 to 0.30).

1293.question: Do ADP receptor antagonists reduce the risk of all-cause mortality, vascular mortality, or myocardial infarction in patients with type 2 diabetes?
1293.notes: One trial with 355 patients showed no statistically significant differences.

1294.question: Does journal endorsement of the CONSORT Statement improve the completeness of reporting in RCTs?
1294.notes: Twenty-five of 27 outcomes favored CONSORT-endorsing journals, with five outcomes showing significant improvement.

1295.question: Is there evidence that antibiotics provide a benefit over no antibiotics in the treatment of uncomplicated diverticulitis?
1295.notes: The newest RCT found no significant difference between antibiotics and no antibiotics.

1296.question: Do newer generation antidepressants reduce depression severity scores in children and adolescents compared to placebo?
1296.notes: Reduction in depression symptoms was small (MD -3.51; 95% CI -4.55 to -2.47).

1297.question: Does flupenthixol reduce the need for additional antipsychotic medication within four weeks compared to placebo?
1297.notes: The study showed fewer people in the active treatment group needed additional medication (OR 0.19, CI 0.05 to 0.71).

1298.question: Does sildenafil improve sexual functioning in men with schizophrenia experiencing antipsychotic-induced sexual dysfunction?
1298.notes: One trial reported significantly more erections sufficient for penetration, greater mean duration of erections, and frequency of satisfactory intercourse with sildenafil compared to placebo (n = 32).

1299.question: Does reducing smoking before quitting result in similar abstinence rates compared to quitting abruptly?
1299.notes: The main analysis showed no superior abstinence rates for either method (RR= 0.94, 95% CI= 0.79 to 1.13).

1300.question: Does nebulised rhDNase reduce the duration of hospital stay in children under 24 months with acute bronchiolitis?
1300.notes: Meta-analysis favored the control group with a shorter duration of hospital stay (MD 0.50; 95% CI 0.10 to 0.90).

1301.question: Does the use of sound-creating devices, including hearing aids, reduce the loudness or severity of tinnitus compared to other interventions?
1301.notes: No significant change was observed in the loudness or severity of tinnitus with sound therapy compared to other interventions.

1302.question: Does assisted hatching (AH) improve the live birth rate in assisted conception?
1302.notes: The odds ratio for live birth was 1.03 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.85 to 1.26, indicating no significant difference.

1303.question: Does extracting the primary maxillary canine prevent the palatal eruption of the permanent canine in children aged 10-13?
1303.notes: The trials included in the review have serious deficiencies and high risk of bias, providing no reliable evidence.

1304.question: Is pentoxifylline more effective than placebo in achieving complete healing of venous leg ulcers?
1304.notes: Pentoxifylline showed a relative risk (RR) of 1.70 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 1.30 to 2.24 compared to placebo.

1305.question: Is external beam radiation therapy (EBRT) more effective for palliation of non-small cell lung cancer symptoms than endobronchial brachytherapy (EBB) alone?
1305.notes: The review concluded that EBRT alone is more effective for palliation of NSCLC symptoms than EBB alone.

1306.question: Does colesevelam, when added to antidiabetic agents, reduce fasting blood glucose levels in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus?
1306.notes: Mean difference of -15 mg/dL with a 95% confidence interval of -22 to -8.

1307.question: Does photodynamic therapy (PDT) provide better cosmetic outcomes compared to cryotherapy for individual lesions?
1307.notes: PDT resulted in better cosmetic outcomes than cryotherapy based on investigator and participant evaluation.

1308.question: Is urethroplasty more effective than urethrotomy in reducing the need for further surgery in men with traumatic stricture of the posterior urethra?
1308.notes: In the first six months, men were more likely to require further surgery in the urethrotomy group than in the primary urethroplasty group (RR 3.39, 95% CI 1.62 to 7.07).

1309.question: Do cognitive behavioral interventions reduce the risk of reoffending in individuals treated for sexual offenses compared to no treatment or standard care?
1309.notes: The largest study reported no difference in risk of reoffending between the treatment and control groups (RR 1.10; 95% CI 0.78 to 1.56).

1310.question: Is there a significant difference in relapse recovery at week four between oral and intravenous steroid treatments for MS relapses?
1310.notes: Mean difference (MD) -0.22, 95% confidence interval (95% CI), 0.71 to 0.26, P = 0.20

1311.question: Is a personal phone call more effective than a generic invitation letter for recruiting smokers into cessation programs?
1311.notes: One study found a significant effect with RR 40.73, 95% CI 2.53 to 654.74.

1312.question: Does creatine supplementation improve survival in patients with ALS?
1312.notes: Pooled log-rank test showed no statistical difference in survival (Chi(2) = 0.09, P = 0.76).

1313.question: Does zinc supplementation improve the Mental Development Index (MDI) in infants and children at high risk of zinc deficiency?
1313.notes: Mean difference was -0.50 with a 95% CI of -2.06 to 1.06, indicating no significant effect.

1314.question: Is there a difference in achieving INR in-range by day five between 5 mg and 10 mg loading doses of warfarin?
1314.notes: Pooling of four studies showed no overall difference (RR 1.17, 95% CI 0.77 to 1.77).

1315.question: Is albendazole as effective as metronidazole in achieving parasitological cure for giardiasis?
1315.notes: Albendazole is probably equivalent to metronidazole at achieving parasitological cure (RR 0.99, 95% CI 0.95 to 1.03).

1316.question: Is imiquimod effective in curing anal canal intraepithelial neoplasia (AIN) compared to placebo?
1316.notes: The trial reported no statistically significant difference in disease cure between imiquimod and placebo.

1317.question: Is there evidence that huperzine A is effective in treating mild cognitive impairment?
1317.notes: No eligible trials were identified, so the efficacy of huperzine A in treating MCI cannot be assessed.

1318.question: Do regulatory interventions at national or branch level lead to a reduction in fatal and non-fatal injuries among construction workers?
1318.notes: Regulatory interventions showed a small but significant initial and sustained increase in fatal and non-fatal injuries.

1319.question: Does oral naftidrofuryl improve pain-free walking distance in patients with intermittent claudication compared to placebo?
1319.notes: The ratio of the relative improvement in PFWD was 1.37 (95% CI 1.27 to 1.49).

1320.question: Does the use of human recombinant activated protein C (APC) reduce all-cause mortality at day 28 in patients with severe sepsis or septic shock?
1320.notes: APC did not significantly affect all-cause mortality at day 28 compared with placebo (RR 1.00, 95% CI 0.86 to 1.16).

1321.question: Does the use of inhaled corticosteroids (ICS) reduce hospital admissions in patients with acute asthma who are not treated with systemic corticosteroids?
1321.notes: Patients treated with ICS were less likely to be admitted to hospital (OR 0.44; 95% CI 0.31 to 0.62).

1322.question: Do green tea preparations lead to a clinically significant weight loss in overweight or obese adults?
1322.notes: The mean difference in weight loss was -0.04 kg with a 95% CI of -0.5 to 0.4, indicating a statistically non-significant and clinically unimportant effect.

1323.question: Does hyperbaric oxygen therapy (HBOT) reduce the risk of death in patients with traumatic brain injury?
1323.notes: Pooled data showed a significant reduction in the risk of dying with HBOT (RR 0.69, 95% CI 0.54 to 0.88).

1324.question: Does the guidewire-assisted cannulation technique reduce the risk of post-endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography pancreatitis compared to the contrast-assisted technique?
1324.notes: The guidewire-assisted technique significantly reduced PEP (RR 0.51, 95% CI 0.32 to 0.82).

1325.question: Does testing for thrombophilia reduce the risk of recurrent venous thromboembolism (VTE)?
1325.notes: No RCTs or CCTs were identified to assess the benefit of testing for thrombophilia on recurrent VTE risk.

1326.question: Does immediate initiation of depot medroxyprogesterone acetate (DMPA) result in fewer pregnancies compared to using a 'bridge' method before DMPA?
1326.notes: Immediate start of DMPA showed fewer pregnancies (OR 0.36; 95% CI 0.16 to 0.84).

1327.question: Do polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFAs) improve disease progression in multiple sclerosis patients over 24 months?
1327.notes: PUFAs did not have a significant effect on disease progression at 24 months.

1328.question: Do antibiotics reduce the risk of treatment failure in outpatients with mild to moderate COPD exacerbations when restricted to currently available drugs?

1329.question: Do corticosteroids and azathioprine reduce the risk of progression from ocular myasthenia to generalized myasthenia gravis?
1329.notes: Observational studies suggest benefits, but RCTs do not provide meaningful conclusions.

1330.question: Does increasing the frequency of hamstring stretching exercises reduce the time to return to full activity in elite athletes?
1330.notes: Mean difference of -1.8 days with a 95% confidence interval of -2.1 to -1.5.

1331.question: Does ursodeoxycholic acid reduce all-cause mortality in patients with primary biliary cirrhosis?

1332.question: Does early screening for oesophageal cancer using endoscopy with iodine staining or cytologic examination reduce mortality in asymptomatic individuals?
1332.notes: No RCTs were found to determine the efficacy of screening, and non-RCTs may be affected by biases.

1333.question: Does PTCRA provide additional benefits over conventional PTCA for non-complex coronary lesions?
1333.notes: There was no evidence of effectiveness in improving patient outcomes of PTCRA in non-complex lesions.

1334.question: Does multidisciplinary rehabilitation improve short-term outcomes such as range of shoulder movement and psychosocial adjustment in women treated for breast cancer?
1334.notes: The abstract mentions 'low level' evidence for short-term gains in impairment, psychosocial adjustment, and quality of life.

1335.question: Does inhaled magnesium sulfate improve pulmonary function when used in addition to inhaled β(2)-agonist?
1335.notes: SMD 0.23; 95% CI -0.27 to 0.74; considerable between study heterogeneity.

1336.question: Is there evidence that immunomodulation treatments, such as intravenous immunoglobulin, are effective for paraneoplastic neuropathies?
1336.notes: The abstract indicates that there are no RCTs or quasi-RCTs available to support the effectiveness of immunomodulation treatments for paraneoplastic neuropathies.

1337.question: Does indomethacin reduce the number of children failing to have 14 consecutive dry nights compared to placebo?
1337.notes: Indomethacin showed a risk ratio of 0.36 (95% CI 0.16 to 0.79) compared to placebo.

1338.question: Does decompressive surgery provide an added benefit over steroid treatment alone for nerve damage in leprosy?
1338.notes: The evidence from the RCTs included in the review is of very low quality and does not show a significant added benefit of surgery over steroid treatment alone.

1339.question: Do perioperative antibiotics reduce pain following tonsillectomy?
1339.notes: Most trials did not find a significant reduction in pain with antibiotics.

1340.question: Does Serenoa repens improve lower urinary tract symptoms in men with benign prostatic hyperplasia compared to placebo?
1340.notes: Serenoa repens was not superior to placebo in reducing LUTS based on the AUA symptom score (MD 0.25 points, 95% CI -0.58 to 1.07).

1341.question: Do mobile phone messaging interventions improve glycaemic control in diabetes patients compared to usual care or email reminders?
1341.notes: Moderate quality evidence from two studies showed no statistical difference in glycaemic control (HbA1c) between intervention and control groups.

1342.question: Does nutritional supplementation lead to significant weight gain in malnourished COPD patients?
1342.notes: Pooled data from 11 RCTs showed a statistically significant weight gain (MD 1.65 kg; 95% CI 0.14 to 3.16) in favor of supplementation.

1343.question: Does exercise reduce the rate of falls in care facilities?
1343.notes: The results from 13 trials testing exercise interventions in care facilities were inconsistent, with no significant difference in the rate of falls (RaR 1.03, 95% CI 0.81 to 1.31).

1344.question: Do erythropoiesis stimulating agents (ESAs) reduce the need for red blood cell transfusions in cancer patients?
1344.notes: Use of ESAs significantly reduced the relative risk of red blood cell transfusions (RR 0.65; 95% CI 0.62 to 0.68).

1345.question: Does pre-operative chemoradiation reduce local recurrence compared to radiotherapy alone in locally advanced rectal cancer?
1345.notes: Reduction in local recurrence was seen in the CRT group (OR 0.56, 95% CI 0.42-0.75).

1346.question: Is intralesional cidofovir more effective than placebo in reducing the extent of recurrent respiratory papillomatosis after 12 months?
1346.notes: The study showed no difference between cidofovir and placebo groups in disease extent reduction.

1347.question: Does breastfeeding reduce physiological markers of pain in neonates compared to no intervention?
1347.notes: Breastfeeding significantly reduced heart rate increase, crying time, and PIPP scores compared to no intervention.

1348.question: Does oral betamimetic maintenance therapy reduce the rate of preterm birth (less than 37 weeks) compared to placebo or no treatment?
1348.notes: The rate of preterm birth showed no significant difference (RR 1.11, 95% CI 0.91 to 1.35; 644 women).

1349.question: Does prophylactic oxygen administration during the second stage of labour increase the risk of abnormal cord blood pH values?
1349.notes: Abnormal cord blood pH values were recorded significantly more frequently in the oxygenation group (RR 3.51, 95% CI 1.34 to 9.19).

1350.question: Does adding intravenous beta(2)-agonists to inhaled beta(2)-agonist therapy reduce hospitalisation rates in adults with acute asthma?
1350.notes: No significant advantage was found (OR 0.29; 95% CI 0.06 to 1.38) for adding IV bedoradrine to standard care in adults.

1351.question: Does the addition of inhaled corticosteroids (ICS) to oral corticosteroid therapy reduce relapse rates in patients with acute asthma following ED discharge?
1351.notes: Relapses were reduced but not statistically significant (OR 0.68; 95% CI 0.46 to 1.02).

1352.question: Is mycophenolate mofetil (MMF) as effective as cyclophosphamide in achieving stable kidney function in patients with proliferative lupus nephritis?

1353.question: Does administering a sweet-tasting solution reduce the duration of crying in infants undergoing needle-related procedures compared to water?
1353.notes: Mean difference in cry duration was -13.47 seconds (95% CI -16.80 to -10.15) with significant heterogeneity (I² = 94%).

1354.question: Do manipulative therapies reduce the average daily crying time in infants with colic?
1354.notes: The combined data from five studies suggest a reduction in crying time by one hour and 12 minutes per day (MD -1.20; 95% CI -1.89 to -0.51).

1355.question: Is there a significant difference in the length of hospital stay between patients treated with IV beta(2)-agonists and those treated with IV aminophylline for acute asthma?
1355.notes: The mean difference was 23.19 hours with a 95% confidence interval of -2.40 to 48.77 hours, indicating no significant difference.

1356.question: Is there evidence that patients undergoing anterior resection have a better quality of life compared to those undergoing abdominoperineal excision?
1356.notes: Fourteen trials found no poorer quality of life in abdominoperineal excision patients, challenging the assumption that anterior resection patients fare better.

1357.question: Does neoadjuvant chemotherapy improve overall survival in women with early or locally-advanced cervical cancer compared to surgery alone?

1358.question: Is there a difference in effectiveness between systematic desensitisation and control interventions for treating vaginismus?
1358.notes: The review found no clinical or statistical difference between systematic desensitisation and control interventions.

1359.question: Do interventions aimed at promoting patient-centred care improve the consultation process in healthcare settings?
1359.notes: Descriptive and pooled analyses showed generally positive effects on consultation processes, including clarifying patients' concerns and beliefs, communicating about treatment options, and levels of empathy.

1360.question: Does the addition of intravenous aminophylline to inhaled beta(2)-agonists reduce the risk of hospital admission in adult patients with acute asthma in the ED setting?

1361.question: Do psychosocial interventions reduce the use of antipsychotic medication in care home residents?
1361.notes: All studies documented a decrease in antipsychotic drug use or a reduction in days with antipsychotic use per 100 days per resident.

1362.question: Is the injection of corticosteroid and local anaesthetic associated with improvement in meralgia paraesthetica?
1362.notes: Improvement was found in 130 (83%) out of 157 cases across four studies.

1363.question: Is there evidence supporting the superiority of surgical interventions over medical interventions for treating recurrent pneumothoraces in people with cystic fibrosis?
1363.notes: No relevant trials were identified, and the review highlights the lack of RCTs comparing these interventions.

1364.question: Is there evidence that percutaneous transluminal angioplasty improves symptoms of multiple sclerosis by addressing chronic cerebrospinal venous insufficiency?
1364.notes: No randomised controlled trials met the inclusion criteria to provide evidence.

1365.question: Does cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) significantly reduce the time until partial return to work (RTW) compared to no treatment for individuals with adjustment disorders?
1365.notes: Moderate-quality evidence showed similar results for time until partial RTW compared to no treatment at one-year follow-up (MD -8.78, 95% CI -23.26 to 5.71).

1366.question: Is tiagabine effective in treating acute mood episodes in bipolar disorder?
1366.notes: No randomised controlled trials were found to support the efficacy of tiagabine in this context.

1367.question: Does the use of inhaled antibiotics improve the quality of life for people with cystic fibrosis during pulmonary exacerbations?
1367.notes: The abstract indicates limited data and insufficient power to determine the effectiveness of inhaled antibiotics on quality of life.

1368.question: Do angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors (ACEi) reduce the risk of new onset of microalbuminuria or macroalbuminuria in people with diabetes compared to placebo?
1368.notes: ACEi reduced the risk with a risk ratio (RR) of 0.71, 95% CI 0.56 to 0.89.

1369.question: Is cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) effective in reducing PTSD symptoms in children and adolescents for up to one year following treatment?
1369.notes: PTSD symptom scores were significantly lower for up to one year with CBT (up to one month: SMD -1.34, 95% CI -1.79 to -0.89; up to one year: SMD -0.73, 95% CI -1.44 to -0.01).

1370.question: Does using a transparent cap on a colonoscope result in faster caecal intubation time compared to standard colonoscopy?
1370.notes: The meta-analysis indicates a faster caecal intubation time with the transparent cap.

1371.question: Do psychological interventions improve depression remission rates in the short and medium term for patients with diabetes and depression?
1371.notes: Short-term OR 2.88 (95% CI 1.58 to 5.25), medium-term OR 2.49 (95% CI 1.44 to 4.32)

1372.question: Is phonics training effective in improving nonword reading accuracy among English-speaking individuals with poor word reading skills?
1372.notes: The effect size for nonword reading accuracy was large (SMD 0.76, 95% CI 0.25 to 1.27) based on eight studies.

1373.question: Does barbiturate therapy reduce mortality in patients with acute traumatic brain injury?
1373.notes: The pooled risk ratio (RR) of death from three trials was 1.09 (95% CI 0.81 to 1.47), indicating no reduction in mortality.

1374.question: Is intravenous immunoglobulin (IVIg) more effective than placebo in treating exacerbations of myasthenia gravis?
1374.notes: One RCT showed a borderline statistically significant improvement in QMGS with IVIg compared to placebo (MD -1.60; 95% CI -3.23 to 0.03).

1375.question: Does the use of anticholinergic drugs result in more symptomatic improvement compared to bladder training alone in the treatment of overactive bladder syndrome?

1376.question: Is amitriptyline more effective than placebo in achieving an acute response in major depressive disorder?
1376.notes: Amitriptyline showed a significant effect with an OR of 2.67 (95% CI 2.21 to 3.23).

1377.question: Does the combination of clofibrate and phototherapy reduce bilirubin levels more effectively than phototherapy alone in term neonates?
1377.notes: Weighted mean difference of -2.14 mg/dL after 24 hours and -1.82 mg/dL after 48 hours.

1378.question: Do mobile phone messaging interventions improve prenatal satisfaction and confidence levels in women compared to those who do not receive such messages?
1378.notes: Women receiving prenatal support via mobile messages had higher satisfaction and confidence levels (MD 1.25, 95% CI 0.78 to 1.72 for satisfaction; MD 1.12, 95% CI 0.51 to 1.73 for confidence).

1379.question: Does the use of non-invasive positive pressure ventilation (NPPV) reduce the need for endotracheal intubation in patients with severe acute asthma?
1379.notes: Risk ratio 4.48; 95% CI 0.23 to 89.13, indicating no clear reduction in intubation needs.

1380.question: Does human chorionic gonadotrophin (hCG) reduce the rate of miscarriage in women with a history of unexplained recurrent miscarriage?
1380.notes: Initial meta-analysis suggested a reduction, but the effect was not significant after excluding studies of weaker quality (risk ratio 0.74; 95% CI 0.44 to 1.23).

1381.question: Does the use of intravitreal LMWH with 5-FU reduce the risk of postoperative PVR in high-risk patients undergoing vitrectomy?
1381.notes: One study showed a beneficial effect with RR: 0.48, 95% CI: 0.25 to 0.92.

1382.question: Do beta-blockers and sotalol have similar efficacy in reducing post-operative atrial fibrillation after cardiac surgery?
1382.notes: Both beta-blockers and sotalol have similar odds ratios (OR 0.33 and OR 0.34 respectively) with overlapping confidence intervals.

1383.question: Is paracetamol effective in providing pain relief for postpartum perineal pain compared to placebo?
1383.notes: Average risk ratio (RR) 2.14, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.59 to 2.89, 10 studies, 1279 women.

1384.question: Is total elbow arthroplasty (TEA) associated with better Mayo Elbow Performance Score (MEPS) results compared to open reduction-internal fixation (ORIF) in patients over 65 years with distal humeral fractures?
1384.notes: TEA showed consistently better MEPS results at 6, 12, and 24 months follow-up.

1385.question: Does vigabatrin help achieve a 50% or greater reduction in seizure frequency for patients with drug-resistant partial epilepsy?
1385.notes: Patients treated with vigabatrin were significantly more likely to obtain a 50% or greater reduction in seizure frequency compared with those treated with placebo (RR 2.58, 95% CI 1.87 to 3.57).

1386.question: Does combining conscious sedation with electro-acupuncture provide more effective pain relief during oocyte retrieval compared to conscious sedation alone?
1386.notes: Intra-operative pain mean difference (MD) on 1 to 10 visual analogue scale (VAS) of 3.00 (95% CI 2.23 to 3.77).

1387.question: Is there a difference in weight loss between nasogastric (NG) and percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy (PEG) feeding at six weeks post-treatment for patients with head and neck cancer?
1387.notes: Weight loss was greater for the NG group at six weeks post-treatment (P = 0.001).

1388.question: Does LASIK provide faster visual recovery compared to PRK?
1388.notes: The abstract states that LASIK gives a faster visual recovery than PRK.

1389.question: Is laparoscopic surgery associated with shorter hospital stays compared to open surgery for ovarian tumors in pregnant women?
1389.notes: The abstract mentions that laparoscopic surgery includes benefits such as shorter hospital stay.

1390.question: Does the pneumococcal polysaccharide vaccine (PPV) provide strong protection against invasive pneumococcal disease (IPD) in adults?
1390.notes: RCTs showed strong evidence of PPV efficacy against IPD with an OR of 0.26 (95% CI 0.14 to 0.45).

1391.question: Does the use of skin substitutes reduce the time to complete wound healing compared to antibacterial agents in facial burns?
1391.notes: Three studies reported significantly shorter healing times with skin substitutes, but the evidence quality was low.

1392.question: Does selenium supplementation reduce the risk of cardiovascular disease events?
1392.notes: The meta-analysis showed no statistically significant effect on all CVD events (RR 1.03, 95% CI 0.95 to 1.11).

1393.question: Are NSAIDs more effective than placebo in reducing heavy menstrual bleeding?
1393.notes: NSAIDs were found to be more effective than placebo in reducing HMB.

1394.question: Is the use of a cannula for transcervical CVS associated with a higher likelihood of failing to obtain an adequate sample compared to biopsy forceps?

1395.question: Is knowledge of transvaginal ultrasound cervical length results associated with a decrease in preterm birth at less than 37 weeks in singleton gestations with preterm labor?
1395.notes: There was a non-significant decrease in PTB at less than 37 weeks (22.3% versus 34.7%; RR 0.59, 95% CI 0.26 to 1.32).

1396.question: Is primary surgery recommended over radiotherapy for early adenocarcinoma of the uterine cervix?
1396.notes: The RCT subgroup analysis showed better outcomes with surgery, but most patients required adjuvant radiotherapy, increasing morbidity.

1397.question: Is there a difference in functional ability and health-related quality of life between surgical and conservative treatment for displaced intra-articular calcaneal fractures at three years follow-up?
1397.notes: The large multi-centre trial found no significant differences in functional ability and health-related quality of life between the two treatment groups.

1398.question: Does retreatment with pegylated interferon in patients with severe fibrosis lead to a reduction in all-cause mortality?
1398.notes: All-cause mortality was significantly higher in recipients of pegylated interferon when only low-risk bias trials were considered (RR 1.41, 95% CI 1.02 to 1.96).

1399.question: Does needle aspiration reduce clinically persistent BCG-induced disease in patients with lymphadenitis abscess?
1399.notes: RR 0.13; 95% CI 0.03 to 0.55; 77 participants, one study

1400.question: Is spinal manipulative therapy more effective than sham therapy for patients with acute low-back pain?
1400.notes: Spinal manipulative therapy showed a 10-mm difference (95% CI, 2 to 17 mm) on a 100-mm visual analogue scale compared to sham therapy.

1401.question: Does the use of bilayer artificial skin in conjunction with compression bandaging increase venous ulcer healing compared to simple dressings plus compression?
1401.notes: Significantly more ulcers healed with bilayer artificial skin than with dressings.

1402.question: Do antiangiogenic steroids prevent visual loss in patients with neovascular AMD?
1402.notes: The trials found no evidence that antiangiogenic steroids prevent visual loss.

1403.question: Does a higher dose of buprenorphine increase the probability of retention in treatment for opium dependence?
1403.notes: Higher doses of buprenorphine (4 mg/day and 8 mg/day) showed increased retention compared to lower doses (2 mg/day, 1 mg/day, and 3 mg/day).

1404.question: Does the use of depot GnRHa compared to daily GnRHa injections affect the live birth or ongoing pregnancy rates in women undergoing IVF?
1404.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 0.95, 95% CI 0.70 to 1.31, indicating no significant difference.

1405.question: Is acupuncture effective in reducing mortality and morbidity in neonates with hypoxic ischemic encephalopathy?
1405.notes: No randomized controlled trials were found that evaluated acupuncture in neonates with HIE.

1406.question: Are individual red flags effective in screening for vertebral fractures in patients with low-back pain?
1406.notes: Most individual red flags have poor diagnostic accuracy with imprecise estimates of likelihood ratios.

1407.question: Is there a difference in the effectiveness of intramuscular versus intravenous administration of anti-D in preventing RhD alloimmunization in RhD-negative pregnant women?
1407.notes: Both IM and IV administration showed no incidence of RhD alloimmunization, but the sample size was insufficient for a meaningful comparison.

1408.question: Are non-removable, pressure-relieving casts more effective in healing diabetes-related plantar foot ulcers than removable casts?
1408.notes: Non-removable casts were associated with a statistically significant increase in the number of ulcers healed compared with removable devices (RR 1.17 95% CI 1.01 to 1.36).

1409.question: Does tranexamic acid reduce the probability of receiving a blood transfusion in patients undergoing emergency or urgent surgery?
1409.notes: Tranexamic acid reduces the probability of receiving a blood transfusion by 30% (RR 0.70; 95% CI 0.52 to 0.94).

1410.question: Do systemic biologic treatments like infliximab and golimumab improve nail psoriasis scores compared to placebo in the medium term?
1410.notes: Infliximab showed 57.2% improvement versus -4.1% for placebo; golimumab showed 33% and 54% improvement versus 0% for placebo.

1411.question: Does Ginkgo biloba extract improve vision in individuals with age-related macular degeneration?
1411.notes: Two small trials suggested possible benefit, but results could not be pooled.

1412.question: Do serotonin and noradrenaline reuptake inhibitors (SNRIs) provide a significant improvement in pain reduction compared to placebo in patients with fibromyalgia syndrome?
1412.notes: SNRIs showed a small incremental effect over placebo in reducing pain with a standardized mean difference (SMD) of -0.23 and a risk ratio (RR) of 1.49.

1413.question: Does the use of a hormone-releasing intrauterine device (LNG-IUD) after surgery reduce the recurrence of painful periods in women with endometriosis compared to expectant management?

1414.question: Does Cerebrolysin improve general cognitive function in patients with vascular dementia as measured by MMSE?
1414.notes: The meta-analysis showed a weighted mean difference of 1.10 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.37 to 1.82.

1415.question: Do statins reduce all-cause mortality in individuals without a history of cardiovascular disease?
1415.notes: Statins reduced all-cause mortality with an OR of 0.86 (95% CI 0.79 to 0.94).

1416.question: Does regular vitamin C supplementation reduce the incidence of the common cold in the general population?
1416.notes: Pooled RR was 0.97 (95% CI 0.94 to 1.00), indicating no significant reduction in incidence.

1417.question: Does anti-VEGF therapy improve visual acuity in patients with macular oedema secondary to non-ischaemic BRVO compared to sham treatment?
1417.notes: The BRAVO study showed a favorable effect of ranibizumab on visual acuity, but many in the sham group received ranibizumab, complicating pure control comparisons.

1418.question: Does prostate cancer screening reduce prostate cancer-specific mortality in the general population?
1418.notes: Meta-analysis of five RCTs showed no significant difference in prostate cancer-specific mortality (RR 1.00, 95% CI 0.86 to 1.17).

1419.question: Is fetal vibroacoustic stimulation (VAS) effective in assessing fetal well-being during labour in the presence of a nonreassuring cardiotocographic (CTG) trace?
1419.notes: There are no randomised controlled trials that provide evidence on the effectiveness of VAS in this context.

1420.question: Is phenytoin associated with a lower rate of treatment withdrawal compared to phenobarbitone in patients with partial onset or generalized tonic-clonic seizures?
1420.notes: Pooled HR for time to treatment withdrawal was 1.62 (1.23 to 2.14), indicating a significant clinical advantage for phenytoin.

1421.question: Are acupuncture techniques effective in treating persistent and intractable hiccups?
1421.notes: All studies had a high risk of bias and did not compare with placebo.

1422.question: Does intravenous immunoglobulin (IVIg) provide a therapeutic advantage over systemic corticosteroids combined with immunosuppressants for treating Wegener's granulomatosis?
1422.notes: The RCT included showed no significant differences in mortality, serious adverse events, time to relapse, open-label rescue therapy, and infection rates between IVIg and placebo groups.

1423.question: Is the MAC regimen associated with less toxicity compared to the CHAMOCA regimen in the treatment of high-risk gestational trophoblastic neoplasia?
1423.notes: The study found statistically significantly less overall and haematological toxicity in the MAC group compared to the CHAMOCA group.

1424.question: Does therapeutic hypothermia reduce mortality in term and late preterm newborns with hypoxic ischaemic encephalopathy?
1424.notes: Typical RR 0.75 (95% CI 0.64 to 0.88); typical RD -0.09 (95% CI -0.13 to -0.04); NNTB 11 (95% CI 8 to 25)

1425.question: Does using the telephone for delivering HIV test results increase the proportion of people who receive their results compared to face-to-face delivery?
1425.notes: 58% received results via telephone vs. 37% face-to-face (p < 0.001).

1426.question: Is weight loss during pregnancy associated with improved outcomes for obese pregnant women?
1426.notes: Observational studies suggest mixed outcomes; no RCTs available to confirm safety or efficacy.

1427.question: Does slum upgrading reduce the incidence of diarrhoeal diseases among urban slum dwellers in low and middle-income countries?
1427.notes: One CBA with a moderate risk of bias found reduced diarrhoeal incidence (RR 0.53; 95% CI 0.27 to 1.04).

1428.question: Do steroids and angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors improve kidney function in patients with HIV-associated nephropathy?
1428.notes: Data from observational studies suggest improvement, but no formal analyses were performed.

1429.question: Does antibiotic treatment effectively eradicate bacterial vaginosis during pregnancy?
1429.notes: Antibiotic therapy was shown to be effective at eradicating bacterial vaginosis during pregnancy with an average risk ratio (RR) of 0.42; 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.31 to 0.56.

1430.question: Is tapered methadone more effective than other pharmacological treatments in terms of treatment completion for opioid withdrawal?
1430.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.08 (95% CI 0.97 to 1.21) indicates no clinical difference.

1431.question: Does pre-emptive treatment reduce the risk of CMV disease compared to placebo or standard care in solid organ transplant recipients?
1431.notes: Pre-emptive treatment significantly reduced the risk of CMV disease (RR 0.29, 95% CI 0.11 to 0.80).

1432.question: Is there evidence supporting the effectiveness of minimally invasive surgery compared to open laparotomy for the reversal of tubal sterilization?
1432.notes: No randomized trials were identified to compare these methods.

1433.question: Is there a single drug therapy that has been shown to be highly effective in treating Lennox-Gastaut syndrome?
1433.notes: No study has shown any one drug to be highly efficacious.

1434.question: Is therapeutic hypothermia associated with improved neurological outcomes in pediatric patients after cardiopulmonary arrest?
1434.notes: No randomized controlled trials were found to assess this association.

1435.question: Does unrestricted mobility lead to better outcomes compared to immobilisation in the treatment of hyperextension injuries of the PIP joint?
1435.notes: One trial found no significant differences in outcomes between unrestricted mobility and immobilisation.

1436.question: Is there evidence supporting specific management strategies for recurrent stress urinary incontinence after failed suburethral tape surgery?
1436.notes: No data available to recommend or refute management strategies.

1437.question: Does spinal cord stimulation improve limb salvage in patients with inoperable chronic critical leg ischaemia compared to conservative treatment alone?
1437.notes: Limb salvage after 12 months was significantly higher in the SCS group (RR 0.71, 95% CI 0.56 to 0.90).

1438.question: Is there evidence that intermittent ICS use leads to fewer exacerbations requiring oral corticosteroids compared to daily ICS use in patients with persistent asthma?
1438.notes: The risk ratio for exacerbations requiring oral corticosteroids was 1.07 (95% CI 0.87 to 1.32), indicating no significant difference between intermittent and daily ICS use.

1439.question: Does bupropion increase smoking cessation rates in individuals with schizophrenia compared to placebo?
1439.notes: Cessation rates were significantly higher with bupropion at the end of treatment (RR 3.03; 95% CI 1.69 to 5.42) and after six months (RR 2.78; 95% CI 1.02 to 7.58).

1440.question: Does a previous history of cancer increase the probability of spinal malignancy in patients with low-back pain?

1441.question: Does endolymphatic sac surgery provide a beneficial effect in reducing symptoms of Ménière's disease compared to placebo or grommet insertion?
1441.notes: Two trials with a total of 59 patients showed no beneficial effect.

1442.question: Does erythropoietin improve health-related quality of life in patients with rheumatoid arthritis and anemia?
1442.notes: Only one trial showed improvement with subcutaneous EPO at 52 weeks, while other trials did not show significant differences.

1443.question: Is achieving complete cytoreduction (no visible residual disease) associated with improved overall survival in women with platinum-sensitive recurrent ovarian cancer?

1444.question: Do endothelin receptor antagonists improve exercise capacity in patients with pulmonary arterial hypertension?

1445.question: Do early warning signs interventions reduce the risk of relapse in people with schizophrenia compared to usual care?

1446.question: Is there evidence that maintaining natural dentition during radiotherapy affects the reduction in mouth opening post-treatment?
1446.notes: No RCTs were found to assess this effect.

1447.question: Does antiviral prophylaxis reduce the risk of CMV disease in solid organ transplant recipients?
1447.notes: Prophylaxis with aciclovir, ganciclovir, or valaciclovir significantly reduced the risk for CMV disease (RR 0.42, 95% CI 0.34 to 0.52).

1448.question: Does restorative justice conferencing reduce the number of re-arrests compared to normal court procedures for young offenders?
1448.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 1.00, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.59 to 1.71; P = 0.99

1449.question: Does personalised risk communication enhance informed decision making in individuals undergoing screening procedures?
1449.notes: The odds ratios for informed decision were 4.48 (95% CI 3.62 to 5.53 for fixed effect) and 3.65 (95% CI 2.13 to 6.23 for random effects), indicating strong evidence.

1450.question: Does physical rehabilitation improve activities of daily living in long-term care residents?
1450.notes: Improvement in Barthel Index scores by six points (95% CI 2 to 11).

1451.question: Does partial liquid ventilation reduce 28-day mortality in children with acute lung injury or acute respiratory distress syndrome?
1451.notes: The relative risk for 28-day mortality in the partial liquid ventilation group was 1.54 (95% CI 0.82 to 2.9), indicating no statistically significant difference.

1452.question: Is there an increased risk of fixation failure when using fixed nail plates compared to the sliding hip screw (SHS)?
1452.notes: Three trials of 355 participants found an increased risk of fixation failure for fixed nail plates.

1453.question: Do progestogen-releasing intrauterine systems reduce menstrual blood loss in premenopausal women with uterine fibroids?
1453.notes: Significant reduction in menstrual blood loss was observed with LNG-IUS compared to COC (MD 77.5%, 95% CI 71.3% to 83.67%).

1454.question: Does influenza vaccination reduce the number, duration, or severity of influenza-related asthma exacerbations in children?
1454.notes: A single trial involving 696 children showed no significant reduction in these outcomes.

1455.question: Does preoperative chemoradiation improve local recurrence rates compared to preoperative radiotherapy alone in resectable stage II and III rectal cancer?
1455.notes: The incidence of local recurrence at five years was significantly lower in the CRT group (OR 0.39-0.72, P < 0.001).

1456.question: Does ventilation with lower tidal volumes improve survival at day 28 in patients with acute respiratory distress syndrome and acute lung injury?
1456.notes: Mortality at day 28 was significantly reduced with a relative risk (RR) of 0.74 (95% CI 0.61 to 0.88).

1457.question: Does ciclesonide provide better asthma symptom control compared to budesonide in children with asthma?
1457.notes: Asthma symptoms and adverse effects were similar in both groups.

1459.question: Are there any effective interventions identified to support parents' decisions about autopsy consent after a stillbirth?
1459.notes: No studies meeting the review inclusion criteria were identified.

1460.question: Does feeding preterm infants with multinutrient fortified breast milk after hospital discharge improve growth rates during infancy?
1460.notes: The trials did not provide evidence that fortification affected growth rates.

1461.question: Do psychosocial and psychological interventions reduce the risk of developing postpartum depression compared to standard care?
1461.notes: Overall risk ratio (RR) for developing postpartum depression was 0.78 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 0.66 to 0.93.

1462.question: Does the use of a pulmonary artery catheter (PAC) alter mortality rates in adult intensive care patients?

1463.question: Does naloxone increase alveolar ventilation in newborn infants exposed to maternal opiate analgesia prior to delivery?
1463.notes: Some evidence suggests an increase in alveolar ventilation, but the trials did not assess primary outcomes like admission to a neonatal unit.

1464.question: Is combination chemotherapy with ifosfamide and paclitaxel associated with a lower risk of death compared to ifosfamide alone in women with advanced uterine carcinosarcoma?
1464.notes: HR = 0.75, 95% CI: 0.60 to 0.94 for overall survival

1465.question: Is the use of pessaries effective in alleviating symptoms of pelvic organ prolapse in women?
1465.notes: The trial showed effectiveness for approximately 60% of women who completed the study, but methodological flaws were noted.

1466.question: Does the use of inhaled corticosteroids (ICS) reduce the severity of subacute cough in children?
1466.notes: The meta-analysis found no significant difference in the proportion of children 'not cured' at follow-up, with a pooled OR of 0.61 (95% CI 0.24 to 1.55).

1467.question: Does high intensity aerobic exercise improve functional status, gait, pain, and aerobic capacity in people with OA of the knee compared to low intensity aerobic exercise?
1467.notes: The study found no significant differences between high and low intensity aerobic exercise in improving these outcomes.

1468.question: Do school-based physical activity interventions improve the proportion of children engaging in moderate to vigorous physical activity during school hours?
1468.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 2.74, 95% confidence interval (CI), 2.01 to 3.75. Improvements were not observed in the original review.

1469.question: Does methotrexate (MTX) improve response rates in ankylosing spondylitis (AS) patients compared to placebo?

1470.question: Does improving thermal comfort in homes lead to health improvements, particularly for individuals with inadequate warmth and chronic respiratory disease?
1470.notes: Improvements in general health, respiratory health, and mental health were reported, especially for those with inadequate warmth and chronic respiratory disease.

1471.question: Are there any known medical benefits to female genital cutting (FGC)?
1471.notes: The abstract clearly states there are no known medical benefits to FGC.

1472.question: Does starting induction of labour with prostaglandins in the morning align with women's preferences?
1472.notes: One study reported a statistically significant preference by women to start induction of labour with prostaglandins in the morning.

1473.question: Is there any evidence supporting the effectiveness of neoadjuvant or adjuvant chemotherapy and radiotherapy regimens for ovarian carcinosarcoma?
1473.notes: The search did not find any trials to provide evidence on this topic.

1474.question: Is there high-level evidence supporting the use of oral H1 antihistamines as monotherapy for eczema?
1474.notes: No randomised controlled trials met the inclusion criteria to provide high-level evidence.

1475.question: Does praziquantel 40 mg/kg reduce parasitological treatment failure at one month post-treatment compared to placebo?
1475.notes: RR 3.13, 95% CI 1.03 to 9.53, two trials, 414 participants

1476.question: Is laparoscopic surgery associated with a reduction in abdominal septic complications compared to open surgery for perforated peptic ulcer?
1476.notes: The odds ratio for abdominal septic complications was 0.66 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.30 to 1.47, indicating no statistically significant difference.

1477.question: Does chest physiotherapy improve mortality rates in adults with pneumonia?
1477.notes: None of the physiotherapies improved mortality rates.

1478.question: Does epidural morphine reduce the incidence of post-dural puncture headache (PDPH) compared to placebo?
1478.notes: Epidural morphine was shown to reduce PDPH incidence compared to placebo.

1479.question: Does prophylactic gastrojejunostomy reduce the incidence of long-term gastric outlet obstruction in patients with unresectable periampullary cancer?
1479.notes: The proportion of patients who developed long-term gastric outlet obstruction was significantly lower in the prophylactic gastrojejunostomy group (2.5%) compared with no gastrojejunostomy group (27.8%) with a risk ratio of 0.10 (95% CI 0.03 to 0.37).

1480.question: Is there evidence from randomized controlled trials supporting the effectiveness of interventions for treating squamous cell carcinoma of the conjunctiva in HIV-infected individuals?
1480.notes: No RCTs were identified that fulfilled the selection criteria.

1481.question: Does the use of dextranomer in stabilised hyaluronic acid (NASHA Dx) improve faecal continence more effectively than sham injections in the short term?
