4962.notes: SSRIs were the only medication proving effective in reducing relapse based on moderate-quality evidence.

4963.question: Does the use of non-invasive ventilation (NIV) improve survival in ALS patients with normal to moderately impaired bulbar function compared to standard care?
4963.notes: Median survival was 205 days longer in the NIV group (216 days vs. 11 days, P = 0.0059).

4964.question: Does the use of NAVA reduce the rates of bronchopulmonary dysplasia (BPD) or death among term and preterm newborn infants compared to other forms of triggered ventilation?
4964.notes: The study found no significant difference in rates of BPD or death when comparing NAVA to other ventilation methods.

4965.question: Do professional interventions make a difference to the number of hospital admissions?
4965.notes: Professional interventions probably make little or no difference to the number of hospital admissions (RR 1.24, 95% CI 0.79 to 1.96).

4966.question: Does metformin reduce the likelihood of caesarean section compared to insulin in pregnant women with type 2 diabetes?

4967.question: Is thrombolytic therapy effective in restoring catheter function compared to placebo in patients with ESKD on HD?
4967.notes: Based on low certainty evidence, thrombolytic therapy may restore catheter function when compared to placebo (149 participants: RR 4.05, 95% CI 1.42 to 11.56).

4968.question: Is metformin effective in regressing endometrial hyperplasia histology towards normal histology compared to megestrol acetate?
4968.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 3.34, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.97 to 11.57, very low-quality evidence.

4969.question: Do local anaesthetics provide a clinically meaningful reduction in pain during outpatient hysteroscopy compared to placebo or no treatment?
4969.notes: Local anaesthetics reduced mean pain scores during the procedure, but the difference was unlikely to be clinically meaningful (up to 7 mm on a 0-10 cm VAS).

4970.question: Do educational interventions aimed at general practitioners lead to a significant weight reduction in adults with overweight or obesity?
4970.notes: Mean difference (MD) -1.24 kg, 95% confidence interval (CI) -2.84 to 0.37; 3 studies, N = 1017 adults.

4971.question: Does tuberculosis outreach screening, using house-to-house visits, increase tuberculosis case detection in areas with a prevalence of 5% or more?

4972.question: Does methylphenidate improve hyperactivity symptoms in children with ASD as rated by teachers?
4972.notes: SMD -0.78, 95% CI -1.13 to -0.43; 4 studies, 73 participants; P < 0.001

4973.question: Are mesenchymal stem/stromal cells (MSCs) currently considered safe and effective for preventing or treating bronchopulmonary dysplasia (BPD) in preterm infants?
4973.notes: There is insufficient evidence from RCTs or quasi-RCTs to determine the safety and efficacy of MSCs for BPD in preterm infants.

4974.question: Do direct oral anticoagulants (DOAC) reduce the incidence of stroke and systemic embolism events compared to warfarin in AF patients with CKD?
4974.notes: DOAC appeared to probably reduce the incidence of stroke and systemic embolism events with a risk ratio (RR) of 0.81 and a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 0.65 to 1.00.

4975.question: Are proton pump inhibitors (PPIs) more effective than placebo in relieving overall dyspepsia symptoms in people with functional dyspepsia?
4975.notes: PPIs were more effective than placebo with a risk ratio (RR) of 0.88 and a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 0.82 to 0.94.

4976.question: Does routine administration of antibiotics after uncomplicated vaginal birth reduce the risk of endometritis?
4976.notes: RR 0.28, 95% CI 0.09 to 0.83, two trials, 1364 women

4977.question: Does enhancing practitioner empathy improve patient outcomes such as pain, anxiety, and satisfaction?
4977.notes: Empathic consultations improved outcomes by a small amount (standardised mean difference -0.18 [95% CI -0.32 to -0.03]).

4978.question: Does early administration of erythropoiesis-stimulating agents (ESAs) reduce the risk of necrotising enterocolitis (NEC) in preterm infants?
4978.notes: Typical RR 0.69, 95% CI 0.52 to 0.91; typical RD -0.03, 95% CI -0.05 to -0.01

4979.question: Do glucocorticosteroids reduce all-cause mortality in patients with alcoholic hepatitis within three months of treatment?
4979.notes: Random-effects RR 0.90, 95% CI 0.70 to 1.15; moderate heterogeneity (I² = 45%)

4980.question: Does performing a screening hysteroscopy before IVF increase the live birth rate in women undergoing IVF?
4980.notes: While initial analysis suggested an increase (RR 1.26, 95% CI 1.11 to 1.43), sensitivity analysis of low-risk bias trials showed no increase (RR 0.99, 95% CI 0.82 to 1.18).

4981.question: Is budesonide more effective than mesalamine in achieving clinical response in patients with collagenous colitis?
4981.notes: Clinical response occurred in 80% of budesonide patients compared to 44% of mesalamine patients (RR 1.82, 95% CI 1.13 to 2.93).

4982.question: Does perineural dexamethasone prolong the duration of sensory block compared to placebo in upper limb surgeries?
4982.notes: Mean difference of 6.70 hours, 95% CI 5.54 to 7.85.

4983.question: Does virtual reality improve upper limb function when used as an adjunct to usual care in stroke rehabilitation?

4984.question: Does glucocorticoid therapy for childhood ALL commonly result in adrenal insufficiency shortly after cessation?
4984.notes: Adrenal insufficiency occurs in nearly all children during the first days after cessation of glucocorticoid treatment.

4985.question: Does adding music therapy to treatment as usual (TAU) improve depressive symptoms compared to TAU alone?
4985.notes: Clinician-rated depressive symptoms (SMD -0.98, 95% CI -1.69 to -0.27) and patient-reported depressive symptoms (SMD -0.85, 95% CI -1.37 to -0.34) showed improvement.

4986.question: Does the use of micronutrient powders (MNP) containing iron reduce the prevalence of anaemia in preschool- and school-age children compared to no intervention or placebo?
4986.notes: Prevalence ratio (PR) 0.66, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.49 to 0.88, based on 10 trials with 2448 children.

4987.question: Does group counselling increase the likelihood of smoking cessation among adolescents compared to no intervention?
4987.notes: Group counselling showed a risk ratio of 1.35 with a 95% confidence interval of 1.03 to 1.77.

4988.question: Does the use of <sup>18</sup>F-florbetaben PET scans improve the diagnostic accuracy for predicting progression from mild cognitive impairment (MCI) to Alzheimer's disease dementia (ADD)?
4988.notes: The sensitivity was 100% and specificity was 88% for diagnosing ADD at follow-up, but based on a single study with 45 participants.

4989.question: Does local cervical treatment for CIN or early cervical cancer increase the risk of preterm birth (less than 37 weeks) compared to no treatment?
4989.notes: Women who had treatment were at increased overall risk of preterm birth (10.7% versus 5.4%, RR 1.75, 95% CI 1.57 to 1.96).

4990.question: Does routine antibiotic prophylaxis reduce the incidence of episiotomy wound dehiscence with infection?
4990.notes: The trial showed no clear indication of reduced incidence with a risk ratio of 0.13 (95% CI 0.01 to 2.28).

4991.question: Is insulin associated with an increased risk for hypertensive disorders of pregnancy compared to oral anti-diabetic pharmacological therapy?
4991.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.89, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.14 to 3.12; four studies, 1214 women.

4992.question: Does oral potassium citrate supplementation reduce recurrent calcium urinary stone formation in children following shockwave lithotripsy?
4992.notes: Risk ratio (RR) of 0.19 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 0.06 to 0.60; evidence downgraded due to study limitations and bias.

4993.question: Does the addition of Doppler ultrasound to fetal growth ultrasound at 25, 30, and 35 weeks' gestation reduce perinatal mortality in twin pregnancies?

4994.question: Does epidural therapy reduce maternal diastolic arterial pressure in severe pre-eclampsia?
4994.notes: The included study reported a reduction in maternal diastolic arterial pressure with epidural therapy.

4995.question: Are regulatory agencies consistently including all available trials in their decisions for extended-release methylphenidate applications for adult ADHD?
4995.notes: 7 out of 13 applications were missing entire trials.

4996.question: Does beta-blocker therapy reduce the incidence of all-cause mortality in people with Marfan syndrome?

4997.question: Does silodosin reduce urologic symptom scores compared to placebo in men with benign prostatic hyperplasia?

4998.question: Is there evidence that prednisone improves neuropathy impairment in CIDP patients compared to no treatment?
4998.notes: The RCT showed a risk ratio of 2.02 (95% CI 0.90 to 4.52) for improvement, but the evidence is very low quality.

4999.question: Does adding inhaled magnesium sulfate to inhaled β₂-agonist and ipratropium bromide reduce hospital admissions during acute asthma exacerbations?
4999.notes: RR 0.95, 95% CI 0.91 to 1.00; participants = 1308; studies = 4; I² = 52%

5000.question: Does combining diet and exercise interventions during pregnancy reduce the risk of gestational diabetes mellitus compared to standard care?
5000.notes: Average risk ratio (RR) 0.85, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.71 to 1.01; moderate-quality evidence.

5001.question: Is the automated photoscreener effective in detecting strabismus in children aged 1 to 6 years in a community setting?
5001.notes: The sensitivity of the automated photoscreener is 0.46 (95% CI 0.19 to 0.75), indicating low effectiveness in detecting strabismus.

5002.question: Do monofilament sutures reduce the risk of incisional hernia compared to multifilament sutures?

5003.question: Is keratinocyte growth factor (KGF) likely to reduce the risk of moderate to severe oral mucositis in adults receiving radiotherapy to the head and neck with cisplatin or fluorouracil?

5004.question: Does zuclopenthixol dihydrochloride cause more extra-pyramidal side effects (EPSEs) compared to risperidone?

5005.question: Does inadequate staffing of facilities impact the quality of care provided by skilled birth attendants in low- and middle-income countries?
5005.notes: Inadequate staffing increases workloads, makes supervision difficult, and results in poorer care.

5006.question: Does adding a tumour bed boost improve local control in women with early-stage breast cancer?
5006.notes: Local control was better with a tumour bed boost (HR 0.64, 95% CI 0.55 to 0.75).

5007.question: Does oral chloral hydrate have a lower sedation failure rate compared to oral promethazine in children undergoing neurodiagnostic procedures?

5008.question: Does the use of <sup>18</sup>F-flutemetamol PET scans improve the diagnostic accuracy for predicting progression from mild cognitive impairment (MCI) to Alzheimer's disease dementia (ADD) at two years of follow-up?
5008.notes: Sensitivity of 89% and specificity of 80% for two-year follow-up.

5009.question: Does alemtuzumab at a dose of 12 mg per day reduce the risk of relapses in patients with relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis compared to interferon beta 1a?

5010.question: Do thrombopoietin receptor agonists (TPO-RAs) reduce the number of patients with at least one bleeding episode of any severity in patients with solid tumors undergoing chemotherapy?
5010.notes: RR 0.62, 95% CI 0.22 to 1.78; two trials, 206 participants

5011.question: Does splenectomy prevent further acute splenic sequestration crises in individuals with sickle cell disease?
5011.notes: Splenectomy, if full, is suggested to prevent further sequestration, but no trials were found to confirm this.

5012.question: Does the use of <sup>18</sup>F-florbetapir PET scan improve the diagnostic accuracy for predicting progression from mild cognitive impairment (MCI) to Alzheimer's disease dementia (ADD)?
5012.notes: Despite some studies showing good sensitivity, the overall poor specificity and limited data do not support routine use.

5013.question: Is inferior oblique myectomy associated with a greater reduction in hypertropia in primary gaze compared to recession?
5013.notes: Data were not available for statistical comparison, but the study reported a higher average decrease in hypertropia for myectomy.

5014.question: Does pharmacological cardioversion of atrial fibrillation reduce the risk of stroke compared to rate control?
5014.notes: The abstract states there is no reduction in stroke risk with rhythm control.

5015.question: Does electrical cardioversion improve quality of life in terms of physical functioning, physical role function, and vitality compared to rate control?
5015.notes: Three domains of quality of life were significantly better in the rhythm control group.

5016.question: Do safe blood collection systems significantly reduce needlestick injuries (NSIs) in healthcare workers?
5016.notes: One RCT found no considerable effect on NSIs (RR 0.2, 95% CI 0.01 to 4.14).

5017.question: Does laparoscopic ovarian drilling (LOD) improve menstrual regularity compared to medical treatments such as metformin and clomiphene?
5017.notes: There appeared to be little or no difference in the rate of women reporting improvement in menstrual regularity when LOD was compared with medical treatment including metformin + clomiphene (OR 1.02, 95% CI 0.64 to 1.64).

5018.question: Does enzyme replacement therapy with alglucosidase alfa improve survival and ventilation-free survival in children with infantile-onset Pompe disease?
5018.notes: The trial reported that long-term alglucosidase alfa treatment markedly extended survival and ventilation-free survival.

5019.question: Do probiotics as an adjuvant therapy increase the rate of short-term clinical cure in non-pregnant women with vulvovaginal candidiasis?
5019.notes: Probiotics increased the rate of short-term clinical cure with a risk ratio of 1.14 (95% CI 1.05 to 1.24).

5020.question: Do implementation strategies in schools lead to improvements in child dietary intake?
5020.notes: Positive improvements in child dietary intake were generally reported among trials reporting these outcomes.

5021.question: Is there evidence that using a device or hormonal treatment compared to no treatment or placebo affects term delivery or ongoing pregnancy rates in women undergoing operative hysteroscopy?
5021.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 0.94, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.42 to 2.12; 107 women; 2 studies; I² = 0%

5022.question: Is there a difference in total complications between ligature and mechanical devices for appendix stump closure?

5023.question: Does neuromuscular electrical stimulation (NMES) reduce the risk of total deep vein thrombosis (DVT) compared to no prophylaxis?
5023.notes: NMES showed lower risks of total DVT with an OR of 0.40 (95% CI 0.23 to 0.70).

5024.question: Does providing information and counselling about cataract and cataract surgery increase the uptake of surgery in rural China?
5024.notes: The study showed little or no effect on the uptake of surgery (OR 1.11, 95% CI 0.67 to 1.84).

5025.question: Is there evidence that pharmacological interventions like baclofen and botulinum toxin A are effective in managing spasticity in TBI patients?
5025.notes: The studies did not report results adequately, and the quality of evidence was very low.

5026.question: Do unconditional cash transfers (UCTs) impact the likelihood of using any health service in low- and middle-income countries?
5026.notes: UCTs may not have impacted the likelihood of having used any health service (RR 1.04, 95% CI 1.00 to 1.09).

5027.question: Does adding a cytostatic or targeted agent improve overall survival in patients with esophageal or gastroesophageal junction cancer compared to control?
5027.notes: The hazard ratio for overall survival was 0.75 (95% CI 0.68 to 0.84), indicating a survival benefit.

5028.question: Does laparoscopic surgical resection lead to a shorter mean hospital stay compared to open surgical resection for acute sigmoid diverticulitis?

5029.question: Is the use of clomiphene citrate or letrozole associated with a reduction in the incidence of ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome compared to gonadotropins in IVF treatments?

5030.question: Is there a difference in the rate of postextubation stridor between cuffed and uncuffed endotracheal tubes in children under eight years old?
5030.notes: Two trials found no difference in postextubation stridor (RR 0.93, 95% CI 0.65 to 1.33; 2734 children).

5031.question: Is there evidence that periodontal therapy can prevent the recurrence of cardiovascular disease in patients with chronic periodontitis?
5031.notes: The study found insufficient evidence to determine the effect of periodontal therapy on CVD recurrence (RR 0.72; 95% CI 0.23 to 2.22).

5032.question: Does physical exercise training improve aerobic exercise capacity in people with cystic fibrosis?
5032.notes: Positive effects were found in four out of seven studies.

5033.question: Are analgesics more effective at reducing pain following orthodontic treatment compared to no treatment or a placebo?
5033.notes: Analgesics reduced pain at 2, 6, and 24 hours with mean differences on a VAS of -11.66 mm, -24.27 mm, and -21.19 mm respectively.

5034.question: Does the speed of subcutaneous heparin injection affect pain intensity 48 hours after injection?
5034.notes: Slow injection is associated with less pain intensity compared to fast injection at 48 hours post-injection.

5035.question: Does itraconazole improve the complete cure rate of Old World cutaneous leishmaniasis compared to placebo?
5035.notes: 85/125 participants in the itraconazole group achieved complete cure compared to 54/119 in the placebo group (RR 3.70, 95% CI 0.35 to 38.99).

5036.question: Does transcendental meditation (TM) effectively reduce systolic and diastolic blood pressure in the context of primary prevention of cardiovascular disease (CVD)?
5036.notes: Considerable statistical heterogeneity was observed (I² = 72% for systolic and I² = 66% for diastolic blood pressure), preventing a definitive conclusion.

5037.question: Is genomics-based non-invasive prenatal testing (gNIPT) sufficiently accurate to replace invasive diagnostic tests for confirming fetal aneuploidies?
5037.notes: The performance of gNIPT is not sufficient to replace current invasive diagnostic tests.

5038.question: Do mass media tobacco control campaigns show a consistent positive effect on smoking prevalence among adults?
5038.notes: The results show mixed effects with some campaigns reporting significant decreases in smoking prevalence, while others do not.

5039.question: Is there evidence that mindfulness-based interventions reduce opioid consumption in chronic non-cancer pain patients?
5039.notes: Two studies found significant differences in opioid consumption with mindfulness interventions.

5040.question: Does metformin improve live birth rates compared to placebo in women with PCOS?
5040.notes: OR 1.59, 95% CI 1.00 to 2.51, 4 studies, 435 women, I<sup>2</sup> = 0%

5041.question: Are biologic treatments such as anti-IL17, anti-IL12/23, anti-IL23, and anti-TNF alpha more effective than small molecules and conventional systemic agents in achieving PASI 90 for moderate to severe psoriasis?
5041.notes: Biologic treatments were significantly more effective than small molecules and conventional systemic agents in reaching PASI 90.

5042.question: Does adding immunotherapy (excluding checkpoint inhibitors) to conventional curative surgery or radiotherapy improve overall survival in patients with localized NSCLC (stages I to III)?
5042.notes: The hazard ratio for overall survival was 0.94 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.83 to 1.06, indicating no statistically significant improvement.

5043.question: Is fondaparinux plus vitamin K antagonist as effective as standard treatment in preventing recurrent venous thromboembolism (VTE) in patients with deep vein thrombosis (DVT)?
5043.notes: The meta-analysis showed no clear difference in the risk of recurrent VTE (RR 0.80, 95% CI 0.43 to 1.47).

5044.question: Is non-invasive ventilation associated with improved short-term survival compared to invasive ventilation in patients with acute respiratory failure due to neuromuscular disease?
5044.notes: The abstract indicates no randomised trials were found to support this comparison.

5045.question: Does antenatal education specifically tailored towards perineal care improve perineal wound healing in postnatal women?
5045.notes: The review found no studies meeting the inclusion criteria to assess the impact of antenatal education on perineal wound healing.

5046.question: Does fitness training improve cardiorespiratory fitness in individuals with traumatic brain injury?
5046.notes: Mean difference in peak power output was 35.47 watts in favor of fitness training (MD 35.47 W, 95% CI 2.53 to 68.41 W).

5047.question: Is there a clear preference for bilateral hearing aids over unilateral hearing aids among patients with bilateral hearing impairment?
5047.notes: The percentage of patients preferring bilateral aids varied widely between studies, and the evidence quality is very low.

5048.question: Is the use of benzodiazepines alone effective for improving the global state in psychosis-induced aggression or agitation compared to placebo in the medium term?
5048.notes: One trial showed more people receiving placebo showed no improvement in the medium term (RR 0.62, 95% CI 0.40 to 0.97).

5049.question: Do zinc supplements improve taste acuity in patients with zinc deficiency or idiopathic taste disorders?
5049.notes: The review found very low-quality evidence insufficient to conclude that zinc supplements improve taste acuity.

5050.question: Does Atraumatic Restorative Treatment (ART) using high-viscosity glass ionomer cement (H-GIC) increase the risk of restoration failure in primary teeth compared to conventional treatment over a follow-up period from 12 to 24 months?
5050.notes: Odds Ratio (OR) 1.60, 95% Confidence Interval (CI) 1.13 to 2.27; five studies; 643 participants analysed.

5051.question: Does the use of vitamin K antagonists (VKA) in ambulatory cancer patients undergoing systemic anticancer therapy decrease the incidence of deep vein thrombosis (DVT)?
5051.notes: VKA likely decreases the incidence of DVT (RR 0.08, 95% CI 0.00 to 1.42; RD 35 fewer per 1000, 95% CI 38 fewer to 16 more).

5052.question: Does antenatal pelvic floor muscle training (PFMT) reduce the risk of urinary incontinence in continent pregnant women during late pregnancy?
5052.notes: Risk ratio (RR) for incontinence 0.38, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.20 to 0.72; 6 trials, 624 women

5053.question: Do calcium channel blockers reduce the frequency of attacks in individuals with Raynaud's phenomenon compared to placebo?
5053.notes: CCBs reduced the average number of attacks per week by six compared with placebo, with a weighted mean difference of -6.13 (95% CI -6.60 to -5.67).

5054.question: Does antioxidant supplementation significantly reduce muscle soreness at 24 hours post-exercise?
5054.notes: The standardized mean difference (SMD) was -0.13 with a 95% confidence interval of -0.27 to 0.00, indicating a small difference that is unlikely to be clinically significant.

5055.question: Is there a clinically important difference in self-reported knee function between one-incision and two-incision techniques for ACL reconstruction in the short-term?
5055.notes: Mean difference (MD) 2.73 favors one-incision technique, 95% confidence interval (CI) -2.70 to 8.15; 79 participants, 2 studies

5056.question: Is botulinum toxin type A (BtA) associated with an improvement in cervical dystonia-specific impairment compared to placebo?
5056.notes: BtA was associated with a moderate-to-large improvement, with a reduction of 8.06 points in the TWSTRS total score at week 4 after injection.

5057.question: Do probiotics reduce the risk of Clostridium difficile-associated diarrhea (CDAD) in patients with a baseline risk greater than 5%?
5057.notes: Probiotics reduced the risk of CDAD by 70% in patients with a baseline risk >5% (RR 0.30, 95% CI 0.21 to 0.42).

5058.question: Does participating in an exercise program improve pain-free walking distance in individuals with intermittent claudication compared to no exercise?
5058.notes: Meta-analysis from nine studies with 391 participants showed improvement in pain-free walking distance (MD 82.11 m, 95% CI 71.73 to 92.48).

5059.question: Does newborn screening for galactosaemia prevent or reduce mortality and morbidity in affected neonates?
5059.notes: No randomized controlled studies were found to support this.

5060.question: Is neuromuscular electrical stimulation (NMES) associated with a clinically important reduction in knee pain when combined with exercise compared to exercise alone for people with patellofemoral pain?
5060.notes: The mean difference in pain reduction was -1.63 on a VAS scale, with a 95% CI of -2.23 to -1.02, which may not be clinically relevant as it falls within the minimal clinically important difference range of 1.5 to 2.0.

5061.question: Does the use of bisphosphonates reduce mortality in patients with multiple myeloma compared to placebo or no treatment?
5061.notes: Pooled results showed a reduction in mortality from 41% to 31% with bisphosphonates (HR 0.90, 95% CI 0.76 to 1.07).

5062.question: Does adding clopidogrel to aspirin reduce the risk of myocardial infarction in people with cardiovascular disease?

5063.question: Is electrical stimulation more effective than no active treatment for subjective cure of stress urinary incontinence?

5064.question: Does itraconazole improve the complete cure rate of Old World cutaneous leishmaniasis compared to placebo?
5064.notes: 85/125 participants in the itraconazole group achieved complete cure compared to 54/119 in the placebo group (RR 3.70, 95% CI 0.35 to 38.99).

5065.question: Is vocational rehabilitation effective in enhancing return-to-work for workers with traumatic upper limb injuries?
5065.notes: The abstract states there is no high-quality evidence to support or refute the efficacy of vocational rehabilitation for this purpose.

5066.question: Does levetiracetam perform better than carbamazepine for individuals with partial seizures in terms of time to withdrawal of allocated treatment?
5066.notes: Levetiracetam performed significantly better than carbamazepine for the primary outcome.

5067.question: Is thrombolysis effective in reducing the risk of serious complications such as post-thrombotic syndrome and pulmonary embolism in patients with acute upper extremity deep vein thrombosis?
5067.notes: No trials were found to assess the effectiveness of thrombolysis in this context.

5068.question: Does peritoneal dialysis (PD) improve all-cause mortality compared to extracorporeal therapy in patients with acute kidney injury (AKI)?
5068.notes: PD probably made little or no difference to all-cause mortality (RR 1.12, 95% CI 0.81 to 1.55).

5069.question: Do long-acting muscarinic antagonist bronchodilators improve FEV1 in children and adults with cystic fibrosis?
5069.notes: The mean difference in FEV1 was not significant with tiotropium at doses of 2.5 µg or 5.0 µg.

5070.question: Is oxcarbazepine associated with at least a 50% reduction in pain scores for patients with painful diabetic peripheral neuropathy compared to placebo?
5070.notes: 34.8% with oxcarbazepine versus 18.2% with placebo (RR 1.91, 95% CI 1.08 to 3.39). High risk of bias and publication bias.

5071.question: Is the NEXUS criteria a reliable tool for detecting cervical spine injury in pediatric patients following blunt trauma?
5071.notes: The sensitivity of the NEXUS criteria varies widely among studies, with a lower limit as low as 0.18, indicating a risk of missing CSI.

5072.question: Does inspiratory muscle training improve predicted maximal inspiratory pressure in people with mild to moderate MS?
5072.notes: Mean difference (MD) 20.92 cmH2O, 95% confidence interval (CI) 6.03 to 35.81, P = 0.006, I2 = 18%

5073.question: Does combining diet and physical activity reduce the incidence of type 2 diabetes mellitus in people with impaired glucose tolerance compared to standard treatment?
5073.notes: The relative risk (RR) for developing T2DM was 0.57 (95% CI 0.50 to 0.64) in the diet plus physical activity group compared to the comparator group.

5074.question: Does head-of-bed elevation (HBE) reduce mortality in patients with severe traumatic brain injury (TBI)?
5074.notes: The review included only three small studies with a total of 20 participants, and the evidence was rated as very low quality.

5075.question: Do corticosteroids reduce mortality in adults with severe pneumonia?

5076.question: Does criteria-based school dental screening improve dental attendance compared to no screening?
5076.notes: Pooled effect estimate of RR 1.07 (95% CI 0.99 to 1.16) suggests a possible benefit.

5077.question: Is there evidence that metal-free single crowns (full contour zirconia) have a lower failure rate than cast gold single crowns after five years?
5077.notes: Some evidence of benefit for gold crowns after five years, but overall insufficient evidence of a difference.

5078.question: Does a home-like model of care improve health-related quality of life compared to traditional designs in residential aged care?
5078.notes: The certainty of the evidence is very low, and no statistically significant differences were observed.

5079.question: Does introducing larvivorous fish reduce malaria transmission or the density of adult Anopheles mosquito populations?
5079.notes: The studies did not report effects on malaria transmission or adult Anopheles density.

5080.question: Does exercise improve maternal and fetal outcomes in pregnant women with pre-existing diabetes?
5080.notes: No RCTs were identified to evaluate the effects of exercise interventions in this population.

5081.question: Does nebulised hypertonic saline reduce the length of hospital stay in infants with acute bronchiolitis compared to nebulised 0.9% saline?
5081.notes: Mean difference of -0.41 days with a 95% confidence interval of -0.75 to -0.07.

5082.question: Does singing improve the physical health component of quality of life in people with COPD?
5082.notes: Improvement in SF-36 Physical Component Summary score (MD 12.64, 95% CI 5.50 to 19.77).

5083.question: Does acupuncture alone reduce the risk of 'no clinical response' to pain compared to other therapies?
5083.notes: Acupuncture may reduce the risk of 'no clinical response' to pain compared to other therapies (RR 0.25, 95% CI 0.12 to 0.51).

5084.question: Does nursing-delivered smoking cessation intervention increase the likelihood of quitting smoking compared to no intervention or usual care?
5084.notes: The intervention increased the likelihood of quitting with a risk ratio (RR) of 1.29 and a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 1.21 to 1.38.

5085.question: Is there a difference in clinical cure rates between macrolides and other antibiotics for treating chancroid?
5085.notes: Low quality evidence suggested no difference in clinical cure rates (RR 1.09, 95% CI 0.97 to 1.21; 2 studies, 340 participants with syndromic approach).

5086.question: Do bisphosphonates reduce the incidence of skeletal-related events in men with prostate cancer metastatic to bone?
5086.notes: Bisphosphonates resulted in 58 fewer skeletal-related events per 1000 (RR 0.87, 95% CI 0.81 to 0.94).

5087.question: Do PPAR-γ agonists reduce the recurrence of stroke compared to placebo in patients with a history of stroke or TIA?

5088.question: Is extended prophylaxis more effective than placebo in preventing VTE-related mortality in patients with unprovoked VTE?
5088.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 0.98, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.14 to 6.98; 1862 participants; P = 0.98

5089.question: Do feed thickeners reduce the number of regurgitation episodes in formula-fed term infants with gastro-oesophageal reflux?
5089.notes: Mean difference of -1.97 episodes per day with a 95% CI of -2.32 to -1.61.

5090.question: Does yoga improve memory function in stroke survivors?
5090.notes: Mean difference (MD) 15.30, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.29 to 29.31, P = 0.03

5091.question: Is there evidence that adding high-dose hemithoracic radiotherapy to extrapleural pneumonectomy and platinum-based chemotherapy improves overall survival in patients with malignant pleural mesothelioma?
5091.notes: Median overall survival was 20.8 months without radiotherapy and 19.3 months with radiotherapy.

5092.question: Does the use of procyclidine result in clinically important improvement in tardive dyskinesia symptoms compared to isocarboxazid after 40 weeks of treatment?
5092.notes: One study reported that significantly more participants allocated to procyclidine had not improved to a clinically important extent compared with those allocated to isocarboxazid (RR 4.20, 95% CI 1.40 to 12.58).

5093.question: Does botulinum toxin effectively reduce the frequency of motor and phonic tics in individuals with Tourette's syndrome?
5093.notes: The study provided limited data with a small sample size and mild tics, leading to uncertain effects on tic frequency.

5094.question: Does losigamone as an add-on therapy lead to a 50% or greater reduction in seizure frequency for patients with focal epilepsy?

5095.question: Does levosimendan reduce short-term mortality compared to dobutamine in patients with cardiogenic shock?
5095.notes: Levosimendan may reduce short-term mortality compared to dobutamine (RR 0.60, 95% CI 0.37 to 0.95; 6 studies; 1776 participants).

5096.question: Is intramuscular aripiprazole more effective than placebo in reducing the need for additional injections in patients with psychosis-induced aggression or agitation?

5097.question: Does physical activity improve health-related quality of life (HRQoL) in women with breast cancer after adjuvant therapy?
5097.notes: Small-to-moderate improvements in HRQoL were observed with SMD 0.39 (95% CI 0.21 to 0.57) and SMD 0.78 (95% CI 0.39 to 1.17).

5098.question: Do alpha-methyldopa and reserpine lead to a clinically important improvement in tardive dyskinesia symptoms compared to placebo after 2 weeks of treatment?
5098.notes: Alpha-methyldopa (RR 0.33, 95% CI 0.14 to 0.80) and reserpine (RR 0.52, 95% CI 0.29 to 0.96) showed improvement compared to placebo.

5099.question: Is intrauterine insemination (IUI) associated with higher clinical pregnancy rates compared to intracervical insemination (ICI) in natural cycles?
5099.notes: IUI resulted in higher clinical pregnancy rates (OR 6.18, 95% CI 1.91 to 20.03; 2 RCTs, 76 women; I² = 48%).

5100.question: Does MR perfusion with an rCBV threshold of <1.75 effectively differentiate low-grade gliomas from high-grade gliomas?
5100.notes: The sensitivity/specificity estimates were 0.83/0.48, indicating limited effectiveness in differentiation.

5101.question: Does preventive antibiotic therapy reduce the risk of a poor functional outcome (dependency and/or death) in people with acute stroke?

5102.question: Is there evidence that adjunctive local antibiotics improve outcomes in supportive periodontal therapy compared to mechanical debridement alone?
5102.notes: Both studies found no evidence of a difference between groups at 12 months.

5103.question: Does intensity-modulated radiotherapy (IMRT) reduce acute gastrointestinal toxicity compared to 3D conformal radiotherapy (3DCRT) in patients receiving pelvic radiotherapy?
5103.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.48, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.26 to 0.88; participants = 444; studies = 4; I² = 77%

5104.question: Do patient reminder or recall interventions improve the proportion of participants who receive immunizations?
5104.notes: Risk ratio (RR) of 1.28, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.23 to 1.35; risk difference of 8%.

5105.question: Do selective noradrenaline reuptake inhibitors (NRIs) improve negative symptoms in schizophrenia compared to placebo?
5105.notes: One RCT showed significantly greater rates of improvement in negative symptoms scores with NRIs (RR 3.17, 95% CI 1.52 to 6.58).

5106.question: Does the administration of propofol improve the quality and quantity of sleep in adults in the ICU?
5106.notes: The studies included in the review did not provide sufficient evidence to determine the effect of propofol on sleep quality and quantity due to methodological heterogeneity and imprecise measurement tools.

5107.question: Do prostanoids reduce the incidence of total amputations in patients with critical limb ischaemia compared to placebo?

5108.question: Is there evidence that interventions targeting parental smoking cessation effectively reduce children's exposure to environmental tobacco smoke?
5108.notes: 26 out of 78 studies reported a beneficial intervention effect, with 24 being statistically significant.

5109.question: Does the use of intravitreal bevacizumab/ranibizumab as monotherapy reduce the risk of retinal detachment in preterm infants with type 1 ROP?

5110.question: Is home treatment with LMWH associated with a lower recurrence of VTE events compared to hospital treatment with UFH?
5110.notes: Fixed-effect risk ratio (RR) 0.58, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.39 to 0.86

5111.question: Does cyclophosphamide improve lung function compared to placebo in individuals with CTD-ILD?
5111.notes: Post-treatment FVC % mean difference (MD) 2.83, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.80 to 4.87; P = 0.006

5112.question: Does selenium supplementation reduce the overall incidence of cancer?
5112.notes: The summary risk ratio for any cancer incidence was 1.01 (95% CI 0.93 to 1.10) in RCTs with high-certainty evidence, indicating no reduction.

5113.question: Does providing physicians with feedback on medication adherence lead to improvements in medication adherence rates?
5113.notes: Seven studies with 22,924 patients showed little or no difference in adherence rates.

5114.question: Do child-feeding practice interventions increase vegetable consumption in children aged five years and younger?
5114.notes: The meta-analysis showed a positive effect with an SMD of 0.38 (95% CI 0.15 to 0.61), equivalent to a mean difference of 4.03 g of vegetables.

5115.question: Does low molecular weight heparin (LMWH) decrease mortality at three months compared to unfractionated heparin (UFH) in people with cancer and venous thromboembolism (VTE)?
5115.notes: LMWH likely decreases mortality at three months compared to UFH with a risk ratio (RR) of 0.66 and a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 0.40 to 1.10.

5116.question: Does e-learning improve patient outcomes such as LDL cholesterol levels and glycated hemoglobin levels compared to traditional learning?
5116.notes: Low-certainty evidence suggests little or no difference in patient outcomes like LDL cholesterol (adjusted difference 4.0%, 95% CI -0.3 to 7.9) and glycated hemoglobin (adjusted difference 4.6%, 95% CI -1.5 to 9.8).

5117.question: Is there evidence that the UCEIS is the most accurate endoscopic scoring tool for detecting disease change in ulcerative colitis?
5117.notes: One study concluded that the UCEIS may be the most accurate endoscopic scoring tool.

5118.question: Is antidepressant therapy associated with greater improvement in depression compared to placebo in people living with HIV when assessed with the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale as a continuous outcome?

5119.question: Is there evidence that surgery improves visual acuity in patients with postvitrectomy cataract?
5119.notes: No RCTs or quasi-RCTs were found to provide evidence on this question.

5120.question: Does modafinil treatment improve fatigue symptoms in individuals with ALS/MND compared to placebo?
5120.notes: The study suggests possible improvements but the evidence is very low quality with a mean difference of -11.00 (95% CI -23.08 to 1.08).

5121.question: Is there a clinically important improvement in tardive dyskinesia when using benzodiazepines compared to placebo?
5121.notes: No significant difference found (RR 1.12, 95% CI 0.60 to 2.09).

5122.question: Does intraoperative MRI (iMRI) increase the extent of resection in high-grade glioma surgeries?
5122.notes: Risk ratio (RR) of incomplete resection 0.13, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.02 to 0.96; 1 study, 49 participants.

5123.question: Does active cerebral NIRS monitoring reduce the incidence of mild postoperative cognitive dysfunction (POCD) at one week after surgery?
5123.notes: Two studies with 126 participants showed a reduction in mild POCD (RR 0.53, 95% CI 0.30 to 0.95, I² = 49%).

5124.question: Does risperidone show a clear advantage over clozapine in reducing positive psychotic symptoms in individuals with serious mental illness and co-occurring substance misuse?

5125.question: Is embolisation associated with a reduction in morbidity and mortality for patients with pulmonary arteriovenous malformations?
5125.notes: Based on accumulated data from observational studies, embolisation is suggested to be a safe procedure that reduces morbidity and mortality.

5126.question: Does gefitinib improve overall survival in the general population when used as first- or second-line treatment for advanced NSCLC?
5126.notes: Gefitinib did not statistically improve overall survival compared to placebo or chemotherapy in the general population.

5127.question: Does early removal of ureteric stents reduce the incidence of urinary tract infections in kidney transplant recipients?
5127.notes: The incidence of UTI may be reduced in the early stent removal group (RR 0.49, 95% CI 0.30 to 0.81).

5128.question: Is buccal midazolam more effective than rectal diazepam for the treatment of acute tonic-clonic convulsions in children?
5128.notes: The review provides low- to very low-quality evidence with uncertainty about the effect (RR 1.25, 95% CI 1.13 to 1.38; 4 trials; 690 children).

5129.question: Is there evidence to support the effectiveness of hybrid repair compared to open surgical repair for thoracic aortic arch aneurysms?
5129.notes: No RCTs or CCTs were found to provide evidence on this comparison.

5130.question: Does comprehensive geriatric assessment (CGA) reduce mortality in older people with hip fracture?

5131.question: Do quality improvement interventions targeting patients, healthcare professionals, or the healthcare system increase diabetic retinopathy screening attendance compared to usual care?
5131.notes: DRS attendance increased by 12% (RD 0.12, 95% CI 0.10 to 0.14) compared with usual care.

5132.question: Does using a checklist-type question method lead to a higher detection of adverse events compared to open questions?
5132.notes: The narrative review showed a lower level of reporting for open questions compared to checklists, with risk ratios ranging from 0.12 to 0.64.

5133.question: Does the use of lower biological WBRT doses compared to standard control doses improve overall survival in adults with newly diagnosed multiple brain metastases?
5133.notes: The hazard ratio for overall survival with lower biological WBRT doses was 1.21 (95% CI 1.04 to 1.40), indicating worse outcomes compared to control.

5134.question: Does vitamin E prevent deterioration of symptoms in patients with antipsychotic-induced tardive dyskinesia?
5134.notes: People allocated to placebo may show more deterioration compared with those given vitamin E (RR 0.23, 95% CI 0.07 to 0.76).

5135.question: Does induction of labour at term reduce the risk of serious maternal morbidity compared to expectant management in women with gestational diabetes?
5135.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.48, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.25 to 8.76, indicating no clear difference.

5136.question: Do physical activity-only interventions improve cognitive executive function scores in children with obesity compared to standard practice?
5136.notes: Mean difference was 5.00 scale points higher in an after-school exercise group compared to standard practice (95% CI 0.68 to 9.32; scale mean 100, standard deviation 15; 116 children, 1 study).

5137.question: Does acupuncture reduce prostatitis symptoms compared with a sham procedure?
5137.notes: Mean difference in total NIH-CPSI score -5.79, 95% CI -7.32 to -4.26

5138.question: Does the application of seminal plasma increase the live birth rate in ART cycles?
5138.notes: There was insufficient evidence to determine a difference in live birth rates (RR 1.10, 95% CI 0.86 to 1.43).

5139.question: Do topical repellents provide protection against clinical malaria caused by P. falciparum when used alone?
5139.notes: One study reported a protective effect (RR 0.40, 95% CI 0.23 to 0.71), but overall evidence is very low certainty.

5140.question: Does administering 0.5 mg of vitamin K intramuscularly result in higher vitamin K levels compared to 0.2 mg given either intramuscularly or intravenously by day 25?
5140.notes: By day 25, vitamin K levels were higher in the 0.5 mg IM group compared to the 0.2 mg IV or IM groups.

5141.question: Does switching to risperidone reduce the severity of tardive dyskinesia compared to antipsychotic cessation?
5141.notes: Low-quality evidence from 1 RCT with 42 people showed a risk ratio of 0.45 (CI 0.23 to 0.89) favoring risperidone.

5142.question: Do personally tailored activities improve challenging behavior in people with dementia in long-term care settings?
5142.notes: The standardized mean difference (SMD) was -0.21 with a 95% confidence interval of -0.49 to 0.08, indicating a slight improvement.

5143.question: Does conducting open trials rather than blinded, placebo trials improve recruitment rates?
5143.notes: The absolute improvement was 10% (95% CI 7% to 13%).

5144.question: Does vaccination with inactivated influenza vaccines reduce the incidence of influenza in healthy adults?
5144.notes: Inactivated influenza vaccines reduce influenza from 2.3% to 0.9% (RR 0.41, 95% CI 0.36 to 0.47).

5145.question: Does fondaparinux reduce the risk of symptomatic venous thromboembolism (VTE) in patients with superficial thrombophlebitis (ST) compared to placebo?
5145.notes: Fondaparinux was associated with a significant reduction in symptomatic VTE (RR 0.15, 95% CI 0.04 to 0.50).

5146.question: Does prophylactic cranial irradiation improve survival in patients with small cell lung cancer in complete remission?
5146.notes: The relative risk of death in the treatment group compared to the control group was 0.84, indicating a survival benefit.

5147.question: Does treating asymptomatic bacteriuria with antibiotics reduce the incidence of symptomatic UTI in kidney transplant recipients?
5147.notes: Antibiotic treatment had uncertain effects on preventing symptomatic UTI (RR 0.86, 95% CI 0.51 to 1.45).

5148.question: Does BIS monitoring reduce the length of stay in the ICU for mechanically ventilated patients compared to clinical sedation assessment?
5148.notes: One study showed no evidence of a difference in ICU LOS with low-quality evidence.

5149.question: Does Niprisan® reduce episodes of severe painful sickle cell disease crisis over a six-month period?
5149.notes: The Phase IIB trial suggests effectiveness in reducing severe painful crises.

5150.question: Does vision screening in older adults living independently in the community reduce the risk of visual impairment?
5150.notes: The evidence from RCTs does not support vision screening for older people living independently in a community setting.

5151.question: Is the Mini-Cog test associated with high diagnostic accuracy for dementia in primary care settings?
5151.notes: The sensitivity varied between 0.76 to 1.00 and specificity between 0.27 to 0.85, with significant heterogeneity and methodological limitations.

5152.question: Does inhaled dry powder mannitol improve lung function in people with cystic fibrosis compared to control treatments?
5152.notes: Pooled evidence from two large parallel studies showed significant improvement in lung function (FEV1) in the mannitol group compared to control.

5153.question: Is ghrelin associated with improved food intake in adults with cancer cachexia compared to placebo?
5153.notes: One trial found that ghrelin improved food intake compared to placebo, but the evidence quality was rated as very low.

5154.question: Does glycerol reduce mortality in people with bacterial meningitis?

5155.question: Does the use of NSAIDs, including COX-2 inhibitors, lead to a higher rate of partial or complete regression of CIN 2 or CIN 3 compared to placebo?
5155.notes: Partial or complete regression occurred in 44% of treatment arms vs. 31% in placebo arms (RR 1.45, 95% CI 0.93 to 2.27; P value 0.10).

5156.question: Does intravenous administration of tranexamic acid reduce the risk of maternal death due to bleeding in women with primary postpartum haemorrhage?
5156.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.81, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.65 to 1.00; two trials, 20,172 women.

5157.question: Do self-management interventions improve health-related quality of life in adults with non-cystic fibrosis bronchiectasis?
5157.notes: Both studies reported no significant differences in health-related quality of life as measured by the SGRQ.

5158.question: Is Prostaglandin E1 (PGE1) effective in maintaining ductal patency in neonates with ductal-dependent cardiac lesions?
5158.notes: No randomized controlled trials were identified to determine the efficacy of PGE1.

5159.question: Does education with visualisation of respiratory particle dispersion improve healthcare workers' use of facial protection?
5159.notes: One study with 20 nurses showed improvement in facial protection use.

5160.question: Does orthodontic treatment without extraction of permanent teeth produce a different result compared to no treatment or treatment involving extraction in children with Class II division 2 malocclusion?
5160.notes: No RCTs or CCTs were identified to assess this comparison.

5161.question: Does exercise-based cardiac rehabilitation improve exercise capacity in adults with stable angina compared to usual care?
5161.notes: Low-quality evidence indicates a small improvement in exercise capacity (SMD 0.45, 95% CI 0.20 to 0.70).

5162.question: Does the introduction of primary care professionals in EDs reduce the total length of ED stay for non-urgent patients compared to care by emergency physicians?
5162.notes: The evidence is of very low certainty, and the results are inconsistent.

5163.question: Does providing free spectacles in addition to vision screening increase the proportion of children wearing spectacles compared to providing a prescription only?
5163.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.60, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.34 to 1.90; 1092 participants.

5164.question: Does nutritional labelling on menus in restaurants reduce energy purchased per meal?
5164.notes: Meta-analysis showed a reduction of 47 kcal per meal (MD -46.72 kcal, 95% CI -78.35, -15.10).

5165.question: Does the use of plastic wraps or bags improve core body temperature on admission to the NICU compared to routine care?
5165.notes: Mean difference (MD) 0.58°C, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.50 to 0.66; 13 studies; 1633 infants.

5166.question: Does a single low dose of primaquine (0.25 mg/kg) added to artemisinin-based therapy reduce infectiousness to mosquitoes by day 3-4?
5166.notes: Infectiousness was reduced with a relative risk of 0.12 (95% CI 0.02 to 0.88) at day 3 or 4.

5167.question: Does combination pharmacotherapy provide superior pain relief compared to monotherapy in fibromyalgia patients?
5167.notes: The abstract indicates inadequate evidence for primary outcomes of pain relief.

5168.question: Do regulatory interventions at national or branch level have a consistent effect on reducing fatal and non-fatal injuries among construction workers?
5168.notes: Effect size of -0.33; 95% CI -2.08 to 1.41 for initial effect and -0.03; 95% CI -0.30 to 0.24 for sustained effect, with high inconsistency (I² = 98%).

5169.question: Does individualizing FSH dose based on ovarian reserve tests improve live birth or ongoing pregnancy rates compared to a standard dose?
5169.notes: ORT-based dosing produces similar live birth/ongoing pregnancy rates to a standard dose of 150 IU.

5170.question: Are combined behavioural and lifestyle interventions associated with improved overall survival in women with endometrial cancer compared to usual care?
5170.notes: Risk ratio (RR mortality), 0.23 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.01 to 4.55, P = 0.34, one RCT, 37 participants.

5171.question: Is influenza vaccination associated with a reduction in all-cause mortality in immunosuppressed cancer patients?
5171.notes: The RCT showed similar mortality rates in both arms, while observational studies suggested a lower risk of death with vaccination.

5172.question: Does the combination of BRAF plus MEK inhibitors improve overall survival compared to BRAF inhibitors alone in BRAF-mutated melanoma?

5173.question: Is there evidence that systemic therapies are superior to best supportive care or placebo in the treatment of metastatic cutaneous melanoma?
5173.notes: No RCTs were found comparing systemic therapy with placebo or best supportive care.

5174.question: Does the addition of immunotherapy to chemotherapy improve survival in patients with metastatic melanoma?
5174.notes: The meta-analysis found no difference in survival with a hazard ratio of 0.89 (95% CI 0.72 to 1.11, P = 0.31).

5175.question: Does administering prophylactic intravenous antibiotics before caesarean incision reduce the risk of surgical site infection compared to administration after cord clamping?

5176.question: Is pulmonary artery perfusion during cardiopulmonary bypass associated with a decrease in all-cause mortality?
5176.notes: The effect on all-cause mortality is uncertain with a Peto OR of 1.78 (95% CI 0.43 to 7.40), indicating no clear evidence of benefit or harm.

5177.question: Do welfare-to-work interventions have a significant impact on maternal mental health over time?
5177.notes: At T1, there was a very small negative impact (SMD 0.07), no effect at T2 (SMD 0.00), and a very small positive effect at T3 (SMD -0.07).

5178.question: Does pregabalin provide greater self-reported neuropathic pain relief compared to placebo in people with sickle cell disease?

5179.question: Does a lower total fat intake (30% or less of total energy) compared to usual or modified fat intake probably decrease BMI in children over a one- to two-year period?

5180.question: Does the use of absorbable sutures lead to different postoperative pain outcomes compared to non-absorbable sutures after open carpal tunnel decompression?
5180.notes: SMD of 0.03 (95% CI -0.43 to 0.48) suggests little or no difference, but with high uncertainty.

5181.question: Do brief interventions reduce alcohol consumption in hazardous and harmful drinkers compared to minimal or no intervention?
5181.notes: Mean difference (MD) -20 g/week, 95% confidence interval (CI) -28 to -12.

5182.question: Does the use of autologous vein grafts improve primary patency compared to prosthetic grafts for above-knee bypasses over a 60-month period?

5185.question: Does influenza vaccination reduce the risk of influenza in older adults compared to placebo?

5186.question: Is there evidence that ceftriaxone is more effective than amoxicillin plus probenecid in curing gonococcal infections during pregnancy?
5186.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.07, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.98 to 1.16; one RCT; 168 women.

5187.question: Do live attenuated influenza vaccines reduce the risk of influenza infection in children aged 3 to 16 years?
5187.notes: Risk reduced from 18% to 4% (RR 0.22, 95% CI 0.11 to 0.41)

5188.question: Does activated charcoal reduce the absorption of paracetamol when administered within four hours of ingestion?
5188.notes: Activated charcoal seemed to reduce absorption, but clinical benefits were unclear.

5189.question: Does planned birth at or near term improve maternal and perinatal outcomes for pregnant women with pre-existing diabetes compared to an expectant approach?
5189.notes: The review identified no eligible published trials to assess this question.

5190.notes: The trials included have serious deficiencies and high risk of bias, providing no reliable evidence.

5191.question: Are there any randomized controlled trials that evaluate interventions for treating post-extraction bleeding?
5191.notes: The abstract states that no suitable RCTs were found for inclusion in the review.

5195.question: Is there a more accurate long-term ocular alignment associated with adjustable sutures compared to non-adjustable sutures in strabismus surgery?
5195.notes: The study showed no statistical difference in ocular alignment between the two techniques due to wide confidence intervals.

5197.question: Does breast surgery improve overall survival in women with metastatic breast cancer when combined with systemic therapy?

5198.question: Does aromatherapy reduce the severity of nausea compared to placebo?

5199.question: Is the diode laser associated with more pain during treatment compared to the argon laser for proliferative diabetic retinopathy?

5200.question: Is the urea breath test-13C more accurate than serology for diagnosing Helicobacter pylori infection?

5201.question: Is there evidence that inhaled antibiotics are more effective than oral antibiotics in eradicating infective organisms in bronchiectasis patients?
5201.notes: The abstract states that it is unclear whether inhaled or oral antibiotics are more effective, and no studies were identified for inclusion in the review.

5203.question: Does early mobilization in the ICU improve the return to independent functional status at hospital discharge compared to usual care?

5205.question: Does massage reduce pain intensity during the first stage of labour compared to usual care?
5205.notes: Standardised mean difference (SMD) -0.81, 95% confidence interval (CI) -1.06 to -0.56, six trials, 362 women.

5206.question: Is awareness of prolapse more common after transanal repair compared to transvaginal repair?
5206.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 2.78, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.00 to 7.70; 2 RCTs; n = 87

5207.question: Do physical activity-only interventions improve cognitive executive function scores in children with obesity compared to standard practice?
5207.notes: Mean difference was 5.00 scale points higher in an after-school exercise group compared to standard practice (95% CI 0.68 to 9.32; scale mean 100, standard deviation 15; 116 children, 1 study).

5208.question: Does the use of a vascular access specialist team improve insertion success compared to a generalist model?

5209.question: Do beta-blockers reduce the occurrence of supraventricular arrhythmias in patients undergoing cardiac surgery?

5211.question: Is oral water soluble contrast (OWSC) effective in reducing the duration of obstruction in patients with malignant bowel obstruction (MBO)?
5211.notes: The study did not report on the therapeutic effect due to low participant numbers.

5214.question: Is acupuncture more effective than no treatment or wait list control in reducing the severity of depression?

5215.question: Do cannabis-based medicines increase the number of people achieving 50% or greater pain relief compared to placebo?

5216.question: Does folic acid supplementation increase serum folate levels in children with sickle cell disease?

5217.question: Does treatment with factor Xa inhibitors reduce the number of strokes and systemic embolic events compared to warfarin in people with atrial fibrillation?

5218.question: Do α-2 adrenergic agonists reduce the risk of all-cause mortality in non-cardiac surgery?

5219.question: Does endovascular revascularisation improve maximum walking distance compared to no specific treatment for intermittent claudication?

5222.question: Does poor nutritional status accelerate the progression of visceral leishmaniasis?

5223.question: Does angioplasty improve ankle brachial pressure indices compared to non-surgical therapy in patients with mild to moderate intermittent claudication at six months follow-up?

5224.question: Does valproate help in reducing the relapse to benzodiazepine use?

5225.question: Do specialized interventions for epilepsy in children show consistent benefits across all outcomes compared to usual care?

5226.question: Does relaxation therapy lower the intensity of pain during the latent phase of labour compared to usual care?

5231.question: Does metabolomic assessment of embryos improve live birth or ongoing pregnancy rates compared to non-metabolomic methods in women undergoing ART?

5232.question: Does the use of intravenous immunoglobulin (IVIg) reduce the need for exchange transfusions in newborns with alloimmune hemolytic disease of the newborn (HDN)?

5233.question: Does FOLFIRINOX improve overall survival compared to gemcitabine alone in advanced pancreatic cancer?

5234.question: Does adding hyaluronidase to local anaesthetic solutions reduce intraoperative pain during eye surgery?

5235.question: Does sumatriptan reduce the risk of acute mountain sickness compared to placebo?

5240.question: Does providing respiratory support before cord clamping reduce mortality during hospital admission for preterm infants?

5241.question: Do systemic corticosteroids, either alone or with antibiotics, improve clinical symptoms and resolution of inflamed tympanic membranes in children with acute otitis media by Day 5?

5242.question: Does high correlated colour temperature (CCT) light improve alertness compared to standard illumination in daytime workers?

5245.question: Is cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) more effective than supportive therapy for improving clinician-reported ADHD symptoms in adults?

5247.question: Do inhaled antibiotics improve lung function in people with cystic fibrosis compared to placebo?

5249.question: Does botulinum toxin improve recovery in individuals with acute sixth nerve palsy compared to observation?

5250.question: Is there evidence that platelet transfusions reduce the risk of major bleeding in patients with thrombocytopenia undergoing lumbar puncture?

5252.question: Is there a preferred type of orthodontic adhesive for reducing bracket failure in fixed orthodontic appliances?

5253.question: Do oral homeopathic medicinal products provide a preventive effect on acute respiratory tract infections in children?

5257.question: Does follicular flushing improve the live birth rate compared to aspiration alone in women undergoing ART?

5258.notes: Net effect = $ -19.25 (2003 USD), intervention effect P = 0.01, clustered SE = $ 5.12

5259.question: Do antidepressants reduce the severity of depression in people with co-occurring depression and alcohol dependence?
5259.notes: Low-quality evidence suggested a reduction in depression severity with antidepressants (SMD -0.27, 95% CI -0.49 to -0.04), but this became non-significant after excluding high-risk bias studies.

5260.question: Do first-line low-dose thiazides reduce mortality in adult patients with moderate to severe primary hypertension?

5261.question: Are ergometrine plus oxytocin, carbetocin, and misoprostol plus oxytocin more effective than oxytocin alone in preventing postpartum haemorrhage of ≥ 500 mL?
5261.notes: Ergometrine plus oxytocin (RR 0.69, 95% CI 0.57 to 0.83), carbetocin (RR 0.72, 95% CI 0.52 to 1.00), and misoprostol plus oxytocin (RR 0.73, 95% CI 0.60 to 0.90) were more effective compared to oxytocin.

5262.question: Does using a two stage-two step final impression with silicone elastomer improve oral health-related quality of life compared to alginate?
5262.notes: Oral health-related quality of life measured by the OHIP-EDENT seemed to be better with silicone (MD 7.20, 95% CI 2.71 to 11.69; 144 participants).

5263.question: Does regional anaesthesia reduce the risk of persistent postoperative pain (PPP) three to 18 months after thoracotomy?
5263.notes: Odds Ratio (OR) 0.52, 95% CI 0.32 to 0.84, based on moderate-quality evidence from seven RCTs.

5264.question: Does oral propranolol improve clinician-assessed clearance of infantile haemangiomas compared to placebo?
5264.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 16.61, 95% confidence interval (CI) 4.22 to 65.34; 1 study; 156 children.

5265.question: Are antidepressants more effective than placebo in treating panic disorder?
5265.notes: The risk ratio for failure to respond is 0.72 (95% CI 0.66 to 0.79), with a number needed to treat for an additional beneficial outcome (NNTB) of 7.

5266.question: Does the laparoscopic-endoscopic rendezvous technique reduce overall morbidity compared to the preoperative endoscopic sphincterotomy followed by laparoscopic cholecystectomy?

5267.question: Do progressive computer glasses with an intermediate focus in the upper part of the glasses lead to a decrease in asthenopia symptoms compared to general-purpose progressive glasses in the short term?

5268.question: Does glucocorticosteroid avoidance or withdrawal reduce the incidence of diabetes mellitus and hypertension in liver transplant patients?
5268.notes: RR for diabetes mellitus: 0.81 (95% CI 0.66 to 0.99); RR for hypertension: 0.76 (95% CI 0.65 to 0.90)

5269.question: Does smectite reduce the duration of diarrhoea in children with acute infectious diarrhoea?
5269.notes: Smectite may reduce the duration by approximately a day (MD -24.38 hours, 95% CI -30.91 to -17.85).

5270.question: Do antimicrobial lock solutions reduce catheter-related infections (CRI) in patients undergoing haemodialysis with a central venous catheter?
5270.notes: Antimicrobial lock solutions probably reduce CRI per 1000 catheter-days (RR 0.38, 95% CI 0.27 to 0.53).

5271.question: Are alerts associated with an increase in the proportion of hospitalized patients who receive prophylaxis?
5271.notes: Alerts were associated with an increase in the proportion of participants who received prophylaxis (RD 21%, 95% CI 15% to 27%).

5272.question: Does zoledronic acid improve bone mineral density (BMD) in men undergoing pelvic radiotherapy for non-metastatic prostate cancer?
5272.notes: Both RCTs reported improvements in BMD with zoledronic acid, but the changes were measured and reported differently.

5273.question: Does supervised exercise therapy (SET) improve maximal treadmill walking distance (MWD) compared to home-based exercise therapy (HBET) and walking advice (WA) in patients with intermittent claudication?
5273.notes: SET showed clear improvement in MWD compared with HBET and WA, with SMDs of 0.37 and 0.80, respectively.

5274.question: Does exercise reduce pain in individuals with osteoarthritis?
5274.notes: Exercise reduced pain by an absolute percent reduction of 6% (95% CI -9% to -4%).

5275.question: Does discontinuation of antipsychotics in older people with dementia and neuropsychiatric symptoms have a significant impact on overall neuropsychiatric symptoms?
5275.notes: Discontinuation may make little or no difference to overall NPS, based on low-quality evidence from 7 trials with 519 participants.

5276.question: Does gemcitabine plus cisplatin reduce mortality at one year compared to S-1 plus cisplatin in adults with advanced biliary tract carcinomas?
5276.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.76, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.58 to 0.98; P = 0.04; participants = 96

5277.question: Do antidepressants show a beneficial effect on depressive symptoms in cancer patients compared to placebo during the acute-phase treatment (6 to 12 weeks)?
5277.notes: Standardised mean difference (SMD) -0.45, 95% confidence interval (CI) -1.01 to 0.11; risk ratio (RR) 0.82, 95% CI 0.62 to 1.08.

5278.question: Does the transradial approach reduce short-term net adverse clinical events compared to the transfemoral approach in patients undergoing diagnostic coronary angiography or PCI?

5279.question: Does hyperbaric oxygenation therapy (HBOT) improve survival rates for head and neck cancer at one and five years post-therapy?
5279.notes: RR at one year 0.83, 95% CI 0.70 to 0.98; RR at five years 0.82, 95% CI 0.69 to 0.98

5280.question: Does grommet insertion reduce the frequency of episodes of recurrent acute otitis media compared to no treatment in the first six months?
5280.notes: Grommet insertion leads to a mean reduction of 1.5 episodes of acute otitis media in the first six months after treatment.

5281.question: Do stand-mounted closed circuit televisions (CCTV) improve reading speed compared to optical devices for individuals with low vision?
5281.notes: Low-certainty evidence from 2 studies with 92 participants suggests higher reading speed with CCTV.

5282.question: Is risperidone more effective than haloperidol in reducing agitation in psychosis-induced aggression?
5282.notes: No clear difference was found between risperidone and haloperidol in terms of efficacy for reducing agitation (RR 1.04, 95% CI 0.86 to 1.26).

5283.question: Are prostaglandins more effective than lumbar sympathectomy in achieving complete ulcer healing without rest pain or major amputation in patients with critical limb ischaemia due to non-reconstructable peripheral arterial disease?
5283.notes: The single study reported a risk ratio of 1.63 (95% CI 1.30 to 2.05) favoring prostaglandins.

5284.question: Does vertebroplasty provide clinically important benefits in terms of pain reduction for patients with osteoporotic vertebral fractures?
5284.notes: Mean pain was 5 points with placebo and 0.6 points better with vertebroplasty, which is below the minimal clinically important difference of 15%.

5285.question: Does low-energy diode transscleral cyclophotocoagulation (TSCPC) achieve similar intraocular pressure (IOP) control compared to high-energy TSCPC in primary open-angle glaucoma?
5285.notes: Control of IOP was achieved in 47% of eyes at similar rates in both groups (RR 1.03, 95% CI 0.64 to 1.65; 79 participants).

5286.question: Does oral ivermectin lead to lower rates of complete clearance after one week compared to permethrin 5% cream?
5286.notes: Illustrative clearance with ivermectin is 43% compared to permethrin's 65% (RR 0.65, 95% CI 0.54 to 0.78).

5287.question: Does the combination of intravitreal anti-VEGF and steroids offer additional visual benefit compared to anti-VEGF monotherapy for diabetic macular oedema?
5287.notes: Mean difference in BCVA was -2.29 VA letters, 95% CI -6.03 to 1.45.

5288.question: Does low dose naltrexone improve clinical remission rates in adult patients with active Crohn's disease compared to placebo?
5288.notes: 30% of LDN patients achieved remission compared to 18% of placebo, but this was not statistically significant (RR 1.48, 95% CI 0.42 to 5.24).

5289.question: Is tranexamic acid (TXA) associated with a higher likelihood of improvement in heavy menstrual bleeding compared to progestogens?
5289.notes: TXA was associated with a higher likelihood of improvement (RR 1.54, 95% CI 1.31 to 1.80).

5290.question: Is rufinamide effective in reducing seizure frequency by at least 50% when used as an add-on treatment in people with drug-resistant focal epilepsy?
5290.notes: The overall RR for 50% or greater reduction in seizure frequency was 1.79 (95% CI 1.44 to 2.22).

5291.question: Does Daikenchuto reduce the time to first flatus in patients undergoing elective abdominal surgery?
5291.notes: Mean difference (MD) -11.32 hours, 95% confidence interval (CI) -17.45 to -5.19; very low-quality evidence.

5292.question: Does the use of moisturisers alone provide a clinically important protective effect against the development of occupational irritant hand dermatitis (OIHD)?
5292.notes: 13% of participants developed symptoms of OIHD compared to 19% of controls (RR 0.71, 95% CI 0.46 to 1.09).

5293.question: Is nortriptyline effective in preventing postnatal depression compared to placebo?
5293.notes: 23% of women on nortriptyline and 24% on placebo developed postnatal depression (RR 0.96, 95% CI 0.36 to 2.59).

5294.question: Does platelet transfusion increase the risk of death or dependence in patients with antiplatelet-associated acute spontaneous intracerebral haemorrhage?
5294.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.29, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.04 to 1.61, based on one trial with 190 participants.

5295.question: Do alpha-blockers increase stone clearance in patients with ureteral stones?
5295.notes: Higher-quality, placebo-controlled trials suggest a smaller effect (RR 1.16, 95% CI 1.07 to 1.25) compared to the overall analysis (RR 1.45, 95% CI 1.36 to 1.55).

5296.question: Is there evidence that non-benzodiazepine GABA agonist drugs improve tardive dyskinesia symptoms compared to placebo after six to eight weeks of treatment?
5296.notes: Data from six trials showed a clinically important improvement in TD symptoms (RR 0.83, CI 0.74 to 0.92).

5297.question: Is paracetamol as effective as ibuprofen in closing a patent ductus arteriosus (PDA) in preterm infants?
5297.notes: Typical risk ratio (RR) 0.95, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.75 to 1.21; typical risk difference (RD) -0.02, 95% CI -0.09 to 0.09); I² = 0% for RR and RD.

5298.question: Does high-frequency rTMS of the motor cortex provide a clinically important reduction in pain intensity at short-term follow-up?
5298.notes: The reduction in pain intensity was 12% (95% CI 9% to 16%), which does not meet the minimum clinically important difference threshold of 15% or greater.

5299.question: Do organisational interventions improve blood pressure control in patients with a history of stroke or TIA?
5299.notes: Organisational interventions resulted in improved blood pressure control, particularly in achieving target blood pressure (OR 1.44, 95% CI 1.09 to 1.90).

5300.question: Is continuing azathioprine monotherapy associated with a lower risk of clinical relapse compared to its withdrawal in patients with quiescent Crohn's disease?
5300.notes: 32% relapse in withdrawal group vs. 14% in continuation group (RR 0.42, 95% CI 0.24 to 0.72)

5301.question: Does deferiprone increase adherence to iron chelation therapy compared to deferoxamine?
5301.notes: Considerable heterogeneity in trials; adherence was high for both medications.

5302.question: Does the use of a time-lapse system (TLS) with conventional morphological assessment improve live birth rates compared to conventional incubation and assessment?
5302.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 0.73, 95% CI 0.47 to 1.13, indicating no evidence of a difference.

5303.question: Does letrozole improve live birth rates compared to clomiphene citrate in subfertile women with anovulatory PCOS?
5303.notes: Live birth rates were higher with letrozole (OR 1.68, 95% CI 1.42 to 1.99; NNTB = 10).

5304.question: Does nicotine replacement therapy (NRT) increase the likelihood of long-term smoking cessation compared to placebo or no treatment?
5304.notes: The risk ratio (RR) of abstinence for any form of NRT relative to control was 1.55 (95% CI 1.49 to 1.61).

5305.question: Is there a clear difference in 30-day mortality between patients treated with moxifloxacin and those treated with amoxicillin-clavulanate for NSTI?
5305.notes: The risk ratio for mortality within 30 days was 3.00 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.39 to 23.07, indicating uncertainty in the effects.

5306.question: Do SSRIs improve subjective sleep measures compared to placebo in adults with insomnia?
5306.notes: Two paroxetine studies showed significant improvements, but the fluoxetine study did not show a difference.

5307.question: Does acupuncture provide a significant reduction in pain compared to sham acupuncture in patients with hip osteoarthritis?
5307.notes: The combined analysis of two sham-controlled RCTs showed little or no effect in pain reduction with acupuncture compared to sham acupuncture (SMD -0.13, 95% CI -0.49 to 0.22).

5308.question: Are bioresorbable fixation systems as effective as titanium systems for the management of facial fractures?
5308.notes: The review found insufficient evidence to support the effectiveness of resorbable systems compared to titanium systems, with some trials stopped due to excess complications in the resorbable arm.

5309.question: Does combining conscious sedation and analgesia with acupuncture or electroacupuncture provide better intraoperative pain relief compared to conscious sedation and analgesia alone during oocyte retrieval?
5309.notes: CSA plus acupuncture (MD 1.00, 95% CI 0.18 to 1.82) or electroacupuncture (MD 3.00, 95% CI 2.23 to 3.77) showed more effective intraoperative pain relief.

5310.question: Does acupuncture lead to a clinically meaningful reduction in prostatitis symptoms compared with a sham procedure?
5310.notes: Mean difference in total NIH-CPSI score -5.79, 95% CI -7.32 to -4.26

5311.question: Does epidural analgesia reduce the intensity of pain compared to opioid analgesia during labor?
5311.notes: Pain scores were lower in women with epidural analgesia (standardised mean difference -2.64, 95% CI -4.56 to -0.73).

5312.question: Is the use of antiepileptic drugs (AEDs) effective in preventing early seizures following craniotomy?
5312.notes: Two trials reported a statistically significant advantage for AED treatment compared to controls for early seizure occurrence.

5313.question: Does whole gland cryotherapy have a clear impact on time to death from prostate cancer compared to radiation therapy?
5313.notes: Hazard ratio of 1.00 (95% CI 0.11 to 9.45) indicates uncertainty.

5314.question: Does stiripentol as an add-on treatment lead to a 50% or greater reduction in seizure frequency for people with focal refractory epilepsy?

5315.question: Does the implantable miniature telescope (IMT) improve visual acuity in individuals with late or advanced age-related macular degeneration (AMD)?
5315.notes: The abstract indicates that there are no completed RCTs or quasi-RCTs to draw conclusions about the effectiveness of the IMT.

5316.question: Does rituximab improve skin vasculitis in patients with HCV-associated mixed cryoglobulinaemia?
5316.notes: Rituximab may slightly improve skin vasculitis (RR 0.57, 95% CI 0.28 to 1.16).

5317.question: Does respiratory muscle training improve pulmonary function in individuals with cystic fibrosis?
5317.notes: No significant improvement was reported in the primary outcome of pulmonary function (forced expiratory volume in one second and forced vital capacity).

5318.question: Does hormone replacement therapy (HRT) increase the risk of endometrial cancer recurrence in women treated for early-stage endometrial cancer?
5318.notes: The study reported a risk ratio (RR) of 1.17 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 0.54 to 2.50, indicating no significant increase in risk.

5319.question: Do educational interventions improve the age at which complementary foods are introduced to infants?
5319.notes: Average RR 0.88, 95% CI 0.83 to 0.94; 4 studies, 1738 children

5320.question: Is mineral trioxide aggregate (MTA) more effective than formocresol in reducing clinical and radiological failures in pulpotomy for primary teeth?
5320.notes: MTA showed statistically significant reductions in clinical and radiological failures compared to formocresol at various time points.

5321.question: Does duodenal stent placement lead to a quicker resumption of oral intake compared to surgical palliation in patients with malignant gastric outlet obstruction?

5322.question: Does water immersion during the first stage of labor reduce the use of regional analgesia in healthy low-risk women?
5322.notes: Reduction from 43% to 39% (RR 0.91, 95% CI 0.83 to 0.99; 5 trials; 2439 women)
