5643.question: Does intensive perioperative alcohol cessation intervention reduce postoperative complications in patients with risky alcohol consumption?

5644.question: Does vitamin E supplementation reduce the risk of progression from mild cognitive impairment to Alzheimer's dementia over three years?

5645.question: Does protocol-directed sedation management reduce the duration of mechanical ventilation compared to usual care in ICU patients?
5645.notes: Mean difference (MD) -28.15 hours, 95% CI -69.15 to 12.84; high heterogeneity (I² = 85%).

5646.question: Does inhalation of dornase alfa after airway clearance techniques significantly improve forced expiratory volume at one second in people with cystic fibrosis?
5646.notes: Inhalation after airway clearance did not significantly change forced expiratory volume at one second.

5647.question: Does prolonged thromboprophylaxis with LMWH reduce the incidence of overall VTE after major abdominal or pelvic surgery compared to in-hospital thromboprophylaxis only?
5647.notes: The incidence of overall VTE was 13.2% in the control group compared to 5.3% in the LMWH group (M-H OR 0.38, 95% CI 0.26 to 0.54).

5648.question: Does haloperidol reduce the incidence of ICU delirium compared to placebo in critically ill patients?

5649.question: Does dexamethasone increase the risk of postoperative infection in surgical patients?
5649.notes: Peto OR 1.01, 95% CI 0.80 to 1.27; 4603 participants, 26 studies

5650.question: Can gene therapy improve survival and prevent symptoms and complications associated with sickle cell disease?
5650.notes: No trials were found to support or refute this claim.

5651.question: Does the addition of anti-angiogenic therapy improve overall survival in patients with newly diagnosed glioblastoma?
5651.notes: Pooled hazard ratio (HR) of 0.95, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.88 to 1.02; P = 0.16

5652.question: Does the use of autologous platelet concentrates (APC) with open flap debridement (OFD) improve probing pocket depth (PD) compared to OFD alone?
5652.notes: Mean difference (MD) 1.29 mm, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.00 to 1.58 mm

5653.question: Is cannabidiol associated with an improvement in clinical remission for patients with mild to moderate ulcerative colitis compared to placebo?
5653.notes: Clinical remission at 10 weeks was achieved by 24% of the cannabidiol group compared to 26% in the placebo group (RR 0.94, 95% CI 0.39 to 2.25).

5654.question: Does midwife-led continuity models of care provide a clear benefit in preventing preterm birth for all pregnant women?
5654.notes: Midwife-led continuity models of care showed clear evidence of benefit for all women.

5655.question: Does vertebroplasty provide a clinically important benefit in terms of pain reduction for patients with osteoporotic vertebral fractures?
5655.notes: Mean pain was 5 points with placebo and 0.7 points better with vertebroplasty, which is below the minimal clinically important difference of 15%.

5656.question: Does balanced energy and protein supplementation during pregnancy reduce the risk of stillbirth?
5656.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.60, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.39 to 0.94; 5 trials, 3408 women.

5657.question: Do implementation strategies in workplace settings improve the implementation of health-promoting policies and practices?
5657.notes: Pooled analysis of three RCTs showed no difference in implementation outcomes (SMD -0.01, 95% CI -0.32 to 0.30).

5658.question: Is there a difference in the number of serious adverse events between using a laryngeal mask airway (LMA) and an endotracheal tube (ETT) during percutaneous dilatational tracheostomy (PDT) in critically ill adults?
5658.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.86, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.41 to 1.80; 467 participants, 8 studies.

5659.question: Does increasing intake of long-chain omega-3 fatty acids (EPA and DHA) significantly reduce all-cause mortality or cardiovascular mortality?
5659.notes: Meta-analysis showed little or no effect on all-cause mortality (RR 0.98, 95% CI 0.90 to 1.03) and cardiovascular mortality (RR 0.95, 95% CI 0.87 to 1.03).

5660.question: Is cannabis associated with an increased clinical response in adults with active Crohn's disease?
5660.notes: In one study, 91% of the cannabis group achieved a clinical response compared to 40% of the placebo group (RR 2.27, 95% CI 1.04 to 4.97).

5661.question: Does a classical 4:1 ketogenic diet result in higher rates of seizure freedom compared to less restrictive ketogenic diets?
5661.notes: Reported rates of seizure freedom reached as high as 55% in a classical 4:1 KD group after three months, compared to up to 25% in MAD.

5662.question: Does laparoscopic appendectomy reduce postoperative pain intensity on day one compared to open appendectomy in adults?
5662.notes: Pain intensity was reduced by 0.75 cm on a 10 cm VAS (MD -0.75, 95% CI -1.04 to -0.45).

5663.question: Does phonics training improve the accuracy of reading real and novel words that follow letter-sound rules in English-speaking poor readers?
5663.notes: Standardised mean difference (SMD) 0.51, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.13 to 0.90; 11 studies, 701 participants

5664.question: Do communication interventions like FPI or PECS result in maintained improvements in spoken or non-verbal communication in minimally verbal children with ASD?
5664.notes: Neither intervention resulted in maintained improvements in communication.

5665.question: Do probiotics make a significant difference in participant- or parent-rated symptoms of eczema?
5665.notes: Symptom severity was 0.44 points lower after probiotic treatment (95% CI -1.22 to 0.33).

5666.question: Does the use of phosphodiesterase inhibitors (PDEIs) result in a small improvement in urinary symptoms as measured by the International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS-total) compared to placebo in men with benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH)?
5666.notes: Mean difference (MD) 1.89 lower, 95% confidence interval (CI) 2.27 lower to 1.50 lower; n = 4293

5667.question: Does mefloquine reduce maternal peripheral parasitaemia at delivery compared to sulfadoxine-pyrimethamine in HIV-uninfected pregnant women?
5667.notes: Mefloquine results in a 35% reduction in maternal peripheral parasitaemia at delivery (RR 0.65, 95% CI 0.48 to 0.86).

5668.question: Is cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT) associated with a reduction in long-term relapse rates compared to other psychosocial therapies for people with schizophrenia?

5669.question: Does extensive testing including CT scans lead to earlier cancer diagnosis compared to tests at the physician's discretion in patients with unprovoked VTE?
5669.notes: Extensively tested participants were diagnosed earlier (mean: 1 month) compared to the control group (11.6 months).

5670.question: Does increasing PUFA intake reduce the risk of coronary heart disease events?
5670.notes: Risk reduced from 14.2% to 12.3%, RR 0.87, 95% CI 0.72 to 1.06

5671.question: Does baclofen reduce the relapse rate to any drinking compared to placebo in individuals with alcohol use disorder?
5671.notes: Relapse-return to any drinking showed RR 0.88, 95% CI 0.74 to 1.04; 5 studies, 781 participants.

5672.question: Does resistance testing improve mortality outcomes in people living with HIV who have been previously exposed to ART?
5672.notes: Resistance testing made little or no difference in mortality (OR 0.89, 95% CI 0.36 to 2.22).

5673.question: Is subpial transection surgery effective in reducing seizures in patients with medically refractory epilepsy?
5673.notes: The abstract states that no relevant studies were found to support or refute the use of subpial transection surgery.

5674.question: Does oral isotretinoin improve acne severity compared to standard oral antibiotic and topical treatment when assessed by a decrease in total inflammatory lesion count?
5674.notes: The results are uncertain due to very low-quality evidence.

5675.question: Does acupuncture have a sustained blood pressure lowering effect in adults with primary hypertension?
5675.notes: Only one trial investigated a sustained effect and found no BP lowering effect at three and six months after acupuncture.

5676.question: Does moxibustion improve white blood cell counts in people with cancer undergoing chemotherapy or radiotherapy compared to no treatment?

5677.question: Does postoperative sinonasal debridement improve disease-specific health-related quality of life in patients undergoing endoscopic sinus surgery?
5677.notes: One study reported no significant difference in SNOT-22 scores between debridement and control groups.

5678.question: Do insecticide-treated nets reduce child mortality from all causes compared to no nets?
5678.notes: Rate ratio 0.83, 95% CI 0.77 to 0.89; 5 trials, 200,833 participants

5679.question: Are rutosides effective in preventing post-thrombotic syndrome in patients with deep vein thrombosis?
5679.notes: No studies were identified comparing rutosides versus any alternative in the prevention of PTS.

5680.question: Do corticosteroids increase the proportion of children with septic arthritis who are pain-free at 12 months?
5680.notes: Risk ratio for absence of pain at 12 months was 1.33, favoring corticosteroids (95% CI 1.03 to 1.72).

5681.question: Does adding ezetimibe to statins reduce the risk of major adverse cardiovascular events compared to statins alone?

5682.question: Is the basal-bolus insulin strategy associated with a higher risk of severe hypoglycaemic episodes compared to sliding scale insulin in non-critically ill hospitalised adults with diabetes mellitus?
5682.notes: The risk ratio for severe hypoglycaemic episodes was 0.22 with a 95% CI of 0.05 to 1.00, indicating a higher risk in the basal-bolus group.

5683.question: Does elective supraomohyoid neck dissection (ND) improve overall and disease-free survival compared to therapeutic (delayed) ND in patients with oral cavity cancer?
5683.notes: One trial found a benefit for elective supraomohyoid ND in overall survival (RR 0.40, 95% CI 0.19 to 0.84) and disease-free survival (HR 0.32, 95% CI 0.12 to 0.84) among 67 participants.

5684.question: Does the use of optical coherence tomography (OCT) improve the detection of basal cell carcinoma (BCC) compared to visual inspection plus dermoscopy?
5684.notes: OCT showed higher sensitivity (95%) and specificity (77%) compared to visual inspection plus dermoscopy.

5685.question: Does teledermatology have a high sensitivity for diagnosing malignant skin lesions using photographic images?
5685.notes: Summary sensitivity was 94.9% (95% CI 90.1% to 97.4%) for diagnosing malignant lesions using photographic images.

5686.question: Does betahistine reduce tinnitus loudness compared to placebo?
5686.notes: Mean difference on a 0- to 10-point visual analogue scale at one-month follow-up was not significant (-0.16, 95% CI -1.01 to 0.70; 81 participants).

5687.question: Do NaoXinTong and TongXinLuo show potential benefits when compared to both 'no treatment' and Western medicine for vascular dementia?
5687.notes: Both TCHMs were identified as having potentially large benefits in studies estimating effects against both 'no treatment' and Western medicine.

5688.question: Is oral midazolam associated with more cooperative behavior in children undergoing dental treatment compared to placebo?
5688.notes: Standardized mean difference (SMD) favored midazolam (SMD 1.96, 95% CI 1.59 to 2.33, P < 0.0001, I² = 90%; 6 studies; 202 participants).

5689.question: Does de-intensified adjuvant therapy after minimally invasive transoral surgery improve overall survival in HPV-positive OPSCC patients compared to standard adjuvant therapy?
5689.notes: No completed RCTs were identified to provide evidence for this question.

5690.question: Does liberal fluid therapy increase the risk of in-hospital mortality in children with sepsis or septic shock?
5690.notes: Liberal fluid therapy may increase risk of in-hospital mortality by 38% (RR 1.38, 95% CI 1.07 to 1.77).

5691.question: Is there evidence that using hearing aids or sound generators significantly reduces tinnitus symptom severity compared to a waiting list control, placebo, or education/information only?
5691.notes: No data available for comparisons with waiting list control, placebo, or education/information only.

5692.question: Are ergometrine plus oxytocin and misoprostol plus oxytocin combinations more effective than oxytocin alone in preventing PPH ≥ 500 mL?
5692.notes: Ergometrine plus oxytocin (RR 0.70, 95% CI 0.59 to 0.84) and misoprostol plus oxytocin (RR 0.70, 95% CI 0.58 to 0.86) show moderate certainty in reducing PPH ≥ 500 mL compared with oxytocin.

5693.question: Does transmural care lead to a reduction in pressure ulcer incidence compared to usual care among patients with spinal cord injury?
5693.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.93, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.53 to 1.64; evidence downgraded for serious limitations and imprecision.

5694.question: Does the use of tricyclic antidepressants (TCAs) reduce depressive symptoms in patients with COPD compared to placebo?
5694.notes: The study showed a mean difference of -10.20 in depressive symptoms with a 95% CI of -16.75 to -3.65.

5695.question: Are psychological therapies more effective than control conditions in treating short-term depression in children and adolescents with long-term physical conditions?

5696.question: Is Internet-based cognitive and behavioural therapy (I-C/BT) associated with a clinically important reduction in PTSD symptoms post-treatment compared to a wait list?

5697.question: Is point-of-care sonography (POCS) effective in detecting chest injuries in patients with blunt thoracoabdominal trauma?
5697.notes: POCS has a sensitivity of 0.96 (95% CI 0.88 to 0.99) and specificity of 0.99 (95% CI 0.97 to 1.00) for chest injuries.

5698.question: Does the LABA/LAMA combination reduce moderate to severe COPD exacerbations compared to LABA/ICS combination in the high-risk population?

5699.question: Is there evidence that routine administration of salmonella vaccines reduces morbidity and mortality in people with sickle cell disease?
5699.notes: No randomized controlled trials were found to support this.

5700.question: Are non-pharmacological interventions like TENS, Ai Chi, and tDCS effective in reducing chronic pain in persons with multiple sclerosis?
5700.notes: The evidence for the effectiveness of these interventions is very low due to methodological biases and limited data.

5701.question: Does tranexamic acid reduce the risk of re-bleeding within 10 days compared to placebo in adult patients with epistaxis?
5701.notes: The risk of re-bleeding reduced from 67% to 47% with tranexamic acid (RR 0.71, 95% CI 0.56 to 0.90).

5702.question: Is the technical success rate higher when using PTA with stenting compared to PTA alone for infrapopliteal arterial lesions in patients with CLTI?
5702.notes: The technical success rate was greater in the stent group (OR 3.00, 95% CI 1.14 to 7.93).

5703.question: Does the combination of herbal interventions with conventional treatment improve visual acuity in patients with diabetic retinopathy?
5703.notes: Combined analysis suggested an improvement in visual acuity with a risk ratio of 1.26 (95% CI 1.08 to 1.48).

5704.question: Does adding cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT) to standard care reduce the long-term risk of relapse in patients with schizophrenia?
5704.notes: The relative risk for relapse was 0.78 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.61 to 1.00, indicating no clear difference.

5705.question: Does exercise training reduce fatigue in people undergoing multimodal cancer treatment?
5705.notes: Exercise training probably reduces fatigue (MD -1.05, 95% CI -1.83 to -0.28; I² = 0%; 3 studies, 449 participants).

5706.question: Is in-person visual inspection more accurate than image-based evaluations for diagnosing melanoma?
5706.notes: In-person diagnosis had a higher relative diagnostic odds ratio of 8.54 compared to image-based evaluations.

5707.question: Does high-frequency ultrasound (HFUS) demonstrate high sensitivity for detecting melanoma when using qualitative characteristics?
5707.notes: Derived sensitivities for qualitative HFUS characteristics were at least 83% (95% CI 75% to 90%) for melanoma detection.

5708.question: Does the hysteroscopic removal of endometrial polyps prior to IUI improve the clinical pregnancy rate compared to diagnostic hysteroscopy only?
5708.notes: The evidence suggests that 63% of women achieved a clinical pregnancy after the removal of endometrial polyps compared to 28% without removal (OR 4.41, 95% CI 2.45 to 7.96).

5709.question: Do smartphone applications using artificial intelligence-based analysis demonstrate sufficient accuracy in diagnosing melanomas?
5709.notes: Sensitivities ranged from 7% to 73% and specificities from 37% to 94%, indicating high variability and insufficient accuracy.

5710.question: Does the use of the levonorgestrel-releasing intrauterine system (LNG-IUS) result in a higher regression rate of atypical endometrial hyperplasia compared to oral progesterone (MPA) after six months of treatment?
5710.notes: The regression rate was 100% in the LNG-IUS group and 77% in the progesterone group, but the evidence is insufficient to determine a difference (OR 2.76, 95% CI 0.26 to 29.73).

5711.question: Does brief motivational intervention lead to a reduction in alcohol use among people who use illicit drugs compared to assessment only?

5712.question: Is the use of regular salmeterol with ICS associated with an increased risk of mortality compared to ICS alone in adults with asthma?
5712.notes: The pooled Peto odds ratio for mortality was 0.80 (95% CI 0.36 to 1.78), indicating no significant difference in mortality risk between the two groups.

5713.question: Does thrombolytic therapy reduce the odds of death in patients with acute pulmonary embolism compared to heparin alone?

5714.question: Does physical exercise reduce mortality in people with cirrhosis?

5715.question: Do sit-stand desks reduce sitting time at work in the short-term?
5715.notes: Sit-stand desks reduced sitting time by an average of 100 minutes per workday at short-term follow-up.

5716.question: Does insecticide spraying reduce the incidence of diarrhoea in children under five years of age during peak fly seasons?
5716.notes: Insecticide spraying was associated with a reduction in diarrhoea incidence in the first and second years during peak fly seasons (RaR 0.77, 95% CI 0.67 to 0.89).

5717.question: Does low-molecular-weight heparin (LMWH) reduce the risk of stillbirth in subsequent pregnancies following a previous stillbirth?
5717.notes: The risk ratio (RR) was 2.58 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 0.40 to 16.62, indicating uncertainty and low-quality evidence.

5718.question: Do antiepileptic drugs prevent the recurrence of epileptic seizures in most people with Alzheimer's disease?
5718.notes: The abstract suggests that antiepileptic drugs seem to prevent recurrence, but the evidence quality is judged to be very low.

5719.question: Does using a removable splint instead of a below-elbow cast for buckle fractures result in similar physical function outcomes at four weeks?
5719.notes: One study reported similar Modified Activities Scale for Kids - Performance scores (splint 99.04; cast 99.11).

5720.question: Does the use of ICD in addition to optimal medical therapy decrease all-cause mortality in people with non-ischaemic cardiomyopathy?
5720.notes: Hazard ratio (HR) 0.78, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.66 to 0.92; high-certainty evidence

5721.question: Does the use of prophylactic fibrinogen concentrate reduce all-cause mortality in patients compared to placebo?
5721.notes: Based on 4 RCTs with 248 participants, there was no evidence of reduced mortality.

5722.question: Does dermoscopy improve the accuracy of melanoma detection compared to visual inspection alone in both in-person and image-based evaluations?
5722.notes: Dermoscopy was found to be more accurate than visual inspection alone with RDORs of 4.7 for in-person evaluations and 5.6 for image-based evaluations.

5723.question: Does reflectance confocal microscopy (RCM) have higher sensitivity for detecting basal cell carcinoma (BCC) in patients with equivocal lesions compared to those with any suspicious lesion?
5723.notes: Sensitivity for equivocal lesions: 94% (CI 79% to 98%); for any suspicious lesion: 76% (CI 45% to 92%).

5724.question: Is myo-inositol associated with an improvement in live birth rates among subfertile women with PCOS undergoing IVF pre-treatment compared to standard treatment?

5725.question: Does the use of single-dose activated charcoal (SDAC) reduce the incidence of adverse events in oral poisoning cases compared to no intervention?
5725.notes: Zero events in both treatment groups; 1 study, 451 participants.

5726.question: Do short-acting insulin analogues provide a significant reduction in HbA1c levels compared to regular human insulin in adults with type 2 diabetes?
5726.notes: The mean difference in HbA1c change was -0.03% with a 95% CI of -0.16 to 0.09, indicating no significant difference.

5727.question: Is exfoliative cytology effective in confirming basal cell carcinoma (BCC) in lesions with high clinical suspicion?
5727.notes: Sensitivity of 97.5% and specificity of 90.1% for BCC detection.

5728.question: Does early initiation of renal replacement therapy reduce the risk of death at day 30 in critically ill patients with acute kidney injury?
5728.notes: The 95% CI (0.61 to 1.13) includes both a reduction and an increase in risk.

5729.question: Does reflectance confocal microscopy (RCM) have higher specificity than dermoscopy for detecting melanoma in lesions that are difficult to diagnose?
5729.notes: Specificity for RCM is 86% compared to 49% for dermoscopy in equivocal lesions.

5730.question: Is there evidence that dietary restriction of salt, caffeine, or alcohol helps control vertigo in patients with Ménière's disease?
5730.notes: No randomized controlled trials were identified to support or refute this intervention.

5731.question: Is laparoscopic retroperitoneal adrenalectomy associated with a lower risk of late morbidity compared to laparoscopic transperitoneal adrenalectomy?
5731.notes: RR 0.12, 95% CI 0.01 to 0.92; P = 0.04; 3 trials, 146 participants

5732.question: Does acarbose reduce the incidence of type 2 diabetes mellitus compared to placebo in people with impaired glucose tolerance?
5732.notes: Acarbose reduced the incidence of T2DM compared to placebo with a risk ratio of 0.82 (95% CI 0.75 to 0.89).

5733.question: Does dermoscopy improve the detection of basal cell carcinoma (BCC) compared to visual inspection alone in primary- and secondary-care settings?
5733.notes: Dermoscopy showed a relative diagnostic odds ratio (RDOR) of 8.2 compared to visual inspection, with a predicted increase in sensitivity of 14% and specificity of 22%.

5734.question: Is medical abortion with misoprostol effective for early abortion in women living with HIV?
5734.notes: The prospective cohort study found medical abortion effective in 96% of cases among women living with HIV.

5735.question: Does acupuncture provide short-term improvement in symptoms for diabetic gastroparesis compared to gastrokinetic medication?
5735.notes: There is very low-certainty evidence that a greater proportion of participants receiving acupuncture had 'improved' symptoms in the short term compared to those who received gastrokinetic medication (RR 1.25; 95% CI 1.17 to 1.33).

5736.question: Does fortifying maize flour with iron and other vitamins and minerals reduce the risk of anaemia in children aged over 2 years and adults?
5736.notes: The evidence is too uncertain to conclude any effect on reducing anaemia risk.

5737.question: Is acupuncture more effective than placebo or sham treatments in improving symptoms of carpal tunnel syndrome in the short term?
5737.notes: Acupuncture and laser acupuncture may have little or no effect in the short term on symptoms of CTS in comparison with placebo or sham acupuncture.

5738.question: Do subconjunctival draining minimally-invasive glaucoma devices effectively reduce intraocular pressure in patients with open angle glaucoma?
5738.notes: No completed RCTs were found to provide evidence on the efficacy of these devices.

5739.question: Does the use of computer-assisted diagnosis (CAD) systems in highly selected populations demonstrate high sensitivity for detecting invasive melanoma?
5739.notes: CAD systems showed high sensitivity for melanoma detection, but the evidence base is poor due to low-quality studies and selected populations.

5740.question: Do pre-emptive opioids reduce early acute postoperative pain in dental surgery?
5740.notes: Mean difference (MD) -1.20, 95% confidence interval (CI) -1.75 to -0.65; 40 participants; 1 study.

5741.question: Does supplementation with B vitamins have an effect on global cognitive function in adults aged 60 and above?
5741.notes: SMD values from -0.03 to 0.06 up to 5 years and SMD -0.01 at 5-10 years indicate little or no effect.

5742.question: Is cognitive-behavioural treatment (CBT) effective in reducing ATS use compared to no intervention or treatment as usual?
5742.notes: The meta-analytic mean across the two trials was not significant, and overall quality of evidence was low.

5743.question: Does interferon-alpha reduce the incidence of chronic HCV infection compared to no intervention?
5743.notes: The odds ratio for interferon-alpha reducing chronic HCV infection is 0.27 (95% CI 0.09 to 0.76).

5744.question: Does recombinant human growth hormone (rhGH) therapy improve pulmonary function outcomes in children and young adults with cystic fibrosis?
5744.notes: Some pulmonary function outcomes showed improvement, but the evidence is limited by inconsistency across trials and small sample sizes.

5745.question: Does the fixed-dose combination (FDC) of aclidinium/formoterol improve symptoms compared to aclidinium alone in patients with stable COPD?
5745.notes: FDC improved symptoms with a higher chance of achieving a minimal clinically important difference (MCID) in the Transitional Dyspnoea Index (TDI) focal score (OR 1.34, 95% CI 1.11 to 1.62).

5746.question: Are anti-TNF agents effective in the management of uveitic macular oedema (UMO)?
5746.notes: The review identified no completed or ongoing trials specifically assessing the efficacy of anti-TNF agents in UMO.

5747.question: Does routine scaling and polishing make a significant difference in gingivitis, probing depths, and oral health-related quality of life over two to three years compared to no scheduled treatments?
5747.notes: High-certainty evidence indicates little or no difference in these outcomes.

5748.question: Do home-based chemically-induced bleaching methods effectively whiten teeth compared to placebo over short time periods?
5748.notes: The evidence supports effectiveness over short periods (2 weeks to 6 months), but the certainty is low to very low.

5749.question: Does perioperative intravenous ketamine reduce postoperative opioid consumption in the first 24 hours after surgery?
5749.notes: Ketamine reduced opioid consumption by 8 mg morphine equivalents (95% CI 6 to 9).

5750.question: Does transfusing RBCs stored for a shorter duration compared to a longer duration affect mortality in adults undergoing major elective surgery?
5750.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.85, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.50 to 1.45 for 30-day follow-up.

5751.question: Does the use of silicone dressings reduce the incidence of pressure ulcers compared to no dressing?
5751.notes: Silicone dressings may reduce pressure ulcer incidence (RR 0.25, 95% CI 0.16 to 0.41; low-certainty evidence).

5752.question: Does the use of a specific technique for releasing the pneumoperitoneum reduce the severity of shoulder-tip pain at 24 hours post-laparoscopy?
5752.notes: Standardised mean difference (SMD) -0.66, 95% confidence interval (CI) -0.82 to -0.50.

5753.question: Does the use of THC preparations increase the likelihood of abstinence at the end of treatment compared to placebo?
5753.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.98, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.64 to 1.52; 305 participants; 3 studies.

5754.question: Do physical therapeutic modalities such as exercise and physical activities improve functional outcomes and quality of life for people with multiple sclerosis?
5754.notes: Moderate-quality evidence suggests improvements in mobility, muscular strength, and quality of life.

5755.question: Do macrolide antibiotics increase the incidence of gastrointestinal adverse events compared to placebo?
5755.notes: Macrolides caused more diarrhoea (OR 1.70), abdominal pain (OR 1.66), nausea (OR 1.61), vomiting (OR 1.27), and gastrointestinal disorders NOS (OR 2.16).

5756.question: Does chest physiotherapy reduce mortality in children with pneumonia?
5756.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.28, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.08 to 0.90; 559 children.

5757.question: Does cetirizine reduce the number of adverse events compared to placebo in children with eczema?
5757.notes: Cetirizine is probably associated with fewer adverse events (risk ratio 0.68, 95% CI 0.46 to 1.01).

5758.question: Does acetyl-L-carnitine reduce blood ammonium levels compared to placebo in patients with hepatic encephalopathy?
5758.notes: Meta-analysis showed a reduction in blood ammonium levels favouring acetyl-L-carnitine (MD -13.06 mg/dL, 95% CI -17.24 to -8.99).

5759.question: Does immunonutrition with omega-3 fatty acids and antioxidants reduce all-cause mortality in adults with ARDS?
5759.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.79, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.59 to 1.07; participants = 1015; studies = 10

5760.question: Does CPAP reduce the need for mechanical ventilation in children with acute bronchiolitis?
5760.notes: The effect of CPAP on the need for mechanical ventilation was uncertain due to imprecision around the effect estimate (RR 0.69, 95% CI 0.14 to 3.36).

5761.question: Does pyronaridine-artesunate have fewer unadjusted treatment failures at day 28 compared to artemether-lumefantrine?

5762.question: Does aerobic physical exercise improve overall survival for adults with haematological malignancies?
5762.notes: Only one study reported overall survival with no evidence for a difference (RR = 0.67; P = 0.112).

5763.question: Do drug-eluting balloons (DEBs) show better outcomes than uncoated balloon angioplasty for target lesion revascularization in patients with in-stent restenosis of the femoropopliteal arteries?
5763.notes: DEBs showed better outcomes for target lesion revascularization with an OR of 0.05 (95% CI 0.00 to 0.92) at six months and OR of 0.24 (95% CI 0.08 to 0.70) at 24 months.

5764.question: Is there a difference in weight gain between specialist inpatient care and active outpatient or combined brief hospital and outpatient care for anorexia nervosa?
5764.notes: Standardised mean difference (SMD) -0.22, 95% CI -0.49 to 0.05; 2 trials, 232 participants.

5765.question: Does topiramate provide a greater reduction in primarily generalized tonic-clonic seizures compared to placebo in juvenile myoclonic epilepsy?
5765.notes: A greater proportion of participants in the topiramate group had a 50% or more reduction in PGTCS compared with placebo.

5766.question: Does albendazole alone or added to another microfilaricidal drug affect microfilariae prevalence over two weeks to 12 months?

5767.question: Is methotrexate associated with improved disease response in adults with psoriatic arthritis compared to placebo?
5767.notes: Disease response was 41/109 in the methotrexate group and 24/112 in the placebo group (RR 1.76, 95% CI 1.14 to 2.70).

5768.question: Is tinidazole more effective than metronidazole in reducing clinical failure in amoebic colitis?
5768.notes: Tinidazole showed a risk ratio of 0.28 (95% CI 0.15 to 0.51) for reducing clinical failure compared to metronidazole.

5769.question: Does using a low dialysate sodium concentration reduce interdialytic weight gain in maintenance haemodialysis patients?

5770.question: Does intermittent iron supplementation reduce the risk of anaemia compared to no intervention or placebo?
5770.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.65, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.49 to 0.87; 11 studies, 3135 participants.

5771.question: Do multidisciplinary interventions reduce all-cause mortality in patients with heart failure?
5771.notes: Pooled analysis of eight multidisciplinary studies gave moderate-quality evidence that these probably reduce all-cause mortality (RR 0.67, 95% CI 0.54 to 0.83; NNTB 17, 95% CI 12 to 32).

5772.question: Does epidural analgesia reduce pain at rest more effectively than systemic analgesia within the first 72 hours after thoraco-lumbar spine surgery in children?
5772.notes: Epidural analgesia reduced pain at rest at all time points, with a mean pain score reduction of -1.32 points at 6-8 hours and -0.8 points at 72 hours.

5773.question: Do print-based self-help materials provide more benefit for smoking cessation when no other support is available compared to when they are used alongside professional advice or nicotine replacement therapy?
5773.notes: Moderate-certainty evidence shows benefit when no other support is available, but no additional benefit when used with professional advice or nicotine replacement therapy.

5774.question: Do general health checks reduce total mortality in adults?
5774.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.00, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.97 to 1.03; high-certainty evidence

5775.question: Do PDE5 inhibitors improve WHO functional class in patients with pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH)?
5775.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 8.59, 95% confidence interval (CI) 3.95 to 18.72; 4 trials, 282 participants

5776.question: Do mesenchymal stromal cells (MSCs) reduce the risk of chronic graft-versus-host disease (cGvHD) in prophylactic settings?
5776.notes: RR 0.66, 95% CI 0.49 to 0.89; participants = 283; studies = 6; I² = 0%

5777.question: Does exercise-based cardiac rehabilitation improve all-cause mortality in the long term for patients with heart failure?

5778.question: Does the use of the Braden risk assessment tool reduce the incidence of pressure ulcers compared to clinical judgement with training?
5778.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.97, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.53 to 1.77; 150 participants. The certainty of the evidence is very low.

5779.question: Does iron therapy improve restlessness and RLS severity compared to placebo?
5779.notes: Iron therapy resulted in greater improvement in IRLS scores (MD -3.78, 95% CI -6.25 to -1.31).

5780.question: Do school-based self-management interventions reduce hospital admissions for children with asthma?
5780.notes: Interventions probably reduce mean hospitalisations by an average of about 0.16 admissions per child over 12 months (SMD -0.19, 95% CI -0.35 to -0.04; 1873 participants; 6 studies).

5781.question: Does protocol-guided discontinuation of antibiotics before neutropenia resolution increase all-cause mortality in people with cancer with febrile neutropenia?

5782.question: Does deep brain stimulation (DBS) of the internal globus pallidus nucleus improve overall cervical dystonia-related symptoms?
5782.notes: Mean difference (MD) 9.8 units, 95% CI 3.52 to 16.08 units; 1 RCT, 59 participants.

5783.question: Are second-generation endometrial ablation techniques associated with shorter operating times compared to first-generation techniques?
5783.notes: Mean difference (MD) -13.52 minutes, 95% CI -16.90 to -10.13; 9 studies; 1822 women.

5784.question: Does the use of systemic aminocaproic acid reduce the rate of secondary hemorrhage in patients with traumatic hyphema?
5784.notes: Systemic aminocaproic acid reduced the rate of recurrent hemorrhage (RR 0.28, 95% CI 0.13 to 0.60).

5785.question: Does standard-dose adrenaline increase survival to hospital discharge compared to placebo in cardiac arrest patients?
5785.notes: RR 1.44, 95% CI 1.11 to 1.86; an increase from 23 to 32 per 1000, 95% CI 25 to 42

5786.question: Does surgical treatment of acute middle third clavicle fractures improve upper arm function compared to conservative treatment at follow-up of one year or longer?
5786.notes: Standardised mean difference (SMD) 0.33, 95% confidence interval (CI) -0.02 to 0.67, indicating no clinically important difference.

5787.question: Is azithromycin less effective than doxycycline for reducing microbiological failure in men with Chlamydia trachomatis infection?
5787.notes: Azithromycin has a higher risk of microbiological failure compared to doxycycline (RR 2.45, 95% CI 1.36 to 4.41).

5788.question: Does ivacaftor improve quality of life scores in adults with the G551D mutation?
5788.notes: Quality of life scores (respiratory domain) were higher with ivacaftor in the adult trial at 24 weeks, MD 8.10 (95% CI 4.77 to 11.43) and 48 weeks, MD 8.60 (95% CI 5.27 to 11.93).

5789.question: Is there a difference in FEV1 outcomes between PEP therapy and oscillating devices after six months of treatment in people with cystic fibrosis?
5789.notes: Mean difference -1.43% predicted (95% confidence interval -5.72 to 2.87)

5790.question: Does routine preoperative medical testing reduce the risk of intraoperative or postoperative ocular adverse events in cataract surgery?
5790.notes: Routine testing did not reduce intraoperative (OR 0.99, 95% CI 0.71 to 1.38) or postoperative ocular adverse events (OR 1.11, 95% CI 0.74 to 1.67).

5791.question: Is the serum CRP level at initial evaluation of an infant with suspected late-onset infection considered sufficiently accurate to aid early diagnosis?
5791.notes: Sensitivity was 0.62 (95% CI 0.50 to 0.73) at median specificity (0.74), indicating limited diagnostic accuracy.

5792.question: Does subacromial decompression surgery provide improvement in pain, shoulder function, or health-related quality of life compared to placebo in patients with rotator cuff disease?
5792.notes: High-certainty evidence indicates no improvement in pain, shoulder function, or health-related quality of life up to one year.

5793.question: Does the use of gonadotrophins result in more live births compared to continued clomiphene citrate in women with clomiphene citrate-resistant PCOS?
5793.notes: Gonadotrophins resulted in more live births than continued clomiphene citrate (RR 1.24, 95% CI 1.05 to 1.46).

5794.question: Is levonorgestrel associated with fewer pregnancies compared to the Yuzpe regimen?

5795.question: Is there a difference in the incidence of catheter-related bloodstream infection when comparing clinically indicated removal to routine removal of peripheral intravenous catheters?
5795.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.61, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.08 to 4.68, low-certainty evidence due to serious imprecision.

5796.question: Does intraoperative neuromonitoring (IONM) reduce the risk of permanent recurrent inferior laryngeal nerve (RILN) palsy compared to visual nerve identification alone during thyroid surgery?

5797.question: Does pregabalin provide at least 30% pain intensity reduction in postherpetic neuralgia compared to placebo?
5797.notes: 50% of participants experienced at least 30% pain reduction with pregabalin 300 mg compared to 25% with placebo; RR 2.1 (95% CI 1.6 to 2.6).

5798.question: Is there a reduction in failed entry into the abdomen when using a direct trocar compared to a Veress needle?

5799.question: Do exercise interventions reduce the rate of falls in older people living in the community?
5799.notes: Exercise reduces the rate of falls by 23% (rate ratio 0.77, 95% CI 0.71 to 0.83).

5800.question: Do performance-based reward interventions improve long-term smoking cessation rates?
5800.notes: No trials found a beneficial effect of performance-based rewards on long-term quit rates.

5801.question: Does iodine fortification of foods increase urinary iodine concentration in populations?
5801.notes: Pooled results from RCTs showed a significant increase in urinary iodine concentration (SMD 0.59, 95% CI 0.37 to 0.81; 6 RCTs, 2032 participants). This effect was not observed in non-RCTs (SMD 0.25, 95% CI -0.16 to 0.66; 3 non-RCTs, 262 participants).

5802.question: Does nutrition education of family members improve growth and neurodevelopment outcomes in preterm infants during the weaning period?
5802.notes: No eligible trials were found to assess the impact of nutrition education on these outcomes.

5803.question: Is Desmopressin acetate (DDAVP) considered effective in reducing the risk of haemorrhage in pregnant women with congenital bleeding disorders?
5803.notes: The abstract states DDAVP is found to be effective in reducing haemorrhage risk, but this is based on lower level evidence due to the absence of RCTs.

5804.question: Does exercise training improve exercise capacity in adults with advanced lung cancer?
5804.notes: Pooled data showed a mean difference of 63.33 meters in the six-minute walk distance (6MWD) with a 95% confidence interval of 3.70 to 122.96.

5805.question: Does lymphaticovenular anastomosis reduce the incidence of lymphoedema compared to nonoperative management after breast cancer treatment?
5805.notes: Risk ratio of 0.20 (95% CI 0.06 to 0.63, P = 0.006; 95 participants)

5806.question: Does administering taxanes before anthracyclines result in a significant improvement in overall survival for patients with early breast cancer?
5806.notes: The neoadjuvant studies suggested little to no difference in overall survival (HR 0.80, 95% CI 0.60 to 1.08).

5807.question: Does yoga improve urinary incontinence in women compared to a waiting list?
5807.notes: The certainty of the evidence is very low due to performance bias, detection bias, and imprecision. The risk ratio for satisfaction with cure or improvement was 6.33, but the confidence interval was wide (1.44 to 27.88).

5808.question: Does nerve-sparing radical hysterectomy reduce postoperative bladder dysfunction compared to standard radical hysterectomy in women with early stage cervical cancer?
5808.notes: Nerve-sparing radical hysterectomy reduced postoperative bladder dysfunction with a mean difference of -13.21 days for time to postvoid residual volume of urine ≤ 50 mL (95% CI -24.02 to -2.41).

5809.question: Does the use of hyperbaric oxygen therapy improve periodontal healing, tooth survival, and pulpal healing in avulsed and replanted permanent front teeth?
5809.notes: One study with high risk of bias showed some evidence of benefit for hyperbaric oxygen therapy.

5810.question: Does Aquablation result in a similar improvement in urologic symptom scores compared to TURP within 12 months?

5811.question: Does active management of the third stage of labour reduce the average risk of maternal severe primary postpartum haemorrhage (PPH) at the time of birth?
5811.notes: Average risk ratio (RR) 0.34, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.14 to 0.87, 3 studies, 4636 women, I² = 60%

5812.question: Does endoscopic cyclophotocoagulation (ECP) effectively reduce intraocular pressure (IOP) in people with primary angle closure glaucoma compared to phacoemulsification alone?
5812.notes: The ongoing study has not yet provided results.

5813.question: Does the consumption of animal-source foods lead to an increase in height-for-age z scores (HAZ) compared to cereal-based foods or no intervention in children aged 5 to 50 months?
5813.notes: Three studies reported a significant increase in HAZ in the intervention group compared to the control group.

5814.question: Is there evidence supporting the effectiveness of ultrasonic instrumentation alone for orthograde root canal treatment?
5814.notes: The abstract indicates a lack of eligible randomized controlled trials to support this.

5815.question: Does the placement of a ureteral stent after uncomplicated ureteroscopy reduce the number of unplanned return visits?
5815.notes: The evidence is very uncertain regarding the reduction of unplanned return visits with stenting.

5816.question: Is thoracic endovascular repair (TEVAR) associated with reduced mortality and morbidity compared to open surgery for blunt traumatic thoracic aortic injury (BTAI)?
5816.notes: No RCTs were found to provide evidence for this comparison.

5817.question: Is ethosuximide more effective than lamotrigine in controlling absence seizures in children?
5817.notes: The large trial found ethosuximide had higher freedom-from-failure rates compared to lamotrigine.

5818.question: Does intravenous iron increase the number of participants who achieve target haemoglobin levels compared to oral iron in chronic kidney disease patients?
5818.notes: IV iron may increase the number of participants who achieve target haemoglobin (RR 1.71, 95% CI 1.43 to 2.04).

5819.question: Does the combined oral contraceptive pill (COCP) improve the response to treatment for heavy menstrual bleeding compared to placebo?
5819.notes: COCP improved response to treatment with an OR of 22.12 (95% CI 4.40 to 111.12).

5820.question: Does the addition of N-acetylcysteine (NAC) to antibiotics improve Helicobacter pylori eradication rates compared to placebo or no NAC?
5820.notes: The eradication rates were 38.8% with NAC versus 49.1% without NAC (RR 0.74, 95% CI 0.51 to 1.08).

5821.question: Does corticosteroid therapy with dexamethasone reduce the intensity of dyspnoea in adults with cancer-related dyspnoea compared to placebo?
5821.notes: MD -0.85 lower dyspnoea (scale 0-10; lower score = less breathlessness), 95% CI -1.73 to 0.03; very low-quality evidence

5822.question: Do calcium antagonists reduce the risk of death or dependency in individuals with acute ischemic stroke?

5823.question: Do antibiotics reduce the failure to achieve remission in Crohn's disease compared to placebo within 6 to 10 weeks?
5823.notes: 55% of antibiotic participants failed to achieve remission compared to 64% of placebo participants (RR 0.86, 95% CI 0.76 to 0.98).

5824.question: Does iodine supplementation reduce mortality before hospital discharge in preterm infants?
5824.notes: Typical RR 1.01, 95% CI 0.72 to 1.42; 2 studies, 1380 infants.

5825.question: Does late initiation of erythropoiesis-stimulating agents reduce the use of one or more red blood cell transfusions in preterm or low birth weight infants?
5825.notes: The meta-analysis showed a significant effect with a typical risk ratio (RR) of 0.72 and a typical risk difference (RD) of -0.17.

5826.question: Does needle aspiration reduce the need for intercostal tube drainage in the management of neonatal pneumothorax?
5826.notes: 30% of newborns did not require intercostal tube drainage with immediate needle removal, and none required it when the needle was left in situ.

5827.question: Does exercise-based cardiac rehabilitation improve exercise capacity in adults with an ICD?
5827.notes: Mean difference (MD) 0.91 mL/kg/min, 95% CI 0.60 to 1.21; participants = 1485; trials = 7

5828.question: Is corticosteroid therapy associated with increased mortality in patients with influenza?
5828.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 3.90, 95% confidence interval (CI) 2.31 to 6.60; I² = 68%.

5829.question: Does TENS reduce pain intensity compared to sham therapy in adults with chronic pain?
5829.notes: One review reported a beneficial effect of TENS versus sham therapy at reducing pain intensity with a mean difference of -1.58 on a 0 to 10 scale, but the evidence quality was very low due to methodological limitations and imprecision.

5830.question: Does paracetamol provide clinically important improvements in pain and physical function for people with hip or knee osteoarthritis?
5830.notes: Mean reduction in pain was 3.23 points better with paracetamol, which is below the minimal clinically important difference of 9%.

5831.question: Do behavioural interventions reduce the mean number of incontinent episodes in 24 hours for stroke patients?
5831.notes: Mean difference (MD) -1.00, 95% confidence interval (CI) -2.74 to 0.74; 1 trial; 18 participants.

5832.question: Does benzathine penicillin administration reduce the rate of neonatal death due to any cause in infants with possible congenital syphilis?

5833.question: Does TACE followed by 3-DCRT reduce all-cause mortality compared to TACE alone in patients with unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma?
5833.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.80, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.73 to 0.88; 552 participants; 7 trials

5834.question: Does long-term low-dose antibiotic prophylaxis reduce the risk of repeat symptomatic UTI in children with VUR compared to no treatment?

5835.question: Does extended varenicline treatment help prevent relapse in individuals who have quit smoking with assistance?
5835.notes: Extended varenicline in assisted abstainers showed a benefit with a risk ratio of 1.23 (95% CI 1.08 to 1.41).

5836.question: Does using an oxygenation-guided lung-recruitment maneuver (LRM) reduce the duration of ventilatory support in preterm infants with RDS compared to routine care?

5837.question: Does antibiotic prophylaxis reduce the risk of symptomatic UTI in adults undergoing cystoscopy?
5837.notes: Antibiotic prophylaxis may reduce the risk of symptomatic UTI (RR 0.49, 95% CI 0.28 to 0.86).

5838.question: Does a low refined carbohydrates diet induce clinical remission in active Crohn's disease compared to a control diet?
5838.notes: At 4 weeks, 100% of participants in the low refined carbohydrates diet group achieved remission compared to 0% in the control group (RR 7.20, 95% CI 0.53 to 97.83).

5839.question: Does intraperitoneal instillation of lidocaine reduce intraperitoneal pain compared to placebo during postpartum mini-laparotomy tubal ligation?
5839.notes: Pooled MD -3.34, 95% CI -4.19 to -2.49, three studies, 190 participants

5840.question: Does ozone application effectively arrest or reverse the progression of dental caries?
5840.notes: The studies showed inconsistent effects and a high risk of bias, leading to no reliable evidence supporting the effectiveness of ozone.

5841.question: Do interventions delivered by nurses or allied healthcare providers in a face-to-face format increase enrolment in cardiac rehabilitation?
5841.notes: The meta-regression analysis showed that the intervention deliverer (nurse or allied healthcare provider) and the delivery format (face-to-face) were influential in increasing enrolment (P = 0.02 and P = 0.01, respectively).

5842.question: Does ultrasound guidance reduce the risk of failed block in children undergoing regional anaesthesia?
5842.notes: Risk difference (RD) -0.16, 95% confidence interval (CI) -0.25 to -0.07; 22 trials; 1789 participants.

5843.question: Does the use of dental cavity liners reduce postoperative hypersensitivity in Class I and Class II resin-based composite restorations?
5843.notes: Inconsistent evidence with low quality regarding postoperative hypersensitivity reduction.

5844.question: Does using 1500 ppm fluoride toothpaste reduce caries increment in the primary dentition of young children compared to non-fluoride toothpaste?
5844.notes: MD -1.86 dfs, 95% CI -2.51 to -1.21; 998 participants, one study

5845.question: Does bright light therapy reduce the incidence of seasonal affective disorder compared to no light therapy?
5845.notes: Bright light therapy reduced the risk of SAD incidence by 36%, but the confidence interval was broad (RR 0.64, 95% CI 0.30 to 1.38).

5846.question: Is there evidence supporting the use of tranexamic acid, vaginal packing, or interventional radiology over radiotherapy for palliative treatment of vaginal bleeding in advanced cervical cancer?
5846.notes: The review found no controlled trials to support or refute the use of these interventions compared with radiotherapy.

5847.question: Does providing feedback on exhaled carbon monoxide measurement increase smoking cessation rates?
5847.notes: RR 1.00, 95% CI 0.83 to 1.21; no evidence of increased cessation rates.

5848.question: Is there evidence suggesting that benzodiazepines are more effective than placebo in the short-term treatment of panic disorder?
5848.notes: The risk ratio for response to treatment was 1.65 (95% CI 1.39 to 1.96) in favor of benzodiazepines.

5849.question: Is there evidence that cisplatin is a risk factor for decreased glomerular filtration rate (GFR) in childhood cancer survivors?
5849.notes: The majority of studies reported cisplatin as a risk factor for decreased GFR.

5850.question: Does prolonged thromboprophylaxis with LMWH reduce the risk of VTE after major abdominal or pelvic surgery compared to in-hospital thromboprophylaxis only?
5850.notes: The incidence of overall VTE was reduced from 13.2% in the control group to 5.3% in the LMWH group (M-H OR 0.38, 95% CI 0.26 to 0.54).

5851.question: Does adherence to a Mediterranean-style diet reduce the risk of stroke in primary prevention?
5851.notes: The PREDIMED trial showed a reduction in the number of strokes with a hazard ratio of 0.60 (95% CI 0.45 to 0.80).

5852.question: Does having a labour companion improve outcomes for women and babies during childbirth?
5852.notes: The Cochrane systematic review concluded that having a labour companion improves outcomes for women and babies.

5853.question: Does negative pressure wound therapy (NPWT) reduce the rate of surgical site infections (SSIs) compared to standard dressings?
5853.notes: RR 0.67, 95% CI 0.53 to 0.85; evidence downgraded twice for very serious risk of bias.

5854.question: Do antioxidants improve live birth rates in subfertile men?
5854.notes: Antioxidants may lead to increased live birth rates (OR 1.79, 95% CI 1.20 to 2.67), but the evidence is of low quality and based on a small number of studies.

5855.question: Do antidepressants increase the number of people who achieve a 50% reduction in emotionalism after a stroke?
5855.notes: Based on very low quality evidence from one small RCT (RR 16.50, 95% CI 1.07 to 253.40; 19 participants).

5856.question: Does computerised cognitive training (CCT) improve episodic memory in healthy older adults compared to inactive control?
5856.notes: Slight improvement in episodic memory with MD -0.90, 95% CI -1.73 to -0.07; 150 participants; 1 study.

5857.question: Does using social networking sites improve the consistency of contraceptive use among reproductive-age women?
5857.notes: The RCT found no difference in self-reported consistency of contraceptive use between the SNS group and control group.

5858.question: Does lifestyle intervention improve the free androgen index (FAI) in women with PCOS?

5859.question: Is there evidence that penicillin treatment leads to clear or almost clear skin in patients with guttate psoriasis compared to no treatment?
5859.notes: No statistically significant difference was observed (RR 2.00, 95% CI 0.68 to 5.85).

5860.question: Does outpatient treatment for low-risk acute pulmonary embolism lead to a difference in short-term mortality compared to inpatient treatment?

5861.question: Does hypothermic machine perfusion (HMP) reduce the risk of delayed graft function (DGF) compared to static cold storage (SCS) in deceased donor kidney transplantation?
5861.notes: HMP reduces the risk of DGF with a risk ratio (RR) of 0.77; 95% CI 0.67 to 0.90.

5862.question: Does laparoscopy accurately predict the resectability of disease in women with advanced ovarian cancer?
5862.notes: Laparoscopy suggested suitability for optimal debulking in 54% to 96% of women with complete debulking and 69% to 100% with optimal debulking.

5863.question: Does screening for psychosocial well-being and care needs improve health-related quality of life (HRQoL) in people with cancer?
5863.notes: The narrative synthesis found very low-certainty evidence for the effect of screening on HRQoL, with most studies showing no effect.

5864.question: Do anti-VEGF agents improve visual acuity in patients with neovascular AMD compared to no treatment?
5864.notes: Participants receiving anti-VEGF agents gained 15 letters or more of visual acuity (RR 4.19, 95% CI 2.32 to 7.55).

5865.question: Do psychological interventions increase the rate of return to work within six months for patients with coronary heart disease?
5865.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.08, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.84 to 1.40; very low-certainty evidence.

5866.question: Does mindfulness-based stress reduction (MBSR) improve quality of life in women with breast cancer in the short term?
5866.notes: MBSR may improve quality of life slightly at the end of the intervention based on low-certainty evidence from three studies with a total of 339 participants.

5867.question: Do family-based prevention programs reduce the prevalence of alcohol use in school-aged children compared to no intervention?
5867.notes: Standardised mean difference (SMD) 0.00, 95% confidence interval (CI) -0.08 to 0.08; studies = 12; participants = 7490; I² = 57%

5868.question: Does memantine provide a clinical benefit for cognitive function in people with moderate-to-severe Alzheimer's disease?
5868.notes: Cognitive function improvement: 3.11 SIB points (95% CI 2.42 to 3.92).

5869.question: Does linezolid improve cure rates in patients with XDR-TB compared to those not receiving it?
5869.notes: One RCT reported higher cure rates with a risk ratio of 2.36 (95% CI 1.13 to 4.90).

5870.question: Does combining SEPS with compression therapy increase the proportion of healed venous leg ulcers at 24 months compared to compression therapy alone?
5870.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.17, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.03 to 1.33; low-certainty evidence.

5871.question: Does multiple-micronutrient supplementation reduce the incidence of low birthweight in comparison to iron and folic acid supplementation?
5871.notes: The average risk ratio for low birthweight was 0.88 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.85 to 0.91.

5872.question: Does supplemental intravenous crystalloid administration reduce the risk of postoperative nausea in patients undergoing general anaesthesia?

5873.question: Is there evidence that oral biotin is effective in reducing the severity of infantile seborrhoeic dermatitis compared to placebo?
5873.notes: One trial did not report a measure of change in severity, and the other reported 'no statistically significant difference'.

5874.question: Does the use of iStent in combination with phacoemulsification increase the likelihood of being drop-free compared to phacoemulsification alone?

5875.question: Does the use of non-invasive positive pressure ventilation (NIPPV) reduce the rate of pulmonary complications after lung resection for lung cancer?
5875.notes: Pooled data showed no difference between NIPPV and no intervention (RR 1.03; 95% CI 0.72 to 1.47).

5876.question: Is there a difference in recurrence-free survival between intralesional treatment and wide resection for central low-grade chondrosarcoma of the long bones?
5876.notes: Meta-analysis showed little or no difference in recurrence-free survival (RR 0.98; 95% CI 0.92 to 1.04).

5877.question: Does hydroxyurea reduce the requirement for blood transfusions in people with transfusion-dependent β-thalassaemia?
5877.notes: No trials were eligible for inclusion, so no evidence is available to support or refute this.

5878.question: Does psychological therapy improve parenting behavior in parents of children with cancer post-treatment?

5879.question: Does antibiotic treatment improve the condition of patients with guttate psoriasis who have evidence of beta-haemolytic streptococcal colonization?
5879.notes: The one eligible trial found no improvement in patients treated with antibiotics.

5880.question: Does RV1 prevent a higher percentage of severe rotavirus diarrhoea cases in low-mortality countries compared to high-mortality countries during the first year of life?
5880.notes: In low-mortality countries, RV1 prevents 84% of severe rotavirus diarrhoea cases, while in high-mortality countries, it prevents 63%.

5881.question: Does computerised cognitive training (CCT) improve global cognitive function in individuals with mild cognitive impairment (MCI) immediately after the intervention period?
5881.notes: The evidence quality for this outcome is very low, preventing any conclusions.

5882.question: Does cognitive training improve global cognition in people with mild to moderate dementia compared to a control condition?
5882.notes: Standardised mean difference (SMD) 0.42, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.23 to 0.62

5883.question: Is endoscopic cyclophotocoagulation (ECP) more effective than the Ahmed implant in reducing intraocular pressure (IOP) at 12 months post-intervention?
5883.notes: Mean difference in IOPs between groups was -1.14 mmHg (95% CI -4.21 to 1.93).

5884.question: Does the AD-8 questionnaire have a higher sensitivity in secondary care settings compared to community care settings?
5884.notes: The AD-8 has a higher relative sensitivity (1.11, 95% CI 1.02 to 1.21) in secondary care compared to community care settings.

5885.question: Does epidural analgesia reduce the risk of myocardial infarction in adults undergoing cardiac surgery compared to systemic analgesia?

5886.question: Does outpatient treatment for low-risk febrile neutropaenia in cancer patients result in a higher rate of treatment failure compared to inpatient treatment?
5886.notes: RR 1.23, 95% CI 0.82 to 1.85 for adults; RR 1.04, 95% CI 0.55 to 1.99 for children.

5887.question: Does the use of once-daily LABA/LAMA combinations improve lung function in patients with mild-to-moderate COPD compared to placebo?
5887.notes: Adjusted trough FEV1, MD 0.20 L (95% CI 0.19 to 0.21); adjusted peak FEV1, MD 0.31 L (95% CI 0.29 to 0.32)

5888.question: Does physical exercise training improve walking distance in people with SMA type 3?
5888.notes: The mean difference in walking distance was 9.54 m with a 95% CI of -83.04 to 102.12, which is not a detectable change.

5889.question: Do probiotics reduce the daily crying time in infants with colic compared to placebo?
5889.notes: Mean difference of -32.57 minutes per day (95% CI -55.60 to -9.54) in favor of probiotics.

5890.question: Does engaging in computerised cognitive training for at least 12 weeks provide a significant improvement in executive function for cognitively healthy adults in midlife?
5890.notes: The study found a small advantage for the CCT group in executive function (MD -1.57, 95% CI -1.85 to -1.29).

5891.question: Does the use of GnRH agonists improve the incidence of menstruation recovery or maintenance within 12 months compared to chemotherapy alone?
5891.notes: Incidence of menstruation recovery or maintenance was 74.5% in the GnRH agonist group versus 50.0% in the control group (RR 1.60, 95% CI 1.14 to 2.24).

5892.question: Does adding ECT to standard care improve the clinical response in people with treatment-resistant schizophrenia compared to standard care alone?
5892.notes: Moderate-quality evidence indicates a positive effect on medium-term clinical response (RR 2.06, 95% CI 1.75 to 2.42).

5893.question: Is bupropion XL effective in preventing the recurrence of depressive episodes in individuals with a history of seasonal affective disorder?
5893.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.56, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.44 to 0.72; 3 RCTs, 1100 participants.

5894.question: Are psychological therapies effective in improving depressive symptoms in patients with COPD compared to no intervention?
5894.notes: Small effect size with SMD 0.19, 95% CI 0.05 to 0.33

5895.question: Do lifestyle interventions involving children lead to a reduction in overweight at 6 and 12 months follow-up?
5895.notes: Meta-analyses indicated a reduction in overweight at 6 and 12 months follow-up in lifestyle interventions involving children.

5896.question: Is there a difference in the rate of retinal reattachment between PPV and scleral buckling for treating primary RRD?
5896.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.07, 95% confidence intervals (CI) 0.98 to 1.16; low-certainty evidence.

5897.question: Does the Specificity Terms Filter for combined MEDLINE/Embase searches have higher precision compared to the Precision Terms Filter while maintaining equal sensitivity?
5897.notes: The Specificity Terms Filter was preferred due to its higher precision and equal sensitivity compared to the Precision Terms Filter.

5898.question: Does nurse-led care lead to similar healthcare outcomes as care delivered by doctors in primary care settings?
5898.notes: The Cochrane Review suggested that nurse-led care probably leads to similar healthcare outcomes as care delivered by doctors.

5899.question: Is the ROSIER scale recommended for use in the emergency room setting due to its sensitivity?
5899.notes: ROSIER was evaluated in more studies than FAST and showed consistently high sensitivity with a summary sensitivity of 0.88 (95% CI 0.84 to 0.91).

5900.question: Does eliminating gluten and/or casein from the diet improve overall autistic traits in individuals with autism?

5901.question: Is dinutuximab-containing immunotherapy associated with improved overall survival in people with high-risk neuroblastoma pre-treated with autologous HSCT?
5901.notes: The hazard ratio for overall survival was 0.50 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.31 to 0.80, indicating a significant improvement.

5902.question: Does a computerised system to identify medications that may contribute to delirium risk reduce the incidence of delirium in older people in institutional long-term care?
5902.notes: 12-month HR 0.42, CI 0.34 to 0.51; moderate-certainty evidence downgraded for risk of bias

5903.question: Does providing additional social support to at-risk pregnant women reduce the likelihood of giving birth to babies weighing less than 2500 g?
5903.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.94, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.86 to 1.04; 16 studies, n = 11,770

5904.question: Does the use of Mitomycin C during aqueous shunt surgery result in a significant reduction in intraocular pressure at 12 months post-surgery?
5904.notes: The meta-analysis showed a mean difference of -0.12 mmHg (95% CI -2.16 to 2.41), indicating unclear effects.

5905.question: Does radiotherapy involving the liver increase the risk of hepatic late adverse effects in childhood cancer survivors?
5905.notes: Radiotherapy involving the liver, especially with a high percentage of the liver irradiated, was shown to increase the risk of cellular liver injury.

5906.question: Is there an established effective treatment protocol for eradicating Burkholderia cepacia complex in cystic fibrosis patients?
5906.notes: The review found an extreme lack of evidence and no studies identified for eradication protocols.

5907.question: Does robotic-assisted radical cystectomy result in fewer blood transfusions compared to open radical cystectomy?
5907.notes: Robotic cystectomy probably results in substantially fewer transfusions (RR 0.58, 95% CI 0.43 to 0.80).

5908.question: Does using combination NRT (fast-acting form + patch) result in higher long-term quit rates compared to using a single form of NRT?
5908.notes: Combination NRT results in higher long-term quit rates than single form (RR 1.25, 95% CI 1.15 to 1.36).

5909.question: Does the use of nutmeg as a topical treatment provide significant pain relief compared to placebo in neuropathic pain conditions?
5909.notes: No evidence of a difference in pain relief (RR 1.12, 95% CI 0.69 to 1.85; 48.6% vs 43.2%).

5910.question: Does performing a screening hysteroscopy before IVF increase the live birth rate in subfertile women?
5910.notes: Pooled results from trials with low risk of bias showed no increase in live birth rate (RR 0.99, 95% CI 0.82 to 1.18).

5911.question: Does the introduction of advanced or specialist nurses to hospital nurse staffing lead to a reduction in patient mortality?
5911.notes: The review suggests little or no difference in patient mortality with the addition of advanced or specialist nurses.

5912.question: Does adding MVA85A to BCG reduce the risk of developing microbiologically confirmed tuberculosis?

5913.question: Do remotely delivered psychological therapies reduce headache severity in children and adolescents with chronic pain conditions immediately after treatment?
5913.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 2.02, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.35 to 3.01; P < 0.001, number needed to treat to benefit (NNTB) = 5.36, 7 studies, 379 participants.

5914.question: Does guided imagery reduce the need for antihypertensive drugs in pregnant women with hypertension?
5914.notes: Low-certainty evidence from one trial suggests guided imagery may make little or no difference in the use of antihypertensive drugs (risk ratio 1.27, 95% confidence interval 0.72 to 2.22).

5915.question: Does TENS therapy reduce pain intensity compared to sham therapy in adults with chronic pain?
5915.notes: One review reported a beneficial effect of TENS versus sham therapy at reducing pain intensity (MD -1.58, 95% CI -2.08 to -1.09).

5916.question: Does sublingual glucose administration result in higher blood glucose concentrations compared to oral administration in children with hypoglycaemia and concomitant malaria or respiratory tract infection?
5916.notes: MD 17 mg/dL, 95% CI 4.4 to 29.6; P = 0.008; 1 study; 42 participants

5917.question: Do long-term antibiotics reduce the risk of repeat symptomatic UTI in children compared to placebo or no treatment?
5917.notes: Antibiotics lead to a modest decrease in repeat symptomatic UTI (RR 0.75, 95% CI 0.28 to 1.98), with greater certainty in studies with concealed treatment allocation (RR 0.68, 95% CI 0.48 to 0.95).

5918.question: Is there evidence that yoga as part of a package of care is effective for people with schizophrenia compared to non-standard care?
5918.notes: No studies met the inclusion criteria, so no data were available for analysis.

5919.question: Does community-based antibiotic delivery reduce neonatal mortality compared to hospital referral in resource-limited settings?
5919.notes: Typical RR 0.82, 95% CI 0.68 to 0.99; high heterogeneity (I² = 87%).

5920.question: Does the use of antifibrinolytic agents like tranexamic acid or EACA reduce the number of bleedings and the amount of blood loss in people with haemophilia undergoing dental extraction?
5920.notes: The trials showed a beneficial effect with a combined risk difference of -0.57 (95% CI -0.76 to -0.37).

5921.question: Does the MRI pathway improve the detection of clinically significant prostate cancer compared to systematic biopsy?
5921.notes: The MRI pathway has a pooled detection ratio of 1.12 (95% CI: 1.02 to 1.23) compared to systematic biopsy, indicating improved detection.

5922.question: Does interdental brushing in addition to toothbrushing reduce gingivitis compared to toothbrushing alone?
5922.notes: One high risk of bias study showed a mean difference of 0.53 (95% CI 0.23 to 0.83) indicating a 34% reduction in gingivitis.

5923.question: Does flossing in addition to toothbrushing reduce gingivitis compared to toothbrushing alone?
5923.notes: Flossing plus toothbrushing showed a statistically significant benefit in reducing gingivitis at 1, 3, and 6 months with SMDs of -0.36, -0.41, and -0.72 respectively.

5924.question: Do probiotics reduce the incidence of antibiotic-associated diarrhea in children compared to no treatment?
5924.notes: The incidence of AAD in the probiotic group was 8% compared to 19% in the control group (RR 0.45, 95% CI 0.36 to 0.56).

5925.question: Does clobetasol propionate 0.05% foam improve participant-rated control of symptoms compared to vehicle after 15 days of treatment?
5925.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 2.32, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.38 to 3.91; number needed to treat for an additional beneficial outcome (NNTB) 3, 95% CI 2 to 8.

5926.question: Is there evidence that Gore-Tex is associated with a higher rate of functional success compared to Ethibond in frontalis sling surgery for congenital ptosis?
5926.notes: Bajaj 2004 showed 93% success in Gore-Tex group vs. 83% in Ethibond group.

5927.question: Does peer support reduce hospital admissions for people with schizophrenia in the medium term?

5928.question: Is there evidence that fish oil-derived (n-3) fatty acid-based lipid emulsion improves participant satisfaction and quality of life in acute guttate psoriasis compared to soya oil-derived (n-6) fatty acid-based lipid emulsion?
5928.notes: Improvement was greater in the fish oil group (75%) compared to the soya oil group (18%), but based on very low-quality evidence.

5929.question: Does the use of BIG-IV reduce the duration of hospitalization in infant botulism?
5929.notes: Mean duration of hospitalization was 2.60 weeks for BIG-IV compared to 5.70 weeks for control, with a mean difference of -3.10 weeks (95% CI -4.52 to -1.68).

5930.question: Do aromatase inhibitors reduce the risk of breast cancer more effectively than tamoxifen in women at above-average risk?
5930.notes: AIs may reduce breast cancer incidence slightly compared to tamoxifen (RR 0.67, 95% CI 0.46 to 0.98; 5 RCTs, 31,256 women).

5931.question: Is discontinuation of haloperidol associated with an increased risk of relapse in people with schizophrenia who are stable on their medication?
5931.notes: RR 1.80, 95% CI 1.18 to 2.74; very low quality evidence

5932.question: Is there evidence that n-3 fatty acid rich lipid emulsion is beneficial for patients with guttate psoriasis compared to placebo?
5932.notes: Based on a small study of 21 patients, n-3 fatty acid preparation appeared beneficial.

5933.question: Does the use of simulated altitude or remote ischaemic preconditioning improve the risk of acute mountain sickness on subsequent exposure to altitude?
5933.notes: Simulated altitude: RR 1.18, 95% CI 0.82 to 1.71; RIPC: RR 3.0, 95% CI 0.69 to 13.12

5934.question: Does fenofibrate reduce the progression of diabetic retinopathy in people with overt retinopathy who live with type 2 diabetes?
5934.notes: Fenofibrate likely reduces progression in people with overt retinopathy (RR 0.21; 95% CI 0.06 to 0.71).

5935.question: Does prophylactic oxytocin reduce the risk of postpartum blood loss of 500 mL or more compared to no uterotonics or placebo?
5935.notes: Average risk ratio (RR) 0.51, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.37 to 0.72

5936.question: Do glucocorticosteroids reduce all-cause mortality in patients with alcoholic hepatitis up to three months following randomization?
5936.notes: Random-effects RR 0.90, 95% CI 0.70 to 1.15; participants = 1861; trials = 15

5937.question: Is plasma interleukin-6 (IL-6) concentration a reliable biomarker for diagnosing sepsis in critically ill adults?
5937.notes: High heterogeneity and risk of bias in studies prevent reliable accuracy estimates.

5938.question: Does physical activity improve symptom scores for lower urinary tract symptoms caused by benign prostatic obstruction compared to watchful waiting?
5938.notes: The mean difference was -8.1 with a 95% confidence interval of -13.2 to -3.1, but the evidence quality is very low, making the effect uncertain.

5939.question: Is there a difference in complication rates between robot-assisted surgery and conventional laparoscopic surgery for hysterectomy?
5939.notes: Low-certainty evidence suggests little or no difference in complication rates (RR 0.92, 95% CI 0.54 to 1.59).

5940.question: Does using interdental brushes in addition to toothbrushing reduce gingivitis more effectively than toothbrushing alone?
5940.notes: Low-certainty evidence suggested interdental brushes may reduce gingivitis more than toothbrushing alone (SMD -1.07, 95% CI -1.51 to -0.63; 2 trials, 93 participants).

5941.question: Does the placement of an enterostomy through the rectus abdominis muscle reduce the incidence of parastomal herniation compared to lateral placement?
5941.notes: The RCT results were inconclusive for the incidence of parastomal herniation with a risk ratio of 1.34 (95% CI 0.40 to 4.48).

5942.question: Do antidepressants improve anxiety symptoms in individuals with IBD at 12 weeks?
5942.notes: Mean anxiety score in antidepressant participants was 6.11 compared to 8.5 in placebo participants (MD -2.39, 95% CI -4.30 to -0.48).

5943.question: Does intensive counseling improve the continuation of hormonal contraceptive methods compared to usual care?
5943.notes: The evidence is uncertain with an OR of 1.28 (95% CI 1.07 to 1.54), and the positive results were restricted to DMPA.

5944.question: Is the combination of metformin and sulphonylurea associated with higher all-cause mortality compared to metformin plus a glucagon-like peptide 1 analogue?
5944.notes: All-cause mortality was 1% for M+S versus 0.7% for metformin plus a glucagon-like peptide 1 analogue, RR 1.15 (95% CI 0.49 to 2.67).

5945.question: Does the use of non-invasive positive pressure ventilation (NPPV) reduce hospital mortality in adults with acute cardiogenic pulmonary oedema (ACPE) compared to standard medical care (SMC)?
5945.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.65, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.51 to 0.82; number needed to treat for an additional beneficial outcome (NNTB) of 17 (NNTB 12 to 32).

5946.question: Does constraint-induced movement therapy (CIMT) improve bimanual performance in children with unilateral cerebral palsy when compared to a low-dose intervention?
5946.notes: CIMT was more effective than a low-dose comparison for improving bimanual performance (MD 5.44 AHA units, 95% CI 2.37 to 8.51).

5947.question: Does mixed exercise training improve health-related quality of life (HRQL) compared to control interventions in adults with fibromyalgia?
5947.notes: Mean HRQL was 56 and 49 in the control and exercise groups, respectively, with an absolute improvement of 7% and relative improvement of 12%.

5948.question: Does telephone support intervention improve the quality of life for caregivers compared to usual care at the end of the intervention?

5949.question: Does sodium thiosulfate reduce symptomatic ototoxicity in children with localized hepatoblastoma treated with cisplatin?
5949.notes: Symptomatic ototoxicity only: RR 0.39, 95% CI 0.19 to 0.83

5950.question: Is there a clear gold standard treatment for orbital lymphangiomas in children and young adults?
5950.notes: The abstract states that there is no clear gold standard of treatment for orbital lymphangiomas.

5951.question: Does laparoscopic catheter insertion compared to laparotomy reduce the risk of peritonitis in peritoneal dialysis patients?

5952.question: Is ciprofloxacin more effective than metronidazole in achieving remission for acute pouchitis at two weeks?
5952.notes: Ciprofloxacin participants (7/7) achieved remission compared to 33% (3/9) of metronidazole participants (RR 2.68, 95% CI 1.13 to 6.35).

5953.question: Is ceftriaxone more effective than penicillin G in achieving serological cure for neurosyphilis in HIV-positive patients?
5953.notes: The trial reported a risk ratio of 1.50 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.28 to 7.93, indicating very low-quality evidence and inconclusive results.

5954.question: Do systemic antibiotics provide pain relief for irreversible pulpitis compared to placebo?
5954.notes: The review found insufficient evidence to support or refute the benefit of penicillin for pain intensity.

5955.question: Does extending the self-certification period from one week to two weeks increase the average duration of sickness absence periods?
5955.notes: Mean difference in change values between the intervention and control group was 0.67 days/period up to 29 days (95% CI 0.55 to 0.79).
