5956.question: Does parenteral nutrition increase postoperative complications compared to oral nutrition in patients undergoing radical cystectomy?
5956.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.40, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.07 to 1.82; low-quality evidence.

5957.question: Does fortifying staple foods with vitamin A alone significantly increase serum retinol concentration in the general population older than two years?
5957.notes: Mean difference (MD) 0.03 μmol/L, 95% CI -0.06 to 0.12; high inconsistency (I² = 90%).

5958.question: Are intrastromal corneal ring segments effective in treating keratoconus compared to spectacles or contact lenses?
5958.notes: No RCTs were found to compare the effectiveness of intrastromal corneal ring segments with spectacles or contact lenses.

5959.question: Does the routine use of calcium and vitamin D supplements in the postoperative period reduce the risk of symptoms and temporary hypocalcaemia after thyroid surgery?
5959.notes: The abstract suggests that routine use may reduce symptoms and temporary hypocalcaemia but is based on low-quality evidence.

5960.question: Does the use of time-lapse systems (TLS) with conventional morphological assessment improve live birth or ongoing pregnancy rates compared to conventional incubation and assessment?
5960.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 0.91, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.67 to 1.23, 3 RCTs, N = 826, I² = 33%

5961.question: Does treatment with mucolytics reduce the likelihood of having an acute exacerbation in patients with chronic bronchitis or COPD?
5961.notes: Peto OR 1.73, 95% CI 1.56 to 1.91; moderate-certainty evidence. More recent studies show less benefit than earlier studies.

5962.question: Does exercise improve sleep quality in individuals with chronic kidney disease?
5962.notes: Exercise had uncertain effects on sleep quality (SMD -1.10, 95% CI -2.26 to 0.05; I² = 90%; 5 studies, 165 participants).

5963.question: Does using a special manual toothbrush reduce gingival inflammation more than a conventional toothbrush in the medium term for people with intellectual disabilities?
5963.notes: Mean difference (MD) -12.40, 95% CI -24.31 to -0.49; 1 RCT, 18 participants

5964.question: Does tramadol alone or in combination with acetaminophen provide a clinically important benefit in pain reduction for people with osteoarthritis compared to placebo?
5964.notes: Tramadol alone and in combination with acetaminophen showed no important benefit on pain reduction compared to placebo control (4% absolute improvement).

5965.question: Does mindfulness-based cognitive therapy (MBCT) reduce the incidence of new depressive episodes in individuals with a history of seasonal affective disorder compared to treatment as usual?
5965.notes: The incidence of new depressive episodes was similar between the MBCT group (65%) and the TAU group (74%), with a risk ratio of 0.88 (95% CI 0.60 to 1.30).

5966.question: Does positional therapy improve Epworth Sleepiness Scale (ESS) scores compared to no intervention in patients with obstructive sleep apnoea?
5966.notes: Positional therapy significantly improved ESS scores with a mean difference of -1.58 (95% CI -2.89 to -0.29).

5967.question: Is there a difference in quality of life improvement between combined roxithromycin and doxycycline versus roxithromycin alone in patients with COPD?
5967.notes: The CRQ sub-scales showed no clear difference in quality of life improvement between treatments.

5968.question: Are there any effective interventions identified for promoting shared decision-making among children and adolescents with cystic fibrosis?
5968.notes: No eligible RCTs were identified to support the effectiveness of interventions.

5969.question: Does administering PCV7 in early infancy reduce the risk of pneumococcal AOM?
5969.notes: CRM197-PCV7 and OMPC-PCV7 were associated with 20% and 25% RRR in pneumococcal AOM, respectively.

5970.question: Does continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) reduce hypertensive disorders of pregnancy compared to intermittent glucose monitoring?
5970.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.58, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.39 to 0.85; 2 studies, 384 women

5971.question: Does anti-TNF dose reduction lead to a significant change in disease activity score (DAS28) after 26 to 52 weeks?
5971.notes: Mean difference (MD) 0.06, 95% confidence interval (CI) -0.11 to 0.24, absolute risk difference (ARD) 1%

5972.question: Is ultrasound estimation of fetal weight (EFW) more accurate than biochemical tests for detecting small-for-gestational-age (SGA) infants?
5972.notes: Ultrasound EFW had a diagnostic odds ratio (DOR) of 21.3 (95% CI 13.1 to 34.6), which was higher than the most accurate biochemical test, hPL, with a DOR of 4.78 (95% CI 3.21 to 7.13).

5973.question: Is there evidence that enteral lactoferrin improves outcomes in neonates with sepsis or necrotizing enterocolitis when used as an adjunct to antibiotics?
5973.notes: No eligible trials were identified to evaluate the efficacy of enteral lactoferrin in this context.

5974.question: Does transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS) improve functional communication in people with aphasia after stroke?
5974.notes: There was no evidence of an effect on functional communication (SMD 0.17, 95% CI -0.20 to 0.55).

5975.question: Does intravenous prostacyclin improve WHO functional class in patients with pulmonary arterial hypertension compared to control?
5975.notes: Participants using intravenous prostacyclin had 14.96 times greater odds of improving by at least one WHO functional class (95% CI 4.76 to 47.04).

5976.question: Does immobilisation in external rotation reduce the risk of re-dislocation compared to internal rotation after 12 months or longer?
5976.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.67, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.38 to 1.19; very low certainty evidence.

5977.question: Does the use of lipid-based nutrient supplements (LNS) with complementary feeding reduce the prevalence of moderate stunting in children compared to no intervention?
5977.notes: LNS plus complementary feeding reduced moderate stunting by 7% (RR 0.93, 95% CI 0.88 to 0.98).

5978.question: Does scanning training improve quality of life for stroke patients with visual field defects?
5978.notes: Low-quality evidence from two studies (96 participants) showed a mean difference of 9.36 in quality of life as measured by VFQ-25, with a 95% confidence interval of 3.10 to 15.62.

5979.question: Does proactive telephone counselling increase quit rates for smokers who contact helplines compared to self-help materials or brief counselling in a single call?
5979.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.38, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.19 to 1.61; substantial heterogeneity (I² = 72%)

5980.question: Does adding indoor residual spraying (IRS) with non-pyrethroid-like insecticides reduce malaria parasite prevalence in communities using insecticide-treated nets (ITNs)?
5980.notes: The addition of IRS with non-pyrethroid-like insecticides may reduce malaria parasite prevalence (RR 0.67, 95% CI 0.35 to 1.28).

5981.question: Is the serum galactomannan ELISA test effective as a routine screening tool for invasive aspergillosis in immunocompromised patients?
5981.notes: The test is non-invasive and can be used for routine screening, but the BAL version is invasive and not suitable for routine use.

5982.question: Does single-dose intravesical chemotherapy reduce the risk of bladder cancer recurrence after nephroureterectomy?

5983.question: Does the prostatic urethral lift (PUL) improve urological symptom scores compared to sham surgery in the short term?
5983.notes: PUL may lead to a clinically important improvement in urological symptom scores (MD -5.20, 95% CI -7.44 to -2.96).

5984.question: Is pharmacological continuation and maintenance therapy effective in reducing relapse or recurrence rates in persistent depressive disorder compared to placebo?
5984.notes: Participants taking antidepressant medication were less likely to relapse compared to placebo (13.9% vs 33.8%, RR 0.41, 95% CI 0.21 to 0.79).

5985.question: Is stem cell transplantation associated with reduced neurological impairment in people with ischemic stroke?
5985.notes: Measured with NIHSS, MD -1.49, 95% CI -2.65 to -0.33

5986.question: Does home-based RUTF meeting WHO recommendations improve recovery in children with SAM compared to an alternative dietary approach?
5986.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.33; 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.16 to 1.54; 6 studies, 1852 children.

5987.question: Do interventions targeting vehicular sources show a consistent association with improved air quality or health outcomes?
5987.notes: The evidence base for vehicular interventions was heterogeneous, with some studies showing a significant association favoring the control.

5988.question: Does venous percutaneous transluminal angioplasty (PTA) improve functional outcomes such as walking control, balance, and manual dexterity in patients with multiple sclerosis (MS) and chronic cerebrospinal venous insufficiency (CCSVI)?

5989.question: Do family therapy approaches offer an advantage over treatment as usual in terms of remission rates post-intervention?
5989.notes: Based on low-quality evidence from two studies with a risk ratio of 3.50 (95% CI 1.49 to 8.23).

5990.question: Does extended pelvic lymph node dissection reduce the risk of death from any cause compared to standard pelvic lymph node dissection in patients undergoing radical cystectomy for urothelial carcinoma of the bladder?
5990.notes: The hazard ratio is 0.78 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.57 to 1.07, indicating the possibility of no effect.

5991.question: Does intravenous administration of antibiotic prophylaxis reduce the risk of shunt infections compared to standard care or placebo?

5992.question: Does band ligation reduce mortality in adults with cirrhosis and oesophageal varices compared to no intervention?

5993.question: Is there an increased risk of invasive ovarian cancer in subfertile women treated with clomiphene citrate compared to those who are multiparous?
5993.notes: The hazard ratio for nulligravid women using clomiphene citrate was 2.49 (95% CI 1.30 to 4.78) compared to multiparous women with HR 1.52 (95% CI 0.67 to 3.42).

5994.question: Does rapid ART initiation improve viral suppression rates at 12 months compared to standard initiation?

5995.question: Is there high-quality evidence available to determine whether surgical resection or biopsy is the better initial surgical management option for high-grade glioma?
5995.notes: The single RCT included was of inadequate methodology to reach reliable conclusions.

5996.question: Does prophylactic ibuprofen decrease the incidence of patent ductus arteriosus in preterm infants?
5996.notes: Ibuprofen probably decreases the risk of PDA on day 3 or 4 with a typical RR of 0.39 (95% CI 0.31 to 0.48).

5997.question: Do marine-derived n-3 PUFAs improve functional outcomes in stroke patients within three months of treatment?
5997.notes: Functional outcome was reported in only one pilot study with very low quality evidence (RR 0.78, 95% CI 0.36 to 1.68).

5998.question: Does antihypertensive drug treatment reduce all-cause mortality in people aged 60 years and older with mild to moderate hypertension?
5998.notes: Antihypertensive treatment reduced all-cause mortality from 11% to 10% (RR 0.91, 95% CI 0.85 to 0.97).

5999.question: Do local opinion leaders improve healthcare professionals' compliance with evidence-based practice?
5999.notes: The median adjusted risk difference for compliance improvement was 10.8% with an interquartile range of 3.5% to 14.6%.

6000.question: Do rigid dressings decrease the time to wound healing compared to soft dressings in transtibial amputations?
6000.notes: MD -25.60 days; 95% CI -49.08 to -2.12; very low-certainty evidence due to high risk of bias and imprecision.

6001.question: Does vaginal misoprostol hasten miscarriage compared to placebo?
6001.notes: Complete miscarriage (5 trials, 305 women, RR 4.23, 95% CI 3.01 to 5.94)

6002.question: Is carbamazepine associated with a shorter time to 12-month remission compared to topiramate in individuals with focal onset seizures?

6003.question: Are 5-ASA formulations more effective than placebo in preventing clinical relapse in patients with surgically-induced remission of Crohn's disease?
6003.notes: 5-ASA formulations showed a lower relapse rate compared to placebo (RR 0.83, 95% CI 0.72 to 0.96).

6004.question: Is surgical resection more effective than medical treatment for achieving freedom from seizures in patients with focal epilepsy?
6004.notes: Two RCTs found surgery to be superior to medical treatment.

6005.question: Does adding behavioural support to pharmacotherapy increase smoking cessation rates?
6005.notes: The pooled estimate from 65 trials showed a statistically significant benefit (RR 1.15, 95% CI 1.08 to 1.22).

6006.question: Is glycerol phenylbutyrate associated with a reduction in hepatic encephalopathy compared to placebo?

6007.question: Is combined therapy of benzodiazepines plus antidepressants more effective than antidepressants alone for depressive severity in the early phase?

6008.question: Is hypnotherapy more effective than attention-matched behavioral treatments for smoking cessation?
6008.notes: RR 1.21, 95% CI 0.91 to 1.61; low certainty evidence

6009.question: Is laronidase enzyme replacement therapy associated with improvements in forced vital capacity in patients with mucopolysaccharidosis type I?
6009.notes: The study showed a mean difference of 5.60 in percent predicted forced vital capacity with a 95% confidence interval of 1.24 to 9.96.

6010.question: Is lithium more effective than placebo in inducing a response in acute mania?

6011.question: Is there evidence that plasma volume expanders reduce mortality compared to no plasma expansion in patients with cirrhosis undergoing paracentesis?

6012.question: Does screening for malignant melanoma reduce overall mortality in the general population?
6012.notes: The abstract states that there are no published or unpublished data on mortality outcomes from the included studies.

6013.question: Does thyroxine treatment improve live birth rates in women with subclinical hypothyroidism and positive or negative anti-TPO antibodies undergoing assisted reproduction?

6014.question: Does zinc supplementation in pregnant women reduce the incidence of low birth weight in urban slums?

6015.question: Is agomelatine effective in reducing the incidence of seasonal affective disorder (SAD) compared to placebo?
6015.notes: The risk ratio (RR) was 0.83 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 0.51 to 1.34, indicating an indeterminate result.

6016.question: Does the perception of antenatal care as a positive experience influence women's initial or continued use of these services?
6016.notes: The abstract indicates that women's use of ANC depends on their perception of it as a positive experience, influenced by the quality and personalization of care.

6017.question: Does exercise training improve exercise capacity in people following lung resection for NSCLC?
6017.notes: Exercise capacity was greater in the intervention group, with VO2peak MD 2.97 mL/kg/min (95% CI 1.93 to 4.02 mL/kg/min) and 6MWD MD 57 m (95% CI 34 to 80 m).

6018.question: Is there a difference in the incidence of PNALD/cholestasis between fish oil-based lipid emulsions and non-fish oil lipid emulsions in preterm infants?
6018.notes: Typical RR 0.61, 95% CI 0.24 to 1.56; typical RD -0.03, 95% CI -0.08 to 0.02; 4 studies; n = 328

6019.question: Is there evidence that smoking cessation interventions are effective for people with lung cancer?
6019.notes: No RCTs were found to determine the effectiveness of smoking cessation interventions for people with lung cancer.

6020.question: Do probiotics reduce the occurrence of acute otitis media in children who are not prone to otitis media?
6020.notes: RR 0.64, 95% CI 0.49 to 0.84; 11 trials; 2227 participants; NNTB = 9

6021.question: Is Xpert Ultra more sensitive than Xpert MTB/RIF for detecting tuberculosis in adults with presumptive pulmonary tuberculosis?
6021.notes: Xpert Ultra sensitivity was 88% (85% to 91%) compared to Xpert MTB/RIF sensitivity of 83% (79% to 86%).

6022.question: Is the use of fish oil-containing lipid emulsions associated with a reduction in cholestasis compared to soybean oil-based emulsions in infants with PNALD?
6022.notes: Typical risk ratio (RR) 0.54, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.32 to 0.91; typical risk difference (RD) -0.39, 95% CI -0.65 to -0.12; number needed to treat for additional beneficial outcome (NNTB) 3, 95% CI 2 to 9; 2 studies; n = 40.

6023.question: Is surgery the most common treatment for Paget's disease of the vulva?
6023.notes: Surgery is the mainstay of treatment according to the current literature.

6024.question: Is intramuscular artemether associated with a reduction in mortality compared to quinine in adults with severe malaria?
6024.notes: RR 0.59, 95% CI 0.42 to 0.83; four trials, 716 participants

6025.question: Does Radix Sophorae flavescentis reduce the proportion of participants with detectable hepatitis B virus e-antigen (HBeAg)?
6025.notes: RR 0.86, 95% CI 0.75 to 0.98; I² = 43%; 7 trials, 588 participants

6026.question: Is there evidence that banked donor preterm milk improves growth outcomes in very low birth weight infants compared to banked donor term milk?
6026.notes: No studies met the inclusion criteria to provide evidence.

6027.question: Does fluticasone have a less suppressive effect on growth compared to budesonide in children with persistent asthma?
6027.notes: Fluticasone showed a less suppressive effect on growth compared to budesonide (MD 0.97 cm, 95% CI 0.62 to 1.32).

6028.question: Does using dilute formula in preterm or low birth weight infants lead to fewer episodes of gastric residuals per day compared to full-strength formula?

6029.question: Do psychosocial interventions improve caregiver quality of life immediately post-intervention compared to usual care?
6029.notes: Standardised mean difference (SMD) 0.29, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.04 to 0.53; studies = 2, 265 participants

6030.question: Does advocacy intervention increase or decrease abuse depending on contextual factors such as severity and type of abuse?
6030.notes: The impact of advocacy interventions on abuse is context-dependent, influenced by factors like severity and type of abuse.

6031.question: Does early androgen suppression therapy (AST) reduce the risk of death from any cause in advanced hormone-sensitive prostate cancer?
6031.notes: Early AST probably reduces the risk of death from any cause over time with a hazard ratio of 0.82 (95% CI 0.75 to 0.90).

6032.question: Does acetyl-L-carnitine (ALC) reduce pain in diabetic peripheral neuropathy (DPN) when compared to placebo?
6032.notes: ALC reduced pain more than placebo on a VAS scale, but the certainty of the evidence is very low.

6033.question: Does long-term inhaled aztreonam lysine therapy improve lung function in people with cystic fibrosis and chronic Burkholderia cepacia complex infection?
6033.notes: Mean difference in FEV1 was 0.91% (95% CI -3.15 to 4.97).

6034.question: Is there evidence that computer and mobile technology interventions improve medication adherence in individuals with thalassemia?
6034.notes: No eligible studies were identified to assess the efficacy of these interventions.

6035.question: Does social skills training improve teacher-rated social skills in children with ADHD?
6035.notes: Standardised mean difference (SMD) 0.11, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.00 to 0.22; minimal clinical relevant difference is 10% on the SSRS scale.

6036.question: Are traffic-light labelling interventions associated with decreasing sales of sugar-sweetened beverages?
6036.notes: The abstract mentions moderate-certainty evidence supporting this association.

6037.question: Do psychological interventions reduce the frequency of migraines in adults?
6037.notes: Standardised mean difference (SMD) -0.02, 95% confidence interval (CI) -0.17 to 0.13; 4 studies, 681 participants.

6038.question: Do corticosteroids reduce all-cause mortality within three months in patients with ARDS?
6038.notes: The confidence interval includes the possibility of both increased and reduced deaths (RR 0.77, 95% CI 0.57 to 1.05).

6039.question: Does reducing the dialysate temperature below 36°C improve the rate of intradialytic hypotension (IDH) compared to standard dialysate temperature?
6039.notes: Rate ratio 0.52, 95% CI 0.34 to 0.80; very low certainty evidence

6040.question: Does singing improve maximal expiratory pressure in children with cystic fibrosis compared to recreational activities?
6040.notes: Mean difference 25.80 (95% confidence interval 5.94 to 45.66) at follow-up.

6041.question: Does inositol supplementation reduce neonatal death in preterm infants?
6041.notes: Neonatal death was significantly reduced with a typical RR of 0.53 (95% CI 0.31 to 0.91) and a typical RD of -0.09 (95% CI -0.16 to -0.01).

6042.question: Does feeding preterm infants protein hydrolysate formula reduce the risk of necrotising enterocolitis compared to standard cow's milk formula?
6042.notes: Meta-analysis showed no effect on the risk of necrotising enterocolitis (typical risk ratio 1.10, 95% CI 0.36 to 3.34).

6043.question: Does Motivational Interviewing (MI) help people to stop smoking compared with no intervention?
6043.notes: RR = 0.84, 95% CI 0.63 to 1.12; low-certainty evidence due to risk of bias and imprecision.

6044.question: Does dietary intervention lead to a 75% or greater improvement in the Psoriasis Area and Severity Index (PASI 75) compared to usual care in obese participants?
6044.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.66, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.07 to 2.58; 2 trials, 323 participants.

6045.question: Does prospective HLA-B*57:01 screening reduce the incidence of hypersensitivity reactions to abacavir in patients with HIV-type 1?
6045.notes: The study showed a lower incidence of hypersensitivity reactions in the screening group with a risk ratio of 0.43 (95% CI 0.28 to 0.67).

6046.question: Does speech and language therapy improve health-related quality of life in individuals with unexplained chronic cough?
6046.notes: Improvement was observed with a mean difference of 1.53 (95% CI 0.21 to 2.85) at four weeks, but not beyond.

6047.question: Is there evidence that arthroscopic partial meniscectomy provides significant improvement in pain and function compared to physical therapy alone for mild to moderate knee osteoarthritis?
6047.notes: Mean pain improvement was 0.2 points better with surgery (95% CI 4.05 better to 3.65 worse), and mean function improvement was 0.8 points better with surgery (95% CI 4.3 better to 2.7 worse).

6048.question: Is zinc tape more effective than magnesium sulphate in healing ulcers in people with leprosy?
6048.notes: Zinc tape showed a higher number of healed ulcers and reduction in mean ulcer area compared to magnesium sulphate, but the evidence is very uncertain due to wide confidence intervals.

6049.question: Does fortification of wheat flour with folic acid reduce the risk of neural tube defects?
6049.notes: This outcome was only reported in one non-RCT with a risk ratio of 0.32 (95% CI 0.21 to 0.48).

6050.question: Does proactive ethics consultation lead to higher satisfaction with care among healthcare providers compared to usual care?
6050.notes: Healthcare providers scored a value of 4 or 5 for 81.4% in the control group and 86.1% in the intervention group (P > 0.05), indicating no significant difference.

6051.question: Does pregabalin provide significant relief for neuropathic pain in people with sickle cell disease compared to placebo?
6051.notes: The mean difference in pain relief was not statistically significant, with a wide confidence interval indicating uncertainty.

6052.question: Do financial incentives improve smoking cessation rates in mixed populations at long-term follow-up?
6052.notes: The pooled risk ratio (RR) for quitting with incentives at longest follow-up was 1.49 (95% CI 1.28 to 1.73).

6053.question: Do buffered solutions reduce in-hospital mortality compared to 0.9% saline solutions in critically ill patients?
6053.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 0.91, 95% CI 0.83 to 1.01; 19,664 participants; 14 studies

6054.question: Does the use of a powered air-purifying respirator provide better protection against contamination compared to a simple ensemble of PPE without such a respirator?

6055.question: Is there a difference in P vivax recurrences at 6 months between the high-standard 14-day regimen and the standard 14-day regimen?
6055.notes: RR 0.82, 95% CI 0.47 to 1.43 with chloroquine; RR 1.11, 95% CI 0.17 to 7.09 with chloroquine or an ACT.

6056.question: Does undergoing IBD-related surgery increase the risk of infertility at 24 months?

6057.question: Do additional work breaks have a significant impact on reducing musculoskeletal pain, discomfort, or fatigue in healthy workers?
6057.notes: Low-quality evidence suggests additional work breaks may not have a considerable effect on musculoskeletal pain, discomfort, or fatigue (SMD -0.08; 95% CI -0.35 to 0.18; three studies; 225 participants).

6058.question: Does the FAST program improve child school performance at long-term follow-up?
6058.notes: Effect size was very small (SMD -0.02, 95% CI -0.11 to 0.08), indicating no important positive or negative effects.

6059.question: Does feeding preterm infants with nutrient-enriched formula increase in-hospital rates of weight gain compared to standard formula?

6060.question: Does supplemental enteral tube feeding improve nutritional status in people with cystic fibrosis?
6060.notes: No eligible randomized controlled trials were found to assess the efficacy.

6061.question: Do inhaled corticosteroids improve forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) or forced vital capacity (FVC) % predicted in individuals with cystic fibrosis?
6061.notes: The trials reported no difference in FEV1 or FVC % predicted, but the quality of the evidence was low due to risks of bias and low participant numbers.

6062.question: Does acupuncture improve the live birth rate compared to sham acupuncture in women with PCOS?

6063.question: Does mobilizing community first responders increase survival to hospital admission in out-of-hospital cardiac arrest cases?
6063.notes: Increased survival to hospital admission was reported in the intervention group (OR 1.5, 95% CI 1.1 to 2.0).

6064.question: Does hyaluronic acid selected sperm-intracytoplasmic sperm injection (HA-ICSI) reduce the risk of miscarriage compared to standard ICSI?
6064.notes: HA-ICSI may decrease miscarriage per woman randomly assigned: 7% chance of miscarriage with ICSI versus 3% to 6% chance with HA-ICSI (RR 0.61, 95% CI 0.45 to 0.83, 3005 women, I<sup>2</sup> = 0%).

6065.question: Do diet combined with physical activity interventions reduce BMI in children aged 0-5 years?
6065.notes: Mean difference (MD) -0.07 kg/m², 95% confidence interval (CI) -0.14 to -0.01

6066.question: Does re-feeding gastric residuals in preterm infants reduce the time to regain birth weight?
6066.notes: Mean difference (MD) 0.40 days, 95% confidence interval (CI) -2.89 to 3.69 days

6067.question: Do supportive interventions improve the psychological distress of caregivers of people with a brain or spinal cord tumour?
6067.notes: There is some evidence for positive effects on psychological distress, but the certainty of evidence is low to very low.

6068.question: Is the diagnostic accuracy of total serum bile acids (TSBA) for intrahepatic cholestasis of pregnancy likely overestimated?
6068.notes: The abstract suggests that the diagnostic accuracy of TSBA might have been overestimated due to high risk of bias and heterogeneity in the studies.

6069.question: Is there evidence that one type of removable dental prosthesis is superior to another in terms of long-term success, function, morbidity, or patient satisfaction?
6069.notes: The review found insufficient evidence to determine superiority among different types of removable dental prostheses.

6070.question: Does the use of an H2 receptor antagonist reduce the risk of upper gastrointestinal bleeding in high-risk newborn infants?
6070.notes: Meta-analysis showed a typical risk ratio of 0.36 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.22 to 0.58.

6071.question: Does ultrasound-guided transvaginal ovarian needle drilling (UTND) lead to a higher ovulation rate compared to laparoscopic ovarian drilling (LOD) in clomiphene-resistant women with PCOS?
6071.notes: UTND may lead to a slight decrease in ovulation rate compared to LOD (OR 0.66, 95% CI 0.45 to 0.97).

6072.question: Is phenytoin associated with a lower rate of treatment failure compared to phenobarbitone?
6072.notes: Pooled HR for treatment failure due to any reason: 1.61, 95% CI 1.22 to 2.12, indicating an advantage for phenytoin.

6073.question: Is pregabalin more effective than placebo in achieving a 50% or greater reduction in seizure frequency for treatment-resistant focal epilepsy?

6074.question: Does vitamin D supplementation alone during pregnancy reduce the risk of pre-eclampsia?
6074.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.48, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.30 to 0.79; 4 trials, 499 women.

6075.question: Does feeding preterm or low birth weight infants with formula compared to donor breast milk result in higher rates of weight gain, linear growth, and head growth?
6075.notes: Formula-fed infants showed higher in-hospital rates of weight gain (MD 2.51 g/kg/day), linear growth (MD 1.21 mm/week), and head growth (MD 0.85 mm/week).

6076.question: Do statins reduce the frequency of COPD exacerbations?
6076.notes: Mean difference (MD) -0.03, 95% confidence interval (CI) -0.25 to 0.19, 1 trial, 877 participants

6077.question: Is early postoperative enteral nutrition associated with a shorter length of hospital stay compared to traditional management in patients undergoing lower gastrointestinal surgery?
6077.notes: Mean difference in LoS was 1.95 days shorter in the early feeding group (95% CI, -2.99 to -0.91).

6078.question: Does knowledge of FFN results reduce the risk of preterm birth before 37 weeks compared to not having this knowledge?
6078.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.72, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.52 to 1.01; 4 trials; 357 women.

6079.question: Does exercise improve physical performance in individuals with vertebral fractures?
6079.notes: Exercise probably improves physical performance, specifically Timed Up and Go test, but the improvement is not clinically important (MD -1.13 seconds, 95% CI -1.85 to -0.42).

6080.question: Is there a difference in time to treatment failure due to adverse events between carbamazepine and phenytoin?
6080.notes: Pooled HR adjusted for seizure type for 546 participants: 1.27, 95% CI 0.87 to 1.86, moderate-certainty evidence.

6081.question: Does exposure to the smell and taste of milk with tube feedings decrease the time taken to reach full sucking feeds in preterm infants?
6081.notes: MD -2.57 days, 95% CI -5.15 to 0.02; I² = 17%; 2 trials, 131 infants

6082.question: Is cryotherapy associated with a lower 10-year mortality rate compared to conventional surgery for liver metastases?
6082.notes: The relative risk (RR) for mortality at 10 years was 0.88 with a 95% CI of 0.77 to 1.02, indicating no significant difference.

6083.question: Does routine monitoring of gastric residual in preterm infants reduce the incidence of necrotising enterocolitis?
6083.notes: Routine monitoring may have little or no effect on the incidence of necrotising enterocolitis (RR 3.07, 95% CI 0.50 to 18.77).

6084.question: Does oral methotrexate plus oral prednisone improve disease activity or damage in juvenile active morphea compared to placebo plus oral prednisone?
6084.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 2.31, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.20 to 4.45; number needed to treat for an additional beneficial outcome (NNTB) 3.

6085.question: Does ultrasound combined with FNAC before sentinel lymph node biopsy effectively identify nodal metastases in melanoma patients?
6085.notes: The combination potentially allows 43 out of 237 people with nodal metastases to be triaged directly to adjuvant therapy, with a specificity of 99.8%.

6086.question: Does the Pay-for-Performance model have a significant impact on patient outcomes in hospitals compared to capitation-based payments without P4P?
6086.notes: The certainty of the evidence was very low, and the effects on patient outcomes were at most small.

6087.question: Does balneotherapy improve health-related quality of life (HRQoL) for patients with chronic venous insufficiency at 12 months?
6087.notes: Moderate improvement in HRQoL at 12 months (MD -4.99, 95% CI -9.19 to -0.78).

6088.question: Are purine analogues more effective than placebo in preventing clinical relapse in patients with surgically-induced remission of Crohn's disease?
6088.notes: 51% of AZA/6-MP participants relapsed compared to 64% of placebo participants (RR 0.79; 95% CI 0.67 to 0.92).

6089.question: Is atropine penalization as effective as conventional occlusion in improving visual acuity in amblyopic eyes?
6089.notes: Evidence from six trials suggests similar improvement in visual acuity with both treatments.

6090.question: Is PCR more sensitive when used on blood samples collected early in the disease stage of leptospirosis?
6090.notes: Two studies suggested increased sensitivity of PCR on early-stage blood samples.

6091.question: Does adding aspirin to standard antipsychotic treatment improve mental state in people with schizophrenia?
6091.notes: Mean total PANSS endpoint scores favored the adjunct aspirin group (MD -6.56, 95% CI -12.04 to -1.08).

6092.question: Does larviciding with chemical or microbial insecticides reduce malaria incidence in areas with aquatic habitats of less than 1 km²?
6092.notes: The cRCT in Sri Lanka showed a lower malaria incidence with a rate ratio of 0.24, and the CBA studies reported lower malaria prevalence with a risk ratio of 0.79.

6093.question: Do immunoglobulins reduce mortality in infants and young children hospitalized with RSV lower respiratory tract infection?
6093.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.87, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.14 to 5.27; very low-certainty evidence.

6094.question: Does feeding preterm or low birth weight infants with maternal breast milk provide immuno-nutritional advantages over formula?
6094.notes: Observational studies and meta-analyses suggest breast milk has major immuno-nutritional advantages.

6095.question: Are multiple session early psychological interventions more effective than usual care in reducing PTSD diagnosis at three to six months' follow-up?
6095.notes: RR 0.62, 95% CI 0.41 to 0.93; I<sup>2</sup> = 34%; studies = 5; participants = 758

6096.question: Is short-cycle progestogen therapy during the luteal phase inferior to other medical therapies in reducing menstrual blood loss?
6096.notes: Short-cycle progestogen therapy was inferior to other medical therapies like tranexamic acid, danazol, and Pg-IUS with a mean difference of 37.29 (95% CI 17.67 to 56.91).

6097.question: Does sulthiame as an add-on therapy lead to complete cessation of seizures in infants with West syndrome?
6097.notes: The risk ratio for complete cessation of seizures was 11.14 (95% CI 0.67 to 184.47), but the difference was not statistically significant.

6098.question: Does radiotherapy increase the risk of cognitive impairment in patients with low-grade gliomas over the long term?
6098.notes: One study reported a higher risk of cognitive impairment in the radiotherapy group at 12 years (RR 1.95, 95% CI 1.02 to 3.71).

6099.question: Does school dental screening improve dental attendance when compared to no screening?
6099.notes: The meta-analysis for dental attendance showed inconclusive results with high heterogeneity.

6100.question: Is endometrial ablation associated with a lower satisfaction rate compared to hysterectomy at two years post-surgery?
6100.notes: Satisfaction rate was lower in the endometrial ablation group at two years (RR 0.87, 95% CI 0.80 to 0.95; 4 studies, 567 women, I² = 0%).

6101.question: Are systematic reviews with financial conflicts of interest more likely to have favourable conclusions compared to those without?
6101.notes: RR: 1.98, 95% CI: 1.26 to 3.11; based on seven studies of 411 systematic reviews.

6102.question: Do interventions focused on the practicalities of adhering to smoking cessation treatment improve medication adherence?
6102.notes: Interventions focused on practicalities showed a small improvement in adherence (SMD 0.21, 95% CI 0.03 to 0.38).

6103.question: Does prolonged thromboprophylaxis with LMWH reduce the incidence of VTE compared to thromboprophylaxis during hospital admittance only after major abdominal or pelvic surgery?
6103.notes: The incidence of VTE was 13.2% in the control group compared to 5.3% in the LMWH group (M-H OR 0.38, 95% CI 0.26 to 0.54).

6104.question: Are there any evidence-based guidelines currently available for managing dental and orthodontic complications in individuals with thalassaemia?
6104.notes: The abstract mentions a lack of evidence-based guidelines for these complications.

6105.question: Does the use of peripheral nerve blocks adjunctive to systemic analgesia reduce pain intensity at rest compared to systemic analgesia alone within 72 hours postoperatively?
6105.notes: Pain intensity was significantly lower at all time periods within 72 hours postoperatively, with MD -11.85 (95% CI -20.45 to -3.25) at 0-23 hours, MD -12.92 (95% CI -19.82 to -6.02) at 24-47 hours, and MD -9.72 (95% CI -16.75 to -2.70) at 48-72 hours.

6106.question: Is topical ketanserin more effective than clioquinol cream or zinc paste in wound healing for leprosy patients?

6107.question: Do TNF-α blockers reduce the incidence of treatment resistance in children with Kawasaki disease?
6107.notes: TNF-α blocker intervention group 30/237, control group 58/257; RR 0.57, 95% CI 0.38 to 0.86

6108.question: Is certolizumab pegol (CZP) more effective than placebo in achieving clinical remission at week 8 for patients with active Crohn's disease?
6108.notes: CZP showed a risk ratio (RR) of 1.36 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 1.11 to 1.66 for clinical remission at week 8.

6109.question: Is felbamate associated with a significant reduction in seizure frequency compared to placebo in people with drug-resistant focal-onset epilepsy?
6109.notes: Conflicting results were reported, with one study showing a significant reduction and another showing no significant difference.

6110.question: Does reducing the number of available food options lead to a significant reduction in the selection of targeted foods?

6111.question: Do eHealth interventions reduce interdialytic weight gain in people with CKD?

6112.question: Does using chlorhexidine for bathing critically ill patients reduce the rate of hospital-acquired infections?
6112.notes: The certainty of the evidence is very low, with a rate difference of 1.70 (95% CI 0.12 to 3.29).

6113.question: Is there evidence that benzodiazepines lead to a clinically important change in catatonic symptoms in people with schizophrenia or similar serious mental illnesses?
6113.notes: The study showed no difference in clinically important change in catatonic symptoms (RR 0.95, 95% CI 0.42 to 2.16) with very low quality evidence.

6114.question: Does enteral supplementation with prebiotics reduce the incidence of hyperbilirubinaemia in neonates compared to distilled water or no supplementation?
6114.notes: One study reported a significant reduction in the risk of hyperbilirubinaemia with prebiotics (RR 0.75, 95% CI 0.58 to 0.97).

6115.question: Does performing a hysterectomy with opportunistic salpingectomy reduce the incidence of ovarian cancer compared to hysterectomy without opportunistic salpingectomy?
6115.notes: No studies reported ovarian cancer incidence specifically after hysterectomy with or without opportunistic salpingectomy.

6116.question: Are there any randomized controlled trials that compare novel contact tracing methods to the current standard of care for tuberculosis in low- to moderate-incidence settings?
6116.notes: No trials met the inclusion criteria for comparing novel methods to the standard of care.

6117.question: Does acupuncture reduce detectable hepatitis B virus (HBV) DNA in people with chronic hepatitis B?
6117.notes: Acupuncture showed a reduction in detectable HBV DNA (RR 0.45, 95% CI 0.27 to 0.74; 1 trial, 58 participants).

6118.question: Does respiratory muscle training (RMT) improve lung capacity in individuals with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) compared to sham training?
6118.notes: Short-term effects showed no clear difference in the change of the per cent predicted forced vital capacity (FVC%) between EMT and sham EMT groups (MD 0.70, 95% CI -8.48 to 9.88).

6119.question: Does intervention for unruptured brain arteriovenous malformations increase the risk of death or dependency compared to conservative management?

6120.question: Does high-dose ibuprofen slow the progression of lung disease in children with cystic fibrosis?
6120.notes: Moderate-quality evidence from post hoc analysis showed a slower rate of annual decline in FEV1 % predicted and FVC in younger children.

6121.question: Does the use of graduated elastic compression stockings (GECS) improve the severity of post-thrombotic syndrome (PTS) symptoms compared to placebo?
6121.notes: One study reported beneficial haemodynamic effects, while another found no benefits on PTS severity compared to placebo.

6122.question: Does delayed cord clamping reduce the number of preterm babies who die before discharge compared to early cord clamping?
6122.notes: Average risk ratio (aRR) 0.73, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.54 to 0.98, 20 studies, 2680 babies.

6123.question: Is there evidence supporting the use of band ligation over beta-blockers for primary prophylaxis of oesophageal variceal bleeding in children with chronic liver disease or portal vein thrombosis?
6123.notes: No randomised clinical trials were found to assess this comparison.

6124.question: Does calcium supplementation before conception or in early pregnancy reduce the risk of pre-eclampsia?
6124.notes: Calcium supplementation may make little or no difference to the risk of pre-eclampsia (RR 0.80, 95% CI 0.61 to 1.06).

6125.question: Is adalimumab effective in reducing the probability of clinical relapse in Crohn's disease patients post-surgery?
6125.notes: Adalimumab showed a hazard ratio of 0.11 with a 95% credible interval of 0.02 to 0.33.

6126.question: Does the disposal of child faeces in a latrine reduce the odds of diarrhoea among all ages?
6126.notes: Pooled results from case-control studies indicated an odds ratio of 0.73 (95% CI: 0.62 to 0.85).

6127.question: Does smoking cessation intervention improve smoking cessation rates in individuals with rheumatoid arthritis?
6127.notes: Neither study provided evidence to show benefit of the interventions tested.

6128.question: Does interactive training improve survival to hospital discharge for patients requiring resuscitation?
6128.notes: Based on one study with 30 participants and 98 events, the evidence suggests little or no difference.

6129.question: Does flexibility exercise training provide clinically important benefits compared to land-based aerobic training in adults with fibromyalgia?
6129.notes: Very low-certainty evidence showed no clinically important benefits in HRQoL, pain intensity, fatigue, stiffness, and physical function.

6130.question: Are NSAIDs more effective than placebo in reducing heavy menstrual bleeding?
6130.notes: NSAIDs were found to be more effective than placebo in reducing heavy menstrual bleeding.

6131.question: Is there a preferred antibiotic treatment for spontaneous bacterial peritonitis in people with decompensated liver cirrhosis?
6131.notes: There is significant uncertainty and no evidence of difference in outcomes between different antibiotics.

6132.question: Does the use of alpha<sub>2</sub> agonist dexmedetomidine reduce the duration of delirium in critically ill adults compared to placebo?
6132.notes: Dexmedetomidine showed the smallest ratio of means (RoM 0.58; 95% CrI 0.26 to 1.27) compared with placebo, indicating a reduction in delirium duration.

6133.question: Is abdominal ultrasound effective in diagnosing abdominal tuberculosis in HIV-positive individuals when bacteriological confirmation is used as the reference standard?
6133.notes: The pooled sensitivity is 63% and specificity is 68%, indicating limited effectiveness.

6134.question: Do taxane-containing regimens improve overall survival in women with operable early breast cancer compared to regimens without taxanes?

6135.question: Does exercise have a clinically significant effect on reducing menstrual pain intensity compared to no treatment?
6135.notes: Exercise may have a large effect on reducing menstrual pain intensity with a standard mean difference of -1.86, corresponding to a 25 mm reduction on a 100 mm visual analogue scale.

6136.question: Is there evidence that laparoscopic splenectomy reduces post-operative hospital stay compared to open surgery in patients with β-thalassaemia?
6136.notes: The study reported a median difference of 1.5 days in hospital stay favoring laparoscopic splenectomy, P = 0.03.

6137.question: Do beta-blockers reduce the incidence of atrial fibrillation or flutter in adults undergoing cardiac surgery?
6137.notes: Beta-blockers may reduce incidences of atrial fibrillation or flutter by 163 fewer incidences per 1000 (RR 0.50, 95% CI 0.42 to 0.59; 40 studies, 5650 participants).

6138.question: Does reducing the number of available food options lead to a reduction in the selection of targeted foods?
6138.notes: Meta-analysis of three comparisons from three studies (n = 154) found a large reduction in selection: SMD -1.13 (95% CI -1.90 to -0.37).

6139.question: Does Tai Chi provide a clinically important improvement in pain for people with rheumatoid arthritis compared to no therapy or alternate therapy?
6139.notes: The mean difference in pain reduction was -2.15 (95% CI -3.19 to -1.11) on a VAS scale, but evidence quality is very low due to imprecision, blinding, and attrition bias.

6140.question: Does the combination of antivirals and corticosteroids reduce the rate of incomplete recovery in Bell's palsy compared to corticosteroids alone?
6140.notes: The combination may have little or no effect on rates of incomplete recovery (RR 0.81, 95% CI 0.38 to 1.74).

6141.question: Does intravenous magnesium therapy reduce the length of hospital stay for patients with sickle cell disease experiencing vaso-occlusive crises?
6141.notes: Data from one study (n = 106) showed no difference in length of stay in hospital between groups.

6142.question: Is there evidence supporting the efficacy of empirical antibiotic treatment for acute chest syndrome in sickle cell disease patients?
6142.notes: No eligible randomized controlled trials were identified to assess efficacy.

6143.question: Does treatment with sotalol increase all-cause mortality compared to placebo or no treatment in patients with atrial fibrillation?
6143.notes: High-certainty evidence from five RCTs indicated an increased risk (RR 2.23, 95% CI 1.03 to 4.81).

6144.question: Does early cognitive rehabilitation improve visual attention in patients with primary malignant brain tumours?
6144.notes: The trial showed differences in the domain of visual attention.

6145.question: Are there any completed studies that demonstrate the benefits or harms of stem cell-based interventions for the treatment or prevention of GM-IVH in preterm infants?
6145.notes: The search did not find any completed studies for inclusion.

6146.question: Is the Mini-Cog test associated with high sensitivity for detecting dementia in secondary care settings?
6146.notes: The reported sensitivities were 0.67, 0.60, and 0.87, indicating variability and generally moderate sensitivity.

6147.question: Does the use of fetal biometry in addition to maternal blood glucose concentration reduce the incidence of caesarean delivery in women with gestational diabetes?
6147.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.81, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.59 to 1.10; 2 trials, 428 women

6148.question: Does a single positive PCR test for invasive aspergillosis have a high negative predictive value in high-risk patient groups?
6148.notes: The sensitivity of a single positive PCR test is 79.2%, which confers a high negative predictive value, allowing the exclusion of the diagnosis.

6149.question: Does supervisor training reduce employees' stress levels compared to no intervention?
6149.notes: Based on 6 studies, supervisor training does not reduce stress levels compared to no intervention.

6150.question: Does hypofractionation result in a difference in prostate cancer-specific survival compared to conventional fractionation?

6151.question: Can interim PET scan results predict overall survival in individuals with Hodgkin lymphoma undergoing first-line therapy?
6151.notes: Unadjusted HR 5.09, 95% CI 2.64 to 9.81, moderate-certainty evidence

6152.question: Does ovarian stimulation (OS) increase the odds of multiple pregnancy compared to expectant management or intrauterine insemination (IUI)?
6152.notes: OS has an OR of 3.07 with a 95% CI of 1.00 to 9.41.

6153.question: Is once-daily dosing of aminoglycoside antibiotics as effective as thrice-daily dosing in improving forced expiratory volume in one second for people with cystic fibrosis?

6154.question: Does knowledge of transvaginal ultrasound-measured cervical length in asymptomatic women with twin pregnancies reduce the risk of preterm birth at less than 34 weeks?
6154.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.62, 95% confidence intervals (CI) 0.30 to 1.25; 1 study, 125 participants

6155.question: Does reducing smoking before quitting result in higher long-term quit rates compared to quitting abruptly?
6155.notes: RR 1.01, 95% CI 0.87 to 1.17; I² = 29%; 22 studies, 9219 participants

6156.question: Does transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation (TENS) help more children achieve continence compared to sham TENS?
6156.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 4.89, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.68 to 14.21; 3 studies; n = 93

6157.question: Does antibiotic treatment reduce the prevalence of active trachoma in individuals with active trachoma at three and twelve months?
6157.notes: Risk ratio (RR) at three months is 0.78 (95% CI 0.69 to 0.89) and at twelve months is 0.74 (95% CI 0.55 to 1.00).

6158.question: Is there evidence that albumin plus noradrenaline results in fewer adverse events per participant compared to albumin plus terlipressin in the treatment of hepatorenal syndrome?
6158.notes: Albumin plus noradrenaline had a rate ratio of 0.51 (95% CrI 0.28 to 0.87) for adverse events per participant compared to albumin plus terlipressin.

6159.question: Is there a difference in the risk of all-cause mortality between adults taking combined formoterol and ICS versus ICS alone?
6159.notes: Pooled Peto OR was 1.25 (95% CI 0.61 to 2.56), indicating no significant difference.

6160.question: Is there evidence supporting the effectiveness of any specific intervention for recurrent stress urinary incontinence after failed midurethral tape surgery?
6160.notes: The review found insufficient data to assess the effects of different management strategies.

6161.question: Does incubating embryos at a temperature lower than 37°C improve live birth rates in IVF?
6161.notes: Live birth data were not interpretable and not presented.

6162.question: Does providing physical breastfeeding support (manual or electric breast pump) improve exclusive breastfeeding rates at four to six weeks for women who are overweight or obese?
6162.notes: The evidence from one small trial with very low certainty suggests it is unclear whether physical support improves exclusive breastfeeding (RR 0.55, 95% CI 0.20 to 1.51).

6163.question: Does topical cyclosporine A improve subjective symptoms of dry eye compared to vehicle or artificial tears?
6163.notes: One trial reported subjective symptoms of dry eye at 6 months in favor of CsA (MD -4.80, 95% CI -6.41 to -3.19).

6164.question: Do prophylactic antibiotics administered preoperatively reduce the incidence of surgical site infections in patients undergoing breast cancer surgery without reconstruction?
6164.notes: Pooled risk ratio (RR) 0.67, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.53 to 0.85

6165.question: Does open surgical excision provide clinically important benefits over eccentric exercises in terms of knee pain reduction for patellar tendinopathy?
6165.notes: The mean knee pain reduction was minimal and not clinically significant, with an absolute pain reduction of 4% and a relative reduction of 10%.

6166.question: Is clinical homeopathy with asafoetida associated with a greater global improvement in IBS symptoms compared to placebo in the short term?
6166.notes: 73% of asafoetida participants experienced improvement compared to 45% of placebo participants (RR 1.61, 95% CI 1.18 to 2.18).

6167.question: Does using BIS to guide anaesthesia reduce the risk of intraoperative awareness compared to using clinical signs?
6167.notes: Peto odds ratio (OR) 0.36, 95% CI 0.21 to 0.60; incidences of intraoperative awareness were three per 1000 with BIS compared to nine per 1000 with clinical signs.

6168.question: Does regular deworming treatment improve average weight in children?
6168.notes: Recent studies show little or no average weight gain, with older studies showing large gains.

6169.question: Does intensive follow-up improve overall survival for patients with non-metastatic colorectal cancer treated with curative intent?
6169.notes: Intensive follow-up made little or no difference (HR 0.91, 95% CI 0.80 to 1.04).

6170.question: Do beta-blockers reduce the incidence of myocardial infarction in adults undergoing non-cardiac surgery?
6170.notes: Beta-blockers may reduce myocardial infarction by 13 fewer incidences per 1000 (RR 0.72, 95% CI 0.60 to 0.87).

6171.question: Does a shorter duration of intravenous antibiotic treatment improve quality of life and adherence in people with cystic fibrosis?
6171.notes: The abstract suggests that shorter treatment durations could improve quality of life and adherence due to reduced side effects and inconvenience.

6172.question: Does N-acetylcysteine (NAC) improve lung function in cystic fibrosis patients at six months?
6172.notes: NAC probably increased FEV1 % predicted from baseline at six months, MD 4.38% (95% CI 0.89 to 7.87).

6173.question: Does reducing smoking before quitting result in similar abstinence rates compared to quitting abruptly?
6173.notes: The main analysis showed no superior abstinence rates for either method (RR= 0.94, 95% CI= 0.79 to 1.13).

6174.question: Does combining serial casting with botulinum toxin type A (BTX) improve the reduction of idiopathic toe walking compared to serial casting alone?
6174.notes: The study found a risk ratio of 1.21 (95% CI 0.57 to 2.55), but the evidence was of very low certainty.

6175.question: Does Botulinum toxin type A (BoNT-A) improve overall gait scores in children with cerebral palsy compared to placebo or sham treatment in the short-term?
6175.notes: RR 1.66, 95% CI 1.16 to 2.37, P = 0.006; 4 studies, 261 assessments

6176.question: Do topical steroid/antibiotic combinations lead to better global improvement in eczema symptoms compared to topical steroids alone?
6176.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.10, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.00 to 1.21; 224 participants; 3 studies

6177.question: Does mindfulness-based stress reduction (MBSR) training improve menopause-specific quality of life in female BRCA carriers who have undergone risk-reducing surgery compared to usual care?
6177.notes: The RCT showed some improvement in MENQOL scores at 3 and 12 months for the MBSR group compared to usual care, but the evidence is of very low certainty.

6178.question: Does the use of a sternocleidomastoid muscle flap reduce the incidence rate of Frey's syndrome in patients undergoing parotidectomy?
6178.notes: Neither of the two studies showed a significant difference between groups (RR 0.08, 95% CI 0.00 to 1.23; 24 participants and RR 1.23, 95% CI 0.88 to 1.73; 36 participants).

6179.question: Can community pharmacists provide effective behavioural support for smoking cessation compared to less intensive interventions?
6179.notes: The pooled studies showed a benefit with a risk ratio of 2.30 (95% CI 1.33 to 3.97), but the evidence is of low certainty due to risk of bias and imprecision.

6180.question: Is norethisterone associated with a reduction in seizure frequency compared to placebo in women with catamenial epilepsy?
6180.notes: No reported treatment differences for mean change in seizure frequency.

6181.question: Do alpha blockers reduce prostatitis symptoms compared to placebo in the short term?
6181.notes: Mean difference in NIH-CPSI score -5.01, 95% CI -7.41 to -2.61

6182.question: Do exercise programmes help reduce pain in people with ankylosing spondylitis compared to no intervention?
6182.notes: Low-quality evidence showed a clinically meaningful reduction of pain with exercise (MD -2.1, 95% CI -3.6 to -0.6).

6183.question: Does removal from exposure improve asthma symptoms compared to continued exposure?

6184.question: Does NP-guided treatment reduce the risk of cardiovascular hospitalisation in patients with cardiovascular risk factors and without heart failure?

6185.question: Does intrapleural fibrinolytic therapy reduce the requirement for surgical intervention in patients with complicated parapneumonic effusions and empyema?
6185.notes: OR 0.37, 95% CI 0.21 to 0.68; 8 studies, 897 participants; I² = 51%

6186.question: Does palliative care improve long-term health-related quality of life in people with multiple sclerosis compared to usual care?
6186.notes: Mean change in health-related quality of life (SEIQoL) showed no evidence of difference (MD 4.80, 95% CI -12.32 to 21.92).

6187.question: Is real-time video counselling more effective than telephone counselling in achieving smoking cessation?
6187.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 2.15, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.38 to 12.04; the wide CI indicates imprecision.

6188.question: Does extended varenicline treatment help prevent relapse in assisted abstainers?
6188.notes: Extended varenicline in assisted abstainers showed a risk ratio (RR) of 1.23 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 1.08 to 1.41.

6189.question: Do NSAIDs improve ongoing pregnancy rates in women undergoing assisted reproduction compared to placebo or no treatment?
6189.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.06, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.71 to 1.59; 4 studies, 1159 participants; I² = 53%

6190.question: Is there a difference in clinical pregnancy rates between the swim-up and gradient techniques for semen preparation?
6190.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 0.83, 95% CI 0.51 to 1.35; I² = 71%; 4 RCTs, 370 participants.

6191.question: Does exercise reduce the rate of falls in people after stroke?
6191.notes: The pooled result of eight studies showed that exercise may reduce the rate of falls (rate ratio 0.72, 95% CI 0.54 to 0.94).

6192.question: Is there evidence that regular long-term blood transfusion regimens reduce mortality associated with chronic chest complications in sickle cell disease?
6192.notes: No studies matching the selection criteria were found, indicating a lack of evidence.

6193.question: Does RV1 prevent a higher percentage of severe rotavirus diarrhoea cases in low-mortality countries compared to high-mortality countries during the first year of life?
6193.notes: In low-mortality countries, RV1 prevents 84% of severe rotavirus diarrhoea cases, whereas in high-mortality countries, it prevents 63%.

6194.question: Does administering low-dose aspirin to pregnant women reduce the risk of proteinuric pre-eclampsia?
6194.notes: Antiplatelet agents reduced the risk of proteinuric pre-eclampsia by 18% (RR 0.82, 95% CI 0.77 to 0.88).

6195.question: Does inhaled nitric oxide reduce the time to pain resolution in sickle cell disease pain crises compared to placebo?
6195.notes: The median time to pain resolution was 73.0 hours for inhaled nitric oxide and 65.5 hours for placebo.

6196.question: Do PPAR-γ agonists reduce the recurrence of stroke in people with a history of stroke or TIA?

6197.question: Is valproate more effective than placebo in treating acute mania in adults?
6197.notes: Valproate induces a slightly higher response compared to placebo (45% vs 29%, OR 2.05, 95% CI 1.32 to 3.20; 4 studies, 869 participants).

6198.question: Does the adductor canal block (ACB) provide better postoperative pain relief at rest compared to sham treatment for knee surgery patients?
6198.notes: SMD -0.56, 95% CI -1.20 to 0.07 at 2 hours; SMD -0.49, 95% CI -1.05 to 0.07 at 24 hours

6199.question: Does fluoxetine lead to a significant reduction in weight compared to placebo in overweight or obese adults without depression?
6199.notes: The mean difference in weight reduction was -2.7 kg (95% CI -4 to -1.4).

6200.question: Does administering chemotherapy before surgery reduce the need for blood transfusions in women with advanced epithelial ovarian cancer?
6200.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.80; 95% CI 0.64 to 0.99; four studies, 1085 women

6201.question: Do interventions for older patients with multi-morbidity likely improve the number of patients discussing their priorities compared to usual care?

6202.question: Does the use of an mTOR inhibitor-containing regimen improve progression-free survival in second/third-line therapy for advanced or recurrent endometrial cancer?

6203.question: Does continuous wound infusion of a local anaesthetic reduce postoperative pain at rest after midline laparotomy for colorectal resection?
6203.notes: Pain at rest reduced with mean difference of -0.59 (95% CI -1.12 to -0.07).

6204.question: Does surgical treatment provide additional benefits in terms of shoulder function at one year compared to conservative treatment?
6204.notes: Low-quality evidence showed no difference in shoulder function at one year (MD 0.73 points, 95% CI -2.70 to 4.16).

6205.question: Does the use of a balloon catheter reduce the risk of uterine hyperstimulation with fetal heart rate changes compared to vaginal PGE2?

6206.question: Does exercise therapy reduce fatigue in adults with chronic fatigue syndrome compared to passive control at the end of treatment?
6206.notes: SMD -0.66, 95% CI -1.01 to -0.31; re-expressed MD -3.4, 95% CI -5.3 to -1.6; scale 0 to 33.

6207.question: Does the LF-LAM test show higher sensitivity for diagnosing tuberculosis in HIV-positive inpatients compared to outpatients?
6207.notes: Pooled sensitivity was 52% among inpatients versus 29% among outpatients for symptomatic participants, and 62% among inpatients versus 31% among outpatients for unselected participants.

6208.question: Do targeted digital communications improve health outcomes in reproductive, maternal, newborn, child, and adolescent health (RMNCAH) contexts?
6208.notes: The abstract suggests potential but acknowledges the challenge in changing health behaviors significantly.

6209.question: Do antiepileptic drugs reduce the likelihood of further seizures in patients with neurocysticercosis who have already experienced a seizure?
6209.notes: The review found no reliable evidence regarding the duration of AED treatment required for secondary prevention.

6210.question: Does clobazam as an add-on treatment reduce seizure frequency in patients with drug-resistant epilepsy?
6210.notes: Two studies reported 50% or greater seizure reduction in 57.7% and 52.4% of participants.

6211.question: Does the addition of oxandrolone to growth hormone therapy result in an increase in final adult height for girls with Turner syndrome?
6211.notes: Mean difference of 2.7 cm in favor of oxandrolone plus GH treatment (95% CI 1.3 to 4.1).

6212.question: Does early enteral nutrition affect the risk of mortality within 30 days in critically ill adults?

6213.question: Are there any high-quality trials available that assess the efficacy of medical interventions for chronic rhinosinusitis in people with cystic fibrosis?
6213.notes: The review identified no trials that met the inclusion criteria.

6214.question: Does a therapeutic community intervention reduce the likelihood of returning to prison compared to treatment as usual?

6215.question: Is the PETTICOAT technique associated with more extensive aortic remodeling compared to standard TEVAR in the context of type B aortic dissection?
6215.notes: No randomized controlled trials were found to compare the two techniques.

6216.question: Do standing devices and orthoses improve musculoskeletal impairments such as pain, contracture, scoliosis development, and bone density in boys and men with Duchenne muscular dystrophy?
6216.notes: No RCTs or quasi-RCTs were available to evaluate the effectiveness of standing devices in this population.

6217.question: Does continuous veno-venous hemofiltration (CVVH) reduce mortality in patients with severe acute pancreatitis?
6217.notes: There were no deaths reported in either group in the study comparing CVVH versus no intervention.

6218.question: Does shock wave lithotripsy have a higher stone-free rate compared to mini-percutaneous nephrolithotripsy for renal stones in children?
6218.notes: SWL likely has a lower SFR (RR 0.88, 95% CI 0.80 to 0.97).

6219.question: Is there evidence supporting the effectiveness of empirical antibiotic treatment for osteomyelitis in people with sickle cell disease?
6219.notes: No eligible randomised controlled trials were identified to support this.

6220.question: Does bisphosphonate therapy reduce the risk of fractures in kidney transplant recipients?
6220.notes: RR 0.62, 95% CI 0.38 to 1.01; low certainty evidence

6221.question: Do prostanoids and their analogues reduce mortality and the need for ECMO in neonates with PPHN?
6221.notes: No eligible trials were identified to evaluate the efficacy of prostanoids as sole agents.

6222.question: Is there a difference in the incidence of intra-operative hypotension requiring treatment between CSE and low-dose spinal anaesthesia?
6222.notes: CSE appeared to reduce the incidence of intra-operative hypotension compared with low-dose spinal (average RR 0.59, 95% CI 0.38 to 0.93; 4 studies, 336 women).

6223.question: Does oral clarithromycin improve itch resolution compared to placebo in patients with pityriasis rosea?
6223.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.84, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.47 to 1.52; 1 study, 28 participants.

6224.question: Does topiramate as an add-on treatment significantly reduce seizure frequency in patients with drug-resistant focal epilepsy compared to placebo?
6224.notes: The RR for a 50% or greater reduction in seizure frequency with add-on topiramate compared to placebo was 2.71 (95% CI 2.05 to 3.59).

6225.question: Does withholding feeds around the time of blood transfusion reduce the risk of necrotising enterocolitis (NEC) in preterm infants?
6225.notes: The single eligible RCT did not report any cases of NEC, and conclusions could not be drawn.

6226.question: Is there a significant difference in peri-implant bone loss between Nobel Speedy Groovy implants and NobelActive implants?
6226.notes: Nobel Speedy Groovy implants showed more peri-implant bone loss compared to NobelActive implants (MD -0.59 mm; 95% CI -0.74 to -0.44).

6227.question: Do clients perceive targeted digital communication via mobile devices as supportive and connecting?
6227.notes: Clients felt supported and connected as someone took the time to send them messages.

6228.question: Does adding exercise to smoking cessation support improve long-term smoking abstinence compared to smoking cessation support alone?
6228.notes: The risk ratio was 1.08 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.96 to 1.22, indicating no significant improvement.

6229.question: Does fortification of rice with iron alone or in combination with other micronutrients reduce the risk of iron deficiency?
6229.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.66, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.51 to 0.84; 8 studies, 1733 participants

6230.question: Does supplementing pregnant women with more than 600 IU/d of vitamin D reduce the risk of gestational diabetes?
6230.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.54, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.34 to 0.86; 5 trials; 1846 participants

6231.question: Do automated text messaging interventions result in higher smoking cessation rates compared to minimal smoking cessation support?

6232.question: Does progestogen supplementation reduce the rate of miscarriage in women with unexplained recurrent miscarriages?
6232.notes: The meta-analysis suggests a reduction in miscarriages with an average risk ratio (RR) of 0.73, 95% CI 0.54 to 1.00.

6233.question: Do intranasal corticosteroids improve patient-reported disease severity in non-allergic rhinitis patients compared to placebo at up to four weeks?
6233.notes: SMD -0.74, 95% CI -1.15 to -0.33; 4 studies; 131 participants; I² = 22%

6234.question: Does prophylactic plasma transfusion reduce 30-day mortality in patients undergoing non-cardiac surgery or invasive procedures?
6234.notes: One trial reported a risk ratio of 0.38 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.13 to 1.10, indicating very low-quality evidence.

6235.question: Does biofeedback plus standard therapy provide a clinical benefit over standard therapy alone for IBS management?
6235.notes: The clinical benefit was uncertain with RR 4.20, 95% CI 1.40 to 12.58.

6236.question: Does repetitive peripheral magnetic stimulation (rPMS) improve activities of daily living in people after stroke when combined with rehabilitation?
6236.notes: Mean difference (MD) -3.00, 95% confidence interval (CI) -16.35 to 10.35; P = 0.66; 1 trial; 63 participants

6237.question: Does using PEP with a mask reduce the rate of respiratory exacerbations compared to other techniques when used for at least one year?
6237.notes: Five studies with 232 participants showed a lower exacerbation rate with PEP using a mask.

6238.question: Does baclofen reduce symptoms of severe alcohol withdrawal syndrome compared to placebo?
6238.notes: No evidence of a difference in CIWA-Ar scores in eight-hour periods from days one to five.

6239.question: Do SSRIs improve disability scores in stroke recovery when considering only trials at low risk of bias?
6239.notes: Meta-analysis of trials at low risk of bias found little or no effect on disability score: SMD -0.01 (95% CI -0.09 to 0.06).

6240.question: Are non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) effective in providing participant-reported pain relief of 50% or 30% or greater in adults with sickle cell vaso-occlusive crises?
6240.notes: No data were reported regarding participant-reported pain relief of 50% or 30% or greater for NSAIDs.

6241.question: Does the use of contrast-enhanced CT improve the sensitivity of diagnosing appendicitis compared to unenhanced CT?
6241.notes: Summary sensitivity was higher for CT with intravenous contrast (0.96), rectal contrast (0.97), and intravenous and oral contrast (0.96) than for unenhanced CT (0.91).

6242.question: Is caeruloplasmin at a cut-off of 0.2 g/L associated with high sensitivity for diagnosing Wilson's disease?

6243.question: Does the use of human milk-derived fortifiers in preterm infants reduce the risk of necrotizing enterocolitis compared to bovine milk-derived fortifiers?

6244.question: Do child-feeding practices have a positive effect on vegetable consumption in children aged five years and under?
6244.notes: Child-feeding practices may lead to a small positive effect equivalent to an increase of 4.45 g of vegetable consumption (SMD 0.42, 95% CI 0.23 to 0.60).

6245.question: Is present-centered therapy (PCT) more effective than control conditions in reducing PTSD symptom severity?
6245.notes: PCT was more effective than wait-list/minimal attention in reducing PTSD symptom severity (SMD -0.84, 95% CI -1.10 to -0.59).

6246.question: Does Xiao Chai Hu Tang formula reduce the presence of hepatitis B virus DNA in the blood?
6246.notes: The evidence is uncertain (RR 0.62, 95% CI 0.45 to 0.85; very low-certainty evidence).

6247.question: Does statin treatment effectively lower low-density lipoprotein cholesterol levels in children with heterozygous familial hypercholesterolemia?
6247.notes: Statins reduced the mean low-density lipoprotein cholesterol concentration at all time points.

6248.question: Is clonazepam as effective as carbamazepine in achieving seizure freedom at one, three, and six months for newly diagnosed mesial temporal lobe epilepsy?
6248.notes: No difference was found between clonazepam and carbamazepine in terms of seizure freedom at one, three, and six months.

6249.question: Does acupuncture at P6 improve the completion rate of dental procedures compared to sham acupuncture?
6249.notes: RR 1.78, 95% CI 1.05 to 3.01; very low-certainty evidence

6250.question: Does video feedback improve parental sensitivity in parents of children at risk for poor attachment outcomes?
6250.notes: Standardised mean difference (SMD) 0.34, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.20 to 0.49

6251.question: Do community health educational interventions improve neonatal mortality rates in low- and middle-income countries?
6251.notes: Community health educational interventions significantly reduced overall neonatal mortality (RR 0.87, 95% CI 0.78 to 0.96).

6252.question: Does treatment with VRDc improve overall survival compared to MP in adults with newly diagnosed transplant-ineligible multiple myeloma?
6252.notes: HR 0.49 (95% CI 0.26 to 0.92), median OS 71.0 months compared to 34.8 months with MP.

6253.question: Are antibody responses similar between two-dose and three-dose HPV vaccine schedules in young females?
6253.notes: Antibody responses were similar after up to five years of follow-up (4 RCTs).

6254.question: Is indomethacin effective in reducing intracranial pressure in adults with severe traumatic brain injury?
6254.notes: No eligible studies were identified to assess the effects of indomethacin on intracranial pressure.

6255.question: Do NSAIDs reduce pain up to 24 hours after brain surgery?
6255.notes: NSAIDs reduce pain up to 24 hours with high-quality evidence (0 to 6 hours, MD -1.16, 95% CI -1.57 to -0.76; 12 hours, MD -0.62, 95% CI -1.11 to -0.14; 24 hours, MD -0.66, 95% CI -1.18 to -0.13).

6256.question: Does administering intramuscular progesterone reduce the risk of preterm birth before 34 weeks in women with multiple pregnancies?
6256.notes: More women delivered at less than 34 weeks' gestation in the IM progesterone group compared with placebo (RR 1.54, 95% CI 1.06 to 2.26).

6257.question: Does cyclosporin increase the number of children achieving complete remission compared to placebo or no treatment within 6 months?

6258.question: Does the professional application of fluoride varnish (7700 or 10,000 ppm F) every six weeks effectively prevent new demineralised lesions during orthodontic treatment?
6258.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.52, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.14 to 1.93; 405 participants; low-certainty evidence.

6259.question: Does non-specialist-led follow-up affect overall survival in cancer survivors?

6260.question: Does cognitive rehabilitation improve divided attention immediately after treatment in stroke survivors?
6260.notes: SMD 0.67, 95% CI 0.35 to 0.98; P < 0.0001; 4 studies, 165 participants

6261.question: Are positive recovery expectations associated with better work participation in adults with low back pain?

6262.question: Do interventions using sit-stand workstations reduce the intensity of low back symptoms in the short term?
6262.notes: Standardised mean difference (SMD) -0.35, 95% confidence interval (CI) -0.80 to 0.10; 2 RCTs

6263.question: Does animal-assisted therapy (AAT) help reduce depressive symptoms in people with dementia?

6264.question: Is ciprofloxacin more effective than metronidazole in achieving remission for acute pouchitis at two weeks?
6264.notes: Ciprofloxacin participants (7/7) achieved remission compared to 33% (3/9) of metronidazole participants (RR 2.68, 95% CI 1.13 to 6.35).

6265.question: Does Cerebrolysin improve cognitive function in people with vascular dementia?

6266.question: Do omega-3 fatty acids help in preventing the transition to psychosis in individuals at risk?
6266.notes: Fewer participants given omega-3 (10%) transitioned to psychosis compared to the placebo group (33%) during long-term follow-up of seven years (RR 0.24 95% CI 0.09 to 0.67; 1 RCT, 81 participants).

6267.question: Is there evidence that exercise interventions reduce the rate of falls in people with multiple sclerosis compared to no intervention?
6267.notes: The rate ratio for falls rate was 0.68 with a 95% CI of 0.43 to 1.06, indicating very low-quality evidence.

6268.question: Does vaccination with LZV reduce the incidence of herpes zoster compared to placebo in older adults?
6268.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.49, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.43 to 0.56; moderate-quality evidence

6269.question: Does providing advice on diet and feeding to pregnant women, mothers, or other caregivers with children up to the age of one year reduce the risk of early childhood caries?
6269.notes: Moderate-certainty evidence suggests a probable 15% reduced risk of caries presence in primary teeth with the intervention (RR 0.85, 95% CI 0.75 to 0.97).

6270.question: Does antibiotic treatment reduce the incidence of pyelonephritis in pregnant women with asymptomatic bacteriuria?
6270.notes: Average risk ratio (RR) 0.24, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.13 to 0.41; 12 studies, 2017 women.

6271.question: Does Integrated Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (ICBT) result in a greater proportion of days abstinent compared to Twelve Step Facilitation (TSF) at six- to 12-month follow-up?
6271.notes: ICBT group had a greater proportion of days abstinent than the TSF group at the six- to 12-month follow-up (MD 10.76, 95% CI 3.10 to 18.42; 189 participants).

6272.question: Is adalimumab more effective than placebo in achieving clinical remission in patients with moderate to severely active Crohn's disease?
6272.notes: 76% of adalimumab participants failed to achieve clinical remission compared to 91% of placebo participants (RR 0.85, 95% CI 0.79 to 0.90).

6273.question: Do dietary interventions for adult cancer survivors lead to a reduction in overall mortality?
6273.notes: Hazard ratio (HR) 0.98, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.77 to 1.23; 1 study; 3107 participants

6274.question: Does the use of platelet-rich plasma in extraction sockets prior to radiotherapy reduce the risk of developing osteoradionecrosis?
6274.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 3.32, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.58 to 19.09; one trial, 44 participants.

6275.question: Does administering a higher fraction of inspired oxygen increase mortality in adults admitted to the ICU compared to a lower fraction?
6275.notes: Meta-analysis indicated harm from higher fraction of inspired oxygen regarding mortality (RR 1.18, 95% CI 1.01 to 1.37).

6276.question: Does long-term GnRH agonist therapy affect the live birth rate in women with endometriosis undergoing IVF/ICSI?
6276.notes: RR 0.48, 95% CI 0.26 to 0.87; 1 RCT, n = 147; very low-quality evidence
