6277.question: Do educational policies involving mailed educational materials on prescribing for physicians and HMO members improve medicine use compared to no educational intervention?
6277.notes: The abstract indicates uncertainty about the effects on medicine use due to very low certainty evidence.

6278.question: Does primary closure improve the proportion of dog bite wounds that are infection-free compared with no closure?
6278.notes: The certainty of evidence for this outcome was judged to be very low (RR 1.01, 95% CI 0.97 to 1.05).

6279.question: Does a sequential IPV-OPV schedule reduce the incidence of vaccine-associated paralytic polio (VAPP) compared to OPV alone?
6279.notes: Sequential IPV-OPV may reduce VAPP cases by 54% to 100%.

6280.question: Is there evidence supporting the use of prophylactic antibiotics to prevent septic complications in patients with penetrating abdominal trauma?
6280.notes: No randomised controlled trials have been identified to support or refute the use of antibiotics.

6281.question: Do toric intraocular lenses provide a higher chance of achieving postoperative astigmatism within 0.5 dioptres compared to limbal relaxing incisions?
6281.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.40, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.10 to 1.78; 5 RCTs, 262 eyes.

6282.question: Does strength training alone improve dynamic strength of elbow flexors in people with FSHD?

6283.question: Is there evidence that scaling and root planning plus antibiotics reduce all-cause death in people with periodontitis and metabolic syndrome?
6283.notes: The study provided very low-certainty evidence with a Peto OR of 7.48 (95% CI 0.15 to 376.98), indicating inconclusive results.

6284.question: Does the ACE-III provide consistent sensitivity across different thresholds and patient populations for detecting dementia?
6284.notes: Sensitivity for dementia at thresholds 82 and 88 ranged from 82% to 97%.

6285.question: Does augmenting current antidepressant therapy with mianserin improve depressive symptoms?

6286.question: Is there any evidence that pharmacological treatments are effective for primary delusional infestation?
6286.notes: No RCTs were identified to evaluate the effectiveness of pharmacological treatments for primary DI.

6287.question: Does a long course of antibiotic prophylaxis (> 24 hours) compared to a short course (≤ 24 hours) reduce the risk of abdominal surgical site infections in patients with penetrating abdominal trauma?
6287.notes: The relative risk was 1.00 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.81 to 1.23, indicating uncertainty in the effect.

6288.question: Does intramuscular full-dose IPV result in higher seroconversion rates for all three types of wild poliovirus compared to intradermal fractional-dose IPV?
6288.notes: Seroconversion rates were significantly higher for intramuscular full-dose IPV for all three types of wild poliovirus after one and two primary doses, and for type two after three doses.

6289.question: Do beta-blockers reduce the short-term risk of reinfarction in patients with acute myocardial infarction?
6289.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.82, 98% confidence interval (CI) 0.73 to 0.91; 67,562 participants; 18 trials

6290.question: Do beginning reading interventions improve phonologic awareness in children and adolescents with intellectual disability?

6291.question: Does long-chain omega-3 supplementation improve aqueous tear production compared to placebo?
6291.notes: Moderate certainty evidence suggests a probable benefit in increasing aqueous tear production (MD 0.68, 95% CI 0.26 to 1.09 mm/5 min using the Schirmer test), though not clinically meaningful.

6292.question: Does collaborative case management reduce drug use compared to treatment as usual for female drug-using offenders?
6292.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.65, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.20 to 2.12; low-certainty evidence

6293.question: Is cognitive behavioural conjoint therapy (CBCT) more effective than a wait list control in reducing PTSD severity in primary patients with PTSD?

6294.question: Does metformin improve live birth rates compared to placebo in women with PCOS?
6294.notes: OR 1.59, 95% CI 1.00 to 2.51; I<sup>2</sup> = 0%; 4 studies, 435 women

6295.question: Does losigamone as an add-on therapy lead to a 50% or greater reduction in seizure frequency for patients with focal epilepsy?

6296.question: Does transcatheter aortic valve implantation (TAVI) reduce the risk of atrial fibrillation compared to surgical aortic valve replacement (SAVR) in patients with severe aortic stenosis and low surgical risk?
6296.notes: TAVI reduces the risk of atrial fibrillation with a risk ratio of 0.21 (95% CI 0.15 to 0.30).

6297.question: Is mechanical tongue cleaning associated with improved dentist-reported organoleptic test (OLT) scores compared to no tongue cleaning?
6297.notes: The evidence was very uncertain with a mean difference of -0.20 (95% CI -0.34 to -0.07) based on 2 trials with 46 participants.

6298.question: Does the use of autologous bone marrow-mesenchymal stem cells (BM-MSC) in combination with riluzole reduce functional impairment in ALS/MND patients compared to riluzole alone?
6298.notes: Mean difference (MD) 3.38, 95% CI 1.22 to 5.54; 1 RCT, 56 participants

6299.question: Does cycled tobramycin inhalation solution (TIS) therapy prolong the time to recurrence of Pseudomonas aeruginosa (PA) infection compared to culture-based therapy in children with cystic fibrosis?
6299.notes: The time to next isolation of PA was probably shorter with cycled TIS therapy than with culture-based therapy, hazard ratio (HR) 2.04 days (95% CI 1.28 to 3.26).

6300.question: Does cognitive behavioural therapy improve depressive symptoms in patients with end-stage kidney disease treated with dialysis?
6300.notes: Cognitive behavioural therapy probably improves depressive symptoms measured using the Beck Depression Inventory (MD -6.10, 95% CI -8.63 to -3.57).

6301.question: Does the use of TOR-I with an antimetabolite increase the risk of graft loss and acute rejection compared to CNI and an antimetabolite?
6301.notes: TOR-I with an antimetabolite increases the risk of graft loss (RR 1.32, 95% CI 0.96 to 1.81) and acute rejection (RR 1.60, 95% CI 1.25 to 2.04).

6302.question: Does auto-CPAP increase machine usage compared to fixed CPAP in adults with moderate to severe sleep apnoea?
6302.notes: Auto-CPAP increases usage by about 13 minutes per night (MD 0.21 hours/night, 95% CI 0.11 to 0.31).

6303.question: Do non-vitamin K antagonist oral anticoagulants (NOACs) reduce the risk of recurrent hospitalisation compared to vitamin K antagonists after percutaneous coronary intervention?
6303.notes: Apixaban (RR 0.85, 95% CI 0.77 to 0.95), high dose rivaroxaban (RR 0.86, 95% CI 0.74 to 1.00), and low dose rivaroxaban (RR 0.80, 95% CI 0.68 to 0.92) probably reduce the risk of recurrent hospitalisation.

6304.question: Does intravenous iron therapy lead to a clinically significant increase in haemoglobin concentration in adults with non-anaemic iron deficiency?
6304.notes: The mean difference in haemoglobin concentration was 3.04 g/L with a 95% CI of 0.65 to 5.42, which is considered of limited clinical significance.

6305.question: Does racecadotril reduce the risk of rehydration failure in children under five with acute diarrhoea?

6306.question: Does food fortification with multiple micronutrients reduce anaemia in the general population compared to no intervention?
6306.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.68, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.56 to 0.84; 11 studies, 3746 participants.

6307.question: Does metformin reduce or delay the risk of developing type 2 diabetes mellitus in people at increased risk compared to placebo or standard diet and exercise?
6307.notes: Metformin compared with placebo or diet and exercise reduced or delayed the risk of T2DM (RR 0.50, 95% CI 0.38 to 0.65).

6308.question: Is the risk of developing transient neurological symptoms (TNS) lower when using bupivacaine compared to lidocaine for spinal anaesthesia?
6308.notes: Risk ratio (RR) for bupivacaine is 0.16 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 0.09 to 0.28.

6309.question: Does pharmacy-based management improve medication adherence compared to treatment as usual in adults with depression?
6309.notes: The risk of non-adherence was reduced in participants receiving pharmacy-based management (RR 0.73, 95% CI 0.61 to 0.87; 6 RCTs, 911 participants).

6310.question: Does early post-operative imaging improve overall survival at one year for patients with glioblastoma?
6310.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.86, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.61 to 1.21; 48% vs 55% died, respectively.

6311.question: Do corticosteroids reduce 28-day mortality in patients with sepsis?
6311.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.91, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.84 to 0.99; 11,233 participants; 50 studies.

6312.question: Does the addition of catumaxomab infusion to abdominal paracentesis extend the median time to the first deterioration of quality of life in women with malignant ascites due to gynaecological cancer?
6312.notes: The median time to QoL deterioration was 47 to 49 days with catumaxomab infusion compared to 19 to 26 days with paracentesis alone.

6313.question: Does transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation (TENS) reduce neck pain compared to sham TENS in the short term?
6313.notes: The mean difference in pain reduction was -0.10 with a 95% CI of -0.97 to 0.77, indicating very low-certainty evidence.

6314.question: Are there established guidelines for the treatment of dental complications in individuals with sickle cell disease?
6314.notes: The abstract states that guidelines for treatment are unclear and often unavailable.

6315.question: Is scleral buckling combined with pars plana vitrectomy beneficial for reattachment in giant retinal tear cases?
6315.notes: The relative risk of reattachment ranged from 3.0 to 4.4, but findings are inconclusive due to lack of peer-reviewed publication and insufficient information for assessing risk of bias.

6316.question: Does parent training reduce crying time in infants with colic compared to control interventions?

6317.question: Do four-month ATT regimens containing moxifloxacin or gatifloxacin increase the risk of relapse compared to the standard six-month regimen in adults with drug-sensitive pulmonary tuberculosis?
6317.notes: Moxifloxacin-containing regimens: RR 3.56, 95% CI 2.37 to 5.37; Gatifloxacin-containing regimens: RR 2.11, 95% CI 1.56 to 2.84.

6318.question: Does bipolar TURP reduce the incidence of TUR syndrome compared to monopolar TURP?
6318.notes: BTURP probably reduces TUR syndrome events slightly (RR 0.17, 95% CI 0.09 to 0.30).

6319.question: Does intermittent preventive treatment in infants (IPTi) with sulfadoxine-pyrimethamine (SP) reduce the incidence of clinical malaria in sub-Saharan Africa?
6319.notes: IPTi with SP resulted in a 27% reduction in clinical malaria incidence (rate ratio 0.73, 0.65 to 0.82).

6320.question: Does positive airway pressure therapy improve quality of life for heart failure patients with central sleep apnoea compared to usual care?
6320.notes: PAP therapy showed some indication of improvement in quality of life scores (SMD -0.32, 95% CI -0.67 to 0.04; MD -0.51, 95% CI -0.78 to -0.24).

6321.question: Do health-promotion interventions in community pharmacies improve the professional practice of pharmacy workers?
6321.notes: Health-promotion interventions probably improve pharmacy workers' behaviour based on moderate-certainty evidence.

6322.question: Does motivational interviewing (MI) lead to a reduction in alcohol use compared to standard care in people with serious mental illness?
6322.notes: A clear difference favoring MI was observed for abstaining from alcohol (RR 0.36, 95% CI 0.17 to 0.75; participants = 28; studies = 1).

6323.question: Does adding hip core decompression to physical therapy improve clinical outcomes in people with sickle cell disease with avascular necrosis of bone compared to physical therapy alone?
6323.notes: The trial showed an improvement of 18.1 points for intervention therapy versus 15.7 points for control therapy, but the evidence quality is very low.

6324.question: Does restrictive fluid therapy (RFT) increase the risk of all-cause mortality compared to goal-directed fluid therapy (GDFT) in adults undergoing major non-cardiac surgery?
6324.notes: The evidence is very uncertain with a reported risk difference of 0.03 (95% CI 0.00 to 0.06) and a Peto OR of 4.81 (95% CI 1.38 to 16.84).

6325.question: Is hypertonic saline more effective than mannitol in reducing intracranial pressure in patients with acute traumatic brain injury?
6325.notes: The trials reported both treatments to be effective, but HTS had increased benefits in some cases. However, the evidence is considered very low due to imprecision and risk of bias.

6326.question: Does adding modafinil to antipsychotic treatment improve cognitive function in people with schizophrenia?
6326.notes: One study reported no clear difference in cognitive scores between modafinil and placebo groups (MD -3.10, 95% CI -10.9 to 4.7; participants = 48; studies = 1).

6327.question: Does dupilumab improve disease-specific health-related quality of life in adults with severe chronic rhinosinusitis and nasal polyps compared to placebo?
6327.notes: SNOT-22 score was 19.61 points lower (better) in participants receiving dupilumab (MD -19.61, 95% CI -22.54 to -16.69).

6328.question: Do manually-generated reminders delivered on paper improve professional practice measured as dichotomous process adherence outcomes compared with usual care?

6329.question: Does tonsillectomy reduce the frequency of PFAPA episodes in children compared to non-surgical treatment?
6329.notes: Surgery results in a large reduction in the average number of episodes over the follow-up period (rate ratio 0.08, 95% CI 0.05 to 0.13).

6330.question: Does intrathecal nusinersen treatment improve motor milestone achievement in infants with SMA type I compared to a sham procedure?
6330.notes: 51% of nusinersen-treated infants achieved a motor milestone response compared to 0% in the control group.

6331.question: Does preoperative iron therapy reduce the need for allogeneic blood transfusions in anaemic patients undergoing surgery?
6331.notes: Meta-analysis showed no difference in the proportion of participants who received a blood transfusion (RR 1.21, 95% CI 0.87 to 1.70).

6332.question: Is intravenous immunoglobulin (IVIg) associated with a 50% or greater reduction in seizure frequency in patients with drug-resistant epilepsy?
6332.notes: The study reported no significant difference between IVIg and placebo for a 50% or greater reduction in seizure frequency (RR 1.89, 95% CI 0.85 to 4.21).

6333.question: Is there a difference in subjective cure rates within 18 months between laparoscopic colposuspension using sutures and open colposuspension?
6333.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.04, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.99 to 1.08; 6 trials, 755 women.

6334.question: Is the primary patency rate at one year higher in the surgery group compared to the endovascular group for asymptomatic popliteal artery aneurysms?
6334.notes: Primary patency rate at one year was 93.3% in the endovascular group and 100% in the surgery group (RR 0.94, 95% CI 0.78 to 1.12).

6335.question: Does rotator cuff repair surgery provide significant improvement in shoulder pain compared to non-operative treatment?
6335.notes: Moderate-certainty evidence suggests surgery provides little or no improvement in pain (0.87 points better with surgery, CI 0.43 to 1.30).

6336.question: Does following a vegan diet lead to a reduction in total cholesterol levels in the context of primary prevention of cardiovascular disease?
6336.notes: Mean difference (MD) -0.24 mmol/L, 95% confidence interval (CI) -0.36 to -0.12

6337.question: Does decompressive craniectomy reduce mortality at six months for patients with severe traumatic brain injury?
6337.notes: Pooled results showed a slight reduction in risk of death at six months (RR 0.66, 95% CI 0.43 to 1.01).

6338.question: Does the duration of cisplatin infusion affect the incidence of hearing loss in children with neuroblastoma?
6338.notes: The risk ratio was 1.39 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.47 to 4.13, indicating imprecision and low-quality evidence.

6339.question: Does hormone replacement therapy (HRT) improve overall survival in women who have undergone surgical treatment for epithelial ovarian cancer?
6339.notes: HRT may improve overall survival with a hazard ratio of 0.71 (95% CI 0.54 to 0.93).

6340.question: Does haloperidol reduce agitation compared to placebo between 24 and 48 hours in terminally ill adults with mild- to moderate-severity delirium?

6341.question: Is maxacalcitol more effective than placebo in achieving clearance for chronic palmoplantar pustulosis in the short term?
6341.notes: Maxacalcitol showed a risk ratio (RR) of 7.83 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 1.85 to 33.12.

6342.question: Do multifocal lenses provide a benefit in slowing myopia progression compared to single vision lenses in children?
6342.notes: Children wearing multifocal lenses progressed on average 0.14 D less than those wearing SVLs.

6343.question: Does the rapid point-of-care test for C trachomatis have a high sensitivity for detecting urogenital infection in nonpregnant women and men of reproductive age?
6343.notes: The mean sensitivity is 0.48 (95% CI 0.39 to 0.58), indicating low sensitivity.

6344.question: Is paracetamol as effective as ibuprofen in closing a patent ductus arteriosus in preterm infants?
6344.notes: Typical risk ratio (RR) 0.95, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.75 to 1.21; typical risk difference (RD) -0.02, 95% CI -0.09 to 0.09); I² = 0% for RR and RD.

6345.question: Does paracetamol reduce pain following heel lance in neonates compared to water, cherry elixir, or EMLA cream?
6345.notes: Paracetamol did not significantly reduce pain following heel lance compared to other interventions.

6346.question: Does reducing sound levels in the NICU improve the Mental Developmental Index of preterm infants at 18 to 22 months corrected age?
6346.notes: The study found a significant difference in the Mental Developmental Index favoring the silicone earplugs group with a mean difference of 14.00 (95% CI 3.13 to 24.87).

6347.question: Does exercise therapy improve pain scores in women with AIMSS?
6347.notes: The evidence for the effect of exercise therapies on overall change in worst pain scores was very uncertain (SMD -0.23, 95% CI -0.78 to 0.32; 4 studies, 284 women).

6348.question: Does cerivastatin have a linear dose-response effect on LDL cholesterol, total cholesterol, and triglycerides?
6348.notes: The abstract states that cerivastatin's effects on LDL cholesterol, total cholesterol, and triglycerides are linearly dependent on dose.

6349.question: Does serlopitant 5 mg provide greater relief of patient-reported pruritus intensity compared to placebo?

6350.question: Does resveratrol supplementation improve glycosylated haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) levels in adults with type 2 diabetes mellitus?
6350.notes: Mean difference (MD) 0.1%, 95% confidence interval (CI) -0.02 to 0.2; P = 0.09; 2 studies; 31 participants.

6351.question: Are biologic treatments more effective than small molecules and conventional systemic agents in achieving PASI 90 for moderate-to-severe psoriasis?
6351.notes: Biologic treatments such as anti-IL17, anti-IL12/23, anti-IL23, and anti-TNF alpha were significantly more effective than small molecules and conventional systemic agents in reaching PASI 90.

6352.question: Is ciprofloxacin more effective than saline in resolving ear discharge in patients with CSOM when both groups receive aural toilet?
6352.notes: Resolution of discharge was 84% with ciprofloxacin versus 12% with saline (RR 6.74, 95% CI 1.82 to 24.99).

6353.question: Does a slow tapering of antiepileptic drugs reduce the risk of seizure recurrence compared to rapid tapering in children with epilepsy?
6353.notes: The review found no significant difference in seizure recurrence between rapid and slow tapering groups, with very low certainty evidence.

6354.question: Does G-CSF administration improve the ongoing pregnancy rate in subfertile women undergoing ART?
6354.notes: RR 1.42, 95% CI 0.83 to 2.42; 2 RCTs; participants = 263; I² = 0%

6355.question: Does electrical stimulation increase the proportion of pressure ulcers healed compared to no electrical stimulation?
6355.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.99, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.39 to 2.85; 11 studies, 501 participants.

6356.question: Does basiliximab induction reduce all-cause mortality compared to glucocorticosteroids induction in people undergoing liver transplantation?
6356.notes: HR 0.53, 95% CrI 0.31 to 0.93; based on 2 direct comparison trials (131 participants; low-certainty evidence)

6357.question: Do hygiene and emollient interventions reduce the frequency of skin tears in older people in residential care settings?
6357.notes: The abstract mentions a reduction in skin tears with emollient use, but the evidence is of very low quality, making the result uncertain.

6358.question: Is motor neuroprosthesis (MN) more beneficial than ankle-foot orthosis (AFO) for improving walking speed in people after stroke?
6358.notes: Mean difference (MD) 0.00 m/s, 95% CI -0.05 to 0.05; P = 0.93; 713 participants; 3 studies; I² = 17%

6359.question: Does prophylactic ibuprofen reduce the incidence of patent ductus arteriosus in preterm infants compared to placebo or no intervention?
6359.notes: Ibuprofen probably decreases the risk of PDA on day 3 or 4 (typical RR 0.39, 95% CI 0.31 to 0.48; NNTB 4, 95% CI 3 to 5).

6360.question: Is there evidence that any specific antibiotic regimen reduces mortality in patients with liver cirrhosis at risk of spontaneous bacterial peritonitis?
6360.notes: There was no evidence of differences between any of the antibiotics and no intervention in terms of mortality.

6361.question: Does titrated oxygen therapy reduce pre/in-hospital mortality compared to high-flow oxygen in patients with acute exacerbations of COPD in the pre-hospital setting?
6361.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.22, 95% CI 0.05 to 0.97; NNTB of 14 (95% CI 12 to 355)

6362.question: Does the use of topical antibiotics (quinolones) lead to a higher resolution of ear discharge compared to boric acid in patients with CSOM at one to two weeks?
6362.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.56, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.27 to 1.92; 1 study; 409 participants.

6363.question: Does interferon beta-1a improve disability in Guillain-Barré syndrome after four weeks?

6364.question: Does blood transfusion reduce the incidence of acute chest syndrome in people with sickle cell disease?
6364.notes: The trial was too small to provide reliable conclusions, with only 10 participants in the randomized arm.

6365.question: Does plasma exchange reduce the need for dialysis at 12 months in patients with renal vasculitis?
6365.notes: Plasma exchange reduced the need for dialysis at 12 months (RR 0.45, 95% CI 0.29 to 0.72).

6366.question: Does the administration of IVIG reduce mortality during hospital stay in neonates with clinically suspected infection?
6366.notes: Typical RR 0.95, 95% CI 0.80 to 1.13; typical RD -0.01, 95% CI -0.04 to 0.02

6367.question: Is radioembolisation associated with a lower incidence of hand-foot skin reaction compared to sorafenib in patients with unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma?

6368.question: Does health education improve HPV vaccine uptake compared to usual practice?

6369.question: Does CBT reduce the impact of tinnitus on quality of life compared to no intervention or wait list control?
6369.notes: SMD -0.56, 95% CI -0.83 to -0.30; equivalent to a 10.91 point reduction on the THI scale.

6370.question: Does telerehabilitation improve activities of daily living among stroke survivors compared to usual care?
6370.notes: Based on 2 studies with 661 participants, SMD -0.00, 95% CI -0.15 to 0.15.

6371.question: Does the use of oral montelukast reduce the apnoea/hypopnoea index (AHI) in children with mild to moderate obstructive sleep apnoea (OSA) compared to placebo?
6371.notes: Montelukast showed a lower AHI (MD -3.41, 95% CI -5.36 to -1.45) compared to placebo.

6372.question: Does the use of 2% ketanserin ointment accelerate wound healing compared to polyethylene glycol alone in arterial leg ulcers?
6372.notes: One trial demonstrated accelerated wound healing in the ketanserin group compared with the control group, but the evidence is of low methodological quality.

6373.question: Do probiotics reduce the number of pulmonary exacerbations in children and adults with cystic fibrosis?
6373.notes: The mean difference was -0.32 episodes per participant with a 95% CI of -0.68 to 0.03, indicating uncertainty in the effect.

6374.question: Does BCG therapy reduce the risk of recurrence compared to MMC in patients with intermediate- and high-risk non-muscle invasive bladder cancer?
6374.notes: BCG may reduce the time to recurrence compared to MMC (HR 0.88, 95% CI 0.71 to 1.09), but the confidence intervals include the possibility of no difference.

6375.question: Is ciclopirox 8% lacquer more effective than vehicle in achieving a complete cure for toenail onychomycosis?

6376.question: Does the use of boric acid in alcohol drops lead to an increase in the resolution of ear discharge compared to no ear drops in children with CSOM?
6376.notes: The evidence is of very low certainty, making it uncertain whether boric acid in alcohol drops increases resolution of ear discharge.

6377.question: Does late initiation of erythropoiesis-stimulating agents reduce the use of one or more red blood cell transfusions in preterm infants?
6377.notes: The meta-analysis showed a significant effect with a typical risk ratio of 0.72 (95% CI 0.65 to 0.79).

6378.question: Does pharmacological therapy reduce the prevalence of diagnosable depression after stroke?
6378.notes: Pharmacological interventions decreased the number of people meeting study criteria for depression (RR 0.70, 95% CI 0.55 to 0.88).

6379.question: Is there a difference in overall survival between carboplatin-based and cisplatin-based chemotherapy regimens in advanced NSCLC?

6380.question: Does early postoperative radiotherapy increase the time to progression compared to delayed radiotherapy in people with low-grade gliomas?
6380.notes: The median progression-free survival was 5.3 years in the early radiotherapy group versus 3.4 years in the delayed group (HR 0.59, 95% CI 0.45 to 0.77).

6381.question: Does the administration of IVIG reduce the incidence of sepsis in preterm and/or low birth weight infants?
6381.notes: IVIG administration results in a 3% reduction in sepsis (RR 0.85, 95% CI 0.74 to 0.98).

6382.question: Does intrathecal nusinersen improve motor function in children with SMA type II compared to a sham procedure?
6382.notes: Nusinersen showed a 3.7-point improvement on the HFMSE compared to a 1.9-point decline in the sham group (P < 0.01; n = 126).

6383.question: Does low vision rehabilitation improve health-related quality of life (HRQOL) in visually impaired adults compared to inactive comparators?
6383.notes: Very low-certainty evidence of no beneficial effects on HRQOL with psychological therapies and/or group programmes and multidisciplinary rehabilitation programmes.

6384.question: Is hypertonic saline more effective than mannitol in reducing mortality in patients with acute traumatic brain injury?
6384.notes: No clear difference was discerned between treatments for mortality.

6385.question: Does caregiver involvement in dietary behavior change interventions affect children's percentage of total energy intake from saturated fat or sodium intake?
6385.notes: Mean difference for saturated fat was -0.42% (95% CI -1.25 to 0.41) and for sodium intake was -0.12 g/d (95% CI -0.36 to 0.12).

6386.question: Does the addition of aldosterone antagonists to paracentesis plus fluid replacement increase the resolution of ascites compared to paracentesis plus fluid replacement alone?

6387.question: Do therapeutic interventions increase employment in unemployed job seekers?
6387.notes: Therapeutic interventions may increase employment at an average of 11 months follow-up (RR = 1.41, 95% CI 1.07 to 1.87), but the evidence is very uncertain.

6388.question: Is there evidence supporting the use of sclerotherapy over beta-blockers for primary prophylaxis of oesophageal variceal bleeding in children and adolescents with chronic liver disease or portal vein thrombosis?
6388.notes: No randomised clinical trials were found to assess the comparison.

6389.question: Does the traditional suburethral sling operation lead to more continent women in the medium term compared to open abdominal retropubic colposuspension?
6389.notes: 69% vs 59% after colposuspension: OR 1.70, 95% CI 1.22 to 2.37

6390.question: Can interim PET scan results predict overall survival in individuals with Hodgkin lymphoma undergoing first-line therapy?
6390.notes: Participants with a negative interim PET scan result probably have a large advantage in OS compared to those with a positive interim PET scan result (unadjusted HR 5.09, 95% CI 2.64 to 9.81).

6391.question: Does myomectomy improve clinical pregnancy rates in women with intramural fibroids?
6391.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 1.88, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.57 to 6.14; 45 participants; one study

6392.question: Does increased water intake reduce the recurrence of urinary stones in individuals with a history of urinary stones?

6393.question: Is dihydrocodeine (DHC) more effective than buprenorphine in achieving abstinence from illicit opiate use at six-month follow-up?
6393.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.59, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.25 to 1.39; P = 0.23

6394.question: Can Transcranial Doppler (TCD) and Transcranial Colour Doppler (TCCD) effectively detect stenosis or occlusion of intracranial large arteries in acute ischaemic stroke patients?
6394.notes: The summary sensitivity and specificity estimates for TCD and TCCD were both 95%.

6395.question: Does combination therapy compared to monotherapy reduce total mortality in patients with primary hypertension?
6395.notes: The risk ratio for total mortality was 1.35 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.08 to 21.72, indicating very uncertain evidence.

6396.question: Does the use of multiple micronutrient powders (MNPs) reduce the risk of anaemia in infants and young children compared to no intervention or placebo?
6396.notes: The risk of anaemia was reduced by 18% (RR 0.82, 95% CI 0.76 to 0.90; 16 studies; 9927 children).

6397.question: Is ibuprofen as effective as indomethacin in closing a patent ductus arteriosus in preterm infants?
6397.notes: Twenty-four studies found no significant differences in failure rates for PDA closure between ibuprofen and indomethacin.

6398.question: Do interventions to restrict access to jumping sites reduce the frequency of suicides by jumping?
6398.notes: A 91% reduction in suicides was observed in the pre- and post-intervention periods, with an incidence rate ratio (IRR) of 0.09 (95% CI 0.03 to 0.27).

6399.question: Does computerised cognitive training (CCT) improve global cognitive function in healthy older adults immediately after a 12-week intervention compared to active controls?
6399.notes: Slight improvement with SMD -0.31, 95% CI -0.57 to -0.05

6400.question: Does the timing of hypertonic saline inhalation (before, during, or after airway clearance techniques) affect lung function in people with cystic fibrosis?
6400.notes: The abstract states there were no clinically important differences in lung function based on timing.

6401.question: Is there a clear benefit of using high-dose unfractionated heparin over low-dose in preventing arterial thrombotic events in children undergoing cardiac catheterization?
6401.notes: The risk ratio for low-dose versus high-dose was 1.06 with a 95% CI of 0.58 to 1.92, indicating no clear benefit of one dose over the other.

6402.question: Does advance care planning (ACP) improve concordance between participants' preferences and end-of-life care in people with heart failure?
6402.notes: Only one study with a small sample size reported on this outcome, showing uncertain effects (RR 1.19, 95% CI 0.91 to 1.55).

6403.question: Does cognitive training improve global cognition in people with Parkinson's disease-related mild cognitive impairment or dementia?
6403.notes: The result was imprecise and not statistically significant (SMD 0.28, 95% CI -0.03 to 0.59).

6404.question: Does membrane sweeping increase the likelihood of spontaneous onset of labour compared to no treatment?
6404.notes: Average risk ratio (aRR) 1.21, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.08 to 1.34, 17 studies, 3170 participants

6405.question: Does acupuncture increase satisfaction with pain relief compared to sham acupuncture?
6405.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 2.38, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.78 to 3.19, 1 trial, 150 women.

6406.question: Are benzodiazepines effective in reducing the severity of delirium in non-ICU settings?
6406.notes: The evidence was of low certainty, and important effects could not be confirmed or excluded.

6407.question: Does intracytoplasmic morphologically selected sperm injection (IMSI) improve live birth rates compared to intracytoplasmic sperm injection (ICSI) in couples undergoing assisted reproduction techniques?
6407.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.11, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.89 to 1.39; 5 studies, 929 couples; I² = 1%

6408.question: Does telerehabilitation improve vision-related quality of life and near reading ability in people with low vision compared to face-to-face rehabilitation services?
6408.notes: No completed RCTs or CCTs were found to provide evidence on this comparison.

6409.question: Is enhanced care and rehabilitation in-hospital associated with reduced rates of postoperative delirium for people with dementia after hip fracture surgery?
6409.notes: Odds ratio 0.04, 95% CI 0.01 to 0.22, based on 2 trials with 141 participants.

6410.question: Does percutaneous pinning compared with plaster cast alone make any difference to patient-reported function at six weeks or six months?
6410.notes: Incomplete data from one trial; unable to determine the effect on patient-reported function.

6411.question: Are anti-VEGF medications effective in reducing intraocular pressure (IOP) in neovascular glaucoma (NVG) at one month?
6411.notes: One trial showed a mean difference of -6.50 mmHg (95% CI -7.93 to -5.07) at one month, indicating effectiveness, while another trial showed inconclusive results.

6412.question: Does increasing long-chain omega-3 intake reduce all-cause mortality?
6412.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.97, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.93 to 1.01; 143,693 participants; 11,297 deaths in 45 RCTs.

6413.question: Does the use of 3D video glasses during LA delivery reduce negative pain-related behavior in children compared to conventional treatment?
6413.notes: The evidence is uncertain with a risk ratio (RR) of 0.13, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.03 to 0.50, from 1 trial with 60 participants.

6414.question: Does laparoscopic ovarian drilling (LOD) reduce the live birth rate compared to medical ovulation induction alone in women with anovulatory PCOS and CC resistance?
6414.notes: Pooled results suggest LOD may decrease live birth slightly (OR 0.71, 95% CI 0.54 to 0.92).

6415.question: Does dupilumab improve disease-specific health-related quality of life in patients with severe chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyps?
6415.notes: SNOT-22 score was 19.61 points lower in participants receiving dupilumab (MD -19.61, 95% CI -22.54 to -16.69).

6416.question: Do beta-blockers reduce the risk of death in patients with chronic heart failure and CKD?
6416.notes: Beta-blockers may reduce the risk of death (any cause) with a risk ratio of 0.69 (95% CI 0.60 to 0.79).

6417.question: Does early administration of erythropoiesis-stimulating agents (ESAs) reduce the need for red blood cell transfusions in preterm infants?
6417.notes: Typical risk ratio (RR) 0.79, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.74 to 0.85; number needed to treat for an additional beneficial outcome (NNTB) 7, 95% CI 6 to 10.

6418.question: Is surfactant treatment associated with reduced mortality in neonates with pulmonary haemorrhage?
6418.notes: No randomized or quasi-randomized trials were identified to evaluate this.

6419.question: Is carotid artery stenting associated with a higher risk of periprocedural stroke or death compared to endarterectomy in patients with symptomatic carotid stenosis?

6420.question: Are topical corticosteroids more effective than placebo in resolving pain associated with oral lichen planus?
6420.notes: RR 1.91, 95% CI 1.08 to 3.36; 2 studies, 72 participants; I² = 0%

6421.question: Is the combination of percutaneous ethanol injection (PEI) and transcatheter arterial chemoembolisation (TACE) associated with improved survival rates compared to TACE alone in patients with liver metastases?
6421.notes: The trial reported a risk ratio for mortality of 0.69 (95% CI 0.36 to 1.33), indicating very low-certainty evidence.

6422.question: Does early administration of erythropoietin (EPO) reduce the use of one or more red blood cell (RBC) transfusions in preterm or low birth weight infants compared to late administration?
6422.notes: The typical risk ratio (RR) was 0.91 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.78 to 1.06, indicating a non-significant reduction.

6423.question: Is anticoagulation therapy effective and safe for patients with isolated subsegmental pulmonary embolism (SSPE) or incidental SSPE?
6423.notes: The abstract states that no randomised controlled trials were identified to assess the effectiveness and safety of anticoagulation therapy in these patients.

6424.question: Do implementation strategies improve the implementation of policies, practices, or programmes that promote child healthy eating, physical activity, and/or obesity prevention in childcare services?
6424.notes: Pooled analysis showed an improvement in implementation outcomes (SMD 0.49; 95% CI 0.19 to 0.79; participants = 495).

6425.question: Does acupuncture significantly reduce intraocular pressure in patients with glaucoma compared to sham procedures?
6425.notes: The trials showed varying results with high risk of bias and imprecision, making it difficult to draw reliable conclusions.

6426.question: Does steroid therapy prevent the progression to end-stage kidney disease in patients with IgA nephropathy and proteinuria greater than 1 g/day?
6426.notes: Steroid therapy probably prevents progression to ESKD (RR 0.39, 95% CI 0.23 to 0.65).

6427.question: Do prophylactic antibiotics reduce the incidence of superficial and deep perineal wound infections in women undergoing operative vaginal deliveries?
6427.notes: Superficial perineal wound infection (RR 0.53, 95% CI 0.40 to 0.69), deep perineal wound infection (RR 0.46, 95% CI 0.31 to 0.69).

6428.question: Does shock wave therapy provide a clinically important improvement in pain relief compared to placebo for rotator cuff disease?
6428.notes: The risk ratio for pain relief of 50% or greater was 1.10 (95% CI 0.62 to 1.94), indicating no clinically important improvement.

6429.question: Does nicotine replacement therapy (NRT) increase smoking cessation rates in late pregnancy compared to placebo?
6429.notes: In placebo-controlled RCTs, the evidence was unclear (RR 1.21, 95% CI 0.95 to 1.55).

6430.question: Do probiotics improve the maintenance of remission in ulcerative colitis compared to placebo?
6430.notes: The evidence is very low-certainty due to high risk of bias, imbalance in baseline characteristics, and imprecision.

6431.question: Does intense pulsed light (IPL) therapy reduce dry eye symptoms in patients with meibomian gland dysfunction?
6431.notes: Pooling data from two trials indicated little to no reduction in dry eye symptoms with IPL relative to a sham intervention (MD -0.33 units, 95% CI -2.56 to 1.89).

6432.question: Does the addition of the Hydrus microstent to cataract surgery increase the proportion of participants who are medication-free compared to cataract surgery alone in the short- and medium-term?
6432.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.59 at 12-month follow-up and RR 1.63 at 24-month follow-up.

6433.question: Is self-administered medical abortion as effective as provider-administered medical abortion for achieving successful abortion?
6433.notes: The risk ratio for successful abortion is 0.99 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.97 to 1.01 from two RCTs.

6434.question: Do health education interventions involving healthcare providers or individuals promote early presentation and referral for women with endometrial cancer symptoms?
6434.notes: The abstract indicates an absence of evidence regarding the effectiveness of such interventions.

6435.question: Does lactoferrin supplementation to enteral feeds decrease late-onset sepsis in preterm neonates?
6435.notes: Meta-analysis of 12 RCTs showed a decrease in late-onset sepsis with typical RR 0.82, 95% CI 0.74 to 0.91.

6436.question: Does implementing maternal death audits and reviews as part of a complex intervention reduce inpatient maternal mortality in low-income country district hospitals?
6436.notes: The QUARITE intervention showed a probable reduction in inpatient maternal deaths with an adjusted OR of 0.85 (95% CI 0.73 to 0.98).

6437.question: Is there currently any established intervention for managing advanced liver disease in individuals with cystic fibrosis?
6437.notes: The abstract indicates that no eligible randomized controlled trials were found to establish effective interventions.

6438.question: Does sustained lung inflation reduce mortality in the delivery room compared to standard inflations for newborns receiving resuscitation?
6438.notes: Typical RR 2.66, 95% CI 0.11 to 63.40; typical RD 0.00, 95% CI -0.02 to 0.02

6439.question: Does manual therapy improve trunk deformity in individuals with cystic fibrosis compared to usual care?
6439.notes: Manual therapy may make little or no difference to the change in trunk deformity compared to usual care.

6440.question: Does adding ovarian function suppression (OFS) to treatment reduce mortality in premenopausal women with hormone receptor-positive early breast cancer?
6440.notes: Adding OFS resulted in a reduction in mortality with a hazard ratio (HR) of 0.86 (95% CI 0.78 to 0.94).

6441.question: Does intra-uterine insemination (IUI) in a natural cycle improve live birth rates compared to expectant management in a natural cycle for couples with unexplained subfertility?
6441.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 1.60, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.92 to 2.78; 1 RCT, 334 women.

6442.question: Does structural MRI of the hippocampus provide sufficient accuracy as a stand-alone test for early diagnosis of dementia due to Alzheimer's disease in people with MCI?
6442.notes: The pooled mean sensitivity and specificity for hippocampal volume were 0.73 and 0.71, respectively, which are not high enough to qualify MRI as a stand-alone test.

6443.question: Does sclerotherapy reduce the incidence of oesophageal variceal bleeding in children with chronic liver disease or portal vein thrombosis?
6443.notes: Oesophageal variceal bleeding occurred in 5% of the sclerotherapy group versus 40% in the control group (RR 0.13, 95% CI 0.04 to 0.42).

6444.question: Is chronic infection with Stenotrophomonas maltophilia an independent predictor of pulmonary exacerbation requiring hospitalization and antibiotics in people with cystic fibrosis?
6444.notes: The abstract states that chronic infection with Stenotrophomonas maltophilia is an independent predictor of pulmonary exacerbation requiring hospitalization and antibiotics.

6445.question: Does hydrocortisone alone suppress 17 OHP and androstenedione levels more effectively than hydrocortisone combined with fludrocortisone at six months?
6445.notes: One trial found that at six months, 17 OHP and androstenedione levels were more suppressed on hydrocortisone alone compared to hydrocortisone with fludrocortisone.

6446.question: Do breathing exercises improve quality of life in asthma patients compared to an inactive control group at three months?
6446.notes: Meta-analysis showed improvement favouring the breathing exercises group at three months (MD 0.42, 95% CI 0.17 to 0.68; 4 studies, 974 participants).

6447.question: Does diaphragm-triggered non-invasive respiratory support reduce the failure of respiratory support modality compared to nasal intermittent positive pressure ventilation in preterm infants?
6447.notes: The risk ratio was 0.33 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.02 to 7.14, indicating no significant difference.

6448.question: Is green tea consumption associated with a reduced incidence of prostate cancer?
6448.notes: Summary RR 0.50 (95% CI 0.18 to 1.36) based on three studies with low-certainty evidence.

6449.question: Does chemoradiotherapy (CRT) prolong overall survival compared to hypofractionated radiotherapy (RT40) in elderly patients with glioblastoma?

6450.question: Does lamotrigine as an add-on treatment reduce seizure frequency in individuals with drug-resistant focal epilepsy?
6450.notes: The overall risk ratio (RR) for 50% or greater reduction in seizure frequency was 1.80 (95% CI 1.45 to 2.23), indicating significant effectiveness.

6451.question: Does convective radiofrequency water vapour thermal therapy improve urologic symptom scores compared to a sham procedure in men with benign prostatic hyperplasia?
6451.notes: Mean difference of -6.9 on the IPSS scale with a 95% CI of -9.06 to -4.74.

6452.question: Do psychological interventions improve the mental health domain of quality of life in people with hemophilia compared to no intervention?
6452.notes: One trial showed improvement in the mental health domain for those receiving the booklet plus DVD compared to booklet alone, MD (4.70, 95% CI 0.33 to 9.07).

6453.question: Do fibrin sealants reduce the incidence of postoperative pancreatic fistula in patients undergoing distal pancreatectomy?
6453.notes: Fibrin sealants may lead to little or no difference in postoperative pancreatic fistula (fibrin sealant 19.3%; control 20.1%; RR 0.96, 95% CI 0.68 to 1.35).

6454.question: Is benzoyl peroxide more effective than placebo or no treatment for improving acne?
6454.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.27, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.12 to 1.45; 3 RCTs; 2234 participants; treatment for 10 to 12 weeks.

6455.question: Is there evidence that transarterial chemoembolisation (TACE) improves median survival compared to no intervention in patients with liver metastases?
6455.notes: Median survival in the TACE group was 10.7 months compared to 9.6 months in the control group, with differences reported as not statistically significant.

6456.question: Does citrate reduce major bleeding compared to unfractionated heparin (UFH) in patients undergoing CRRT?
6456.notes: Citrate probably reduces major bleeding compared to UFH (RR 0.22, 95% CI 0.08 to 0.62).

6457.question: Does cardiorespiratory training improve disability scores in stroke survivors?
6457.notes: Standardised mean difference (SMD) 0.52, 95% CI 0.19 to 0.84; 8 studies, 462 participants.

6458.question: Does TENS provide significant pain relief compared to placebo in individuals with sickle cell disease during pain crises?
6458.notes: The trial reported no difference in pain ratings between TENS and placebo groups at one and four hours post-intervention.

6459.question: Is severe fatigue more prevalent in childhood cancer survivors compared to control groups?
6459.notes: Survivors were more often fatigued than controls, but this difference was statistically significant in only two studies.

6460.question: Does the use of mHealth technologies improve coordination and quality of care among health workers?
6460.notes: Health workers appreciated being more connected to colleagues, which they thought improved coordination and quality of care.

6461.question: Is there evidence supporting the effectiveness of occlusion therapy for stimulus deprivation amblyopia?
6461.notes: The abstract states that no trials met the inclusion criteria, indicating a lack of evidence from RCTs or quasi-randomized trials.

6462.question: Does vitamin A supplementation increase the risk of lung cancer incidence and mortality in smokers or asbestos workers?
6462.notes: Vitamin A increases lung cancer incidence (RR 1.10, 95% CI 1.01 to 1.20) and mortality (RR 1.18, 95% CI 1.01 to 1.38) in smokers or asbestos workers.

6463.question: Does routine calcitonin testing effectively identify medullary thyroid carcinoma (MTC) in patients with thyroid nodules?
6463.notes: Despite high sensitivity and specificity, the low prevalence of MTC results in a low positive predictive value (PPV) for basal calcitonin testing.

6464.question: Does nasogastric feeding reduce mortality compared to nasojejunal feeding in severe acute pancreatitis?
6464.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.65, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.36 to 1.17; very low-certainty evidence due to indirectness and imprecision.

6465.question: Do probiotics induce clinical remission in active ulcerative colitis when compared to placebo?
6465.notes: RR 1.73, 95% CI 1.19 to 2.54; 9 studies, 594 participants; low-certainty evidence.

6466.question: Does the administration of postnatal corticosteroids reduce the need for nasal continuous positive airway pressure in infants with transient tachypnoea of the newborn?
6466.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.27, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.65 to 2.51; based on one study with 49 participants.

6467.question: Does oxidised regenerated cellulose reduce the incidence of re-formed adhesions compared to no treatment at laparotomy?
6467.notes: OR 0.38, 95% CI 0.27 to 0.55, 6 RCTs, 554 participants; I² = 41%

6468.question: Does manualized AA/TSF improve rates of continuous abstinence at 12 months compared to other clinical interventions?
6468.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.21, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.03 to 1.42; 2 studies, 1936 participants

6469.question: Does non-invasive respiratory support reduce the need for mechanical ventilation in newborns with transient tachypnea?
6469.notes: The use of CPAP versus free oxygen did not improve the need for mechanical ventilation (RR 0.30, 95% CI 0.01 to 6.99).

6470.question: Does zinc supplementation improve weight-for-age and weight-for-length Z-scores in infants compared to placebo?
6470.notes: Zinc supplementation showed a positive effect on WAZ (SMD 0.16, 95% CI 0.03 to 0.29) and WLZ (SMD 0.15, 95% CI 0.02 to 0.28) in infants.

6471.question: Does low-dose aspirin reduce the incidence of dementia in older adults without a history of dementia, cardiovascular disease, or physical disability?

6472.question: Does antibiotic prophylaxis reduce the risk of all types of postoperative wound infections in herniorrhaphy surgery?
6472.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.86, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.56 to 1.33; 5 studies, 1865 participants.

6473.question: Is there evidence that gene therapy is effective in treating haemophilia compared to standard treatment?
6473.notes: No trials matching the inclusion criteria were identified, so the efficacy of gene therapy cannot be determined.

6474.question: Does bupropion increase long-term smoking cessation rates compared to placebo?
6474.notes: Bupropion increased long-term smoking cessation rates with a risk ratio of 1.64 (95% CI 1.52 to 1.77).

6475.question: Is the MMR vaccine effective in preventing measles after one dose?
6475.notes: Effectiveness is 95% after one dose (RR 0.05, 95% CI 0.02 to 0.13; 7 cohort studies; 12,039 children).

6476.question: Does taxing sugar-added foods lead to a reduction in their consumption?
6476.notes: The study reported a 4.0% decrease in the consumption of taxed sugar-added foods (SMD -0.040, 95% CI -0.07 to -0.01).

6477.question: Does electroacupuncture improve fatigue in IBD patients compared to no treatment?
6477.notes: Electroacupuncture showed an improvement in FACIT-F scores at week eight with a mean difference of 8.00 points (95% CI 6.45 to 9.55).

6478.question: Is vitamin C supplementation associated with a reduction in the incidence of pneumonia?
6478.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.46, 95% CI 0.06 to 3.61; very low-quality evidence

6479.question: Do epidural corticosteroid injections slightly reduce leg pain at short-term follow-up in people with lumbosacral radicular pain?
6479.notes: Mean difference (MD) -4.93, 95% confidence interval (CI) -8.77 to -1.09 on a 0 to 100 scale; 8 trials, n = 949.

6480.question: Is a single dose of albendazole as effective as multiple doses of albendazole for treating Ascaris lumbricoides infection?
6480.notes: Illustrative cure of 93.2% with single dose, 94.3% with multiple doses; RR 0.98, 95% CI 0.92 to 1.05

6481.question: Are NSAIDs more effective than placebo for short-term pain reduction in acute low back pain?
6481.notes: Mean difference (MD) -7.29, 95% confidence interval (CI) -10.98 to -3.61; 4 RCTs, N = 815

6482.question: Does liposomal amphotericin B have higher clinical success rates compared to deoxycholate amphotericin B for induction therapy in PDH?

6483.question: Is the use of antiepileptic drugs (AEDs) effective in preventing early seizures following craniotomy?
6483.notes: Two trials reported a statistically significant advantage for AED treatment compared to controls for early seizure occurrence.

6484.question: Does the use of indocyanine green fluorescence angiography (ICGA) reduce the rate of mastectomy skin flap necrosis (MSFN) compared to clinical evaluation alone on a per breast basis?
6484.notes: ICGA may reduce MSFN with a relative risk of 0.62 (95% CI 0.48 to 0.82) based on six studies involving 1435 breasts.

6485.question: Does partial removal of the tonsils result in a faster return to normal activity compared to total removal in children with obstructive sleep-disordered breathing?
6485.notes: Children who underwent tonsillotomy returned to normal activity four days earlier (MD 3.84 days, 95% CI 0.23 to 7.44).

6486.question: Is normal saline as effective as heparin in preventing occlusion in long-term central venous catheters in infants and children?
6486.notes: The estimated RR for CVC occlusion was 0.75 (95% CI 0.10 to 5.51), indicating very low certainty evidence.

6487.question: Is there a clinically important benefit in pain reduction when comparing conventional stemmed total shoulder replacement (TSR) to stemmed humeral hemiarthroplasty in patients with osteoarthritis?
6487.notes: Low-quality evidence suggests a small but clinically uncertain improvement in pain.

6488.question: Is there evidence supporting the use of EEG in children under five with complex febrile seizures?
6488.notes: No RCTs were found to support or refute the use of EEG in this context.

6489.question: Does the use of antimetabolites improve functional success in DCR beyond six months?

6490.question: Is talc slurry more effective than bleomycin in reducing pleurodesis failure rates?
6490.notes: Talc slurry has a lower pleurodesis failure rate compared to bleomycin (OR 2.24, 95% Cr-I 1.10 to 4.68).

6491.question: Does vaginal cleansing with antiseptic solutions before cesarean delivery reduce the incidence of post-cesarean endometritis?
6491.notes: Vaginal cleansing reduced endometritis from 7.1% to 3.1% (aRR 0.41, 95% CI 0.29 to 0.58).

6492.question: Does simulated presence therapy (SPT) effectively reduce behavioural and psychological symptoms in people with dementia compared to usual care?
6492.notes: The evidence was very uncertain due to small participant numbers and high risk of bias.

6493.question: Are there any established guidelines for the use of drugs to ease breathlessness in cystic fibrosis patients?
6493.notes: The abstract states that no definite guidelines are available for the use of drugs to ease breathlessness in cystic fibrosis.

6494.question: Does agricultural education aimed at changing post-harvest practices reduce the proportion of underweight infants in LMICs?
6494.notes: The intervention may reduce the proportion of underweight infants by 6.7% (95% CI -12.6 to -1.4).

6495.question: Does using a transverse groin incision reduce the risk of surgical wound infection compared to a vertical groin incision in the 10- to 28-day period following surgery?
6495.notes: Risk ratio [RR] 0.25, 95% confidence interval [CI] 0.08 to 0.76; low-certainty evidence due to high risk of bias and small sample size.

6496.question: Does clear communication about IPC guidelines improve healthcare workers' adherence to these guidelines?
6496.notes: Healthcare workers emphasized the importance of clear communication about IPC guidelines.

6497.question: Is there a difference in uncorrected visual acuity between LASIK with a mechanical microkeratome and LASIK with a femtosecond laser at 12 months?

6498.question: Does omega-3 supplementation reduce the number of pulmonary exacerbations in people with cystic fibrosis?
6498.notes: One study reported a reduction in pulmonary exacerbations, but the evidence quality is very low, and no control data was provided.

6499.question: Does the use of spectacles in infants and children with hyperopia reduce the risk of developing strabismus?
6499.notes: The risk ratio for strabismus incidence was 0.65 (95% CI 0.41 to 1.02), but the evidence is of very low confidence due to high risk of bias, inconsistency, and imprecision.

6500.question: Is hand cleaning with ash associated with a reduced rate of hospital contacts for moderate-to-severe diarrhoea in children compared to using soap?
6500.notes: RR 0.97, 95% CI 0.84 to 1.11; very low-certainty evidence

6501.question: Does sildenafil make a difference in reducing the frequency of stuttering priapism in individuals with sickle cell disease?
6501.notes: The evidence suggests that sildenafil may make little or no difference in reducing the frequency of stuttering priapism.

6502.question: Does tafamidis reduce the progression of peripheral neuropathy more than placebo in early-stage TTR-FAP?

6503.question: Does calcium alone improve the healing of nutritional rickets compared to vitamin D alone in children?
6503.notes: Calcium alone improved healing of rickets at 24 weeks' follow-up (RR 3.26, 95% CI 1.59 to 6.69).

6504.question: Do interventions focused on the vector during the pre-event phase result in a reduction of overall aggression compared to practice as usual?
6504.notes: Short-term risk assessment showed a decreased incidence of aggression (RR 0.36, 95% CI 0.16 to 0.78).

6505.question: Does the use of a powered, air-purifying respirator with coverall provide better protection against contamination compared to an N95 mask and gown?

6506.question: Does organised inpatient (stroke unit) care improve the odds of survival and independence compared to general ward care for stroke patients?
6506.notes: Organised inpatient care was associated with improved outcomes, including survival and independence, with an odds ratio of 0.77 for poor outcomes.

6507.question: Does late commencement of parenteral nutrition reduce in-hospital all-cause mortality in critically ill term infants?

6508.question: Are there existing evidence-based guidelines for treating Burkholderia cepacia complex infections in cystic fibrosis patients?
6508.notes: The abstract states that evidence-based guidelines for Pseudomonas aeruginosa cannot be extended to Burkholderia cepacia complex infections.

6509.question: Is clonidine effective in reducing procedural or postoperative pain in neonates?
6509.notes: No completed studies met the inclusion criteria to assess clonidine's effectiveness in this context.

6510.question: Do behavioural interventions lead to a clinically meaningful increase in CPAP device usage compared to usual care?
6510.notes: Behavioural interventions increase device usage by 1.31 hours/night (95% CI 0.95 to 1.66).

6511.question: Does quarantine alone significantly reduce the incidence and mortality of COVID-19 compared to no measures?
6511.notes: Modelling studies reported a reduction of 44% to 81% in incident cases and 31% to 63% in deaths.

6512.question: Is clonazepam effective as an add-on therapy for drug-resistant epilepsy in adults and children?
6512.notes: No double-blind randomized controlled trials were found to support or refute the efficacy of clonazepam as an add-on therapy.

6513.question: Do long-term red blood cell transfusions reduce the incidence of silent cerebral infarcts in children with abnormal transcranial doppler velocities?

6514.question: Does anticoagulation with a vitamin K antagonist reduce the risk of recurrent venous thromboembolism compared to no anticoagulation in patients with distal DVT?

6515.question: Does rituximab, when combined with calcineurin inhibitors and prednisolone, reduce the number of children who relapse at six months compared to CNI and prednisolone alone?
6515.notes: Rituximab reduces relapses at six months (RR 0.23, 95% CI 0.12 to 0.43).

6516.question: Does the use of low molecular weight heparin (LMWH) improve the success rate of digital replantation compared to unfractionated heparin (UFH)?
6516.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.98, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.87 to 1.10; very low-certainty evidence

6517.question: Does high-intensity interval exercise training improve physical activity levels in people with COPD?
6517.notes: Improvement of 6 minutes per day in MVPA (95% CI 4 to 8; 2 studies, 275 participants).

6518.question: Are oscillating devices more effective than other forms of physiotherapy in managing airway secretions in people with cystic fibrosis?
6518.notes: There was no clear evidence that oscillation was a more or less effective intervention overall than other forms of physiotherapy.

6519.question: Does moderate-intensity aerobic exercise reduce the number of acute respiratory infection episodes per person per year?
6519.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.00, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.77 to 1.30; 4 trials; 514 participants

6520.question: Does nocturnal supervision reduce the incidence of SUDEP in people with epilepsy?
6520.notes: Two case-control studies reported a protective effect with unadjusted ORs of 0.34 (95% CI 0.22 to 0.53) and 0.08 (95% CI 0.02 to 0.27).

6521.question: Do patient-initiated appointment systems reduce anxiety compared to consultant-led appointment systems for patients with chronic conditions?
6521.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 0.87, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.68 to 1.12; 5 studies, 1019 participants

6522.question: Does rinse-free hand washing reduce absenteeism due to any illness compared to no rinse-free hand washing?
6522.notes: The pooled IRR was 0.82 (95% CI 0.69 to 0.97), indicating a reduction in absenteeism from 16 to 13 days per 1000.

6523.question: Do subcuticular sutures improve patient satisfaction compared to transdermal sutures in non-obstetric surgery?
6523.notes: Subcuticular sutures probably improve patient satisfaction (MD 1.60, 95% CI 1.32 to 1.88; 290 participants).

6524.question: Does the Ponseti technique improve foot alignment more effectively than the Kite technique in initial presentations of CTEV?
6524.notes: The Ponseti technique showed a mean difference of -1.15 in the Pirani score compared to the Kite technique (95% CI -1.32 to -0.98).

6525.question: Is the use of non-nutritive sweeteners associated with a clinically significant change in HbA1c levels compared to sugar in people with diabetes?
6525.notes: HbA1c was 0.4% higher in the NNS group with a 95% CI of -0.5 to 1.2, indicating no significant difference.

6526.question: Do oral protein-based nutritional supplements lead to a higher mean change in serum albumin in patients with CKD on dialysis?
6526.notes: Mean difference of 0.19 g/dL with a 95% CI of 0.05 to 0.33.

6527.question: Do pharmacological galactagogues increase milk volume in breastfeeding mothers?
6527.notes: Pharmacological galactagogues may increase milk volume (MD 63.82 mL, 95% CI 25.91 to 101.72; 3 studies, 151 participants).

6528.question: Does the use of a powered, air-purifying respirator with coverall provide better protection against contamination compared to an N95 mask and gown?

6529.question: Does adding levofloxacin to standard treatment improve all-cause mortality compared to standard treatment alone for infective endocarditis?

6530.question: Is there sufficient evidence to support the use of sertraline for treating sexual dysfunction following stroke?
6530.notes: The RCTs identified were small and of low quality, and data are insufficient to provide reliable indications of benefit.

6531.question: Is adalimumab effective in maintaining clinical remission in people with quiescent Crohn's disease compared to placebo?
6531.notes: 59% of participants treated with adalimumab failed to maintain clinical remission compared to 86% with placebo (RR 0.70, 95% CI 0.64 to 0.77).

6532.question: Is intravenous iloprost more effective than aspirin for healing ischaemic ulcers in Buerger's disease?
6532.notes: Intravenous iloprost improved ulcer healing with a risk ratio of 2.65 (95% CI 1.15 to 6.11).

6533.question: Does growth hormone therapy improve height velocity in children with thalassaemia compared to standard care?
6533.notes: Height velocity improved with a mean difference of 2.28 cm/year (95% CI 1.76 to 2.80).

6534.question: Does azelaic acid provide a better treatment response compared to benzoyl peroxide for acne?
6534.notes: Azelaic acid is probably less effective than benzoyl peroxide (RR 0.82, 95% CI 0.72 to 0.95; 1 study, 351 participants).

6535.question: Does convalescent plasma therapy reduce mortality in patients with COVID-19?
6535.notes: All participants were alive at the end of the reporting period, but the certainty of evidence is very low, and the effect on mortality is unclear.

6536.question: Does alarm therapy reduce the number of wet nights per week compared to no treatment in children with enuresis?

6537.question: Do corticosteroids increase the likelihood of complete resolution of sore throat pain at 24 hours?
6537.notes: Corticosteroids increased the likelihood of complete resolution of pain at 24 hours by 2.40 times (RR 2.4, 95% CI 1.29 to 4.47).

6538.question: Does vitamin D supplementation lead to higher serum 25(OH)D levels in individuals with sickle cell disease?
6538.notes: Vitamin D supplementation probably led to higher serum 25(OH)D levels at various time points with moderate-quality evidence.

6539.question: Does supplementation with polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFAs) compared to monounsaturated fatty acids (MUFAs) influence the relapse rate in individuals with multiple sclerosis?
6539.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.02, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.88 to 1.20; 3 studies, 217 participants.

6540.question: Is the limbal anterior chamber depth (LACD) test associated with high sensitivity and specificity for detecting occludable angles in high-risk populations?

6541.question: Do physical activity interventions improve aerobic fitness in individuals with non-advanced colorectal cancer?
6541.notes: Positive effects on aerobic fitness were observed with a standardised mean difference of 0.82 (95% CI 0.34 to 1.29).

6542.question: Does postoperative radiotherapy improve overall survival in adults with high-grade glioma compared to supportive care?
6542.notes: The overall hazard ratio for survival was 2.01 favoring postoperative radiotherapy (95% CI 1.58 to 2.55).

6543.question: Does Avatar Therapy improve insight compared to treatment as usual for people with schizophrenia?
6543.notes: Revised Beliefs about Voices Questionnaire (BAVQ-R) showed an effect in favor of Avatar Therapy (MD -5.97, 95% CI -10.98 to -0.96).

6544.question: Does treatment with inhaled dry powder mannitol improve lung function in people with cystic fibrosis compared to control?
6544.notes: Pooled evidence from two large parallel studies showed significant improvement in lung function (FEV1) in the mannitol group compared to control.

6545.question: Does psychotherapy reduce BPD symptom severity compared to treatment-as-usual (TAU)?
6545.notes: Psychotherapy reduced BPD symptom severity with a standardised mean difference (SMD) of -0.52, 95% CI -0.70 to -0.33.

6546.question: Does antenatal pelvic floor muscle training (PFMT) in continent pregnant women reduce the risk of urinary incontinence (UI) in late pregnancy?
6546.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.38, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.20 to 0.72; 6 trials, 624 women

6547.question: Do video calls help reduce loneliness in older adults compared to usual care?
6547.notes: The evidence suggests little to no difference in loneliness scores at three, six, and twelve months.

6548.question: Does the combination of heparin and aspirin increase the live birth rate compared to aspirin alone in women with persistent antiphospholipid antibodies?
6548.notes: Heparin plus aspirin may increase the number of live births (RR 1.27, 95% CI 1.09 to 1.49, 5 studies, 1295 women).

6549.question: Is silicone oil more effective than SF6 gas for macular attachment at two years?
6549.notes: Silicone oil showed more favorable outcomes for macular attachment compared to SF6 at two years (58% versus 79%; RR 1.37; 95% CI 1.01 to 1.86).

6550.question: Do pharmacological interventions reduce the incidence of diagnosable depression after stroke compared to placebo?

6551.question: Is there evidence from randomized trials comparing the effectiveness of endotherapies versus surgery in treating early neoplasia in Barrett's oesophagus?
6551.notes: The abstract states that no RCTs were identified that met the inclusion criteria for comparing endotherapies with surgery.

6552.question: Is there evidence that intravenous diazepam followed by glucagon is more effective than placebo in achieving disimpaction of a soft food bolus in the oesophagus?
6552.notes: The study showed similar disimpaction rates for active treatment and placebo (38% vs 32%; risk ratio 1.19, 95% CI 0.51 to 2.75).

6553.question: Does the combination of salt bath and UVB light improve psoriasis more than UVB light treatment alone?
6553.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.71, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.24 to 2.35; based on low-certainty evidence from two studies.

6554.question: Is the presence of asymptomatic disease-free impacted wisdom teeth associated with an increased risk of periodontitis affecting the adjacent second molar in the long term?
6554.notes: The prospective cohort study suggests an association, but the evidence is of very low certainty.

6555.question: Do PDE₄ inhibitors provide a clinically significant improvement in lung function for COPD patients?
6555.notes: The mean difference in FEV₁ was 49.33 mL, which is below the minimally important difference of 100 mL.

6556.question: Does the addition of anti-EGFR therapy improve overall survival in first-line treatment of glioblastoma?
6556.notes: Hazard ratio (HR) 0.89, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.76 to 1.04; 3 RCTs, 1000 participants

6557.question: Does the desire to protect unborn babies influence pregnant women's use of NRT or e-cigarettes?
6557.notes: Women's desire to protect their unborn babies from harm is a key determinant of NRT and e-cigarette use.

6558.question: Does promoting the administration of antenatal corticosteroids (ACS) in low-resource settings increase the risk of perinatal death?
6558.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.11, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.04 to 1.19; 1 study; n = 100,705

6559.question: Does reducing saturated fat intake reduce the risk of combined cardiovascular events?

6560.question: Does in-bag morcellation reduce the risk of intraoperative complications compared to uncontained power morcellation during laparoscopic myomectomy?
6560.notes: No intraoperative complications were reported in either group, and the evidence quality is very low.

6561.question: Does the use of low-molecular-weight heparin (LMWH) reduce the incidence of symptomatic deep vein thrombosis (DVT) in patients undergoing knee arthroscopy?
6561.notes: LMWH showed no reduction of the incidence of symptomatic DVT (RR 0.61, 95% CI 0.18 to 2.03; 1848 participants; 4 studies).

6562.question: Does screening for type 2 diabetes mellitus lead to a reduction in all-cause mortality compared to no screening?
6562.notes: The hazard ratio for all-cause mortality was 1.06 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.90 to 1.25, indicating no clear difference.

6563.question: Is there evidence that EDTA chelation therapy reduces all-cause mortality in patients with coronary artery disease compared to placebo?

6564.question: Does choosing antibiotics based on combination antimicrobial susceptibility testing improve the time until the next pulmonary exacerbation in people with cystic fibrosis infected with Pseudomonas aeruginosa?
6564.notes: The hazard ratio for time until next exacerbation was 0.82, favoring the control group, with a 95% confidence interval of 0.44 to 1.51 (P = 0.52).

6565.question: Do anti-inflammatory medications reduce the risk of major cardiovascular events in patients with a history of ischaemic stroke or TIA?
6565.notes: No studies met the inclusion criteria to assess this question.

6566.question: Do child-feeding practices have a positive effect on increasing vegetable consumption in children aged five years and under?
6566.notes: Child-feeding practices may have a small positive effect on vegetable consumption, equivalent to an increase of 5.30 grams (SMD 0.50, 95% CI 0.29 to 0.71).

6567.question: Is there evidence to support the use of artificial corneas over donor corneas for individuals who have failed previous corneal transplantations?
6567.notes: No randomized controlled trials or controlled clinical trials were identified to compare the effectiveness of artificial versus donor corneas.

6568.question: Does stiripentol as an add-on treatment lead to a 50% or greater reduction in seizure frequency for drug-resistant focal epilepsy?

6569.question: Does mental practice (MP) in addition to other treatment improve upper extremity activity compared to the other treatment alone for individuals post-stroke?
6569.notes: SMD 0.66, 95% CI 0.39 to 0.94; I² = 39%; 15 studies; 397 participants

6570.question: Can early detection of hypertension through screening reduce morbidity and mortality?
6570.notes: The abstract states that the assumption of early detection reducing morbidity and mortality has not been tested in rigorous research studies.

6571.question: Is the monthly injection regimen more effective in improving best-corrected visual acuity (BCVA) compared to the standard PRN regimen for newly diagnosed nAMD patients?
6571.notes: The mean difference in BCVA change at one year for the standard PRN subgroup was -1.7 letters (95% CI -2.8 to -0.6), favoring monthly injections.

6572.question: Does negative pressure wound therapy (NPWT) reduce the incidence of surgical site infections compared to standard dressings?
6572.notes: NPWT probably results in fewer SSIs (8.8% vs. 13.0%; RR 0.66, 95% CI 0.55 to 0.80).

6573.question: Do behavioural only interventions increase the proportion of older adults who adhere to their prescribed medications compared to usual care?

6574.question: Does discontinuing antihypertensive medications in older adults increase the risk of all-cause mortality compared to continuation?
6574.notes: The odds for all-cause mortality were 2.08 (95% CI 0.79 to 5.46), indicating low certainty of evidence.

6575.question: Is tea tree oil effective in reducing the number of Demodex mites in the short term?
6575.notes: The mean difference was 0.70 with a 95% CI of 0.24 to 1.16, indicating uncertainty about the effectiveness.

6576.question: Is there evidence that DHA supplementation slows the progression of visual field sensitivity loss in patients with retinitis pigmentosa?
6576.notes: One trial found that the annual rate of change of visual field sensitivity over four years favored the DHA group in foveal, macular, peripheral, and total visual field sensitivity.

6577.question: Is there evidence that antibiotic treatment improves lung function in individuals with cystic fibrosis suffering from nontuberculous mycobacteria lung infections?
6577.notes: The review did not find any evidence for the effectiveness of different antimicrobial treatments.

6578.question: Does the F1RDT-IPM test have high sensitivity for diagnosing pneumonic plague when performed in sputum?
6578.notes: Pooled sensitivity against culture was 100% (95% CI 0 to 100; 2 studies, 56 participants).

6579.question: Does chlorhexidine gluconate reduce the incidence of surgical site infection compared to povidone iodine in women undergoing caesarean section?
6579.notes: Moderate-certainty evidence suggests chlorhexidine gluconate probably slightly reduces the incidence of surgical site infection (RR 0.72, 95% CI 0.58 to 0.91; 8 trials, 4323 women).

6580.question: Do mechanical assist devices improve 30-day survival in people with acute cardiogenic shock?
6580.notes: The meta-analysis showed a risk ratio of 1.01 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.76 to 1.35, indicating no significant effect on 30-day survival.

6581.question: Does negative pressure wound therapy (NPWT) reduce the incidence of surgical site infections compared to standard dressings in wounds healing by primary closure?
6581.notes: Moderate-certainty evidence suggests NPWT results in fewer SSIs (8.8% vs. 13.0% with standard dressings; RR 0.66, 95% CI 0.55 to 0.80).

6582.question: Is there a difference in the incidence of treatment failure between standard valves and anti-syphon valves in patients with hydrocephalus?
6582.notes: The certainty of the evidence is very low, making it difficult to draw definitive conclusions.

6583.question: Are there any established interventions for treating intrahepatic cholestasis in people with sickle cell disease?
6583.notes: No randomized controlled trials were identified to establish treatment interventions.

6584.question: Does the implantation of trifocal IOL improve uncorrected intermediate visual acuity compared to bifocal IOL at one year?

6585.question: Do probiotics reduce the risk of hypertensive disorders in pregnant women with gestational diabetes mellitus?
6585.notes: The risk ratio was 1.50 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.64 to 3.53, indicating uncertainty with low-certainty evidence.

6586.question: Does low molecular weight heparin (LMWH) prophylaxis reduce the incidence of CVC-related thrombosis in children compared to low-dose unfractionated heparin (UFH)?

6587.question: Does feeding preterm infants with multi-nutrient fortified human milk increase in-hospital growth rates compared to unfortified human milk?
6587.notes: Meta-analyses showed increases in weight gain (MD 1.76 g/kg/d), body length (MD 0.11 cm/week), and head circumference (MD 0.06 cm/week).

6588.question: Does metformin monotherapy reduce all-cause mortality compared to sulphonylureas in adults with T2DM?
6588.notes: In one trial, 2.1% in the metformin group died compared to 2.2% in the sulphonylurea group.

6589.question: Does newborn screening for galactosaemia prevent or reduce mortality and morbidity in affected neonates?
6589.notes: No randomized controlled studies were found to support this claim, although uncontrolled studies suggest efficacy.

6590.question: Are antibody tests likely to be useful for detecting previous SARS-CoV-2 infection if used 15 or more days after the onset of symptoms?
