6911.notes: One trial found increased extent of resection with iMRI (RR for incomplete resection was 0.13, 95% CI 0.02 to 0.96).

6912.question: Does the combination of bevacizumab and lomustine improve overall survival compared to lomustine monotherapy in the treatment of first recurrence of glioblastoma?

6913.question: Does IR methylphenidate reduce symptoms of ADHD in adults when compared to placebo?
6913.notes: The evidence is uncertain and of very low certainty, with conflicting results between investigator-rated and participant-rated scales.

6914.question: Is optical coherence tomography (OCT) more sensitive than near-infrared (NIR) and fibre-optic devices in detecting enamel caries?
6914.notes: OCT sensitivity: 0.94 (95% CI 0.88 to 0.97), NIR sensitivity: 0.58 (95% CI 0.46 to 0.68), FOTI/DIFOTI sensitivity: 0.47 (95% CI 0.35 to 0.59)

6915.question: Does a single dose of NSAIDs provide more adequate pain relief at four hours compared to placebo for women with acute postpartum perineal pain?
6915.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.91, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.64 to 2.23; 10 studies, 1573 women.

6916.question: Does Xpert Ultra have higher sensitivity than Xpert MTB/RIF for detecting tuberculous meningitis?
6916.notes: Xpert Ultra sensitivity is 89.4% compared to Xpert MTB/RIF's 71.1%.

6917.question: Does the use of macrolides reduce the frequency of exacerbations in COPD patients compared to placebo?
6917.notes: Macrolides had a hazard ratio of 0.67 (95% CrI 0.60 to 0.75) compared to placebo, indicating a reduction in exacerbations.

6918.question: Does antibiotic therapy reduce the risk of treatment failure in children aged 2 to 59 months with WHO-defined non-severe pneumonia and wheeze?
6918.notes: Antibiotic therapy may result in a reduction of treatment failure by 20% (RR 0.80, 95% CI 0.68 to 0.94).

6919.question: Does bethanechol reduce post-void residual urine volume compared to placebo one month after radical hysterectomy?
6919.notes: Mean difference (MD) -37.4 mL, 95% confidence interval (CI) -60.35 to -14.45; one study, 39 participants.

6920.question: Is there evidence that newer generation antidepressants reduce the repetition of self-harm compared to placebo?
6920.notes: Odds Ratio (OR) 0.59, 95% Confidence Interval (CI) 0.29 to 1.19; N = 129; k = 2

6921.question: Does extended lymphadenectomy improve overall survival compared to standard lymphadenectomy in patients with pancreatic head and periampullary adenocarcinoma?

6922.question: Does atorvastatin reduce total testosterone levels in males with normal lipid profiles or mild dyslipidaemia?

6923.question: Does the use of naltrexone/bupropion reduce all-cause or cardiovascular mortality in adults with hypertension?
6923.notes: The trial showed no differences in all-cause or cardiovascular mortality between naltrexone/bupropion and placebo.

6924.question: Do remotely delivered interventions including support, training, or both, with or without information, help reduce caregiver burden compared to usual treatment, waiting list, or attention control?
6924.notes: Standardised mean difference (SMD) -0.06, 95% confidence interval (CI) -0.35 to 0.23

6925.question: Does pay-for-performance (P4P) improve child immunisation rates compared to existing payment methods in outpatient healthcare settings?
6925.notes: P4P incentives probably improve child immunisation status (RR 1.27, 95% CI 1.19 to 1.36; 3760 patients).

6926.question: Does tyrosine supplementation improve intelligence, neuropsychological performance, growth, nutritional status, mortality rate, or quality of life in individuals with phenylketonuria?
6926.notes: No significant differences were found between any of the outcomes measured, except for blood tyrosine concentrations.

6927.question: Is ethosuximide more effective than lamotrigine in achieving seizure freedom at 12 months for children with newly diagnosed childhood absence epilepsy?
6927.notes: Ethosuximide showed a higher seizure freedom rate (45%) compared to lamotrigine (21%) at 12 months.

6928.question: Does the combination of topical and systemic antibiotic prophylaxis reduce overall mortality in patients receiving mechanical ventilation for at least 48 hours?
6928.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.84, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.73 to 0.96; 18 studies; 5290 participants.

6929.question: Does arginine butyrate reduce ulcer size compared to standard care alone in people with sickle cell disease?
6929.notes: The mean reduction was -5.10 cm² (95% CI -9.65 to -0.55), but the certainty of the evidence is very low.

6930.question: Does telerehabilitation achieve similar exercise capacity outcomes as traditional in-person pulmonary rehabilitation for primary pulmonary rehabilitation?
6930.notes: Mean difference (MD) 0.06 metres (m), 95% confidence interval (CI) -10.82 m to 10.94 m; 556 participants; four studies.

6931.question: Does thrombolysis (with or without additional clot removal strategies) result in more frequent complete clot lysis compared to standard anticoagulation in the early and intermediate follow-up periods?
6931.notes: Early follow-up RR 4.75 (95% CI 1.83 to 12.33); Intermediate follow-up RR 2.42 (95% CI 1.42 to 4.12)

6932.question: Is there evidence that electrocoagulation alone reduces all-cause mortality compared to the control group in patients with liver metastases?
6932.notes: The risk ratio for mortality in the electrocoagulation alone group versus the control group was 0.98 (95% CI 0.94 to 1.03), indicating no difference.

6933.question: Is atovaquone-proguanil associated with higher treatment failure rates compared to artesunate-amodiaquine in treating uncomplicated Plasmodium falciparum malaria?
6933.notes: PCR-adjusted treatment failures at day 28: 9.4% with atovaquone-proguanil compared to 2.9% with artesunate-amodiaquine; RR 3.19, 95% CI 0.67 to 15.22.

6934.question: Does screening of windows and doors reduce clinical malaria incidence caused by Plasmodium falciparum?
6934.notes: Rate ratio 0.38, 95% CI 0.18 to 0.82; Ethiopian study

6935.question: Does using 1% w/v triclosan reduce the incidence of suspected infection compared to 4% chlorhexidine gluconate in neonates?
6935.notes: The study suggests a potential reduction, but the evidence is very uncertain (RR 1.04, 95% CI 0.19 to 5.60).

6936.question: Are beta-blockers beneficial for primary prophylaxis of oesophageal variceal bleeding in children with chronic liver disease or portal vein thrombosis?
6936.notes: No randomised clinical trials were found to assess the benefits of beta-blockers for this purpose.

6937.question: Does intermittent fasting lead to a clinically significant reduction in body weight compared to ad libitum feeding in the short term?
6937.notes: Body weight was reduced with IF compared to ad libitum feeding in the short term (MD -2.88 kg, 95% CI -3.96 to -1.80), but this was not deemed clinically significant.

6938.question: Does the provision of counselling increase quit rates for smoking cessation?
6938.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 1.44, 95% credibility interval (CrI) 1.22 to 1.70, 194 studies, n = 72,273

6939.question: Does hand-washing promotion in child day-care centres or schools in high-income countries reduce diarrhoea episodes by about one-third?

6940.question: Is gabapentin effective in reducing seizure frequency by 50% or more when used as an add-on treatment for drug-resistant focal epilepsy?
6940.notes: The overall risk ratio (RR) for reduction in seizure frequency of 50% or more compared to placebo was 1.89 (95% CI 1.40 to 2.55).

6941.question: Does early surgical intervention improve the complete recovery of facial palsy at 12 months compared to no treatment?
6941.notes: The evidence was uncertain with a risk ratio of 0.76 and a wide confidence interval (0.05 to 11.11).

6942.question: Does intravenous ferric carboxymaltose lead to more people having resolution of iron deficiency anaemia compared to intravenous iron sucrose?
6942.notes: Moderate-certainty evidence suggests superiority of intravenous ferric carboxymaltose over intravenous iron sucrose (RR 1.25, 95% CI 1.06 to 1.46, NNTB = 9).

6943.question: Does indomethacin administration reduce the failure of PDA closure within one week in preterm infants with symptomatic PDA?
6943.notes: Indomethacin was associated with a large reduction in failure of PDA closure (RR 0.30, 95% CI 0.23 to 0.38).

6944.question: Do interventions targeting depression in people with comorbidity improve mental health outcomes?
6944.notes: Mental health outcomes improved with high certainty evidence, with a standardized mean difference (SMD) of -0.41 and a 95% confidence interval (CI) of -0.63 to -0.2.

6945.question: Does urgent-start peritoneal dialysis reduce the incidence of catheter-related bacteraemia compared to haemodialysis initiated with a central venous catheter?
6945.notes: RR 0.13, 95% CI 0.04 to 0.41; low certainty evidence

6946.question: Does topical administration of ciprofloxacin increase the resolution of ear discharge compared to systemic administration in patients with CSOM?
6946.notes: Topical administration may slightly increase resolution (RR 1.48, 95% CI 1.24 to 1.76).

6947.question: Is there a difference in the development of type 2 diabetes between atypical and typical antipsychotics in individuals with schizophrenia?
6947.notes: The study showed no difference with a risk ratio of 0.46 and a wide confidence interval (0.03 to 7.05).

6948.question: Is there evidence supporting the use of surgical or endovascular interventions over antithrombotic therapy alone for treating symptomatic cervical artery dissection?
6948.notes: No completed RCTs or CCTs were found to compare these interventions.

6949.question: Do prophylactic antibiotics reduce the risk of postsurgical infectious complications in patients undergoing third molar extractions?
6949.notes: Antibiotics may reduce the risk by approximately 66% (RR 0.34, 95% CI 0.19 to 0.64).

6950.question: Do aldosterone antagonists reduce the risk of all-cause death in people with CKD requiring dialysis?
6950.notes: Aldosterone antagonists probably reduced the risk of death (any cause) with a risk ratio (RR) of 0.45, 95% CI 0.30 to 0.67.

6951.question: Do psychosocial nursing interventions by SBCNs improve general health-related quality of life for women with primary breast cancer compared to standard care?
6951.notes: Eight studies showed small improvements or no difference in effect between nine weeks and 18 months.

6952.question: Does neoadjuvant chemotherapy (NACT) reduce the need for blood transfusion compared to primary debulking surgery (PDS) in women with advanced epithelial ovarian cancer?
6952.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.80; 95% CI 0.64 to 0.99; four studies, 1085 women

6953.question: Is the perception of improvement in heavy menstrual bleeding lower with endometrial resection/ablation compared to open hysterectomy?
6953.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.90, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.84 to 0.95; 2 studies, 247 women.

6954.question: Does percutaneous osteosynthesis provide better patient-rated knee function compared to open surgery at 12 months?
6954.notes: The evidence is very low quality, making us uncertain of any clinically important difference.

6955.question: Is the presence of anosmia or ageusia considered a reliable indicator for COVID-19?
6955.notes: Anosmia or ageusia had high specificity but low sensitivity, with positive likelihood ratios below the threshold for a 'red flag'.

6956.question: Do non-exergames have a less beneficial effect on cognitive functioning compared to cognitive remediation in people with schizophrenia?

6957.question: Is there evidence that antidepressants improve treatment success for Functional Abdominal Pain Disorders in children compared to placebo?
6957.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.17, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.87 to 1.56; low-certainty evidence.

6958.question: Does paravertebral anaesthesia reduce the 24-hour postoperative analgesic requirement compared to general anaesthesia in women undergoing breast cancer surgery?
6958.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 0.07, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.01 to 0.34; 5 studies, 305 participants

6959.question: Does behavioural support provided by dental professionals increase tobacco abstinence rates compared to usual care?
6959.notes: RR 1.86, 95% CI 1.01 to 3.41 for one session; RR 1.90, 95% CI 1.17 to 3.11 for more than one session

6960.question: Does a vegan diet lead to a reduction in total cholesterol levels in the context of primary prevention of cardiovascular disease?
6960.notes: Mean difference (MD) -0.24 mmol/L, 95% confidence interval (CI) -0.36 to -0.12

6961.question: Do antibiotics increase the risk of all-cause mortality in patients with coronary heart disease at maximum follow-up?

6962.question: Does measuring CSF ABeta42 levels help differentiate Alzheimer's disease dementia (ADD) from other dementia subtypes?
6962.notes: Sensitivity and specificity values indicate some ability to differentiate, but the test is imperfect.

6963.question: Does providing adult patients with access to electronic health records (EHRs) alone or with additional functionalities improve patient adherence to the process of monitoring risk factors and preventive services?
6963.notes: Low-quality evidence from two studies suggests slight improvement in adherence.

6964.question: Does critical care telemedicine (CCT) improve access to critical care experts for both hospital staff and family members?
6964.notes: Hospital staff and family members valued having access to critical care experts through CCT.

6965.question: Does a weight-reducing diet lower the necessity of reinstating antihypertensive therapy and severe cardiovascular complications in people with hypertension?

6966.question: Does coenzyme Q10 reduce the risk of all-cause mortality in people with heart failure?

6967.question: Does regulating private health insurance improve the utilisation of healthcare services in for-profit schemes?
6967.notes: The studies included reported on utilisation but the certainty of evidence was assessed as very low.

6968.question: Does belimumab at the FDA-approved dose of 10 mg/kg improve disease activity in SLE patients compared to placebo?
6968.notes: Belimumab showed at least a 4-point improvement in SELENA-SLEDAI score with a risk ratio of 1.33 (95% CI 1.22 to 1.45).

6969.question: Does combination therapy with anticholinergics and alpha-blockers improve urologic symptom scores compared to placebo?

6970.question: Does hydroxychloroquine reduce the risk of death in people infected with COVID-19?
6970.notes: HCQ makes little or no difference to death due to any cause (RR 1.09, 95% CI 0.99 to 1.19; 8208 participants; 9 trials).

6971.question: Do interventions aimed at improving medical students' interpersonal communication skills have a positive effect on overall communication skills when assessed by experts?
6971.notes: Standardised mean difference (SMD) 0.92, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.53 to 1.31; 18 studies, 1356 participants; I² = 90%

6972.question: Does fluid restriction reduce the duration of supplemental oxygen therapy in neonates with transient tachypnea of the newborn?
6972.notes: Mean difference -12.95 hours, 95% CI -32.82 to 6.92; high heterogeneity (I² = 98%).

6973.question: Does pulmonary rehabilitation improve the six-minute walk distance (6MWD) in people with interstitial lung disease (ILD)?
6973.notes: Mean difference of 40.07 metres, 95% confidence interval 32.70 to 47.44; 585 participants.

6974.question: Do skin care interventions during infancy change the risk of developing eczema by one to two years of age?
6974.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.03, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.81 to 1.31; moderate-certainty evidence

6975.question: Are SSRIs more effective than placebo in achieving remission in postnatal depression?
6975.notes: Remission rates were 42% for SSRIs versus 27% for placebo (RR 1.54, 95% CI 0.99 to 2.41).

6976.question: Does salbutamol administration reduce the duration of oxygen therapy in newborns with transient tachypnea?
6976.notes: Mean difference (MD) -19.24 hours, 95% confidence interval (CI) -23.76 to -14.72, but evidence is low certainty.

6977.question: Is ab interno trabecular bypass surgery with Trabectome more effective than trabeculectomy with mitomycin C in achieving medication-free status at 12 months?
6977.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 2.33, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.34 to 16.2; very low-certainty evidence.

6978.question: Is there a difference in cumulative live birth rate between the 'freeze all' strategy and the conventional IVF/ICSI strategy?
6978.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 1.08, 95% CI 0.95 to 1.22; I<sup>2</sup> = 0%; 8 RCTs, 4712 women.

6979.question: Does D-cycloserine improve social interaction impairment in children with ASD compared to placebo?

6980.question: Does Xpert Ultra have higher sensitivity than Xpert MTB/RIF for detecting pulmonary tuberculosis in smear-negative participants?
6980.notes: Pooled sensitivity for Xpert Ultra was 77.5% compared to 60.6% for Xpert MTB/RIF.

6981.question: Does discontinuing cholinesterase inhibitors result in worse cognitive function compared to continuing treatment in the short term?
6981.notes: Standardised mean difference (SMD) -0.42, 95% confidence interval (CI) -0.64 to -0.21; 4 studies.

6982.question: Do psychological interventions improve the proportion of wounds completely healed in people with diabetic foot ulceration compared to standard care?
6982.notes: The evidence is very low-certainty due to serious study limitations, risk of bias, and imprecision.

6983.question: Does feeding preterm infants with high MCT formula improve their short-term growth compared to low MCT formula?
6983.notes: Mean difference in weight gain velocity was -0.21 g/kg/d (95% CI -1.24 to 0.83), indicating little to no difference.

6984.question: Can surgical interventions for infantile nystagmus syndrome (INS) improve visual acuity?
6984.notes: The abstract indicates very uncertain evidence about the effect of interventions on visual acuity.

6985.question: Does the use of a synthetic patch compared to a vein patch significantly reduce the risk of perioperative ipsilateral stroke?
6985.notes: The evidence is very uncertain with an odds ratio of 2.05 (95% CI 0.66 to 6.38).

6986.question: Does the use of a self-instruction manual combined with one-to-one patient training reduce the proportion of at-risk people developing a new pressure ulcer compared to a self-instruction manual alone?
6986.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.40, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.14 to 1.18; evidence downgraded for study limitations and imprecision.

6987.question: Is there evidence that cefadroxil is more effective than flucloxacillin in achieving clinical cure for bacterial folliculitis or boils?
6987.notes: The risk ratio (RR) is 0.90 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 0.70 to 1.16, indicating uncertainty in the difference.

6988.question: Does the integrated community case management (iCCM) strategy increase the coverage of careseeking to an appropriate provider for any iCCM illness?
6988.notes: iCCM probably increases coverage of careseeking by 68% (RR 1.68, 95% CI 1.24 to 2.27; 2 trials, 9853 children).

6989.question: Does walking reduce systolic blood pressure (SBP) in individuals aged 40 years and under?
6989.notes: MD -4.41 mmHg, 95% CI -6.17 to -2.65; 14 studies, n = 491

6990.question: Is there evidence that systemic antibiotics alone are more effective than placebo in resolving ear discharge in CSOM patients?
6990.notes: The evidence is very uncertain with a risk ratio of 8.47 and a wide confidence interval (1.88 to 38.21) from one study with 33 participants.

6991.question: Does donepezil 10 mg improve cognition in people with vascular cognitive impairment?
6991.notes: Mean difference (MD) -2.21 ADAS-Cog points, 95% CI -3.07 to -1.35

6992.question: Does variceal band ligation result in fewer serious adverse events compared to sclerotherapy?

6993.question: Does exercise alone improve lean body mass in adults with cancer cachexia compared to usual care?
6993.notes: MD 6.40 kg, 95% CI -2.30 to 15.10; very low-certainty evidence

6994.question: Does dornase alfa improve lung function compared to placebo in cystic fibrosis patients over a period of one month to two years?
6994.notes: Dornase alfa probably improved FEV1 at one month, three months, six months, and two years.

6995.question: Does assisted hatching improve live birth rates in assisted conception?
6995.notes: The odds ratio for live birth rates with assisted hatching is 1.09 (95% CI 0.92 to 1.29), indicating uncertainty in improvement.

6996.question: Does laser peripheral iridoplasty (LPIp) show any evidence of reducing intraocular pressure (IOP) compared to laser peripheral iridotomy alone?
6996.notes: Mean difference (MD) 0.39 mmHg, 95% confidence interval (CI) -1.07 to 1.85; low-certainty evidence.

6997.question: Do endothelin receptor antagonists improve exercise capacity in patients with pulmonary arterial hypertension compared to placebo?
6997.notes: Participants receiving ERAs could probably walk on average 25.06 m further than those receiving placebo in a 6MWD.

6998.question: Does chloroquine increase the complete clinical response in patients with cutaneous lupus erythematosus compared to placebo at 12 months' follow-up?
6998.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.57, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.95 to 2.61; 1 study, 24 participants.

6999.question: Does tocilizumab reduce all-cause mortality at 28 days compared to standard care alone or placebo in COVID-19 patients?
6999.notes: Tocilizumab reduces all-cause mortality at D28 (RR 0.89, 95% CI 0.82 to 0.97; 8 RCTs, 6363 participants).

7000.question: Does the use of CBCT provide higher sensitivity for detecting early caries compared to analogue or digital radiographs?
7000.notes: CBCT showed superior sensitivity, but its routine use is not justified due to high radiation dose and potential artefacts.

7001.question: Does the use of aqueous oxygen peroxide compared to sterile water improve the complete healing of venous leg ulcers after 12 months?
7001.notes: The risk ratio is 1.88 with a 95% confidence interval of 1.10 to 3.20, but the evidence is of very low certainty due to study limitations and imprecision.

7002.question: Does enteral zinc supplementation decrease all-cause mortality in preterm infants compared to no supplementation?

7003.question: Is there evidence that smooth pins provide better independent mobility compared to fixed angle plates in older adults with intracapsular hip fractures?
7003.notes: Very low-certainty evidence of little or no difference in independent mobility (1 study, 112 participants).

7004.question: Does unfractionated heparin (UFH) increase the risk of major bleeding events in kidney transplant recipients?
7004.notes: UFH may increase the risk of haemorrhagic events compared to placebo (RR 3.33, 95% CI 1.04 to 10.67, P = 0.04).

7005.question: Is Xpert MTB/RIF effective as a screening test for tuberculosis in people living with HIV?
7005.notes: Xpert MTB/RIF pooled sensitivity was 61.8% and specificity was 98.8% in people living with HIV.

7006.question: Does providing high volume feeds improve weight gain during hospital stay for preterm or low birth weight infants?
7006.notes: High volume feeds with fortified human milk or preterm formula showed a mean difference of 2.58 g/kg/day (95% CI 1.41 to 3.76), and with unfortified human milk or term formula showed a mean difference of 6.2 g/kg/day (95% CI 2.71 to 9.69).

7007.question: Does inhalation of dornase alfa after airway clearance techniques significantly improve forced expiratory volume at one second in people with cystic fibrosis?
7007.notes: Inhalation after airway clearance did not significantly change forced expiratory volume at one second.

7008.question: Does the use of oxytocin solution via umbilical vein injection reduce the need for manual removal of the placenta compared to expectant management?
7008.notes: Mean RR 0.73, 95% CI 0.56 to 0.95; 7 studies, n = 546

7009.question: Is methylation-specific polymerase chain reaction (MSP) more prognostic for overall survival than immunohistochemistry (IHC) in glioblastoma patients treated with temozolomide?
7009.notes: MSP is more prognostic than IHC with a ratio of hazard ratios (RHR) of 1.31 (95% CI 1.01 to 1.71).

7010.question: Is problem-solving therapy more effective than treatment as usual in preventing the incidence of depression immediately post-intervention in adults with age-related macular degeneration?
7010.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 0.43, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.20 to 0.95; 194 participants.

7011.question: Do weight loss interventions lead to a reduction in body weight among overweight or obese adults with CKD?
7011.notes: Weight loss interventions may lead to weight loss or reduction in body weight post intervention (MD -3.69 kg, 95% CI -5.82 to -1.57).

7012.question: Does prophylactic penicillin reduce the risk of pneumococcal infection in children with sickle cell disease?
7012.notes: The odds ratio for initiation of penicillin was 0.37 (95% CI 0.16 to 0.86), indicating a significant reduction in risk.

7013.question: Are hypertension, diabetes, and ischaemic heart disease associated with an increased risk of death in people hospitalized with COVID-19?
7013.notes: Hypertension (WMP: 36.1%), diabetes (WMP: 22.1%), and ischaemic heart disease (WMP: 10.5%) are prevalent and associated with increased risk of death.

7014.question: Do electrical conductance devices provide accurate detection and diagnosis of non-cavitated coronal dental caries across different populations?
7014.notes: The evidence base is sparse and judged to be of very low certainty due to risk of bias, imprecision, and inconsistency.

7015.question: Does high-flow nasal cannulae (HFNC) lead to less treatment failure compared to standard oxygen therapy in adults in the ICU?
7015.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.62, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.45 to 0.86; 15 studies, 3044 participants.

7016.question: Does the combination of bevacizumab and chemotherapy reduce the risk of death compared to chemotherapy alone in women with metastatic or recurrent cervical cancer?
7016.notes: Hazard ratio (HR) 0.77, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.62 to 0.95; 1 study, 452 participants.

7017.question: Does zinc supplementation during pregnancy reduce the risk of preterm births?
7017.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.87, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.74 to 1.03; 21 studies, 9851 participants

7018.question: Do psychosocial interventions reduce the frequency of parental alcohol misuse more effectively than comparison conditions at 6-month follow-up?
7018.notes: Mean difference (MD) -0.32, 95% confidence interval (CI) -0.51 to -0.13; 6 studies, 475 participants

7019.question: Do self-sampling kits improve retention in randomized trials?
7019.notes: Self-sampling kits were one of the interventions with moderate-certainty evidence supporting retention.

7020.question: Is fluoxetine more effective than placebo in achieving clinical response for seasonal affective disorder?
7020.notes: The confidence interval includes both potential benefit and no benefit (RR 1.62, 95% CI 0.92 to 2.83).

7021.question: Does terminal complement inhibition with eculizumab reduce the need for dialysis in patients with atypical haemolytic uraemic syndrome?
7021.notes: 70% reduction in the number of patients requiring dialysis after 26 weeks of eculizumab therapy.

7022.question: Do antistaphylococcal cephalosporins and broad spectrum penicillins plus betalactamase inhibitors have similar efficacy in preventing endometritis after caesarean section?
7022.notes: The risk ratio for endometritis was 1.10 with a 95% CI of 0.76 to 1.60, indicating little or no difference.

7023.question: Does insulin detemir reduce the risk of severe hypoglycaemia compared to NPH insulin in people with type 1 diabetes mellitus?

7024.question: Is there evidence that cephalosporins provide better symptom resolution than penicillin in the treatment of GABHS tonsillopharyngitis?
7024.notes: Odds ratio for absence of symptom resolution 0.79, 95% CI 0.55 to 1.12; sensitivity analysis showed different results with OR 0.51, 95% CI 0.27 to 0.97.

7025.question: Does home-based end-of-life care increase the likelihood of dying at home compared to usual care?

7026.question: Does smoking cessation lead to an improvement in anxiety symptoms compared to continuing smoking?
7026.notes: SMD -0.28, 95% CI -0.43 to -0.13; 15 studies, 3141 participants; I² = 69%

7027.question: Does dupilumab improve disease-specific health-related quality of life in patients with chronic rhinosinusitis compared to placebo?
7027.notes: Dupilumab results in a large reduction in the SNOT-22 score (MD -19.61, 95% CI -22.54 to -16.69).

7028.question: Does transepithelial CXL result in a significant difference in maximum keratometry compared to epithelium-off CXL at 12 months or later?
7028.notes: Mean difference (MD) 0.99 diopters (D), 95% CI -0.11 to 2.09; 5 studies; 177 eyes; I² = 41%

7029.question: Do opioids have a significant effect on the Premature Infant Pain Profile (PIPP) Scale in the first 12 hours after infusion?
7029.notes: The evidence is very low-certainty due to limitations in study design, high heterogeneity, and imprecision of estimates.

7030.question: Does SSRI treatment improve self-perceived premature ejaculation symptoms compared to placebo?

7031.question: Does ultrasound estimated fetal weight discordance (EFWD) at a 20% cut-off have high sensitivity in detecting birth weight discordance (BWD) in twin pregnancies?
7031.notes: The sensitivity for a 20% cut-off is 0.51 (95% CI 0.42 to 0.60), indicating low sensitivity.

7032.question: Does dialectical behavior therapy for adolescents (DBT-A) reduce the repetition of self-harm compared to treatment-as-usual or enhanced usual care?
7032.notes: DBT-A showed a lower rate of self-harm repetition (30%) compared to TAU, EUC, or alternative psychotherapy (43%) with an OR of 0.46 (95% CI 0.26 to 0.82).

7033.question: Do travel restrictions effectively reduce COVID-19 cases in the community?
7033.notes: Most studies reported positive effects, but the evidence is of very low certainty.

7034.question: Does adding rituximab to glucocorticoid therapy increase the rate of complete haematological response at 12 months in patients with warm AIHA?

7035.question: Does immediate surgery for mild symptomatic epiretinal membrane result in a significant improvement in visual acuity compared to watchful waiting at 12 months?
7035.notes: The mean difference in visual acuity was 2.1 ETDRS letters (95% CI -2.0 to 6.2), indicating no significant improvement.

7036.question: Does intentional endometrial injury increase the probability of live birth in women undergoing intrauterine insemination (IUI) or attempting to conceive via sexual intercourse?
7036.notes: The evidence is insufficient and of very low quality, with a wide confidence interval (RR 1.11, 95% CI 0.78 to 1.59).

7037.question: Does the use of dapivirine microbicide reduce the risk of acquiring HIV in women who have sex with men?
7037.notes: Dapivirine showed a risk ratio of 0.71 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.57 to 0.89.

7038.question: Do mobile phone-based interventions show a consistent beneficial effect on reducing LDL cholesterol levels in adults for the primary prevention of CVD?
7038.notes: Two studies found a small beneficial effect, but other studies showed varying results with wide confidence intervals including no effect.

7039.question: Does the use of high levels of PEEP improve mortality rates before hospital discharge in patients with ALI and ARDS?
7039.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.97, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.90 to 1.04; moderate-certainty evidence.

7040.question: Do circumcision devices reduce the operative time compared to standard surgical techniques?
7040.notes: Operative time is about 17 minutes shorter with devices (MD -17.26 minutes, 95% CI -19.96 to -14.57).

7041.question: Do antigen tests have higher sensitivity in symptomatic individuals compared to asymptomatic individuals?
7041.notes: Sensitivity in symptomatic individuals is 72.0% compared to 58.1% in asymptomatic individuals.

7042.question: Do lung recruitment manoeuvres (LRMs) reduce mortality in mechanically ventilated neonates compared to routine care?
7042.notes: Meta-analysis showed no evidence of a difference in mortality (RR 1.00, 95% CI 0.17 to 5.77).

7043.question: Does a diet or lifestyle intervention compared to no intervention affect the chance of live birth in obese women with subfertility?
7043.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 0.85, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.65 to 1.11; 918 women, 3 studies; I² = 78%

7044.question: Is chest CT more specific than ultrasound for diagnosing COVID-19?
7044.notes: Chest CT had a higher specificity than ultrasound based on indirect comparisons.

7045.question: Does laparoscopic pyloromyotomy increase the risk of mucosal perforation compared to open pyloromyotomy in infants with IHPS?

7046.question: Does the use of erlotinib, gefitinib, or afatinib improve progression-free survival compared to cytotoxic chemotherapy in patients with EGFR mutation-positive non-small cell lung cancer?
7046.notes: Erlotinib (HR 0.31; 95% CI 0.25 to 0.39), gefitinib (HR 0.39; 95% CI 0.32 to 0.48 and HR 0.59; 95% CI 0.46 to 0.74), and afatinib (HR 0.42; 95% CI 0.34 to 0.53) all showed clinical benefit for PFS.

7047.question: Does the use of heparin reduce the risk of symptomatic thromboembolic events compared to no treatment during pregnancy?
7047.notes: The risk ratio for heparin versus no treatment/placebo is 0.39 with a 95% CI of 0.08 to 1.98, indicating very low-certainty evidence.

7048.question: Does phacoemulsification reduce the progression of visual field loss compared to laser peripheral iridotomy in chronic PACG patients?
7048.notes: Odds ratio [OR] 0.35, 95% confidence interval [CI] 0.13 to 0.91; 216 eyes

7049.question: Do digital interventions improve the six-minute walk distance (6MWD) in patients with COPD at 52 weeks?
7049.notes: The evidence is very uncertain about the effects on 6MWD at 52 weeks, with a mean difference of 54.33 (95% CI -35.47 to 144.12).

7050.question: Does venlafaxine improve depressive symptoms more than no treatment in people with epilepsy and depression?
7050.notes: Mean difference (MD) -7.59 (95% confidence interval (CI) -11.52 to -3.66; 1 study, 64 participants)

7051.question: Does monitoring with TVUS only affect the clinical pregnancy rate compared to combined monitoring with TVUS and serum estradiol?
7051.notes: The odds ratio for clinical pregnancy rate per woman was 1.10 with a 95% CI of 0.79 to 1.54, indicating uncertainty in the effect.

7052.question: Do agents that reduce gastric acidity improve gastro-intestinal symptoms in people with cystic fibrosis?
7052.notes: One trial found improvement in gastro-intestinal symptoms such as abdominal pain.

7053.question: Does preconception lifestyle advice on a combination of topics result in an increase in live births for people with infertility?
7053.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.93, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.79 to 1.10; 1 RCT, 626 participants

7054.question: Does abrupt discontinuation of antidepressants without psychological support increase the risk of relapse compared to continuation?
