7186.question: Is the Mini-Cog test highly sensitive for detecting dementia in community settings?
7186.notes: The sensitivities reported were 0.99, 0.76, and 0.99, indicating high sensitivity in two of the three studies.

7187.question: Does the use of intranasal corticosteroids improve the recovery of sense of smell in individuals with COVID-19 related olfactory dysfunction?
7187.notes: The study showed a risk ratio of 1.19 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.85 to 1.68, indicating very uncertain evidence.

7188.question: Is hybrid repair associated with better outcomes compared to open surgical repair for aortic arch dissection?
7188.notes: There is a lack of published RCTs or CCTs to compare outcomes directly.

7189.question: Does ivermectin reduce mortality in patients with moderate-to-severe COVID-19 when compared to placebo or standard of care?
7189.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.60, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.14 to 2.51; 2 studies, 185 participants.

7190.question: Is there evidence that trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole reduces the incidence of HUS in patients with diarrhoea due to STEC infection?
7190.notes: The risk ratio was 0.57 with a 95% CI of 0.11-2.81, indicating very low certainty evidence.

7191.question: Is telehealth assessment as accurate as conventional face-to-face assessment for diagnosing all-cause dementia?
7191.notes: Sensitivity ranged from 0.80 to 1.00 and specificity from 0.80 to 1.00, but evidence is considered very low-certainty due to imprecision and risk of bias.

7192.question: Is the failure rate higher for conventional restoration compared to the Hall Technique in cavitated, but not deep lesions in primary teeth?
7192.notes: The odds ratio for failure is 8.35, with a 95% confidence interval of 3.73 to 18.68.

7193.question: Does neoadjuvant chemotherapy (NACT) reduce the risk of serious postoperative adverse events compared to primary debulking surgery (PDS) in women with advanced epithelial ovarian cancer?
7193.notes: NACT group had 6% serious adverse events compared to 29% in the PDS group (RR 0.22, 95% CI 0.13 to 0.38).

7194.question: Does wearing compression bandages or stockings help in achieving complete healing of venous leg ulcers more quickly compared to not wearing compression?
7194.notes: Pooled hazard ratio for time-to-complete healing 2.17, 95% CI 1.52 to 3.10.

7195.question: Is the Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) associated with high sensitivity for detecting dementia when using a threshold score of 26 or over?
7195.notes: The MoCA had high sensitivity of 0.94 or more in studies using the threshold score of 26 or over.

7196.question: Do compression stockings improve symptoms in people with varicose veins without healed or active venous ulceration?
7196.notes: All studies reported subjective improvement in symptoms, but results were subject to bias due to lack of comparison between randomised arms.

7197.question: Does intermittent preventive treatment in infants (IPTi) with sulfadoxine-pyrimethamine (SP) reduce the incidence of clinical malaria in sub-Saharan Africa?
7197.notes: IPTi with SP resulted in a 30% reduction in clinical malaria incidence (rate ratio 0.70, 0.62 to 0.80).

7198.question: Do anti-osteoporotic drugs reduce the risk of vertebral fracture in patients with CKD stages 3-4?

7199.question: Does the use of morphine compared to supportive care alone increase the duration of hospitalization for infants with NAS?
7199.notes: Mean difference of 15.00 days, 95% CI 8.86 to 21.14

7200.question: Does the IQCODE perform better in a general hospital setting compared to a specialist memory setting for detecting dementia?
7200.notes: Statistically significant difference in test accuracy between settings (P = 0.019).

7201.question: Does oral cytology offer the most potential as an adjunctive test for detecting oral cancer and OPMD compared to other index tests?
7201.notes: Oral cytology has a sensitivity of 0.90 and specificity of 0.94, both with moderate-certainty evidence.

7202.question: Does remote monitoring plus usual care reduce COPD-related hospital re-admissions at 26 weeks?
7202.notes: Hazard ratio 0.42, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.19 to 0.93; 106 participants.

7203.question: Is the IQCODE effective in predicting future dementia diagnosis in poststroke patients using a cut-off of 3.3?
7203.notes: Sensitivity of 0.84 (95% CI 0.68 to 0.94) and specificity of 0.87 (95% CI 0.76 to 0.94) at one year after stroke.

7204.question: Does sunlight exposure reduce the incidence of jaundice in term and late preterm neonates compared to no treatment?
7204.notes: Risk ratio [RR] 0.61, 95% confidence interval [CI] 0.45 to 0.82; risk difference [RD] -0.14, 95% CI -0.22 to -0.06; number needed to treat for an additional beneficial outcome [NNTB] 7, 95% CI 5 to 17; 1 study, 482 infants.

7205.question: Is the Mini-Cog test associated with high sensitivity for detecting dementia in secondary care settings?
7205.notes: The sensitivities reported were 0.67, 0.60, and 0.87, indicating variability and generally moderate sensitivity.

7206.question: Does increasing the frequency of home visits improve exclusive breastfeeding rates at six weeks postpartum?
7206.notes: RR 1.17, 95% CI 1.01 to 1.36; three studies, 960 women

7207.question: Does the IQCODE demonstrate high sensitivity for detecting dementia at a threshold of 3.2 in a primary care setting?
7207.notes: Sensitivity at threshold 3.2 is 100%, but the study is at high risk of bias.

7208.question: Does double IUI improve the live birth rate compared to single IUI in subfertile couples?
7208.notes: The odds ratio for live birth rate is 1.15 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.71 to 1.88, indicating uncertainty in improvement.

7209.question: Does proton therapy compared to photon therapy improve local control in patients with chordoma?
7209.notes: The hazard ratio for local control is 5.34 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.66 to 43.43, indicating very low-certainty evidence.

7210.question: Does exercise training improve muscle strength and bone mineral density in adults undergoing lung transplantation?
7210.notes: Two studies reported increases in muscle strength and bone mineral density with exercise training, but the evidence is rated as very low due to high risk of bias and imprecision.

7211.question: Does prehabilitation exercise therapy reduce the occurrence of cardiac complications compared to usual care in patients awaiting elective AAA repair?

7212.question: Does tailored pulmonary rehabilitation improve quality of life compared to usual care for people with COPD and comorbidities?
7212.notes: Mean difference (MD) -10.85, 95% confidence interval (CI) -12.66 to -9.04; 1 study, 70 participants

7213.question: Do PUL and PAE result in little to no difference in urologic symptoms scores compared to TURP?

7214.question: Does low-dose colchicine improve treatment success compared to placebo in the context of acute gout?
7214.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 2.43, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.05 to 5.64; absolute improvement 25% more reported success.

7215.question: Does routine first trimester ultrasound reduce short-term maternal anxiety about pregnancy?

7216.question: Is the failure rate of composite resin restorations higher compared to amalgam restorations in posterior teeth?
7216.notes: Composite resin restorations had almost double the risk of failure compared to amalgam restorations (RR 1.89, 95% CI 1.52 to 2.35).

7217.question: Does the use of LF-LAM testing in inpatient settings reduce mortality in people living with HIV compared to routine tuberculosis diagnostic testing without LF-LAM?
7217.notes: Pooled RR 0.85, 95% CI 0.76 to 0.94; 5102 participants, 2 trials

7218.question: Does remdesivir reduce all-cause mortality in hospitalized adults with SARS-CoV-2 infection at up to day 28?
7218.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.93, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.81 to 1.06; moderate-certainty evidence.

7219.question: Is there an increased risk of surgical site infections when hair is removed with a razor compared to no hair removal?
7219.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.82, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.05 to 3.14; seven studies with 1706 participants.

7220.question: Does enteral tube feeding improve survival time in people with severe dementia?
7220.notes: Four studies with PEG feeding found no evidence of effects on survival time.

7221.question: Does calcium supplementation reduce systolic blood pressure in normotensive individuals under 35 years old?
7221.notes: Mean difference (MD) -1.86 mmHg, 95% confidence interval (CI) -3.45, -0.27; 452 participants; eight studies; I² = 19%

7222.question: Do systemic corticosteroids reduce all-cause mortality in hospitalized individuals with symptomatic COVID-19?
7222.notes: Systemic corticosteroids plus standard care probably reduce all-cause mortality slightly compared to standard care alone (RR 0.89, 95% CI 0.80 to 1.00).

7223.question: Does a two-hour feeding interval reduce the time taken to achieve full enteral feeding compared to a three-hour interval in preterm infants?

7224.question: Can point-of-care nucleic acid-based testing (POC NAT) accurately diagnose HIV infection in infants and children aged 18 months or less?
7224.notes: POC NAT tests showed high sensitivity (98.6%) and specificity (99.9%) against laboratory reference standards.

7225.question: Are sharp-edged intraocular lenses (IOLs) associated with a lower incidence of Nd:YAG capsulotomy compared to round-edged IOLs one year after cataract surgery?
7225.notes: Peto odds ratio 0.30, 95% CI 0.05 to 1.74; judged as low-certainty evidence due to imprecision and risk of bias.

7226.question: Is hydromorphone associated with a difference in pain intensity compared to oxycodone in adults with cancer pain?
7226.notes: The evidence is very uncertain with no clear difference found in pain intensity (3 RCTs, 381 participants).

7227.question: Does posterior musculofascial reconstruction during RALP improve urinary continence one week after catheter removal compared to no reconstruction?
7227.notes: The risk ratio is 1.25 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.90 to 1.73, indicating a possible improvement but with low certainty.

7228.question: Does cataract extraction surgery increase the risk of trabeculectomy failure?
7228.notes: The abstract reports a 30% to 40% risk of trabeculectomy failure following cataract extraction surgery.

7229.question: Is rituximab effective in eradicating FVIII autoantibodies in people with acquired haemophilia A?
7229.notes: No randomised clinical trials were found to assess the efficacy of rituximab.

7230.question: Does endovenous laser ablation (EVLA) offer improved technical success compared to ultrasound-guided foam sclerotherapy (UGFS) in the treatment of great saphenous vein (GSV) varicosities?
7230.notes: EVLA may be better in technical success up to five years (OR 6.13, 95% CI 0.98 to 38.27) and over five years (OR 6.47, 95% CI 2.60 to 16.10).

7231.question: Do reactive air surfaces reduce the incidence of pressure ulcers compared to foam surfaces?
7231.notes: Reactive air surfaces have a risk ratio (RR) of 0.46 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 0.29 to 0.75.

7232.question: Does vitamin D supplementation reduce all-cause mortality in adults with chronic liver diseases?
7232.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.86, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.51 to 1.45; 27 trials; 1979 participants

7233.question: Do lay health worker-led interventions increase recovery rates for adults with common mental disorders in low- and middle-income countries?
7233.notes: Recovery rates increased with a risk ratio of 1.29 (95% CI 1.06 to 1.56).

7234.question: Does pentoxifylline improve the clinical pregnancy rate in women with endometriosis compared to placebo?

7235.question: Does the timing of PERT administration affect fat absorption in individuals with cystic fibrosis?
7235.notes: The review did not identify any eligible studies to assess the timing of PERT administration.

7236.question: Does continuous intragastric tube feeding reduce the number of episodes of gastro-oesophageal reflux disease in preterm and low birth weight infants compared to intermittent bolus feeding?
7236.notes: No trials were found that evaluated the effects of continuous versus intermittent bolus intragastric tube feeding.

7237.question: Does chronic non-invasive ventilation improve arterial partial pressure of carbon dioxide (PaCO2) in stable COPD patients over a 12-month period?
7237.notes: PaCO2 was reduced in participants allocated to NIV after three months (AMD -0.61 kPa, 95% CI -0.77 to -0.45) and persisted up to 12 months (AMD -0.42 kPa, 95% CI -0.68 to -0.16).

7238.question: Does slow advancement of enteral feed volumes reduce the risk of necrotising enterocolitis (NEC) in very preterm or very low birth weight infants?
7238.notes: Meta-analyses showed little or no effect on the risk of NEC (RR 1.06, 95% CI 0.83 to 1.37).

7239.question: Are pharmacological interventions effective for symptom relief in COVID-19 patients receiving palliative care?
7239.notes: The evidence is very uncertain due to high risk of bias and lack of controlled studies.

7240.question: Does Kinesio Taping improve overall pain compared to sham taping in adults with rotator cuff disease?
7240.notes: Mean overall pain was 2.96 with sham taping and 3.03 with KT, with a relative difference of 2% worse (95% CI 21% better to 24% worse).

7241.question: Does prophylaxis reduce the frequency of joint bleeds compared to on-demand treatment in individuals with hemophilia?
7241.notes: Prophylaxis may result in a large decrease in the number of joint bleeds compared to on-demand treatment, MD -30.34 (95% CI -46.95 to -13.73).

7242.question: Does the use of abdominal drainage reduce the risk of intraperitoneal abscess after open appendectomy for complicated appendicitis?
7242.notes: The risk ratio for intraperitoneal abscess was 1.23 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.47 to 3.21, indicating very low-certainty evidence.

7243.question: Are physical therapy interventions effective in improving the quality of life for children and adolescents diagnosed with cancer?
7243.notes: The review found no RCTs, cross-over trials, or CCTs that could provide evidence on the efficacy of physical therapy interventions for this purpose.

7244.question: Does recombinant human growth hormone (rhGH) therapy improve pulmonary function outcomes in children and young adults with cystic fibrosis?
7244.notes: rhGH treatment may improve some pulmonary function outcomes, but evidence is limited by inconsistency, small sample size, and short trial duration.

7245.question: Do supervised maintenance programmes improve health-related quality of life in COPD patients compared to usual care?
7245.notes: Mean difference in Chronic Respiratory Questionnaire total score was 0.54 points, exceeding the minimal important difference of 0.5 points.

7246.question: Does heliox provide a significant improvement in croup scores for children with mild croup compared to 30% humidified oxygen?

7247.question: Does tocilizumab improve sustained remission rates in patients with giant cell arteritis compared to placebo?
7247.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 4.25, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.21 to 14.88 in one RCT; RR 3.17 to 4.00 in another RCT depending on the comparator group.

7248.question: Does degarelix result in fewer serious adverse events compared to standard androgen suppression therapy in men with advanced prostate cancer?
7248.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.80, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.62 to 1.05; indicates little to no difference.

7249.question: Is there a difference in intraocular pressure control between fornix-based and limbal-based trabeculectomy surgeries at 12 months?
7249.notes: Mean IOP ranged from 12.5 to 15.5 mmHg in fornix-based and 11.7 to 15.1 mmHg in limbal-based surgeries with no significant difference.

7250.question: Is oral chloral hydrate associated with a lower sedation failure rate compared to oral promethazine in children undergoing neurodiagnostic procedures?
7250.notes: Fewer children who received oral chloral hydrate had sedation failure compared with oral promethazine (RR 0.11, 95% CI 0.01 to 0.82).

7251.question: Does partial breast irradiation (PBI) or accelerated partial breast irradiation (APBI) lead to worse local recurrence-free survival compared to whole breast radiotherapy (WBRT) in women with early-stage breast cancer?
7251.notes: Local recurrence-free survival is slightly reduced with PBI/APBI (HR 1.21, 95% CI 1.03 to 1.42).

7252.question: Does push feeding result in more rapid establishment of full gavage feeds compared to gravity feeding in preterm or low birth weight infants?
7252.notes: The primary outcome of time taken to establish full gavage feeding was not reported in the included study.

7253.question: Do masks or altered cycle routes have a significant impact on physiological markers of air pollution exposure?
7253.notes: The evidence is very uncertain according to the GRADE approach.

7254.question: Does ultrasound-guided glucocorticoid injection provide a clinically important benefit in terms of pain relief compared to non-image-guided injection for shoulder pain?
7254.notes: Moderate-certainty evidence indicates little or no clinically important benefits for pain relief with ultrasound guidance.

7255.question: Does non-invasive positive airway pressure therapy improve erectile dysfunction in men with obstructive sleep apnoea when compared to no treatment?
7255.notes: There is uncertainty about the effect of CPAP on mean ED scores after 4 and 12 weeks, with very low-certainty evidence.

7256.question: Does intravenous ibuprofen provide at least 50% pain relief compared to placebo in the postoperative setting?
7256.notes: The risk ratio was 1.44 (95% CI 0.77 to 2.66), indicating no significant difference.

7257.question: Does mass drug administration (MDA) reduce Plasmodium falciparum parasitaemia prevalence in moderate- to high-transmission settings within six months after the intervention?
7257.notes: No important effects on P falciparum parasitaemia prevalence were reported within six months after MDA in moderate- to high-transmission settings.

7258.question: Are forceps more likely to achieve a successful vaginal birth compared to vacuum cups?
7258.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.58, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.39 to 0.88; 11 studies, 3080 women.

7259.question: Is there a difference in health-related quality of life between Roux-en-Y and Billroth-I reconstruction after distal gastrectomy?
7259.notes: Standardised mean difference 0.04, 95% CI -0.11 to 0.18; low-certainty evidence.

7260.question: Can MRI be used as a replacement for evacuation proctography (EP) in diagnosing posterior pelvic floor disorders in women with obstructed defaecation syndrome?
7260.notes: MRI did not meet the criteria to replace EP, as both sensitivity and specificity were not similar or higher than EP.

7261.question: Does bamlanivimab reduce hospital admissions in non-hospitalised COVID-19 patients compared to placebo?
7261.notes: Bamlanivimab showed a reduced risk of hospital admission by day 29 compared to placebo (RR 0.17, 95% CI 0.02 to 1.33 for 0.7 g dose).

7262.question: Is high-dose chemotherapy followed by autologous haematopoietic cell transplantation associated with improved survival outcomes in children with first recurrence of Ewing sarcoma?
7262.notes: No eligible studies were identified to assess the efficacy.

7263.question: Do educational meetings as the main component of an intervention probably slightly improve professional practice compared to no intervention?
7263.notes: Adjusted risk difference for dichotomous outcomes is 6.79% (95% CI 6.62% to 6.97%).

7264.question: Does valvuloplasty plus surgery of the superficial venous system improve clinical outcomes compared to surgery of the superficial venous system alone in patients with primary valvular incompetence?
7264.notes: The mean CEAP severity score improved more in the valvuloplasty group compared to the surgery-only group.

7265.question: Do multi-component interventions help reduce the number of people admitted to the hospital for COPD-related reasons?

7266.question: Do changes to the organization and delivery of care for people with advanced dementia increase comfort in dying?

7267.question: Does involving consumers and health providers in partnership improve the person-centredness of health services compared to usual practice?
7267.notes: The effects are uncertain due to very low-certainty evidence and lack of usable data.

7268.question: Do physical activity interventions in outside-school hours childcare settings lead to a significant increase in total daily moderate-to-vigorous physical activity?
7268.notes: Mean difference of 1.7 minutes with a 95% CI of -0.42 to 3.82 indicates little to no effect.

7269.question: Does administering a whole-cell pertussis (wP) vaccine compared to an acellular pertussis (aP) vaccine in early infancy reduce the risk of atopic diseases in children?
7269.notes: The evidence is uncertain with a risk ratio of 0.85 (95% CI 0.62 to 1.17), indicating no clear effect.

7270.question: Is norethisterone effective in reducing seizure frequency in women with catamenial epilepsy?
7270.notes: The RCTs reported no treatment differences for change in seizure frequency between norethisterone and placebo.

7271.question: Is high-dose chemotherapy with autologous haematopoietic cell transplantation associated with improved event-free survival compared to conventional chemotherapy with whole lung irradiation in children, adolescents, and young adults with primary pulmonary metastatic Ewing sarcoma?
7271.notes: The hazard ratio for event-free survival was 0.83 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.59 to 1.17, indicating no significant difference.

7272.question: Do cannabinoids have a clinically important effect on cognitive function in dementia patients?
7272.notes: The mean difference was 1.1 points on the sMMSE with a 95% CI of 0.1 to 2.1, suggesting little or no clinically important effect.

7273.question: Is aspirin associated with a reduced risk of symptomatic deep vein thrombosis compared to vitamin K antagonists in patients with multiple myeloma receiving immunomodulatory agents?
7273.notes: RR 0.57, 95% CI 0.24 to 1.33; very low-certainty evidence

7274.question: Is exercise treatment more effective for reducing pain in chronic low back pain compared to no treatment, usual care, or placebo?
7274.notes: Moderate-certainty evidence with MD -15.2, 95% CI -18.3 to -12.2, which is a clinically important difference.

7275.question: Does self-confinement of staff with residents reduce the number of infections and deaths in long-term care facilities?
7275.notes: The abstract suggests that self-confinement may reduce infections and deaths, but the evidence is very uncertain.

7276.question: Is lamotrigine more effective than placebo in preventing the recurrence of manic symptoms in bipolar disorder?
7276.notes: The estimated risk ratio (RR) for recurrence of manic symptoms at one year was 0.67 (95% CI 0.51 to 0.87) in favor of lamotrigine.

7277.question: Is omalizumab associated with a higher incidence of serious side effects compared to placebo in the treatment of allergic bronchopulmonary aspergillosis in people with cystic fibrosis?
7277.notes: Serious side effects were encountered in 66.67% of participants in the omalizumab group compared to 20% in the placebo group.

7278.question: Does enzyme replacement therapy with galsulfase reduce urinary glycosaminoglycan levels in patients with MPS VI?
7278.notes: Mean difference of -227.00 with a 95% confidence interval of -264.00 to -190.00.

7279.question: Does frequent monitoring of gastric residual volume (GRV) reduce the incidence of pneumonia in patients receiving enteral nutrition in ICU settings?
7279.notes: RR 1.08, 95% CI 0.64 to 1.83; very low-certainty evidence

7280.question: Does the Lidcombe Program result in a lower frequency of stuttering in children aged up to six years compared to a wait-list control group at post-test?

7281.question: Do school-based physical activity interventions significantly increase the time children and adolescents engage in moderate to vigorous physical activity?
7281.notes: Mean difference of 0.73 minutes per day with a 95% confidence interval of 0.16 to 1.30.

7282.question: Does adjunctive counseling by a health professional other than the physician increase smoking quit rates in primary care?
7282.notes: RR 1.31, 95% CI 1.10 to 1.55; I<sup>2</sup> = 44%; 22 studies, 18,150 participants

7283.question: Does postoperative adjuvant chemotherapy reduce all-cause mortality compared to no postoperative adjuvant chemotherapy in patients with cholangiocarcinoma?
7283.notes: The evidence is very uncertain with a risk ratio of 0.92 (95% CI 0.84 to 1.01).

7284.question: Do autologous blood or PRP injections provide clinically significant improvement in pain or function compared to placebo at three months?
7284.notes: Moderate-certainty evidence suggests no significant improvement in pain or function compared to placebo.

7285.question: Does intravenous atosiban increase the clinical pregnancy rate in women undergoing embryo transfer?

7286.question: Does silicone gel sheeting (SGS) reduce pain levels compared to no treatment for hypertrophic scars?
7286.notes: One study with 34 participants suggests SGS may result in a slight reduction in pain level compared with no SGS treatment (MD -1.26, 95% CI -2.26 to -0.26).

7287.question: Is there a greater treatment response in adults with trichotillomania when treated with antipsychotics compared to placebo?
7287.notes: Based on a single trial of olanzapine, RR 5.08, 95% CI 1.4 to 18.37; 25 participants.

7288.question: Does CAR T-cell therapy improve overall survival in patients with relapsed or refractory DLBCL?
7288.notes: The evidence is very uncertain about the effect of CAR T-cell therapy on overall survival, with reported survival rates at 12 months ranging between 48% and 59%.

7289.question: Does ketamine increase response and remission rates compared to placebo at 24 hours in patients with unipolar major depressive disorder?
7289.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 3.94, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.54 to 10.10; n = 185, studies = 7

7290.question: Does the CHIVA method make a difference in the recurrence of varicose veins compared to vein stripping?
7290.notes: CHIVA may make little or no difference to the recurrence of varicose veins compared to stripping (RR 0.74, 95% CI 0.46 to 1.20).

7291.question: Does integrated disease management (IDM) improve health-related quality of life (QoL) for people with COPD at medium-term follow-up?
7291.notes: IDM probably improves health-related QoL as measured by St. George's Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) total score at medium-term follow-up (MD -3.89, 95% CI -6.16 to -1.63).

7292.question: Do invitation letters increase the uptake of cervical screening compared to no intervention?
7292.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.71, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.49 to 1.96; 141,391 participants; 24 studies.

7293.question: Is cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT) more effective than anxiety management in reducing OCD symptoms in individuals with high-functioning autism spectrum disorder (ASD)?
7293.notes: The study showed a mean difference favoring CBT, but the confidence interval (-8.02 to 2.02) includes zero, indicating low certainty.

7294.question: Is sulthiame associated with a lower risk of treatment withdrawal due to seizure recurrence or adverse reactions compared to levetiracetam in patients with benign epilepsy of childhood with centrotemporal spikes?

7295.question: Does patching improve motor alignment at near and distance fixation in children with intermittent exotropia compared to active observation?
7295.notes: Patching was found to be clinically more effective than active observation in improving motor alignment at near (MD -2.23, 95% CI -4.02 to -0.44) and distance (MD -2.00, 95% CI -3.40 to -0.61) fixation.

7296.question: Does the use of TTS/EWS reduce maternal death compared to standard care in low-resource settings?

7297.question: Do nicotine electronic cigarettes increase quit rates compared to nicotine replacement therapy?
7297.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.53, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.21 to 1.93; 4 studies, 1924 participants.

7298.question: Does iron supplementation increase hemoglobin levels and reduce the risk of anemia in infants?
7298.notes: Iron supplementation increased Hb levels and reduced the risk of anemia and IDA in two reviews.

7299.question: Does colchicine improve all-cause mortality in hospitalized patients with moderate to severe COVID-19 compared to standard care?
7299.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.00, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.93 to 1.08; 2 RCTs, 11,445 participants.

7300.question: Does recombinant human growth hormone therapy improve height standard deviation score in children with X-linked hypophosphatemia?
7300.notes: Improvement in height SDS was observed, but no significant difference between groups after three years (MD 0.50 SDS, 95% CI -0.54 to 1.54).

7301.question: Does folic acid supplementation reduce blood arsenic concentrations in arsenic-exposed individuals compared to placebo?
7301.notes: FA800 reduced blood arsenic levels more than placebo (%change in GM FA800 -17.8%, 95% CI -25.0 to -9.8; placebo GM -9.5%, 95% CI -16.5 to -1.8).

7302.question: Does ketamine show a higher response rate compared to placebo in alleviating acute symptoms of depression in bipolar disorder within 24 hours?
7302.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 11.61, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.25 to 107.74; P = 0.03; participants = 33; studies = 2; I² = 0%

7303.question: Do parenting interventions improve parenting skills and decrease child disruptive behavior in parents with schizophrenia or related serious mental illness?
7303.notes: The only included trial was inconclusive and had a high risk of bias.

7304.question: Does increasing the time spent in rehabilitation improve activities of daily living in stroke patients?
7304.notes: SMD 0.13, 95% CI -0.02 to 0.28; P = 0.09; I² = 7%; 14 studies, 864 participants

7305.question: Does extensive testing, including CT scans, lead to earlier cancer diagnosis compared to tests at the physician's discretion in patients with unprovoked VTE?
7305.notes: Extensively tested participants were diagnosed earlier (mean: 1 month) compared to the control group (11.6 months).

7306.question: Do anti-interleukin-13/-4 agents reduce the rate of asthma exacerbations requiring hospitalisation or emergency department visits compared to placebo?
7306.notes: Rate ratio 0.68, 95% CI 0.47 to 0.98 for tralokinumab.

7307.question: Do mindfulness-based interventions (MBIs) reduce the percentage of days with substance use compared to other treatments at post-treatment?

7308.question: Does an intermittent very low calorie diet (VLCD) increase the chances of smoking abstinence at 12 months?
7308.notes: The VLCD increased the chances of abstinence at 12 months (RR 1.73, 95% CI 1.10 to 2.73; 1 study, 287 participants).

7309.question: Does uninterrupted vitamin K antagonist (VKA) therapy reduce the risk of thromboembolic events without increasing the risk of bleeding in adults undergoing catheter ablation for arrhythmia?
7309.notes: Subgroup analysis showed uninterrupted VKA is associated with a lower risk of thromboembolic events without increasing bleeding risk.

7310.question: Does intraperitoneal local anaesthetic reduce pain at up to 24 hours after laparoscopic cholecystectomy?
7310.notes: Pain scores were lower in the intraperitoneal local anaesthetic group compared to control at both four to eight hours (MD -0.99 cm VAS; 95% CI -1.19 to -0.79) and nine to 24 hours (MD -0.68 cm VAS; 95% CI -0.88 to -0.49).

7311.question: Do vitamin K antagonists (VKAs) reduce mortality at six months in ambulatory people with cancer undergoing systemic anticancer therapy?
7311.notes: VKAs probably reduce mortality at six months slightly with a risk ratio (RR) of 0.93 and a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 0.77 to 1.13.

7312.question: Is there a difference in the risk of symptomatic urinary tract infections between aseptic and clean catheterisation techniques?
7312.notes: The evidence is low-certainty and the confidence interval is consistent with both possible benefit and harm (RR 1.20, 95% CI 0.54 to 2.66).

7313.question: Does using dentine-bonded resin composite increase the success rate of retrograde filling compared to glass ionomer cement after one year?

7314.question: Does early systemic corticosteroid treatment reduce the risk of bronchopulmonary dysplasia (BPD) at 36 weeks' postmenstrual age?
7314.notes: Early systemic corticosteroids probably reduce BPD at 36 weeks' PMA (RR 0.80, 95% CI 0.73 to 0.88).

7315.question: Does the use of voice-enabling aids improve the ability to phonate at least one intelligible word compared to routine use?
7315.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 3.03, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.18 to 50.08; 2 studies; very low-certainty evidence.

7316.question: Does the use of sclerosing agents lead to more resolution or improvement of telangiectasias compared to placebo?

7317.question: Do humour-based interventions improve depressive symptoms compared to active control in people with schizophrenia?
7317.notes: Beck Depression Inventory (BDI): MD -6.20, 95% CI -12.08 to -0.32; 1 study, 30 participants

7318.question: Is a reduction in mammographic density associated with a decreased risk of breast cancer mortality in women receiving tamoxifen therapy?
7318.notes: Two studies reported risk ratio point estimates of ~0.4 and ~0.5 associated with a density reduction.

7319.question: Does early anticoagulation therapy reduce the odds of death or dependence in activities of daily living after an acute ischaemic stroke?
7319.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 0.98, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.92 to 1.03; 12 RCTs, 22,428 participants.

7320.question: Does narrowband ultraviolet B (NB-UVB) treatment improve physician-assessed signs of atopic eczema compared to placebo or no treatment after 12 weeks?
7320.notes: Mean difference (MD) -9.4, 95% confidence interval (CI) -3.62 to -15.18; 1 trial, 41 participants.

7321.question: Do broader ideas and practices surrounding health and illness influence parents' views on childhood vaccination?
7321.notes: The abstract states that parents' vaccination ideas and practices may be influenced by their broader ideas and practices surrounding health and illness.

7322.question: Do calcium channel blockers (CCBs) increase major cardiovascular events compared to diuretics in the treatment of hypertension?

7323.question: Does azithromycin reduce all-cause mortality in hospitalized COVID-19 patients after 28 days compared to standard care?
7323.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.98; 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.90 to 1.06; high-certainty evidence.

7324.question: Does performing carotid endarterectomy under local anaesthetic reduce the incidence of stroke compared to general anaesthetic?
7324.notes: The incidence of stroke was 3.2% for local anaesthesia and 3.5% for general anaesthesia (Peto OR 0.91, 95% CI 0.66 to 1.26).

7325.question: Does administering antibiotics prior to the insertion of long-term CVCs reduce gram-positive CVC-related infections in people with cancer?
7325.notes: Pooled risk ratio 0.67, CI 95% 0.32 to 1.43; moderate-certainty evidence.

7326.question: Does real-time B-mode ultrasound guidance improve the first attempt success rate for radial artery catheterisation compared to palpation and landmarks?

7327.question: Does CT imaging accurately diagnose hepatocellular carcinoma of any size and stage in adults with chronic liver disease?
7327.notes: CT imaging has a sensitivity of 77.5% and specificity of 91.3%, indicating that 22.5% of cases could be missed.

7328.question: Does avoiding bottle feeds increase the extent of full breastfeeding on discharge home for preterm infants?

7329.question: Do music interventions have a large anxiety-reducing effect in adults with cancer?
7329.notes: Average anxiety reduction of 7.73 units on the Spielberger State Anxiety Inventory scale (95% CI -10.02 to -5.44).

7330.question: Does antihypertensive pharmacotherapy reduce mortality in adults with hypertension-induced LVH compared to placebo or no treatment?
7330.notes: The risk ratio for mortality was 1.02 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.74 to 1.40, indicating very low-certainty evidence.

7331.question: Does preconception genetic risk assessment enable autonomous reproductive choice for couples at risk of autosomal recessive conditions?
7331.notes: No RCTs were found to assess this, so evidence is lacking.

7332.question: Does the use of the Bedside Aspiration test provide a reliable assessment of aspiration risk in acute stroke patients?
7332.notes: The Bedside Aspiration test showed high sensitivity and specificity in a single study with a small sample size, limiting its reliability.

7333.question: Can lipid-lowering therapy prevent increased cardiovascular morbidity and mortality in patients with familial hypercholesterolaemia?
7333.notes: The abstract states that increased cardiovascular morbidity and mortality can be prevented by starting lipid-lowering therapy.

7334.question: Does oncoplastic breast-conserving surgery (O-BCS) reduce the rate of re-excisions needed for oncological resection compared to standard breast-conserving surgery (S-BCS)?
7334.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.76, 95% CI 0.69 to 0.85; 38 studies, 13,341 participants

7335.question: Does prophylactic nasal CPAP reduce the incidence of bronchopulmonary dysplasia (BPD) in preterm infants when compared to supportive care?
7335.notes: CPAP possibly reduces BPD at 36 weeks (RR 0.76, 95% CI 0.51 to 1.14; moderate certainty evidence), but the confidence interval crosses 1, indicating uncertainty.

7336.question: Does memory rehabilitation improve subjective memory in people with multiple sclerosis at the intermediate time point?

7337.question: Do DPP4i reduce the risk of cardiovascular mortality in patients with established CVD?
7337.notes: The odds ratio for CVD mortality with DPP4i is 1.00 (95% CI 0.91 to 1.09).

7338.question: Does feedback on patient-reported outcomes measures (PROMs) improve quality of life for patients?
7338.notes: Standardised mean difference (SMD) 0.15, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.05 to 0.26; 11 studies; 2687 participants

7339.question: Does n-3PUFA supplementation provide a clinically meaningful benefit for depressive symptomology compared to placebo in adults with MDD?
7339.notes: The standardised mean difference (SMD) was -0.40 (95% CI -0.64 to -0.16), which is unlikely to be clinically meaningful as it represents a difference of approximately 2.5 points on the HDRS, where the minimal clinically important change is 3.0 points.

7340.question: Does surgical intervention improve visual acuity in patients with lamellar macular holes compared to observation?
7340.notes: Mean difference in vision change was -0.29 logMAR (95% CI: -0.33 to -0.25) favoring surgery.

7341.question: Is transcranial direct current stimulation associated with an improvement in pain intensity compared to sham stimulation in IBD patients?

7342.question: Do gonadotropins improve the cumulative live birth rate compared to anti-oestrogens in infertile ovulatory women?
7342.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 1.37, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.05 to 1.79; moderate-certainty evidence.

7343.question: Is everolimus associated with improved progression-free survival in patients with pancreatic NETs?
7343.notes: Everolimus has a hazard ratio of 0.36 [95% CI, 0.28 to 0.46], indicating improved progression-free survival.

7344.question: Do NSAIDs reduce pain intensity 24 hours following breast surgery compared to placebo?
7344.notes: SMD -0.26, 95% CI -0.49 to -0.03; 3 studies, 310 participants; I² = 73%

7345.question: Does idebenone result in a significant reduction in the decline of forced vital capacity (FVC) in patients with Duchenne muscular dystrophy compared to placebo?
7345.notes: Mean difference (MD) 3.28%, 95% confidence interval (CI) -0.41 to 6.97; 64 participants

7346.question: Does multidisciplinary rehabilitation in an inpatient setting result in fewer cases of poor outcome (death or deterioration in residential status) at 6 to 12 months' follow-up compared to usual care?
7346.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.88, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.80 to 0.98; 13 studies, 3036 participants.

7347.question: Do multi-domain interventions reduce the incidence of dementia compared to usual care or sham interventions?

7348.question: Does using low versus moderate-high nasal CPAP levels improve the outcome of death or bronchopulmonary dysplasia at 36 weeks' postmenstrual age in preterm infants?
7348.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.02, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.56 to 1.85; 1 trial, 271 participants.

7349.question: Does paracetamol reduce mortality in children with acute bacterial meningitis?
7349.notes: Paracetamol may make little or no difference to mortality (RR 0.94, 95% CI 0.81 to 1.09).

7350.question: Does topiramate lead to a 50% or greater reduction in primarily generalized tonic-clonic seizures compared to placebo in people with juvenile myoclonic epilepsy?

7351.question: Do SSRIs improve disability or independence in stroke survivors compared to placebo or usual care?
7351.notes: High-quality evidence shows little to no difference in disability (SMD -0.0; 95% CI -0.05 to 0.05) or independence (RR 0.98; 95% CI 0.93 to 1.03).

7352.question: Is intra-arterial infusion more effective than intravenous infusion in achieving vessel patency?
7352.notes: Intra-arterial infusion showed a higher likelihood of complete success in vessel patency (OR 13.22, 95% CI 2.79 to 62.67).

7353.question: Does the use of saline for uterine distension result in fewer vasovagal reaction events compared to carbon dioxide?

7354.question: Does immunosuppressive treatment reduce the risk of progression to end-stage kidney disease (ESKD) in patients with primary membranous nephropathy?
7354.notes: Immunosuppressive treatment probably reduces the overall risk of ESKD with a risk ratio of 0.59 (95% CI 0.35 to 0.99).

7355.question: Do late systemic corticosteroids reduce mortality in preterm infants with evolving or established BPD?
7355.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.81, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.66 to 0.99; 21 studies, 1428 infants.

7356.question: Does siponimod reduce the number of participants with disability progression at six months compared to placebo?
7356.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.78, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.65 to 0.94; 1 study, 1641 participants.

7357.question: Does inducing hypertension reduce the risk of death from all causes in patients with acute subarachnoid haemorrhage?
7357.notes: Meta-analysis showed no evidence of a difference (RR 1.60, 95% CI 0.57 to 4.42).

7358.question: Is ultrasound-guided transvaginal ovarian needle drilling (UTND) effective in increasing live birth rates in women with clomiphene-resistant PCOS?
7358.notes: No trials were identified to assess the efficacy of UTND for this outcome.

7359.question: Does active information provision improve stroke-related knowledge for stroke survivors?
7359.notes: Standardised mean difference (SMD) 0.41, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.17 to 0.65; 3 studies, 275 participants

7360.question: Do beta-blockers reduce the risk of all-cause mortality in patients younger than 75 years of age without heart failure following acute myocardial infarction?
7360.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.81, 97.5% confidence interval (CI) 0.73 to 0.90; moderate-certainty evidence.

7361.question: Does renal denervation improve major cardiovascular outcomes in patients with resistant hypertension?
7361.notes: Low-certainty evidence suggests little or no effect on myocardial infarction, ischaemic stroke, unstable angina, or hospitalisation.

7362.question: Does pneumatic retinopexy result in lower rates of retinal reattachment compared to scleral buckle?

7363.question: Do multicomponent non-pharmacological interventions reduce the incidence of delirium in hospitalized patients compared to usual care?
7363.notes: The incidence of delirium was 10.5% in the intervention group compared to 18.4% in the control group, with a risk ratio (RR) of 0.57 and a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 0.46 to 0.71.

7364.question: Does Rotarix prevent a higher percentage of severe rotavirus diarrhoea cases in low-mortality countries compared to high-mortality countries during the first year of life?
7364.notes: In low-mortality countries, Rotarix prevented 93% of severe rotavirus diarrhoea cases, while in high-mortality countries, it prevented 58%.

7365.question: Is the MMR vaccine effective in preventing measles after two doses?
7365.notes: Effectiveness is 96% after two doses (RR 0.04, 95% CI 0.01 to 0.28).

7366.question: Does palivizumab reduce hospitalisation due to RSV infection in children at high risk?
7366.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.44, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.30 to 0.64; high certainty evidence.

7367.question: Does exercise-based cardiac rehabilitation result in a reduction in myocardial infarction risk in the short-term follow-up?
7367.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.72, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.55 to 0.93; number needed to treat for an additional beneficial outcome (NNTB) 75, 95% CI 47 to 298.

7368.question: Do early warning systems (EWS) and rapid response systems (RRS) lead to a reduction in hospital mortality?
7368.notes: Randomised trials provided low-certainty evidence that EWS and RRS may result in little or no difference in hospital mortality.

7369.question: Does environmental enrichment improve functional recovery in people with stroke or non-progressive brain injury?
7369.notes: The single RCT included was small and had a high risk of bias, providing insufficient data to determine the effectiveness of environmental enrichment on functional recovery.

7370.question: Can 18F-FDG-PET/CT reliably replace other imaging modalities for staging distant metastases in RMS patients?
7370.notes: The abstract indicates insufficient evidence due to the small number of studies and participants.

7371.question: Does vitamin C supplementation reduce the incidence of pneumonia in children and adults?
7371.notes: The certainty of the evidence regarding the effect of vitamin C on pneumonia incidence is very low, and the studies did not report on pneumonia prevalence or mortality.

7372.question: Does decision coaching improve knowledge when combined with evidence-based information compared to usual care?

7373.question: Does enriched skim milk powder reduce the frequency of acute gout attacks compared to control groups?
7373.notes: Mean difference in flares per month was -0.21 (95% CI -0.76 to 0.34), indicating no clinically significant reduction.

7374.question: Is there evidence that antiepileptic drugs (AEDs) reduce the likelihood of seizures in people with neurocysticercosis who have not had a seizure?
7374.notes: No trials were found that investigated the role of AEDs in preventing seizures among people with neurocysticercosis presenting with symptoms other than seizures.

7375.question: Are any antibiotic regimens clearly superior in treating hospital-acquired pneumonia in children and neonates?
7375.notes: The evidence is insufficient to support any antibiotic regimen being superior due to very low certainty.

7376.question: Does Roselle extract have a significant effect on reducing systolic blood pressure in adults with hypertension?
7376.notes: The mean difference in SBP was 1.65 mmHg with a 95% CI of -7.89 to 11.19 mmHg, indicating no significant effect.

7377.question: Is there sufficient evidence to determine the impact of insulin therapy guided by continuous glucose monitoring on the management of cystic fibrosis-related diabetes?
7377.notes: No studies were included in the review, indicating insufficient evidence.

7378.question: Do macrolides reduce the rate of exacerbations requiring hospitalizations in people with asthma?
7378.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 0.47, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.20 to 1.12; moderate-certainty evidence.

7379.question: Is the combination of fosnetupitant and palonosetron more effective than aprepitant and granisetron in achieving complete control of vomiting during the overall treatment phase for patients receiving highly emetogenic chemotherapy?
7379.notes: Fosnetupitant + palonosetron (810 of 1000; RR 1.15, 95% CI 0.97 to 1.37) is more efficacious than aprepitant + granisetron (704 of 1000).

7380.question: Does medication reconciliation reduce medication errors compared to no medication reconciliation in hospital settings?
7380.notes: Odds ratio [OR] 0.55, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.17 to 1.74; 3 studies; n=379

7381.question: Does the use of growth hormone as an adjuvant in IVF increase the live birth rate in poor responders?
7381.notes: The odds ratio for live birth rate in poor responders is 1.77 (95% CI 1.17 to 2.70), but the evidence is very uncertain.

7382.question: Does the use of induction chemotherapy with platinum plus 5-fluorouracil prior to radiotherapy improve overall survival in patients with oral cavity and oropharyngeal cancers?
7382.notes: HR for death 0.85, 95% CI 0.70 to 1.04, P = 0.11; 7427 participants, 5 studies

7383.question: Does the addition of NT-proBNP and troponin to the RCRI improve the prediction of major adverse cardiac events (MACE) in patients undergoing noncardiac surgery?
7383.notes: The median delta c-statistics were 0.08, 0.14, and 0.12 for NT-proBNP, troponin, and their combination, respectively.

7384.question: Does adhesiolysis improve pelvic pain scores in women with chronic pelvic pain syndrome at 12 months post-surgery?
7384.notes: The mean difference was 0.00 with a 95% CI of -4.60, indicating no clear evidence of improvement.

7385.question: Does long-term inhaled aztreonam lysine therapy improve lung function in people with cystic fibrosis and chronic Burkholderia cepacia complex infection?
7385.notes: Mean difference in FEV1 was 0.91% (95% CI -3.15 to 4.97), indicating no improvement.

7386.question: Do antibiotics reduce sore throat symptoms at day three compared to placebo or no treatment?
7386.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.70, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.60 to 0.80; 16 studies, 3730 participants.

7387.question: Does carisbamate as an add-on therapy increase the responder rate in drug-resistant focal epilepsy compared to placebo?

7388.question: Is autogenic drainage more effective than other airway clearance techniques in improving forced expiratory volume in one second for people with cystic fibrosis?
7388.notes: No statistically significant differences were found between autogenic drainage and other techniques for forced expiratory volume in one second.

7389.question: Do psychological interventions result in a reduction in end-of-treatment depression symptoms in individuals with CAD and depression?
7389.notes: SMD -0.55, 95% CI -0.92 to -0.19, I² = 88%; low certainty evidence; 10 trials; n = 1226

7390.question: Does increasing indoor air humidity at the workplace significantly reduce dryness symptoms of the eyes?
7390.notes: The only cRCT showed a significant decrease in dry eye symptoms (OR 0.54, 95% CI 0.37 to 0.79), but overall evidence is low.

7391.question: Does dietary advice improve weight in adults with disease-related malnutrition after three months?
7391.notes: Mean difference in weight after three months was 0.97 kg (95% CI 0.06 to 1.87).

7392.question: Does fexinidazole increase the risk of mortality compared to NECT in treating second-stage g-HAT?
7392.notes: Mortality was higher in the fexinidazole group (9/264) compared to the NECT group (2/130), with a risk ratio of 2.22 (95% CI 0.49 to 10.11).

7393.question: Does idebenone result in a significant reduction in the decline of forced vital capacity (FVC) in patients with Duchenne muscular dystrophy compared to placebo?
7393.notes: Mean difference (MD) 3.28%, 95% confidence interval (CI) -0.41 to 6.97; low-certainty evidence.

7394.question: Does blue light-enhanced TURBT reduce the risk of disease recurrence in patients with non-muscle invasive bladder cancer compared to white light TURBT?

7395.question: Is the quad-helix appliance more effective than expansion plates for correcting posterior crossbite in children aged 7 to 11 years?
7395.notes: Quad-helix was more effective for posterior crossbite correction (RR 1.29, 95% CI 1.13 to 1.46).

7396.question: Is there a preferred mode of delivery to reduce morbidity and mortality in women with bleeding disorders during childbirth?
7396.notes: The abstract indicates that no randomized controlled trials were found to determine the safest mode of delivery.

7397.question: Does a restrictive transfusion strategy reduce the risk of receiving at least one RBC transfusion compared to a liberal transfusion strategy across a broad range of clinical contexts?
7397.notes: Restrictive transfusion strategies reduced the risk by 41% (RR 0.59, 95% CI 0.53 to 0.66).

7398.question: Is cisapride effective in reducing the occurrence of DIOS in patients with cystic fibrosis?
7398.notes: Radiograph scores showed no difference in DIOS occurrence between cisapride and placebo.

7399.question: Do antenatal corticosteroids reduce the risk of admission to neonatal special care for respiratory complications in infants born by elective caesarean section at term?
7399.notes: Relative risk (RR) 0.45, 95% CI 0.22 to 0.90; 1 study; 942 infants

7400.question: Is there evidence to support the use of thoracic aortic endovascular repair (TEVAR) over open surgical repair (OSR) for treating complicated chronic Type B aortic dissection?
7400.notes: No RCTs or CCTs were identified to provide evidence on the effectiveness and safety of TEVAR versus OSR.

7401.question: Does enteral tube fluid therapy result in a significant difference in the actual length of hospital stay compared to intravenous fluid therapy in children with bronchiolitis?
7401.notes: Mean difference (MD) 6.8 hours, 95% confidence interval (CI) -4.7 to 18.4 hours; 2 studies, 810 children.

7402.question: Does spinal cord stimulation (SCS) provide clinically important benefits for pain intensity when compared to placebo stimulation in the short term?
7402.notes: The mean difference in pain intensity was -8.73, which falls below the clinically important threshold of ≥10 points.

7403.question: Does rhTSH-aided radioiodine treatment lead to a greater reduction in thyroid volume compared to radioiodine alone in patients with non-toxic multinodular goitre?
7403.notes: RhTSH-aided radioiodine reduced thyroid volume with a mean difference of 11.9% (95% CI 4.4 to 19.4).

7404.question: Does the use of a lip bumper reduce crowding in the early permanent dentition?
7404.notes: One study found a mean difference of -4.39 mm (95% CI -5.07 to -3.71) with 34 participants.

7405.question: Is the combination of an antidepressant plus an antipsychotic more effective in reducing depression severity compared to antipsychotic monotherapy?

7406.question: Does the use of continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) devices reduce mortality in preterm infants during hospitalization?
7406.notes: The effect of CGM on mortality during hospitalization is uncertain (RR 0.59, 95% CI 0.16 to 2.13; RD -0.02, 95% CI -0.07 to 0.03).

7407.question: Is MRI as accurate as CT scans in diagnosing appendicitis across all patient groups?
7407.notes: MRI shows high sensitivity (0.95) and specificity (0.96) similar to CT scans, but study quality is low.

7408.question: Does periodontal treatment lead to a significant reduction in systolic and diastolic blood pressure in people diagnosed with both periodontitis and hypertension in the short term?
7408.notes: One study reported a significant reduction in SBP (MD -11.20 mmHg, 95% CI -15.40 to -7.00) and DBP (MD -8.40 mmHg, 95% CI -12.19 to -4.61) in the short term.

7409.question: Do mindfulness interventions improve anxiety levels in medical students and junior doctors immediately post-intervention?
7409.notes: SMD 0.09, 95% CI -0.33 to 0.52; unlikely to be clinically important

7410.question: Does a through-knee amputation offer superior functional recovery compared to an above-knee amputation?
7410.notes: No RCTs were identified to compare the outcomes of through-knee and above-knee amputations.

7411.question: Does intravenous thrombolytic treatment improve functional outcomes in patients with acute ischaemic wake-up stroke compared to control?
7411.notes: 66% of participants had a good functional outcome with thrombolytic treatment compared to 58% with control (RR 1.13, 95% CI 1.01 to 1.26).

7412.question: Does propionyl-L-carnitine improve maximal walking performance compared to placebo in patients with intermittent claudication?
7412.notes: Mean difference in absolute improvement of 50.86 meters (95% CI 50.34 to 51.38).

7413.question: Is risk-based monitoring as effective as extensive on-site monitoring in identifying major or critical findings in clinical intervention studies?
7413.notes: Risk ratio of 1.03 with a 95% CI of 0.81 to 1.33 suggests no significant difference.

7414.question: Is there evidence that high-dose pancreatic enzyme therapy is more effective than low-dose therapy in resolving DIOS in cystic fibrosis patients?
7414.notes: The trial reported no difference between high-dose and low-dose pancreatic enzyme therapy, but lacked numerical data and had an unclear risk of bias.

7415.question: Does the use of LNG-IUD post-surgery improve dysmenorrhoea at 12 months compared to expectant management?
7415.notes: Two RCTs reported data, but meta-analysis was not possible. Low-certainty evidence.

7416.question: Do NSAIDs improve pain at 24 hours compared to placebo in the treatment of acute gout?
7416.notes: NSAIDs may lead to a 50% reduction in pain at 24 hours compared to placebo (RR 2.7, 95% CI 1.1 to 6.7).

7417.question: Do peer support interventions improve psychological distress for parents and carers of children with complex needs compared to usual care?
7417.notes: The standardised mean difference (SMD) was -0.10 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of -0.32 to 0.11, indicating no clear effect.

7418.question: Do typical antipsychotics improve agitation in patients with dementia compared to placebo?
7418.notes: Standardised mean difference (SMD) -0.36, 95% confidence interval (CI) -0.57 to -0.15, 4 studies, n = 361

7419.question: Do resilience-building programmes effectively increase resilience among military and frontline emergency workers before deployment?
7419.notes: Five out of eight studies reported success in building resilience, particularly those using CBT and mindfulness-based interventions.

7420.question: Does VR training reduce operating times compared to no supplementary training for postgraduate ophthalmology trainees?
7420.notes: One study reported a mean difference of -17 minutes with a 95% CI of -21.62 to -12.38.

7421.question: Does the addition of vital rinsing to conventional oral examination improve the detection accuracy of oral cavity squamous cell carcinoma (OSCC) and oral potentially malignant disorders (OPMD) compared to conventional oral examination alone?
7421.notes: The evidence for vital rinsing as an adjunct to conventional oral examination was judged to be moderate, indicating some improvement in detection accuracy.

7422.question: Does foam sclerotherapy improve cosmetic appearance compared to placebo in patients with varicose veins?
7422.notes: Foam sclerotherapy may improve cosmetic appearance as measured by IPR-V (MD -0.76, 95% CI -0.91 to -0.60).

7423.question: Does the use of surgical drains reduce 90-day mortality after pancreatic surgery?
7423.notes: RR 0.23, 95% CI 0.06 to 0.90; two studies, 478 participants

7424.question: Does extracting the primary canine increase the proportion of palatally displaced canines that successfully erupt into the mouth at 12 months?
7424.notes: The confidence interval (RR 2.87, 95% CI 0.90 to 9.23) includes the possibility of no difference, making the evidence uncertain.

7425.question: Is nifedipine associated with any pain relief compared to placebo in women with primary dysmenorrhoea?
7425.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 9.04, 95% confidence interval (CI) 2.61 to 31.31; 2 studies, 66 participants.

7426.question: Does adding immunotherapy (excluding checkpoint inhibitors) to conventional curative surgery or radiotherapy improve overall survival in patients with localized NSCLC (stages I to III)?
7426.notes: HR 0.94, 95% CI 0.84 to 1.05; P = 0.27; 4 trials, 3848 participants

7427.question: Does low molecular weight heparin (LMWH) reduce mortality at three months compared to unfractionated heparin (UFH) in people with cancer and VTE?
7427.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.66, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.40 to 1.10; risk difference (RD) 57 fewer per 1000, 95% CI 101 fewer to 17 more

7428.question: Does the administration of ACE inhibitors reduce microalbuminuria and proteinuria in people with sickle cell disease?
7428.notes: The study showed a mean difference in albumin excretion but was not powered to detect a significant group difference.

7429.question: Does exercise training improve depressive symptoms in adults undergoing dialysis, particularly when maintained beyond four months?
7429.notes: Exercise training probably improves depressive symptoms (SMD -0.65, 95% CI -1.07 to -0.22) and the effect may be greater when maintained beyond four months (SMD -0.30, 95% CI 0.14 to -0.74).

7430.question: Is there a difference in mortality rates within four months and at 12 months between cephalomedullary nails and extramedullary implants for treating extracapsular hip fractures in older adults?
7430.notes: Mortality within four months (RR 0.96, 95% CI 0.79 to 1.18) and at 12 months (RR 0.99, 95% CI 0.90 to 1.08) showed little or no difference.

7431.question: Does calcium supplementation reduce systolic and diastolic blood pressure in normotensive individuals?
7431.notes: Mean difference for systolic blood pressure: -1.37 mmHg, 95% CI -2.08 to -0.66; diastolic blood pressure: -1.45 mmHg, 95% CI -2.23 to -0.67.

7432.question: Do low-carbohydrate weight-reducing diets result in a significant difference in body weight change compared to balanced-carbohydrate diets in overweight and obese adults without T2DM over one to two years?

7433.question: Are the methods used in systematic reviews of effectiveness focused on evidence relevant to populations experiencing health inequity?
7433.notes: 108 out of 158 studies focused on evidence relevant to populations experiencing health inequity.

7434.question: Does reducing added sugar intake have a significant impact on total cholesterol levels in healthy adults?

7435.question: Is the combination of TACE plus thermal ablation associated with a more favorable prognosis than TACE alone for hepatocellular carcinoma?
7435.notes: The abstract indicates a lack of confirmed randomized clinical trials to assess the efficacy of the combination therapy.

7436.question: Is there evidence that ultrasound-accelerated thrombolysis (USAT) is more effective than catheter-directed thrombolysis (CDT) in reducing the amputation rate for acute limb ischaemia?
7436.notes: The risk ratio for amputation rate was 1.14 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.17 to 7.59, indicating no evidence of a difference.

7437.question: Does ultrafiltration reduce heart failure-related rehospitalisation in the long term?
7437.notes: RR 0.69, 95% CI 0.53 to 0.90; NNTB of 10; 4 studies, 636 participants

7438.question: Does initiating proton pump inhibitor treatment before endoscopy reduce the need for endoscopic haemostatic treatment in patients with upper GI bleeding?
7438.notes: Pre-endoscopic PPI use likely reduces the need for endoscopic haemostatic treatment at index endoscopy (OR 0.68, 95% CI 0.50 to 0.93).

7439.question: Does immediate oral antiplatelet therapy reduce the risk of death or dependency in people with acute ischaemic stroke?
7439.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 0.95, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.91 to 0.99; 7 RCTs, 42,034 participants

7440.question: Does intravenous immunoglobulin (IVIg) improve muscle strength in IVIg-naive participants with multifocal motor neuropathy (MMN)?

7441.question: Does slow tapering of antiepileptic drugs reduce the risk of seizure recurrence compared to rapid tapering in children with epilepsy?
7441.notes: The studies showed no significant difference in seizure recurrence between rapid and slow tapering groups.

7442.question: Does a 14-day on/off cycle of ciprofloxacin reduce the frequency of exacerbations in adults with bronchiectasis compared to placebo?

7443.question: Do measures reducing the opportunity for contacts, such as alternating attendance and reduced class size, help reduce transmission and healthcare utilisation outcomes in school settings during the COVID-19 pandemic?
7443.notes: Most studies showed a reduction in transmission and healthcare utilisation outcomes.

7444.question: Does anakinra result in a significant increase in clinical improvement at Day 28 for hospitalized COVID-19 patients?
7444.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.08, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.97 to 1.20; 3 RCTs, 837 participants.

7445.question: Do ALK inhibitors improve progression-free survival compared to chemotherapy in advanced ALK-rearranged NSCLC?

7446.question: Do antihistamine-decongestant combinations reduce the duration of symptoms in adults with the common cold?

7447.question: Does combining intermittent pneumatic leg compression (IPC) with pharmacological prophylaxis reduce the incidence of pulmonary embolism (PE) compared to IPC alone?

7449.question: Does early cognitive rehabilitation improve visual attention and verbal memory in patients with primary malignant brain tumours?
7449.notes: The trial showed differences in visual attention and verbal memory, but not in logical-executive function.

7450.question: Do custom foot orthoses (CFOs) provide any significant improvement in pain relief for asymptomatic children with flat feet compared to regular shoes?

7451.question: Are cuffed endotracheal tubes associated with a reduced likelihood of reintubation for any reason in neonates?

7457.question: Do foot orthoses (FOs) improve pain and function in children with juvenile idiopathic arthritis (JIA) compared to shoes?

7459.question: Does the choice between antecolic and retrocolic reconstruction after partial pancreaticoduodenectomy significantly affect the frequency of delayed gastric emptying?

7460.question: Is there evidence to support that stenting is more effective than angioplasty alone for treating subclavian artery stenosis?

7468.question: Does the combination of PARP inhibitors with chemotherapy improve progression-free survival in newly diagnosed epithelial ovarian cancer?

7478.question: Are pit and fissure sealants effective in preventing dental caries in primary teeth?

7565.question: Does antibiotic therapy result in a difference in achieving clinical remission compared to placebo in ulcerative colitis patients?

7566.question: Do community-based interventions improve symptoms of post-traumatic stress in refugee children and adolescents compared to a waiting list?
7566.notes: Mean difference (MD) -1.46, 95% confidence interval (CI) -6.78 to 3.86; 1 study

7567.question: Does topical clonidine provide a greater than 30% pain relief compared to placebo in adults with chronic neuropathic pain?

7568.question: Is extracorporeal photopheresis (ECP) considered an effective treatment for steroid-refractory chronic graft-versus-host disease (cGvHD) in children and adolescents?
7568.notes: The review found no RCTs to evaluate the efficacy of ECP in this population.

7569.question: Does pyronaridine-artesunate perform better than artemether-lumefantrine for unadjusted treatment failures at day 28 in treating uncomplicated P falciparum malaria?

7570.question: Is netarsudil monotherapy more effective than placebo in reducing intraocular pressure in patients with open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension?
7570.notes: Netarsudil monotherapy showed a mean difference of 3.11 mmHg in IOP reduction compared to placebo (95% CI 2.59 to 3.62).

7571.question: Is there a lower risk of nerve injury when using retrograde lateral wires compared to retrograde crossed wires in the treatment of supracondylar elbow fractures in children?

7572.question: Does exercise reduce the rate of falls in people with mild to moderate Parkinson's disease?
7572.notes: Exercise probably reduces the rate of falls by 26% (rate ratio 0.74, 95% CI 0.63 to 0.87).

7573.question: Does tixagevimab/cilgavimab decrease the development of clinical COVID-19 symptoms in unvaccinated individuals?
7573.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.18, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.09 to 0.35; 5172 participants.

7574.question: Do short-acting inhaled beta-2 agonists improve FEV1 compared to placebo in people with cystic fibrosis?
7574.notes: Mean difference (MD) 6.95%, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.88 to 12.02; 2 trials, 82 participants

7575.question: Do marine-derived n-3 PUFAs improve functional outcomes in stroke patients within three months of treatment?
7575.notes: Functional outcome was reported in only one pilot study with a risk ratio of 0.78 (95% CI 0.36 to 1.68), indicating no clear evidence of benefit.

7576.question: Are faecal immunochemical tests (FITs) more effective than guaiac-based faecal occult blood tests (gFOBTs) in detecting advanced neoplasia (AN) in average-risk individuals?
7576.notes: FITs showed higher sensitivity for AN detection compared to gFOBTs, with summary sensitivities of 33% and 26% at 10 μg and 20 μg Hb/g cut-offs, respectively, versus 15% for gFOBTs.

7577.question: Does physical activity improve global symptoms of irritable bowel syndrome compared to usual care?
7577.notes: Meta-analysis showed an improvement in symptoms (SMD -0.93, 95% CI -1.44 to -0.42), but the evidence is very uncertain due to high risk of bias and imprecision.

7578.question: Does the use of adjunctive steroids in combination with antibiotics improve the chance of a good visual outcome at three months compared to antibiotics alone in the management of acute endophthalmitis?
7578.notes: Low certainty evidence from two studies suggested a risk ratio of 1.95 (95% CI 1.05 to 3.60) for good visual outcome with adjunctive steroids.

7579.question: Is clinical judgement by general practitioners more specific than sensitive for diagnosing dementia?
7579.notes: Sensitivity 58% (95% CI 43% to 72%), specificity 89% (95% CI 79% to 95%)

7580.question: Does prone positioning improve the oxygenation index in mechanically ventilated children with ARDS compared to the supine position?
7580.notes: Improvement in oxygenation index with prone positioning was observed in both parallel trials (MD -2.42, 95% CI -3.60 to -1.25) and the cross-over study (MD -8.13, 95% CI -15.01 to -1.25).

7581.question: Does the combination of ESA and intravenous iron reduce the need for red blood cell transfusions in cancer patients with anaemia?
7581.notes: The combination of ESA and intravenous iron reduced the need for transfusions (158 of 1000; RR 0.44, 95% CI 0.31 to 0.63).

7582.question: Does routine shunting reduce the risk of stroke-related death within 30 days of surgery compared to no shunting?
7582.notes: Peto odds ratio (OR) 0.13, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.02 to 0.96

7583.question: Do WASH interventions result in a reduction of any STH infection?
7583.notes: The pooled effect estimates showed a slight reduction with an OR of 0.86 amongst RCTs (95% CI 0.74 to 1.01).

7584.question: Does mobility training improve mobility levels in frail older people living in the community?
7584.notes: Mobility training improved the mobility score by 1.00 point (95% CI 0.51 to 1.51) on the Short Physical Performance Battery.

7585.question: Do school-based measures to prevent SARS-CoV-2 transmission have unintended educational consequences?
7585.notes: Eleven studies investigated educational consequences, most considered harmful.

7586.question: Does rituximab improve the clinical activity score (CAS) in patients with thyroid-associated ophthalmopathy compared to intravenous methylprednisolone?
7586.notes: RTX may result in CAS improvement at 24 weeks compared to IVMP (RR 1.32, 95% CI 0.98 to 1.78).

7587.question: Does certolizumab pegol (CZP) reduce the failure to maintain clinical remission at week 26 in adults with Crohn's disease compared to placebo?
7587.notes: RR 0.73, 95% CI 0.63 to 0.85; NNTB was 5 (95% CI 4 to 9)

7588.question: Is there evidence that early spontaneous breathing during invasive mechanical ventilation is beneficial for patients with COVID-19-induced ARDS?
7588.notes: The abstract states that no eligible studies were identified to provide direct evidence on the benefits or harms of early spontaneous breathing in this context.

7589.question: Do digital interventions improve adherence to maintenance treatments in asthma?
7589.notes: Mean difference of 14.66 percentage points, 95% CI 7.74 to 21.57

7590.question: Is there a clinically significant difference in pain intensity between controlled-release oxycodone and controlled-release morphine for cancer pain relief?
7590.notes: The pooled analysis indicated a small difference in pain intensity favoring CR morphine, but it was not clinically significant (SMD 0.14, 95% CI 0.01 to 0.27).

7591.question: Do peri-implantation glucocorticoids improve live birth rates in women undergoing IVF or ICSI?
7591.notes: Odds ratio (OR) 1.37, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.69 to 2.71; very low-certainty evidence.

7592.question: Does ivermectin plus standard of care reduce all-cause mortality at 28 days in patients with moderate-to-severe COVID-19?
7592.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 0.60, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.14 to 2.51; 3 trials, 230 participants.

7593.question: Can exercise alone improve FEV1 in people with cystic fibrosis compared to the active cycle of breathing technique (ACBT)?
7593.notes: The evidence is very low-certainty, and the study showed no change from baseline in FEV1.

7594.question: Is there a clinical benefit of full-mouth scaling over conventional quadrant scaling in terms of probing pocket depth reduction?
7594.notes: Mean difference (MD) 0.03 mm, 95% confidence interval (CI) -0.14 to 0.20; 5 trials, 148 participants.

7595.question: Do non-pharmacological sleep promotion interventions improve objective sleep measures in hospitalized children compared to usual care?
7595.notes: Five studies provided low-certainty evidence of no clear difference between interventions and usual care on objective sleep measures.

7596.question: Does early mobilisation improve shoulder function at one year for non-surgically-treated proximal humeral fractures?
7596.notes: The evidence is very limited and uncertain, with very low-certainty evidence from single trials.

7597.question: Do systemic JAK inhibitors decrease all-cause mortality in hospitalized individuals with moderate to severe COVID-19?
7597.notes: Systemic JAK inhibitors probably decrease all-cause mortality at up to day 28 and day 60 with moderate to high-certainty evidence.

7598.question: Does weekly paclitaxel reduce the risk of neutropenia compared to three-weekly paclitaxel in women with recurrent epithelial ovarian cancer?
7598.notes: Risk ratio (RR) of 0.51, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.27 to 0.95, two studies, 260 participants.

7599.question: Is the sensitivity of rapid antigen tests higher in symptomatic individuals compared to asymptomatic individuals?
7599.notes: Average sensitivity was 73.0% in symptomatic participants compared to 54.7% in asymptomatic participants.

7600.question: Does the use of OROS-MPH in children with ADHD and co-occurring epilepsy lead to a significant worsening of epilepsy?
7600.notes: No participant taking OROS-MPH experienced significant worsening of epilepsy as defined by specific criteria.

7601.question: Does regular dental examination and preventive treatment reduce the incidence of MRONJ in men with metastatic prostate cancer treated with zoledronic acid?
7601.notes: The intervention seemed to lower the risk of MRONJ (RR 0.10, 95% CI 0.02 to 0.39, 253 participants).

7602.question: Does intermittent locking with heparin result in fewer central venous catheter occlusions compared to normal saline in adults?
7602.notes: The risk ratio is 0.70 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.51 to 0.95, but the evidence is of low certainty.

7603.question: Does acetylsalicylic acid (ASA) reduce the risk of all-cause mortality in patients with elevated blood pressure?

7604.question: Does training improve the number of reported cases of child abuse and neglect by professionals?
7604.notes: The evidence is very uncertain, with a standardised mean difference (SMD) of 0.81 and a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 0.18 to 1.43.

7605.question: Does high-level VNS stimulation reduce seizure frequency more effectively than low-level stimulation in patients with drug-resistant focal epilepsy?
7605.notes: Risk ratio (RR) for 50% or greater reduction in seizure frequency was 1.73 (95% CI 1.13 to 2.64).

7606.question: In premenopausal women, does the ADNEX model demonstrate higher sensitivity compared to the RMI for diagnosing ovarian cancer?
7606.notes: ADNEX sensitivity: 95.5% (95% CI 91.0% to 97.8%) vs. RMI sensitivity: 57.2% (95% CI 50.3% to 63.8%)

7607.question: Does group CBTp improve overall mental state compared to standard care or other psychosocial interventions for people with schizophrenia?
7607.notes: Group CBTp may have some advantage over standard care or other psychosocial interventions for overall mental state at the end of treatment (MD -3.73, 95% CI -4.63 to -2.83).

7608.question: Does criteria-based screening improve dental attendance compared to no screening?
7608.notes: Pooled risk ratio (RR) 1.07, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.99 to 1.16

7609.question: Does electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) result in greater improvement in catatonic symptoms compared to risperidone in the first three weeks of treatment for schizophrenia spectrum disorders with catatonic symptoms?
7609.notes: ECT showed significantly greater improvement in catatonia scores compared to risperidone at week 3 endpoint.

7610.question: Is the administration of autologous adult bone marrow mononuclear cells associated with a reduction in all-cause mortality in patients with critical limb ischaemia?
7610.notes: Risk ratio (RR) 1.00, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.15 to 6.63; 3 studies, 123 participants.

7611.question: Can self-report questionnaires reliably detect non-suppressed viral load in people living with HIV receiving ART treatment?
7611.notes: Sensitivity ranged from 10% to 85% and specificity ranged from 10% to 99%, indicating high variability and low reliability.

7612.question: Do antiplatelet agents reduce the risk of post-thrombotic syndrome (PTS) in acute DVT when added to best medical practice?

7613.question: Is duplex ultrasound (DUS) highly accurate in detecting carotid artery stenosis in the 70% to 99% range?
7613.notes: Summary sensitivity was 0.85 (95% CI 0.77 to 0.91) and specificity was 0.98 (95% CI 0.74 to 0.90).

7614.question: Do interventions to improve communication about end-of-life care have a significant impact on the knowledge of illness and prognosis for patients?
7614.notes: Interventions may have little or no effect on knowledge of illness and prognosis, based on low-certainty evidence.
